reviews.review: Amazing Stupa. We really enjoyed this experience. It was busy but not too crowded. We walked all around the stupa and spun the prayer wheels. It is the largest stupa in all of Asia. The shops around the stupa were full of lovely things and nice shopkeepers. The Tibetan culture is alive and well here. It was one of the highlights of Kathmandu for us.

In the throes of renovation. The temple is currently being renovated so it is not possible to appreciate the stupa properly. It is worthwhile though just stopping to people watch as they circle the structure clockwise turning the many prayer wheels. There are many different castes/ nationalities here in all different types of dress, our official guide explaining where they all came from.- fascinating. There are many shops around the stupa but a must is to go into the temple opposite the main entrance where there is a balcony from which you can literally watch the world go by.
Nepal. This Stupa is very spiritual-the nepalese eyes seem to relax all that surrounds you.The prayer wheels give you hope that all will be well in the world when you walk by & spin them.
Love it . Very nice hence super crowded area . Construction is still taking place so we couldn't enjoy much the site seeing.

Beautiful but be aware of people offering tours . Very nice, unique temple but my experience was a little tainted by the "tour" I was given by a local, watch out for these people who like to be tricky with their wording when they state their price for showing you around.
Good to see restoration is well in progress. Stupa is being beautifully restored. Monas term opporsite is a must see. The shops and restaurants around the stupa are busy and colourful

Shopping central. Was there in October, 2016. Still under construction from the damage caused by the 2015 earthquake. The Stupa is in a square surrounded by shops. It's a nice place to spend a quiet afternoon browsing the shops.

Great!. My son and I visited today and what was really appealling was not being hassled to purchase anything! A lot of places in the world make being a tourist unpleasant because of the practice of hustling. We didn't experience this here and we made some great purchases unmolested.Despite the crowd and bustle, the clockwise pedestrian flow contributed to the special serenity.I bought a great mandala here.

Popular Tourist Destination... It has plenty of restaurants, shopping hubs, walking area all around the stupa and the ambience is serene.Be it drinks with friends, a coffee with a colleague and just walking around feels wonderful esp. in the evening.It closes a bit early, so pls plan accordingly.
Should Be Finished In About 50 Years. Fun street shops and food surround this block. great coffee and unique stores. The slow process of repairs may take a while!

This under repair. Interesting to see, but no access due to repairs. You are able to walk around and view it from all sides. Also remember as you circle to visit the monastery where you can see Boudhanath from 3 stories up.

A must when in Kathmandu. Go in the late afternoon and see the area filled with locals, music, chanting and candles. Ignore the souvenir shops and simply take in the atmosphre of young and old circling the stupa.
Great atmosphere!. Stunning monument which is now restored after the damage by the earthquake. Let yourself be immersed and go in one of the shops to have the singing bowl explained to you....

Serene. Located near Chabahil, Stupa is a beautiful and serene place to visit. Take your time to forget about the stress from daily hustle bustle. It is surrounded by lots of good restaurants, hotels and shopping centers. There is no entry fee and is the best place if you want to buy souvenirs. It is one of the world heritage sites in Nepal.

Boudhnatha or Boudha or Khasti or Jyarung Khasor Temple in Kathmandu. A must visit in Kathmandu Valley.It is one of the world Heritage sites in Kathmandu and is located on a walking distance from Pashupati Temple,the Holiest Hindu Temple of Shiva in Kathmandu. The huge stupa stands on a 3D mandala. the Boudha Stupa is famous for Buddhists and most resided by the Tibetan Refugees who fled Tibet during 1959 invasion.the area is surrounded by Monasteries, Shops, Restaurants and guest houses. One place stop to learn about Buddhism in Nepal.
Repair coming along.. It was wonderful to see that the earthquake damage is being repaired so well. This is a must see place when visiting Kathmandu.

Lots of steps and monkeys! . No visit to Kathmandu would be complete without visiting this place! Enter from the top if you're not a fan of steps because there are 365 stairs if you go from the bottom. Tons of monkeys everywhere, many shops and plenty of photo ops. Worth the visit!

Peaceful. My husband and I returned to Kathmandu with Boudhanath at the top of our list and we weren't disappointed. The atmosphere here is peaceful and yet energizing. We bought a singing bowl, male and prayer flags here all for great prices. We also had them blessed by a monk. When I return to Nepal I will book a room here and soak in all the peace and joy that surrounds this site.
The road to Stupa. The road to Stupa was very bad. The stupa had lot of shops around it and excellent place for spending some time there,
Serenity . Lovely place in the evening. Almost done with construction aftet the earthquake. Lot of markets, good restaurants. Overall a lovely stupa to roam about.

Great sight seeing. Admiring all stupas and other historic shrines in the area. Fantastic!
Close to Thamel, convenient location for shopping and exploring.
Good. In this palace in kathmandu is really good and heritage historical nile and tourist palaci we like baudha stupa
This is an absolute must see!. This is definitely one of the highlights of my visit to Kathmandu. It is a truly unique cultural gathering place. There are plenty of shops and restaurants as well.
Under reconstruction. Lots of work going on and plenty of scaffolding. Still a nice place to visit but not the same when it's all covered over.

Boudhanath revisited. This is the first time I had visited since the Earthquake. The stupa is in a sorry state and not a photogenic site as it is surrounded by scaffolding and the whitewash has been removed. I look forward to coming back after the restoration.

way overrated. Yes: the biggest stupa in nepal, surrounded by shops. I was really expecting something better. They are doing some "renovations" so you cannot climb the stupa, you just walk around it and do some shopping. The shops around the stupa and the restaurants take away what could be mistical and religious about the place. Definitely not worth the visit. There are way better places to go to in Kathmandu.
Kathmandu must see. Even with the earthquake damage still being repaired this was an amazing visit. We had lunch up on the rooftop of a local restaurant overlooking the Stupa.

Wonderful experience despite the earthquake damage. I was delighted to see that the badly damaged Stupa is under going extensive renovation following the earthquake. This is a major " must see" in Katmandu. Try and eat in one of the restaurants overlooking the Stupa, and soak up the atmosphere of sights, smells and sounds in this remarkably mystical and spiritual place!
Nice . We are a buddish because of this we like baudha stupa also really heritave historically and nice palace

Being repaired. While I went to this place it was closed and was being repaired after earthquake. Didnt see what was inside but loved the atmosphere around this place , the market, the bells on the boundary of the stupa...
awesome views. this site rocks . a lot of people a lots flavors and genuine and authentic atmosphere. definitely with the visit

Commercialized Buddhist temple. Sad to see that the tragedy of Nepal earthquake has damaged these beautiful structures. But happy to see that the Government is trying to restore them.Being a place of worship, i definitely expected more of worship and less of business. It was quite the oppodite. The whole place is filled with shops selling fake beads , paintings and priced exorbitantly high. A bead wrist band of superior quality should not be more than 40 to 50 N.rupees. The shops charge over 200 to 500. Bargaining is the only way outEateries are just ok. Unhealthy ...
Very much worth visiting!. If you like to see Bouddism in its glory, go here! Walk around the stupa as much rounds as you want and 'feel' the special energy.
Stupa. Was being restored which is good as it needs attention before it loses its charm. Will be better when finished. Nice view. Calming area,

Peaceful haven amongst the City madness. Really peaceful place, A visual spectacle also despite undergoing building work following last years earthquake. Nice monastary inside also and a lovely little art workshop.
Peaceful. i love the peaceful environment, the stupas,the market, the people, the bells and feeding the pigeons .Its amazing :)
Buddha eyes . There is so much serenity about this place a great stop worth the time. It is best in the late afternoon. Expect a crowd
Cultural heart center for Kathmandu. fabulous place to visit for the day or stay in the surrounding hotels for a longer visiting experience

Just WOW!. Despite being under construction this place is awesome! Also a little piece away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Which I do love that element of Kathmandu but also gets a little bit intense. Theres no cars or bike allowed in here and there are many places you can eat and buy all your bits for presents. Also I wasn't lucky enough to catch this, but on a clear day you can see the Himalayas. Really a must go and see, you'll end up spending a lot more time there than you first intended!

Cultural immersion. My Lady and I wanted to immerse ourselves in the culture, history and people of Nepal on this trip, and that is just what Nepal Tours did for us. Our first full day Robbie took us to the Boudhanath Stupa on the way to our visit with the child we sponsor in Nepal. We were totally entranced, and we even got to interact with the local Monks and Temple people in an informed manner

One of the best place in Kathmandu. Boundhanth is located near the Hyatt Regency Kathmandu, it is 5 min by walk. I went to Stupa 4 times from Hyatt, early in the morning, day time and late night time. Whenever I went many people are praying and walking around the stupa. It is good for taking pictures.
Good. One of the best Stupak is called Buchanan stupa allpall-around this area is really good and heritage and historical
Temple of god. We spent a good time in this place. What a good place with whole city view and peaceful place. We love it

Beautiful Buddhist Temple. This impressive Buddhist Temple is located in Kathmandu and can be visited throughout the entire year. The architecture of the shops and crafting places all around the temple is something to notice on top of the imposing Stupa.
A great temple to visit!. Though the temple was being renovated, it was full of people visiting and touring around. Also, it has many stores in the area.

Powerful spiritual energy. This stupa is not only beautiful, but surrounded by circumambulating pilgrims who you can join in meditation almost any time of day. Pleasant area around it with good restaurants and little shops. It is now a world heritage site, and when I was there, they were completing restoration after the earthquake. I enjoyed watching them get the famous eyes back in place. Highly recommended.

A taste of Tibet. A nice day trip from the bustle of Kathmandu, Boudhanath Stupa is a taste of Tibet in Nepal. While the Stupa itself is impressive - though at time of visit the summit was covered by scaffolding, the surrounding streets and district is thronging with monks, Tibetan shops and monasteries and temples all touched with a taste of Nepal's Tibetan diaspora. I found the surrounds more interesting than the Stupa itself not and it made for a great day to get a taste of the other Nepal.

You Must Visit This Spot. This is a very impressive spot. Though the stupa was being renovated when we visited, it was still not hard to get an idea of what it must look like in its glory. It is impressive, and yet another reminder of how comfortably Buddhism and Hinduism seem to coexist in Nepal. The circular perimeter around the stupa is full of shops, of course, but many of them were quite appealing, selling everything from t-shirts to thangka art. Organize your time so that you can have lunch at one of the rooftop restaurants overlooking the stupa. The area provides some great people-watching, in addition to the views of the stupa itself.

Being restored. Even though the stupa is being repaired still from the earthquake you can see get a sense of its magnificence.after doing a sunset Cora around the stupa we went for a lovely vegetarian dinner at one of the restaurants over looking the square- beautiful!

Nice and giant Stuba. Phantastic place and definitely a mustsee in Kathmandu! A holy place and maybe the most quiet spot you find in the middle of everything! I'm loving it! It is good to be there in late afternoon. Currently in construction / recovery from last eq.

Great place to visit - but you do have some dodgy steps to negotiate. This is an historical place to visit and if you want to see the real gem you have to climb a good number of steps - some of which have been damaged in the earthquake - so you need to negotiate with care - not really for the infirm or too young as some is a bit dangerous. I'm sure this will be repaired in due course - but a year after the quake and there was little sign of any repairs on the steps underway! But that is classic Nepal for you!

Very Impressive. It was quite humbling to watch the locals, as we walked around Boudhanath. They were there to worship. The place is wonderful & despite so many people has a very peaceful & calming atmosphere

Definitely worth a visit.. Compared to other temples around the Kathmandu's area this one is reasonably priced at 250 rupees.Not only can you walk-in and Sunday the stupa, you can also visit the monks and listen to mantra recitations an traditional instrument playing in the temple in the adjacent buildings. I was there at 3pm.Really great places to grab a cup of Nepali tea, worth the 400 taxi fare to Thank.
peace place. wonderful place for the people like me to make your mind peace and there are lots of buddhist temples for peace meditation.wow!! feel good to come here after lots of work.

MUST SEE. This place blew my mind. It was so so beautiful. My suggestion would be to go at sunrise or sunset and have at least an hour to spend. The way up is not to be missed and I would suggest getting a taxi to maybe halfway and walking the rest past the homes and stores on the way up. Costs 200 rupee to get inside. And please don't bring food or lots of bags in, the monkeys will get you!

Under construection. Due to damage from the Aril, 2015 earthquake, the Stupa is under renovation. Word seems to be that they hope to finish the repairs in November. It definitely detracts from and effects the impression of the Stupa itself, but the surrounding "village" is still attractive and appealing. When back to its from, I highly recommend the Bhoudha Stupa as a destination. Right now it is still worth a visit but one needs to enjoy the scene around the surrounding village.
Underconstruction. Part of the Stupa was covered when I was there so other than the nice little shops around the outside...there was not much to see. Great places to eat and explore though.

Beautiful. Beautiful place with clean surroundings. Excellent structure and place for Buddhist pilgrims. A peaceful and good place for refreshment. Amazing restaurants nearby and various shopping choices as well
Boudha!. A very unique part of the Nepal-Tibet history. Definite must see in KTM! Find someone who can give you the history.
Walk around it always three times...! . Phantastic place and definitely a mustsee in Kathmandu! A holy place and maybe the most quiet spot u find in the middle of everything! I'm loving it!

Nice destination. Walk clockwise around the stupa 3 times. Lots of tourist shops around the periphery but the place didn't feel too touristy. Lots of locals there as well, spinning the prayer wheels and chanting their prayers. The central tower was damaged in the earthquake and is still being repaired.

Biggest stupa in the world . The entrance fee to this stupa is 250 rupees. The stupa, although huge is tucked away behind shops on a busy Katmandu street. You walk up one of the alleyways and it unfolds before your eyes. Enjoy walking around the stupa seeing the religious folk engage in their prayer rituals. Drop into one of the monasteries to see a big Buddha and look in the numerous tourist stalls for a souvenir. It is still under repair after the earthquake but it doesn't take away from the bigness of the stupa.

One of my favorite places in the world. Peaceful, calm, spiritual place. When I was there I felt like time is paused and only the current moment is important. Lots of birds, tourist, prayers, monks... everything makes the atmosphere there special...
#baudanath . It's a historic place of buddish..biggest stupa in the world..world heritage side..do at least one visit..

Post quake renovations in progress. It is amazing to see so many people walking round & round the Stupa with their prayer beads. It humbles me to see very old Tibetan men and women performing this ritual. The old buildings around the Stupa are absolutely beautiful. Post earthquake renovation was still in progress to repair the damage to the top of the Stupa.
Being renovated at the moment. Severely damaged during the earthquake of 2015 but still worth a visit.It will probably be more impressive when renovations are done.
Nice. Kalke ond of the largest and most importantly old stupa in the order in eArth really good and heritage palace
largest stupa. this is Buddhist place one of the largest sputa after earthquake little bit damage but now they are rebuild

Love the structure. It was magnificent despite being damaged by the quake. At first, I thought that this stupa is located in a wide space. However when we took a tazi there, it was near a town where many tibetans ethnic group lives. This was because their features looked different from where I stayed.This was the very first time that I saw the buddha eye. Despite the fact that the building had been damaged by the earthquake, I still find this stupa structure magnificent and I was touched by the tibetan buddhist devotee who were praying there. We went 1 round before heading back.
Great place to visit if you like old structures. Worth a visit to see the old structure. Good landmark to visit if you have time on your hands. Definitely not a must see.
Religious. Get a peaceful mind to simmer in this religious atmosphere. The alleys surround the stupa are worth to explore.
Great . Baudhanath stupa is verry good sam bamage fram earthquick still repairing nice and heritage palace to menny tibiten shap sround we love this palace

Go for finding peace; and masala chai!. To see any religion in the eyes of the devotees is the finest experience ever. This place will offer you that. You will be walking among monks and pedestrians who reach their heart to God so simply yet elegantly. It was a fulfilling experience.

Ancient blessings filled site. This stupa was damaged in the 2015 earthquake and is currently being repaired.
Pilgrims from around the world come to do khora and obtain blessings.
Memoryable. One of the largest stupa call baudha stupa is reallr good far travellre real nice heritahe and old and centre of city
Under construction. The place was fully under construction and nearly nothing to see. But it has still entrance fee. It should be free these kind of times.

Tibetan refugees - Buddhist centre in KTM. Always make the trip to Boudha every time we are in KTM you pay to be allowed entry to the Stupa area and it is absolutely something to be done Since the earthquake last year the Stupa is damaged but under repair - like so much of Nepal - some tat but seek out the genuine Tibetans and just wonder at how some of the craftwork is done - Explore off piste too some really interesting shops and cafes off the main circular drag around the Stupa

Love it. Boudhanath is one of my favorite places to hang out in Kathmandu. As you walk around the stupa (clockwise), you'll see so many different sights --an old lady feeding the birds, prayer wheels, temples, people lighting incense, candles,the monks, coffee shops, and of course, the iconic stupa itself, which towers over you. Check out the giant prayer wheels, sit in one of the cafes or pizza places and soak in the smells, sounds and images around you.
By Night. We expected a nicer view when we visited the Temple Komplex by night... However, there are a few rooftop restaurants/bars around where you can have a relaxed evening.
Mr. Very historical place. Under maintenance. Lot of monasteries around. Circular in shape with lot of shops around to buy gift items.
Must visit.. This temple is an integral part of daily Nepalese life. Get there early to enjoy the quiet and serene nature of the temple.

Under construction. we visited the temple in early Sept 2016, its still under construction since it was damaged during last year earthquake, the temple is surrounded by souvenir shops and small buildings. its nice to visit if you have time however Swayambhunath Temple is more recommended since it's not damaged at all.

A must visit !!!!!!. My sister and myself were on a short visit to the city and spent the evening at Bodhyanath temple . Its usually a very crowded place and i do suggest wear comfortable shoes as you will need it and dont forget your camera. The entrance fee to the site is 50 Rs for SAARC nation countries and for foreigners its 250 Rs but on the day we visited there was no one at the ticket counter. as you enter the main stupa area you will see the huge , lager than life stupa , it was under construction due to maintainance from the earthquake. but it still looked beautiful. We did go a round or two of the stupa and spinned the prayer wheels. You will see people walking round the stupa and chanting prayers and its a very different feeling .You will see various buddhist temples as you walk the around the stupa.The stupa is surrounded by temples , places to shop , cafes and hotels .

Under renovation . This famous Buddhist temple is under construction but it still worth a visit to see the beautiful surroundings and all the different monetarist associated with the temple and stupa.

Beautiful, even under contruction. I was so excited to come here when I first arrived in Kathmandu. Even though it was under construction from last year's earthquake, it's still worth a visit. Don't forget to make a wish!
Heart of Kathmandu. Amazing place even if it is under construction. Very powerful and beautiful especially in early morning!

Under refurbish . Historical Stupa. Is seen from the air as flights take off Kathmandu airport . Was damaged during last year's earthquake and is now undergoing restoration. Very Buddhist atmosphere with Many monasteries around the Stupa and plenty of really huge Tibetan bells. We're lucky to attend a musical prayer in the prayer hall just opp the Stupa.

Excellent place to be at evening,, Peaceful and heavenly. It was the best evening, so peaceful and serene environment. Visiting the huge monastery and capturing few pics of this stupa was worthwhile experience. It is in rebuilding process now,, Planning to get back here soon..
religious boudhanath. Boudhanath is a stupa in Kathmandu, Nepal. It is known as Khāsti in Nepal Bhasa, Jyarung Khashor in Tibetan language or as Bauddha by speakers of Nepali
Nice. One of the best and large budish stupa call boudhanath in Katmandu and really good and historical and natural

Stunning. Great sight spot with the most ancient Buddhist monument in Nepal. There are plenty of monasteries to visit all around and everything one can desire for shopping for souvenirs. Bought some nice incense and statues there
Nepal one of the place to be in the evening ! Stupa and surrounding view is amazing. Often go there in the evening , spend my time having coffee and few rounds of stupa and sit for while .
A place with spirit. Take your time, enjoy the details of the temple and the serounding area the entry fee of 2oo Rp is value for money
Outstanding Stupa, must visit!. Memorable circumambulating this Stupa with great shops around it. I will never forget it. Do visit it if you can.

Wonderful world heritage site. Ticket entry , still being restored after the 2015 earthquake. Marvellous architecture. Great shopping around the area. Crystals bracelets , neck pieces , Nepal cashmere stoles, Buddhist prayers wheels etc. Are there for shopping.
A must see. Another must-see place in Nepal. You need to be here to understand the culture and life of the Nepalese people.

An ancient, world heritage site.. This site was heavily damaged by the 2015 earthquake and was still being reconstructed. It is still an impressive site to visit however and entry fees are used to help rebuild it.
nice . boudhanath, very beautiful stupa I have ever seen. it's very big,biggest in Asia. located in very center of the city.
Nice. Good place to get familiar with this kind of religious celebrations also buy souvenir . when we arrived it was under construction partly
Good. The larger stupa in around the world and the best way to get the budish activity like thanka budish incence etc

Must visit Stupa in Nepal. Just been there. Although renovation work is been done to restore the top of the stupa, it is still a very nice place to visit. You can see the local especially the elders, walk around the stupa sincerely and chanting mantras. Feel so holy.

To feel and observe . What recommendation you can write about such place. Stupa is alive starting 5 and finishing almost midnight. Great people walking, praying, chanting, eating. Good restaurants around and very interesting people wherever you go.
Trace of an ancient monestary. You will enjoy the vastness of the stupa area. Never miss to spin the prayer wheels and rounding the stupa clockwise as it brings good luck forthcoming.

Damage by earthquake. The base and the dome of the stupa are in ok shape, but the top (what people like to take in picture!) is in renovation. The size of the stupa, the amount of people circumambulating it, and the shops all around still make Boudhanath an interesting place. Good spot to buy prayer flags or rudraksha. Lots of small temples within walking distance. The Tibetan community is also interesting, and very different from the rest of Kathmandu.

Under renovation. The stupa seemed to be under renovation. I had visited in the evening. There were prayers going on! Many shops around the compound to buy souvenirs. Negotiation with price is advised.

Largest Stupa in the World. Serene.. Best place to view stupa : Grab a coffee in the early morning at any one of the rooftop restuarant.Best thing to do : 1) Circle around the stupa(Outside & inside) 2) Take a look inside the monastery in the inner circle 3) Take photo from the top of the monastery.Best thing to eat : Laphing(Ask any local for details)Best time to visit : Buddha Purnima(May/June) or any other time when various functions are going on.Note : Stupa is under reconstruction due to the damage caused by 2015 Earthquake. Still it is one of the best places to visit in Kathmandu.
Holiness everywhere. Here you can really feel the holiness by listening to the prayer wheels turning and the pilgrims and monks walking clockwise around the stupa chanting.
Average. Lots of shops surrounding the stupa, some earthquake damage to the stupa itself, area seemed toutty, personally i could have given it a miss.
great . me and my friends been in this palace call baudhanath stua is really good stupa also largest stupa in the world but little damage fram earthquake realy good palace
Wonderful pilgrims. It is most visited place for pilgrims place for peace and prosperity. I feel really peace during my visit.
peaceful. Katmandu is a wonderful peaceful thriving city. The people are great there . You must see all of the temples

If only it was not for the earthquake!. Beautiful place but highly over crowded. The shop keepers on the side are too insistent and won't let you enjoy the peace of the place.The overall place is very important for Buddhism but the earthquake seems to have destroyed quite a lot. But the best part is that there are a lot of volunteers working day in and day out to reconstruct the same.Tip: Stay at the Hyatt Regency nearby and take a walk out from the back door of the hotel garden.

Unfortunately very damaged by earthquake . I suppose before the earthquake this stupa would have been magnificent but unfortunately at the moment is under restoration and you can hardly see anything or visiting it. The visit is just worthy because the square where it is located is very picturesque and full of very interesting people shops and restaurants. So if you visit it for this them go but to visit he stupa only wait until it is restored
Earthquake shut. It is a stunning building, but unfortunately when I was there it was shut due to the last year earthquake.

Sacred. I stayed at guest house hotel in boudhanath stupa. It was a great location. Every morning I walked around the stupa with the Tibetans and did prostrations. Being from America it was very difficult for me to see all the hungry dogs. I went and bought dog food and would walk every night and feed the dogs this is a sacred place to the Buddhist and it was def a beautiful place to stay
Don't miss this. In addition to this being one of the largest sites in Kathmandu, it is lined with terrific places to eat, many of which have a view, and places to shop for souvenirs.

highly recommended for both the temple and the monkeys. We spent 2 hours here. The temple and other things to look at are all really interesting. The views are really amazing. Best of all was the monkeys - there are lots of them and they play and jump into the monkey pool, fantastic to watch. We got a taxi to almost the top and then walked down all the steps. Inexpensive entry fee at 200 Ns

A must visit in Kathmandu. The biggest and most important buddisth Stupa in Nepal, which is soon almost fully restored after last years earthquakes! Situated in an area where many Tibetans live with a big variety of good quality handicraft stores!

You breath peace!!. Its the most holy place for Buddhists. The stupa is huge and was under construction. Due to earthquake of 2015. Still we got a good opportunity to visit it with less crowd and it was very divine feeling to be around this place.
Incredible. The temple was partially covered in scaffolding when I visited, but it was still amazing. There are incredible monasteries around and great rooftop restaurants surrounding the temple.

Renovation of history. Since the earthquake, the community is striving and working hard to renovate and rebuilt the damaged Buddha Stupa. Lots of pilgrimage and tourist flock to this place to see the beauty and pray. There are plenty of restaurants, coffee shop for caffeine lover and local places to eat and watch the stupa being renovated. People also circle around the stupa in belief it will help you in afterlife and helps in attaining peace.How about lighting Butter lamp.

Amazing . I have visited the stupa 7 times in the past two years. I have seen it at its best and its worst following the earthquakes. It is presently being completed after having new reinforcements and a newly worked on top part. It is usual well maintained and so interesting to see Buddhists from all around the world coming to pray. The shops around the Stupa are expensive and you must barter or you could be paying up to three times the true amount!

Still standing. There are many places described as magical, this one is for real. A sunny afternoon on a terrace overlooking the stupa, with hundreds of praying Tibetans chanting and circling it is transcendent.

Best of KTM. Do not miss this stupa !It's like you're in a different world, once you enter.Don't walk the wrong way around ! :)I can write about it forever, but you should see it for yourself!A place you won't forget.

Currently Under Wraps!. Work on the Stupa is still ongoing, and so, currently, there is not much to see apart from a lot of tourist stands, souvenirs and restaurants. Still good to have gone, also a good spot for some people watching.
Really beautiful. Fascinating place to visit and take some photos. I have visited twice and it is always very busy so best to go early morning to avoid the crowds.

Peace . The most peaceful and sacred place on Earth !!You seem to forget everything when you are in Boudha.My only disappointment was the crowd and those street side shops . It looked more like a market rather than a holy place . You tend to loose your focus from enjoying the beauty of Boudha because of the shops in every round .Apart from that this place has some great rooftop restaurants with great food music and view . Waiting for my next visit ☺️
A must in Kathmandu . If you want to understand something about this temple, take a guide or a book. Majestic and imposing, it's a must in Kathmandu.

amagnificent view from top . I was with their with my friend ! it was my first visit their but at the first visit their I full in love with a magnificent view from on top on swyambunath (monkeytample ) what you can see allot of monkeys their .what I suggest to you is do not try to play with monkey becouse they have sharp nails it is poisonous .they play each and every days with garbage .. hide your plastic bag from them they will grabe it becouse they might thought every bag has food !!! if you intresting with history spend more time & chat with local oeople or monk who explane you about those place  most interesting thing is to watch kathmandu valley through their

a good place to stay a little longer!. What an amazing ways to round the temple 3 times: monks talking on their mobile, a concentrated woman on hands and knees, crippled in their wheelchairs. And the quiet peoples turning the praying rolls. I could have stayed there and watched for hours.

BUDA. WHAT A WONDERFUL VISIT FOR WHATEVER FAITH .you will be moved

There are about 5-6 money exchangers surrounding stupa and they have better exchange rate than in Thamel!The same day at the Thamel I saw the dollar exchange rate about 104.6 while at the stupa it was 106!

The place full of tibetan. If you want to find a place that the people is not cheat you (different pay compare to local people), here you should go. Tibetan Buddhist always treat you as same as local people.

The Stupa Site. This was our fourth UNESCO site visit in one day and we were exhausted and ready to go back to the hotel, BUT we were very happy the guides did NOT listen to us. The Stupa reminded me of the towns in Europe very different from the other sites in Kathmandu

Peace. Worth visiting with beautiful view. You feel the peace. A must visit place. Nature is still preserved though they had gone through devastation.

One of the best Stupa around the world !! Must Visit During the stay at Kathmandu. Boudhanath Stupa is located at Boudha, Chabahil, is one of the world heritage site.As from the earthquake of April, 2015 it was damaged but the construction is going on hopefully it will be like as before within some months. You will see a peaceful environment with Buddhist musics, and culture.For Nepali its free to enter but costs some for foreigners.

One of the most sacred place in Kathmandu. Well, for the western people it might be little bit hard to distinguish Hinduism and Buddhism. Hindu says, Buddhism is the part of their religion, and quite a lot of Buddhist tales actually related with Hindu. But there are several places where we can find the different points, and one of them is Boudhanat. This place is the sacred place to the Tibetans and high hill Nepalese. These peoples are cross Himalaya by foot, moreover bowing five times for one foot. It means when they do one step ahead, they bow five times and that bow is not just a bow, they have to forehead, palms, knees and toes touch the ground.Even you don’t understand anything about Buddhism or doesn’t know anything about recent Tibetan history, you might feel something when you visit here.
SPECIAL ATMOSPHERE. The stupa is a special place for peace and quite. You can listen to mantras while you walk round making the praying wheels go round
Nice place. Nice place to visit if you are going to nepal as you get to see the culture of nepal and gets the chance to be part of it

Under construction . The Stupa is still being reconstructed post earthquake. Foreigners are charged a fee to see the Stupa even if you're just shopping in the area. Many homeless people and people begging here.
Very beautiful. It is a beautiful temple surrounded by shops and restaurants, we just walked and walked around the temple stopping at all the little shops around it
good . the new things and ready good to see if you have time you may have been there to see baudha stupa really good

Meh. Entry fee of 250 nepalese rupees and can't even enter the main temple as of August 2016. Is a huuge sight though and a bery famous place for shopping and buying souvenirs. Plenty of shops around the temple but still the temple is under heavy reconstruction so be aware.

Comfortable place to visit many times. The Boudhanath Stupa is an amazing place and so important to followers of the Buddhist faith. Even if you're not a Buddhist the atmosphere here is special. I visited many times because of the peace and quiet, despite being in a busy part of Kathmandu. It's refreshing to see young Nepalese coming here to meet their friends and spend time together. Unfortunately the stupa suffered damage from the 2015 earthquake so it's currently being reconstructed. It's not at its visual best but it's still worth visiting to be part of the ritual and tradition of the Buddhist faith.

A Divine Place Crowded by Pilgrims & Tourists. Was here a week before the devastating earthquake (Apr 2015). It's truly a special place. Loaded with pilgrims, mostly Tibetans, who came all the way to pray, chanting and circling the mighty stupa endlessly. It's humbling to see how absorbed they seemed to be, not bothered by the crowd. Wondering what/whom they were praying for? Saw a ritual where some monks played traditional music instruments and people came with various donations (food, money). Lots of souvenir shops & cafes around the big complex. Stayed 1 night in a hotel close by (Shambaling) and just walked here. Worth it.
A little vailage. not only is there the great stupa, but numerous templesmay shops add to the experience surrounding it and very great for people watching--
good . me and myself with friends been in this pale is very good stupagis king park far baudhis wet will cam again
Boudha Stupa is one of the largest in the world.. Boudha Stupa is one of the largest in the world. everybody must visit once here. Peace and quite and place for visitor.

Magical place. An incredible atmosphere at the Stupa. Constant stream of pilgrims, Tibetan, Nepali, and all other nations. Kora( circling) the Stupa takes place all day but is at its peak early morning and evening.Plenty of shops and restaurants circling the Stupa , so always somewhere to chill and people watch. Plenty of budget hotels nearby so why not stay for a few days and soak up atmosphere?The Stupa was damaged in 2015 earthquake but is well in its way to recovery with excellent restoration taking place.

Need a guide or guidebook. Really interesting - this is a World Heritage Site. It's a large stupa (which is a place of worship for Buddhists)It's large and they are still working on it from the earthquake damage, but it's quite pretty to see.There are some nearby restaurants and shops.
Boudhnth stupa day visit. This UNESCO heritage centre was good but there was work going on so some areas not accessible because of construction work

Biggest Stupa in the World.. The environment is very calm and beautiful. It feels great to do KORA (circumambulation) aroung the stupa with great bhuddhist chanting and many people making round aroung the stupa with great spirit. It feels the eyes of the Buddha is looking at you.

Ridiculously bad roads but peaceful at the top. We rented a scooter in Pokhara and tried to drive to the base of the Stupa steps. The road was atrocious, many times we had to actually dismount from the scooter to navigate the potholes. Lots of black smoke coming from busses too so if you go on a bike, take a scarf to cover your face.However the pagoda is extremely serene and quiet. Lots of beautiful flowers. It is a welcome break from the city!
The Great Stupa. An extraordinarily spiritual place. Just stop a while and settle inwards. Where do these inner feelings of joy come from? A wonderful place to explore.

Must visit. This is a lovely place to visit. A UNESCO site which is still under repairs work post the Nepal earthquake. We visited when it was cloudy and windy. Interacted with so many shopkeepers. Also bought a few souvenirs for friends. The stupa is supposedly one of the biggest in Asia.
Very impressive. I highly recommended this tour if you have limited time in Kathmandu. It is suitable for solo traveler,
Restoration is in progress . Visitors are not allowed inside the STUPA as the the restoration work is in progress. This fact should be mentioned while selling the tickets.
My favorite Place. Visit Bauddhanath in the evening. Enjoy sunset, the aroma, and the food. My personal favorite thing is to sit on one rooftop restaurant and enjoy the view. :)

Very nice place like going to tibet. Resturation of the stupa going on still take a visit its 15 minutes from Thamel. Lovely place like take a trip to Tibet resturation after earth quake goung on.Shops around is very expensive.

The largest shrine in the world. Amazing myth , history and nice architecture . Peaceful walk and great restaurants around the whole shrine. Would recommend to be there during the mornings or evenings where you can feel the shrine being alive with buddhism when the pilgrims circumblate the shrine.

V nice surroundings. I think the appropriate place to spend the whole day walking around with the monasteries and stupa itself. Momos restaurants, buddha chanting, flier of 5 elements hanging all around and the tibetan communities all makes this place perfect for travelers best choice.

Stunning. This is really stunning, even with limited access due to earthquake damage. It's really overwhelming to see how much damage occurred during the earthquake and it is very visible here. This is a must-see in Kathmandu.
good to see. This stupa is one of the biggest stupa in asia.here mostly tibetan people stay.there is manymany hotel and also shop.people much like so they must visit.

Sit down and take in the atmosphere!. I spent almost a day here. The stupa gets very busy, which adds to the atmosphere. There is not much you need to do. Just be there and watch. It is a tantalising and other worldly experience. Visit such that you can see the temple when it gets dark.
Fair enough. After the earthquake the statue is not any longer in place, however you can go around shopping and take some pictures of the images in the bottom of the monument

My favorite Stupa in Nepal. The Boudhanath stupa was under construction during my visit. But it was still really beautiful. The shops around the stupa are great and there are several rooftop cafes. My personal favorites are the Hello cafe and Sakura Japanese restaurant. The staff are great and the prices aren't bad.

Peaceful and a worthy experience. This Buddhist temple is smack in the middle of the city yet it is very peaceful. The place is surrounded with small shops selling artifacts and souvenirs but make sure you bargain well with the shopkeepers.

Full moon at Boudanath. The great Stupa is being repaired after the earthquake. It is very beautiful and on the full moon, many people come to make the kora nd light lamps. It was a good experience to see so many Tibetan people. Stupa View reataurant is a good plave to eat while visiting this importannt site.

Once the top is back on it.... ...Boudhanath will return to its old glory. Impressive temple, beautiful area, and so many things to see. Can easily spend half a day here and keeping checking out all the small side streets!

Despite being under construction it's a must-see. I had the good fortune to stay at the Hyatt Regency hotel, a mere 10-minute walk to Boudhanath, during a week-long stay in Kathmandu. I walked over to Boudhanath every evening and never got tired of it. The 2015 earthquake destroyed the spire of the stupa, which is currently being rebuilt. Accordingly, all access to the various levels of the stupa's mandala are closed. You can only walk around the perimeter and enter the small temple on the north side of the stupa.Nevertheless, this is in my opinion a sight you can't miss while in Kathmandu. It's the holiest Tibetan Buddhist shrine outside of Tibet. The perimeter of the square is filled with shops and monasteries. Pilgrims make circuits around the base of the stupa. I found it very tranquil and relaxing to walk with them as they chanted and some even prostrated themselves.I had dinners at the Roadhouse Cafe rooftop, which looks out at the south side of the stupa, as the sun set each evening. On my final morning in town I woke up early and walked over to Boudhanath at 6:30 a.m. The square was already buzzing with pilgrims circumambulating the stupa. I also had the treat of seeing and hearing novice monks engaged in their morning chants at one of the monasteries on the square.If you're in town, make sure to visit. Even without the ability to walk up to the top of the stupa this is still one of the special and unique holy places on earth to see.

Boudha...a day to remember. The stupa is huge, however under restoration due to the damage caused by the earthquake. the shops, curios, monastery and restaurants add flavor to the beauty of the place. the temple of Goddess Ajima, is beautiful.

Nice atmosphere, under repair though . The stupa itself was under renovations so quite unimpressive but the area around it is well worth a few hours to explore - many locals and a great shopping area.
Very nice site.. This stupa was in repair during my visit but the area is very inviting and many good shops and cafes are around this stupa. Good place to relax, have tea and people watch.

Still under construction. A vast temple, full of small doorways into a totally different culture from my African/English upbringing. Feelings of great energy in such a holy place, a must see for any first time visitor to Kathmandu!

Still Being Repaired. It was easy to tell that this was a beautiful place before the earthquake, but it was still being repaired when I visited and therefore did not get the full experience as there were workmen and tape restricting access. Still worth a visit though as there are lots of amazing attractions nearby.

Depending on how the earthquake reconstruction goes, this will be very impressive. During a March / April 2016 visit, there was a lot of reconstruction going on. It obviously was an astounding site before the earthquake and probably will be again when finished. The square surrounding the Boudhanath is full of restaurants with good food. It's certainly worth a visit but not too long unless it has been repaired.
Spiritual. Beautiful neat and clean. Nice experience though it was under construction after the earthquake damages.
remembering boudha. the tibetan way of livings and the morning prays is excellent. The stupa is stood for Mahayana budhism which is foudnded in Kathmandu valley

Favorite place in Kathmandu. Not everyone will have the same feeling about this place as I did. However, we found this to be an incredibly peacefully and special place in the midst of a huge city. We would often go here in the early evening and stay for dinner. The people watching, the views from the many rooftop restaurants and many shops we great.

Peaceful place.... Lovely place for peace of mind..... Great place to visit!
This is realistic world heritage place. Happy being this place.... very nice and very quit place!
Visit heaven. Worth it to visit, i love Nepal. All the peoples is very friendly, expecially for Visit heaven trek. Very excited

Worth the trip. While undergoing renovation as a result of the earthquake, the buddhist temple is still worth the visit. The Stupa is surrounded by a marketplace selling touristy items which curiously adds to the atmosphere. There are also quaint hotels. There is an entrance fee of about Rupees 500 for foreigners. If you are not already aware, one must complete the loop in a clockwise manner.

Affected by the earthquake, but still a good visit. The place has been affected by the earthquake, so there is some re-construction going on. It does affect the pictures but the symbolism remains. Take some time to visit the restaurants on the inside circle.
Value for visiting . This stupa is nice decorated. Very clean around stupa. Worthful for visiting this place and recommit for visiting

Energizing place. Normally i walk there from Thamel every time i am in Kathamndu. At first i was not really understanding circling around the stupa, but once i tried it there was no stopping me:) I had sore feet that year after trekking, yet i have added some Ozzy Osbourne music in my playlist and walked 'till i could not walk anymore. Amazing expirience, but you have to walk on the higher circle. It is indeed some kind of meditation and after trekking it feels like proper thing to do to say goodbye to Nepal. In 2015 with stupa gone we felt so devastating there, could only last for 5 to 10 minutes. It felt as if this place is a heart of Nepal and it was broken that year. But when Stupa will be restored is highly recommended, probably the best place in Kathmandu, but unfortunately overcrowded.
It is getting fixed. It is not worth going. You can barely see something because it is getting fixed. The temples around it are nice but you are the to see the estupa and it is not available.
Prime location. This one is located at a prime location. Second must see places after pasupathy temple. Buses from pasupathy are easily available. The stupa is yet to recover from the earthquake.
Thanks . Thanks to my friends who recumbent to go there and this palace is really important for travel about baud ha and above stupa

Beautiful place to visit.. Currently, under a lot of scaffolding and repairs after the earthquake, can't see the top part of the temple. Still worth a visit for the magnitude of it, and even to see the damage the earthquake caused. There is a fee of NPR500 (about USD$5).

Amazing to experience Buddhism and the Buddhist town of Kathmandu. Still under reconstruction after the earthquake. Amazing to see poor humble civils on the roofs, all together helping to reconstruct the temple. Tip: go and check the school of Tantra painting.

Great Stupa. Located at the center of the city . Yet could not recover fully from devastating earthquake..All around the White stupa there is a parikroma (traversing space) . Pilgrims are chanting and doing parikrama mostly elders Tibetan. All around Stupa there are numerous shops Nepalee Tibetan Culture and heritage .

Visit the art school!. The Stup is a beautiful place to visit, some of it is still being rebuilt, but worth visiting. The little shops around it are a great place to buy gifts and souvenirs with no hassles. We visited the Buddhist Thangka Centre, School of Thangka Art. So pleased we did. Upstairs you can sit and watch students and Masters painting, while a guide will share with you the forms of painting, and what they use. A must for visitors. This was such a beautiful moving experience. There is no pressure to buy, although I could not resist these masterpieces.

A lot of earthquake damage. Was really excited to be visiting this temple but the golden stupa is under a significant amount of scaffolding and covers. I was told that it should be fully repaired in 6 months so i would give it a miss if you are visiting before Feb 17
Beautiful . Beautiful name of Buddha in hat of Kathmandu call Baudha nath nice looking heritages please also shaping area around
Silent and wonderful. A wonderful place - pay it a visit. There is a certain peaceNice restaurants and small shops next to.

A must visit . The stupa at Boudha has been for centuries the most important landmark along the Tibet-Kathmandu trade route and today is in many regards the national symbol for Nepal. The Tibetans call it Chorten Chempo (the Great Stupa). Visiting the Boudha Stupa area is an imersion into Tibetan culture.
Quiet and wonderful. Its a good place full of positive vibes. A good place for enjoying tibetan culture and collecting cultural show pieces.
Amazing. Amazing Buddhist place in the middle of the city. The white dome is being restored now and the sorrounding lanes are abuzz with pilgrims and travellers
Beautiful place. Unfortunatelly because of the earthquake, the piece was damaged and right now it's covered, but still a good place to go around, have great food, meet people and take nice pictures

Nice serene temple Surrounded by bustling shopping area. This sacred place is surrounded by a circle of shops and has some of the most centralized and varied shopping in the city, so be sure to plan extra time if you have shoppers with you.

Spiritual Place. The stupa was under construction because of the earthquake, but it didn't lessen the spiritual feeling when I was in this place. People, monks, kids, adults, all were together, walked around in circle. It gave you the feeling that we are all just humans, and we are together living in this world, regardless our different background. A memorable place I've ever visited.

Serene pilgrim. When you went there, you'll see range of people who chanted and prayed. Local, Tibetan and Monks. Old women enjoyed sitting on the bench and fed pigeons.
I went there during the festival, and it was amazing!

Worth a Visit. Very peaceful and a great sense of belonging.
Little earthquake damage so you can enjoy it as it should be.
A Spectacular Spiritual Destination. You arrive at Boudhanath with a sense of common purpose amongst the worshippers, pilgrims, travellers and ordinary passers by - you feel you're on holy ground !
Boudhanath Stupa.. In search of peace. Go their, spend some time. You will find peace of mind. It is a place of worship and sprituality. A must go place in Nepal.

Terrific. Very interesting Buddhist temple. Barely damaged in the earthquake. Interesting monastery as part of complex. Also possible to see how traditional painting is done in ones of the shops/ schools.

Impressive!. BOUDHANAHT. KATHMANDU. One of the places to visit. World Heritage. A ticket around 500 R. Just a round clean square with the stupa in the middle. Now (6.2016), the works hidden the beautiful Buddha eyes. . Around the square, several restaurants, and a buddish temples with monks (we were lucky, and it was possible to hear the tibetan longhorns).

Very Interesting Indeed. Enjoyed the area, but is still under construction :( know that if you do not have a guide you will pick up one that just wants to "help" you understand the attention. The area has lots of places to get coffee and something to eat.

God resides within and one must relize not find . This quote gets its validity when we reached here..... though construction has been going on but still we could relate with it. People helping and not just workers they were for the construction process. Giving us live example of people help each other helping nepal re-built its legacy. Come here now to live the legacy.

Great Kathmandu Attraction. This is a great tourist attraction to visit in Kathmandu. Sadly, the stupa is still being rebuilt after last year's earthquake. However, you could walk around the stupa which is located in the center with shops lining the pathway across from the stupa. Feel free to volunteer to haul buckets of sand up to the workers rebuilding the stupa. Do venture into some alleyways and small lanes between the shops for some surprise bargains. You can pop into a functional temple for a short look-see and opt for a monk's blessing by paying a token sum. I'm sure we would be able to view the stupa in all iis glory once the rebuild is completed.

Great food, people & spectacular views. I went Boudhanath and I loved it! Although under construction (due to earthquake) it was still an amazing place. I could walk around and see the Stupa without feeling hassled by shop owners or other patrons. Which coming from Thamel is a great surprise. I recommend this place 100%. You can spend an hour or the whole day here. It's a very calming and beautiful place.
very impressive. we visited in good weather, this is a live real Stupa, with monks and bells and trumpets, very spiritual and steeped in history, this should definitely be on your agenda .
Bellissimo!. Enjoyed this sightseeing though the stupa is being rebuild qnd there are some scaffolding around it. Lots of monasteries, curio shops and excellent incense grangrances"
Amazing place. Enjoyed a private tour with a very knowledgable guide. Very colourful place and people. Entered a Buddhist temple where chanting and candles were the order of the day.
Awesome Place. its a nice place to visit.. with lots of culture and nice tibeten food... specially in the evening its worth to visit it.. lots of lights..wow its relaxing..
Nice . Undergoing renovation. Very spiritual. Higher priced shops and restaurants around the stupa - walk the Kora- not much else to do. Crowded at times - not very touristy, which is nice.
Impressive. Currently being repaired after earthquake damage. I have seen many pictures of this so it was great to see it in person. Located in the Tibetan area if Kathmandu. Good souvenir shopping.
Well spent evening. Went there to see the re construction of the stupa after the earthquake, ate at roadhouse cafe! Great view

A very special place. The largest Stupa in Nepal, and I think the world? A UNESCO world Heritage site has much to offer if you are observant and respectful. In the evening watch the Tibetan Refugees who have had to relocate to Nepal as the pay their respects. Go clockwise around the Stupa. Turn the prayer wheels, it works!One of my favourite pilgrimage sites when I come here. Right now it is still under repair from the earthquake, but they are making huge strides to get it restored. Not the best restaurants in town, and over priced Nepali items, buy elsewhere. come here for the experience.

Damaged from earthquake. Unfortunately the construction going on made this into a poor photo opportunity. The little temple was interesting but there was a little person and they were treating him like a tourist attraction wanting us to take photos and such making me feel uncomfortable.
Boudhanath | Kathmandu. 250 rupees entry fee, good place to take portraits of Nepali people, try to explore little side street, place to get Tibetan clothing, souvenirs, furniture, etc.
Enjoy the beauty of the Stupa.. Boudhanath Stupa is just a short taxi ride from Thamel. I recommend this place to all the travelers who visits Nepal.
A great place to have lunch or dinner. There a lots of good roof top restaurants around Boudhanath. A great place to enjoy the view of the Stupa
Wow...!. This Stupa is wonderful to see. It is grand and a wonderful site in your camera lens! Highly recommended to see.

Monkeys everywhere!. Beautiful shrine! Aside from that, you will be hassled by vendors all the way, there is about a thousand (seems like) stairs, so be in shape, or you will be by the end... there are dogs and monkeys everywhere, don't feed and they leave you alone. Historical world. If you love and adore history and culture of buddhism then you must visit this stupa. But even if you are not of this type you must visit it. It is worth visit with excellent sculptures, colors, and art. View is breathtaking as you enter. As well as you get good foods nearby. Sit here peacefully and try to feel its aroma. You dont have to walk much around. Place is small but has everything you need to know about art. You must come to "chabel" the main crossroads. But just ask microvans for "bouddha" and get off 10 meters from the stupa. 3 hours is enough i guess
Reconstruction. After the reconstruction, the place will be fantastic and inspiring. Half a day is needed to see the surrounding and goods for sale!

Spire still missing after the earthquake. Having been there in 2004 before, the look was unfamiliar as the spire is still missing after the earthquake. Still, Boudhanath Stupa is one of the world's most spiritual places.

Good Place to see.. I was here last week.This is a huge stupa related to buddhism mainly.Renovation work is in progress as earthquake ruined the temple premises.But nice place to see.A tibetian temple in front of this stupa, is also very attractive to visit.must watch.

Great place for history and vendors. You will be accosted by almost everyone to buy something. Plus you will start to see the same things over and over again. However, here they have a little more variety and some good restaurants near by.

Peaceful experience. We visited at dusk and immediately became part of the gathering circling the stupa. Although the stupa is largely closed off for repairs following last year's earthquake the main attraction is the serenity and peaceful ambience.

diversed experience. when you first think of Stupa you feel its going to be calm and peaceful. but ths place had more than just the regular experience. the entire surrounding of the stupa is packed with various kinds of stores selling a lot of local handicrafts.. there are cafes too where you can sit and enjoy a small meal, there are all kinds of people around which makes it feel like the most central place inside kathmandu and the purpose for your visit is not just the calm experience of the stupa but endless observation of people and a lot of other things that distract your mind., must visit..

Kathmandu, Nepal is spectacular!. So many different sights accessible by very affordable transportation options. Each sight had its own charm.Had a great brealfast in a restaurant while seeing the place. Weather was great in mid-morning
Peace :). Such an amazing place in midst of the crowded city. Absolutely love it. I always go here to lit up lights.

work in progress. The Stupa is still being repaired after the earthquake, it is still worth the visit as it is awe inspiring with a lovely calm vibe, Tell the guides to leave you alone, and take the time to slowly walk around the stupa soaking it all in, well worth the visit
A great place. A peaceful place to visit with family. Join the crowd and take rounds of the stupa. a good experience.

Absolute Delight. The stupa is surrounded by large no of roof top cafes. Sit down for a coffee & relax your mind when you visit this place. The place has peaceful air and hence a serene experience amidst large crowd of tourists too. The place is surrounded by tibetan stores for shopping too.
great holy place. The great holy place ! what a peaceful place..The monasteries are the main attractions. The Mantra "Om mani padme hum" heal the mind. The largest Buddhist Stupa in the world !

A great place to watch and walk. Walking around the stupa early morning or late afternoon is a great experience. Or just sit down and watch the people pass by. A sunset drink from one of the restaurants overviewing the stupa is a great thing.

Enjoyable place to stroll, crowded with the faithful and tourists. We stayed near Boudhanath and walked around it most days. I enjoyed the buzz of the crowds and people watching at this busy hub. There were more locals and monks than tourists and the shops that surround the stupa are worth a browse. We picked up several well priced souvenirs here. You'll have to watch for people dropping to the ground in prayer and dodge numerous sleeping dogs, but you can also escape to one of the numerous restaurants that overlook the site and watch the world go by.While it is crowded, the fact that there are no cars is a welcome change in a city where traffic seems to have no rules!
Worth a visit. This place is amazing. I would recommend this place to everyone visiting kathmandu valley. Really a peaceful place .

Still worth a visit .... Although the stupa was damaged by the earthquake and is now under reconstruction, the place is still worth a visit. You can still have a pretty good overall view from the terrace of any of the restaurants and cafes surrounding the stupa, while at the ground level there are countless little shops selling all kinds of, mostly, Tibetan stuff, beginning with prayer wheels, yak butter candles and thankas, and ending with high quality curio and antiques...We went there in the afternoon and after a tour of the shops and a good coffee, we just sat on the steps of one of the shops and watched the people passing by: Tibetans doing their counter-clockwise circumambulation of the holly stupa, rotating their prayer wheels or handling their prayer beads while chanting mantras, tourists, a few stray dogs, yak butter candle smell in the air, the sun was slowly coming down and one of the nearby music stores was playing "Om Mani Padme Uhm" again and again....
Big stupa, under renovation. Went there june 2016, the big stupa was under renovation because of 2015 earthquake.Nonetheless it is a good place, lots of shops and restaurant around the Stupa

Landmark well worth visiting. We stayed around Bouddha for 5 nights and visited the stupa daily. It was under renovation after the earthquake but still could be visited on the first floor. From the terraces of the cafes around you can climb to view work to complete the dome of the stupa, and we were lucky enough to see the gilding of one part. Tuesday evening just before sunset is a great time to see large crowds of devotees buying oil lamps, prostrating themselves, and spinning their prayer wheels.
beautiful place. one of the most beautiful temples in nepal. defininitely recommend visiting. be prepared to encounter some monkeys

Interesting Visit for One Hour. When we visited Boudhanath in May 2016, the site was still under repair not allowing the viewer to appreciate its true beauty. Putting that detail aside, the Stupa was only worth about an hour's visit since it was the singe thing to see there. Other sites tend to be part of much larger attraction allowing more time to explore. The only other aspect was the many souvenir stores surrounding the structure in a large circle. It made the experience a little disappointing as it seemed more of a tourist shopping area than a religious shrine. Still worth seeing, especially when repaired, but try to find other sites to see nearby to make the trip worthwhile.

Boudhanath (Stupa). This place must have been amazing. It is obviously damaged now but they are in the process of repairing it. Hopefully they will be done soon and it will be back to amazing. I still very much enjoyed seeing it and the flow of people around it.

Earthquake damage saddening. Such a beautiful piece of architecture and religion. Seeing the earthquake damage and the degree to which is was ruined was heart breaking. Still worth visiting even if for the people watching and the experience of being there

Under restoration..... The stupa is only a mini Tibetan market presently as the main stupa is closed for repairs.Avoidable till repaired.Shops around the place are full of Buddhist relics n artifacts at not so reasonable prices. An old Japanese garment store selling cotton clothes is the only worthwhile shop.

Great place. The stupa is currently being renovated after the earthquake damaged it. The atmosphere around the stupa is amazing, plenty of monasteries and locals circumbulating the premises to accumulate merits. Also a great place to shop for incense and buddhist statues.

A good landing pad. Boudhanath is a great place to use as your landing point in Kathmandu and Nepal. You could easily spend your whole trip in and around the Stupa, and there are dozens of restaurants and cafes catering to all tastes and appetites. The restoration work is going well, and it's worth paying the entry fee even though it is easy to 'sneak in' from the many alleyways that circle the Stupa. On Saturdays there is a dog clinic run in the Stupa and the volunteers are happy to let you pet the dogs or lend a hand for a while as they clean, brush, and vaccinate the many street dogs for free. Sunday mornings really come alive, with hundreds descending for prayer and offerings. Evenings tend to be quiet, with most vendors and restaurants closed by 8.30/9pm. Prayer goes through the night though, so it's still worth a visit after dark.

Part of a day's excursion. At the time of my visit (early March) the structure was under renovation / reconstruction. This did not take away anything from my experience as I very much enjoyed watching the traditional methods and techniques of building. I love the ambiance of the late afternoon hustle and bustle around here . Many people , many butter lamps , shops to visit , some great tucked away scrumptious restaurants in the area .Though I'm not sure if I'd want to spend a whole day with the frenetic pace , this place is defo worth a visit .
For tibetan buddhism. Sadly under repair, didn't find different than thamel, shops, restaurants. It can be interesting maybe who interested tibetan buddhism for others I didn't find anything.

Yeah it's big. "The worlds biggest stupa", lives up to its name, it's big!!! Currently under renovation after the earthquake but does not stop locals coming each day and taking a walk around. A nice place to leave the hustle and bustle of the car horns and enter a mini town inside a city. Lots of nice places to eat and have a drink and watch the world go by.
Unfortunately still very damaged . Sadly this beautiful monument is still under repair... Still impressive but the stupa at the 'monkey temple' is far more interesting and better value.

Great stupa. This stupa is much bigger than the one in Swayambhunath. Unfortunately when we visited it. It was reconstructed. There are always many tourists from Tibet and China there. They told me that the stupa is one of the most sacred stupa around the area. Well, it's worth visiting.

A temple with a difference . A great place immersed in culture and tradition. The ambience was different to the other temples. The layout was very good. Interesting to see how sticks and poles are holding up damage from the earthquake. Rebuilding is happening but a long way to restore back to what would be its original beauty.

You will not see what it was. Nice UNESCO World Heritage Site. I had visited even in my earlier visit to Nepal. Badly heat by the earthquake. So you will not find the original flavour now. Reconstruction is going on.
Entrancing. The whole place has an air of tranquility even though there are plenty people. The Tibetan flavour permeates all.

NIce visit. Visited here as part of a day tour. Interesting site, lots to see and many good souvenir shops and restaurants. Such a shame the site was damaged in the earthquake, but rebuilding has started and it should be back to all its glory soon.

Boudhanath Stupa The Boudhanath Stupa, a world heritage site, is one of the holiest and most recognisable attractions in. Boudhanath StupaThe Boudhanath Stupa, a world heritage site, is one of the holiest and most recognisable attractions in Kathmandu. A Tibetan woman praying at BoudhanathThe Boudhanath stupa is one of the holiest and most recognisable sites in Kathmandu.Assigned UNESCO world heritage status in 1979, Boudhanath (aka the Boudha, Chorten Chempo and Khasa Caityais) has a diameter of 120 metres, making it the largest temple in Nepal.The stupa is built on an octagonal base, is surrounded by prayer wheels, and has colourful prayer flags draped from its 36-metre central spire.Boudhanath is rich in symbolism: it has five statues of Dhyani Buddhas, representing the five elements (earth, fire, water, air and ether); nine levels, representing Mount Meru (the mythical peak at the centre of the Buddhist cosmos); and 13 rings from its base to its apex (representing the steps to enlightenment or Nirvana).Boudhanath is the religious centre of Nepal's Tibetan/Buddhist community, and is surrounded by around 50 monasteries and shops settling Tibetan artefacts. About 15% of the population are Buddhists.Look out for Tibetan monks, with shaven heads and maroon robes, and pilgrims spinning prayer wheels and buying yak butter and tsampa (roasted barley flour). Be careful to observe Tibetan custom by walking around the stupa in a clockwise direction.There has been a stupa on this site since Tibetan king Songsten Gampo converted to Buddhism in around 600 AD.when? Late afternoon is the best time to visit, after tour groups have departed. The Losar (Tibetan New Year) celebrations are held here in February or March.£$€¥ Rs 250 (foreigners); Rs 50 (SAARC). (Sept 2015)
Om mane padme. Best place to be relaxed mentally and spiritually,When ever am tired and weak I often visit here at Boudhanath stupa.

SPIRITUAL STUPA. A MAGIC MOMENT IN YOUR TRIP IN NEPAL. Surely, this stupa or chorten is one of the biggest of the world. It is pilgrimage place where many tibetan people and local people come here for chatting, lighting butter lamps, socializing or strolling clockwise. Unique atmosphere. It is a spiritual and mistic place!!!
Om . Amazing trip and beautiful road to go saw the Stupa ! Pokhara it's the best place to stay and enjoy and visited around ! I will comeback !

One of the place never miss it... i had been 3 time . Boudhanath after earthquake it still crowdy with people who come to pay respect and tourists. you can feel the heart of believe. there are many reataurants that you can relaxand see the stupa.
Under construction, but still a great visit. Go there for a multi-cultural religious experience, typical of the Indian sub-continent. Would be much better once the construction work is over!

Paid NPR200 to see almost nothing, the stupa was underconstruction. It is less than 30 minutes driving from Thamel city to this place. For me, it wasn't worth for a visit. We went in, walked a round, then we left, it took us less than 30 minutes to visit this place.
So quaint. The little bouddhanath old city is really charming!!! Go to see and stay one night maybe more to taste the Buddhism life

Road to Boudhanath is in bad shape and full of traffic. Also the stupa is under repairs. The road which leads to the stupa is being renovated. Actually, it looks like the whole town of Kathmandu is under renovation. Roads are cluttered with debris everywhere. Traffic jam everywhere. Lots of dust. Lots of air and noice pollution. The stupa is also being renovated. It suffered damage after the deadly earthquake in 2015
One of the most important places in Buddhism. Currently under rennovation due to the damage which happen because of the earthquake. the venue is open to public for making the rounds around the Stupa.

Huge stupa and good meaning behind the architech. It was under reconstruction during my visit and it is expected to be complete by the end of the year 2016 so I would recommend traveller to visit after 2016. It is still worth a visit though but i think it will be more beautiful after it is completed.

Construction. I visited the stupa and was so amazed watching the workers move bricks to rebuild after the 2015 earthquake. The construction is so hands on and primitive. Do not exchange with the people set up in front of shops.

Nice and Fun. It was sad to see how destroyed that beautiful stupa is by the earthquake. Nonetheless, there is so much to see. The "thanka" school, the shops, other temples and even one with monks singing when I arrived.I recommend the Spanish restaurant called La Casita. Good wine and Jamon SERRANO that tested better than ever!
Bouddhanath is rebuilding. i visited the Boudhanath stupa with my guide. i was being reconstructed due to the damage by last year earthquake. but it is really very strange and wonderful!
Sightseeing . Very beautiful and nice huge Stuppa in the world. Very good for meditation and pray for goodwill. Worth the visit

Reconstructing the stupa. During 2015 earthquake the stupa was badly damaged. Currently the reconstruction is in progress. They have kept the small model of orginal stupa for tourists. The temple is located approx 2- 2.5 km from Pashupatinath temple. You can reach here by 'Tusal Marg' which is short cut from pashupatinath temple to boudhanath temple. There are many monasteries in the temple area.There are many types of shops & restaurants available. You can easily spend 3-4 hrs here. For SAARC countries the entry fees is 100 NPR
Beautiful . Love this place and its devotional ambience. Some great eating places around the stupa. However, best to shop along the side streets were prices are much lower.

peace in mind and energy in body. I have visited the place a lot of time as i find this place gives me calm and peace in mind. Mostly with my friends i like to hang out there.Its one of the best place to go in Kathmandu.

Reconstruction of the boudhanath. Confronting to the rest of the city is this a very quiet place without the chaotic traffic...it is really amazing to see how busy the inhabitans of kathmandu are reconstructing their city and special the boudhanath.

Continuous grief. Boudhanath was the biggest stupa of Nepal till 2015 earthquake. Even there is no fast reconstruction still, here is one of the most crowded praying center with the locals who are performing kora around the stupa.

Being repaired after earthquake. Although the stupa was damaged by the 2015 earthquake, it is still interesting to see. You can watch the workers as they rebuild. The area around the stupa is also interesting, with shops and restaurants. You can get a great view of the stupa from a top floor of a nearby restaurant

Recap Rebuilt Revive. After withstanding two major earthquakes less than a month apart, the sacred Boudhanath Stupa still stand firm with slight structural damage. Visitors and worshipers are seen circling round the Stupa as usual, with background of workers rebuilding the structure. Ultmost gratitude to all whom had come together from all corners of the world to put back the smile on the people of Nepal.

Still Restoring after the Quake, but Beautiful!. The Boudhanath is still undergoing restorations after last year's earthquake, but is doesn't take away from its beauty or magnificence. It was inspiring to see how much everyone adores this Stupa. As the largest Stupa in the world, it is a must see.

Wonderful world heritage site.. I was happy to see this site as this is not only a world heritage site but also a piece of marvellous architecture full of devotion of people's faith. Serene environment with shopping opportunities makes it worth spending half a day...

Renovation in progress from earthquake damage. Beautiful monument but the tomb was destroyed in earthquake and they are rebuilding it now. Place is very nice and must visit as part of Kathmandu sight seeing.
Amazing place to visit. it was sad to see top part collapsed in earthquake in 2015 but they are building it back again. The buddha eyes are just amazing on these stupa.
