At the right season, sometime before winter or spring, the air is simply cool, fresh and crisp. The kind of weather where one doesn't feel much sweat and perspiration. Or just order a cup of local tea and appreciate the moment by a window :)

Boudhanath Stupa is a very historical place and holy place.. A lot of shops and monasteries around the place.a few good eating places. Dislike having to buythe tickets each time we visit the place, even going to the shops around the stupa!!!
Stunning. The stupa itself was huge and absolutely stunning. There were lots of interesting temples around. It's a busy place with lots of shops, pilgrims and tourists.

Roaming around stupa.... ☺☺☺☺. I feel surprised when i entered boudhanath stupa. its full of buddhist and their culture and way of their believe towards stupa. i feel glad that such stupa are still located in our country.. "Birthplace of buddha"

A beautiful destination. This is a beautiful place to spend a couple of hours wondering around and enjoying the precinct. Take your time and enjoy the restaurants, the sites and some peace before heading back out in to the busy streets of Kathmandu.
Basic Symbol of Nepal. If you stay positive, and get all the information about it, you'll understand all the basic principles about this place...

The best place in kathmandu. This is perhaps the best place i visited in kathmandu. There is a very nice white temple, a lot of monks and devote people walking all around it and praying. The square is awesome, full of shops and restaurant with terraces offering an amazing view from the top. Highly reccomended!!!
a must. there are a number of stupas and temples to visit. this is a major sight to visit and must not be missed. Very holy and moving pace to be

Must visit if your in Kathmandu. Beautiful views and small shops line the walkway around the Stupa. 300 step climb from the front side, 100 step climb from the rear. 250 rs ($2.50 U.S.) admission fee. Worth time and trouble.

Bouddha is a magical place at dawn. Bouddhanath is a wonderful iconic destination for all visitors to Nepal. I feel so peaceful as soon as I enter the circle and the act of circling the Stupa at dawn with the ordinary Tibetan folk is a joy. Look right as you go clockwise - it can be a bit Golden Mile if you look to the shops and cafes!
Humbled. That's how one feels when one sees the devotees showing their reverence. Beautiful Buddhist temple. Lovely experience.

Heritage site with good food options. The atmosphere of this site is best experienced at dusk when the true pilgrims make their way silently round the stupa. Even better is full moon or festivals such as Tibetan New Year. The best view is from one of the roof-top restaurants. Although there is a wide variety of Tibetan businesses to chose from, the Stupa is the main attraction.

Must visit in Nepal. The Stupa was great, the best time to visit it would be early morning or during evenings, there are a lot of café and lounges around the Stupa where you can enjoy a lot of good coffee, food and Nepalese delicacy.

peace in the crowd. I really loved visiting Boudhanath Stupa. I was shocked when I entered the Boudhanath Stupa premises. Outside it was too noisy and over crowded but when enterd in the premises it is peaceful and amzing place. Who would have believed there would be a largest stupa on earth surrounded by the houses on its all sides.
Spectacular. One of the biggest stupas I have seen. A lovely, quiet place, great for some reflection time. There are tons of shops all around and is easy to get to from anywhere in Kathmandu.
impressive with the religious atmosphere. better to choose a rooftop restaurant for spending your time

What a wonderful place. This place was one of my favorite places because it is like Mecca. People will make their way to this holy spot to walk around the Stupa 7 times as their tradition calls for. So you people of all ages coming to this enormous structure to worship. Shops all around where you can buy ALL your suviners from Napal.

Nepal's #1 Buddhist shrine. This giant whitewashed stupa used to be out in the. Countryside, but is now in a suburb of Kathmandu. However, it is surrounded by Tibetan Buddhist temples, shops and restaurants and is one of the key sights of Kathmandu. It's a great place for people watching and for quiet contemplation. Make sure you go up to the upper levels of the mandala base as you get a very different perspective. The chanting monks add to the atmosphere and the devotions of regular people will make you wonder.
Busshist Stupa. Nice ancient stupa of buddist religion. One get to see the Buddist religion from close. Nice place for visitors from foreign.

Huge Stupa. I was unlucky, and was a rainny day, if not I heard that it's very recommendable to see the monks praying there. So maybe I will need to go back and check it again. Anyways, you can have lunch in one of the terraces around enjoying the view and magic of Kathmandu

World Heritage site, a religious/commercial experience. Completely encircled by shops and restaurants, one is still taken on a religious adventure by the sheer size and beauty of this stupa. The devotion of the many worshippers is inspiring. You will have to share space with hundreds of pigeons. Watch out for celestial droppings !
very peaceful. must visit this place, it is a nice and peaceful place. Please take care of your hand baggage while travelling over there because of temple surrounded by so many monkey.

Must be visited!. The atmosphere is amazing. Many people and monks walking around the stupa doing your prayers. The best moment to visit is at the night. Many people lighting candles let the place more interesting

Breathtaking!. The stupa is absolutely breathtaking, and there are a lot of surrounding temples that you can visit. The food inside the compound is a bit pricey, but if you go out of the gate, you can find local eateries that serve delicious (and cheap!) momos.
Vast stupa. Largest Buddhist Stupa. Allowed only up to first storey. Lots of shops around but expensive. since climbing was involved, we went around the Stupa. Nice experience

A "Must-do" in Kathmandu. We arrived early in the morning as Tibetan monks and locals participated in morning prayers and walked around the stupa. Visitor should always walk with the crowd and always walk clockwise (its bad luck otherwise-and frowned upon). The base of the stupa is over 300 feet in diameter with a walkway surrounding the stupa. The stupa and walkway is then surrounded by monasteries and many small shops.

A grand stupa. A well worth visit to see this grand stupa. We took a taxi to see this iconic stupa. Although a small fee is required to see the stupa it is worth it. As with any of them, you need to walk clockwise around it. About 1/4 of the way round you can go into one of buildings surrounded by the shops and push the bells which is supposed to give you good luck (although makes you dizzy!!) but you should definitely walk up to the top and you can have magnificent views of the stupa and surrounding area. You can walk up the stairs to the first layer of the stupa where it and walk around it but you cannot walk any higher than that. We saw a few people doing it and it seemed disrespectful and rude so just stay on the main bit where all of the people will be. There are many cafes and shops surrounding the stupa and is worth going up to a rooftop or terrace to have a drink or some food with amazing views. Worth the visit.

One of the largest Stupa in the world.. I walked around the whole area. It is very nice and calm feeling in the area. I visited in March and the weather is quite hot, bright and sunny, so it is a good idea if you wear a hat or use umbrella. They have plenty of coffee shops, cafe, shops and handicraft area for you to choose.You have to pay for the entry and is not much.
Peaceful and beautiful. Such a peaceful place and plenty of interesting things to see. Coming in from the busy street outside into the tranquillity of the streets around the temple is lovely.

Morning at Boudhanath. Spent a lovely morning meandering at Boudhanath Stupa. Visited the temples and watched the people.. whether sightseers or monks and pilgrims amd the feeders and children amongst the pigeons! It was our final day in KTM so a bit of shopping was on the agenda... though normally would have ignored these.There are a lot all the way round.Travelled by taxi from Thamel area 500rp Easy to enter 500rp entry at gate.Enjoyed an Illy coffee! And finding a return taxi very easy just outside the gate.. friendly and speaking some English our driver returned us to Thamel for same price..bit of negotiaiting.. but we knew the price to expect which always helps! Ask at your hotel before leaving.

Interesting. It was worth the visit, but the over priced retaurants around the Stupa are not big on quality food but rather hefty price tags. Its much better to visit the small restaurants where the food is more authentic and cheaper.

Busy Boudhanath. I love this place and have visited before. It is much busier than it was 20 years ago and much more of a tourist attraction but still manages to retain its mysticism. Lots of rooftop eateries with great views of the mayhem downstairs and the lights when they are turned on.

Little Tibet in Kathmandu. Once you enter in to this enclave off a busy street in downtown Kathmandu , the ambience changes significantly. It is quiet, peaceful with an aura of serenity. It is so interesting wandering around the little souvenir shops and in the square surrounding the Boudanath stupa. Stop for a cuppa masala tea in one of the rooftop restaurants. Highly recommended.
A must visit. We spent quite a lot of time there. Lovely at nightt he site is surrounded by a little too many shops for my taste. Would have liked it better had it been a little quieter.

Awesome Religious Site - fantastic in size and in impression - a genuine must see !. We visited Boudanath twice during our stay in Kathmandu, the only place we did visit twice such is the impressive nature of this iconic structure.For such a large stupa it is fairly well hidden from the road and the entrance is not obvious at first. This adds to the gravitas as when one does enter the large and calm area the Stupa sits in - it is a huge change in tempo. The prayer flags and the quieter cleaner atmosphere is telling. The Stupa it's self is massive. There is a wide pedestrian area around the stupa lined on the outsid with giftshops, Cafes and the like. Visitors and pilgrims, as in all Bhuddist sites, walk in a clockwise direction around the stupa.One can walk on the lower areas of the Stupa it's self. There are excellent views and vantage points to be had from the numerous rooftop cafes.On our second visit we ventured a little further into the complex. If you follow the small road / pathway which is directly opposite the main entranceway you can visit some small Bhuddist temples which are very very well worth a visit in their own right and would attract high Trip Advisor scores if listed separatley. Got some brilliant pictures at those.So all in in all Boudhanath Stupa is a fantastic attraction, an imposing religious site, a photographers dream and a true must see !
Liked it okay. I liked this place moderately. The site is surrounded by a little too many shops for my taste. Would have liked it better had it been a little quieter.

A must visit. Unlike most tourist spots don't visit here early in the morning , unless you want to share your space with hundreds of worshippers . Worth taking in lunch or drink from one of the many roof top resteraunts. Lots of places to practice your bargaining around the edges and the archetcutre of the surrounding buildings is rather special.
very atmospheric. We spent quite a lot of time there. Lovely at night with all the butterlamps lit. We were lucky enough to see some sort of festival where we were handed a packet of biscuits!

An experience in the midst of Kathmandu. Wow, this place is worth visiting for any tourist in Kathmandu. Around this haven, the streets are super busy and scary. Around the gigantic stupa you can navigate easily and find many shops and a European feel to the place. The shops form the perimeter and you need to walk clockwise to respect the Buddhist icon as all Buddhists walk clockwise around their edifices. Spin the many prayer wheels. We found a stall on a side street that sold Tibetan salt super cheap and clean. Get a face mask for the pollution you will find breathing in the air. It is free - no entry fee for foreigners!
calm within a storm. Shops surround this site. The site dominates the area and is the focalpoint for various cafes atound the area.

A stupa not to be missed!. This is truly a magnificent site, and sight! And one not to be missed regardless of whether or not you are a Buddhist. We visited at lunchtime and had a great meal on the elevated terrace of one of the restaurants - I think it was called The Best View Restaurant - and the view is certainly spectacular, of the stupa as well as the surrounding buildings and the snow covered mountains in the distance. We then went for a walk around the stupa and when up close its size is even more impressive, as are the multitude of prayer flags fluttering in the early afternoon breeze. We were so absorbed by the splendor of the stupa that we barely noticed the shops, and the never ending passing parade of visitors, monks and pilgrims made for a rich and textured moving tapestry of humanity. This visit was certainly one of the highlights of our few days in Kathmandu.

Nothing impressive but good photo op. Nothing impressive for the Boudhanath Stupa. Just a photo op. Yes you could spend an afternoon at one of the shabby cafes build around to gaze at the stupa from a height but that would not be worth it. The shopping opportunities are reasonably better. Tibetan arts, crafts and paintings besides singing or healing bowls deck encircle the stupa arena. Overall a must watch in the city as it just exists. The entrance through the hectic bazaar street is not quite impressive.
Great Place to know more about Buddhism!!!. Loved the Stupa which was beautiful and big.Took lots of Photograph..I could see lots of people from Tibet in this location!!!

We visited on the 3rd April 2015.. We visited this famous stupa on Good Friday.It was very busy we lots of Nepalese people visiting for their festival day.We paid a small fee to enter, and spent a lovely hour just wandering around, taking in the festival feel. Lots of colourful people. It is a must to visit whilst in Kathmandu.
The place to be. Make sure you understand what the stupa is. if you do the blessing of walking around it in a clockwise direction are innumerable. Such a great energy and vibe.

An oasis in the middle of the city. Its takes just a few steps from the crowded road to enter this world heritage site. When inside you are transported to a different world. The stupa itself is a stunning sight and all along the circumference there are restaurants from where you get a brilliant view of the entire area. Not to be missed.

Historical nice place but needs more cleaning .. Historical nice place but needs more cleaning . If you are staying in kathmandu and have time you can visit it . However We didn't like the smell there .

A Buddhist icon. This gigantic stupa is a World Heritage-listed site and a must-see on every devout Buddhist's list. It can get very crowded as it is a favourite tour destination for Tibetan pilgrims. All around the stupa are plenty of shops selling Buddhist religious paraphernalia, not forgetting too to mention the presence of hawkers. It seems a contradiction that while Buddhism teaches us not to be too attached to material things the shops are enticing us to do the opposite by indulging in retail therapy!
A must visit in Kathmandu. It is the eye of the Buddha that follows you 360 degrees, of course there are lot of shopping around this, well worth ignoring them and concentrate on the temple.
Nice place worth a visit. can easily complete this place along with others like Pashupatinath temple, swayambhu etc. Great view of the valley from the top. calming effect.
Cool.. This is the beautiful and largest stupa in the heart of city. You will get full refresh and enjoy even in the mid afternoon. Also the quite place. Better to visit this holy Temple by everyone.
One of the top 2 attractions in Kathmandu. This is worth visiting.The stupa is surrounded by shops, hotels, restaurants, money changers etc....

One of must see. Do you the difference between Stupa and temple? Ask a guide. We visited this Stupa as a part of Heritage tour and spend an hour and learn quite a bit, shape, teaching and etc. from the Guide.

Good tibetian Buddhist stupa . This is one of the famous tibetian Buddhist stupa. Lots of Buddhist from all over the world come here for spiritual energy. This is one of the heritage site also in Nepal. Very clean and peaceful environ. You will find lots of shops around where you can buy gifts. But pls do bargain on price. Must visit place around kathmandu Nepal.

Loved all of "Little Tibet" with its magnificent stupa. This stupa, the largest in Kathmandu offered fascinating photo ops from all angles. It is located in the small circular Boudhanath (Little Tibet). The shopping opportunities were fantastic, we enjoyed seeing intricate mandalas being painted, and we purchased some singing(healing) bowls as well. We ate in a restaurant that overlooked all the action and loved the momos (dumplings). The best thing was admiring all of the locals in their traditional garb. The older people were the most photogenic.

An Excellent Place. This is leading tourist spot of Kathmandu.this Boudha stupa was built by just demise of Lord Budhdha.An entresting story about this place. Jajima, an Apsara in previous life has four husband and all four husband have a son. All four son contributed to built this stupa.This is one of the holiest place for Buddhist not only from Kathmandu but for all buddhist from Asian Countries also.Here we found mental piece.
A Big Stupa. Its in Kathmandu city. One of the Biggest stupa. Around which there are lot of shops for purchasing. One must bargain before purchasing.

Beautiful place. The great stupa of boudhanath is a must visit on your list. I was their with my family we had great experience and did 3 Cora (circle) for good luck. We were up on the stupa side and view was great most of all so peaceful. Lot of people lot to take picture.

Fabulous. Visited here nearly every day of our stay - lots of shops and restaurants (a bit like the money changers at the Temple??) but a wonderful spiritual feeling as you walk around surrounded by chanting monks and pilgrims. The true Kathmandu.

one of the holiest places of pilgrimage for Nepalese Budddhist. one of the holiest places of pilgrimage for Nepalese Budddhist and neighboring Asian countries but the site for a one day stay with varied options

An absolute must-see and highly recommended.. One of the holiest temple in Nepal and one of the largest stupa in the world. It is the main pilgrimage site for Tibetan Buddhists. A place not to be missed when visiting Kathmandu. Buddha's blue eyes watches you as you walk, clockwise, around the stupa. Lots of interesting shops, restaurants, and small monasteries surround the stupa. At the right time, one can watch monks conducting their ritual prayers. An absolute must-see and highly recommended.

Beautiful stupa. Bouddhanath is a wonder to behold. Walk around it in a clockwise direction and then go sit in one of the second floor restaurants with a cup of tea and dessert. Also, walk up the stairs and visit the wall murals that are in one of the temples surrounding this peaceful place.

A day of spirituality, shopping, dining and bliss!. The Boudhanath Stupa is not only the largest to be seen in Kathmandu and one of the holiest places of pilgrimage for Nepalese Budddhist and neighboring Asian countries but the site for a one day stay with varied options. The stupa is approximately some 14 kilometers from the central area of Kathamandu. Local transport routes are indicated in Nepali only. A taxi costs approximately 600 to 500 Nepali rupees. Most taxi drivers will offer to wait for you some two to three hours to get the return fare as well.If you are passionate about photography, spirituality and having a days experience of leisure it might be wise to simply get a taxi back when you are ready.The stupa is surrounded by many shops, restaurants and cafés as well as four monasteries.There are many visiting Buddhist monks as well as pilgrims to be seen walking around the stupa as they carry out their spiritual practices.Entrance to the monasteries require only taking off your shoes and even though the monks are quite laid back even when carrying out their prayer, as a matter of respect it would be perhaps a matter of respect trying not to snap photos openly ( for example in the middle aisle as if you were observing some rare species.) Unfortunately some westerners seem to have just no regard for the spiritual practices of others snapping photographs with flash or standing next to prayer wheels and not allowing those in prayer to freely circle around.Entrance cost to this world heritage site cost 250 Nepali Rupees. This might very well be one of the cleanest and best well kept heritage sites to be found in Kathmandu. This is definitely a site well worth visiting.Enjoy the bliss of this profoundly spiritual place.

Fantastic cultural experiece. Boudhanath Stupa was a wonderful day experience. The Stupa is surrounded by rows of beautiful original Tibetan Architecture, local artists show off their wares and the cultural experience is absolutely beautiful. If your visiting Kathmandu, this is an absolute must see and do experience.
wonderfully spitatual place. A totally different ex[perience to the rest of Kathmandu and surrounded by brilliant places to eat. Plenty of tourist shops as well
Nice.. The temple is beautiful! The largest stupa you'll see in Nepal. It's extremely photo worthy. It is very busy however, best experience in the afternoon, or the morning.

"exciting place ". Worth the taxi rude,for sure...many souvenir stalls and restaurants around.beautiful monasteries... You can avoid paying the entrancefee by walking in through a small side street...Even though it doesn't really matter,it's only 200 rupees ;-)
Peace and Tranquility. A must visit place while you are in Kathmandu to see the Tibetan way of worship. you can spend some good time here watching the rituals in the complex.

Must see. a gentle stroll clockwise round this buzzing and busy, but peaceful and calm place is a lovely thing to do in khatmandu. The Stupa is fascinating and is surrounded by interesting and picturesque shops guest houses and other buildings. We could have spent longer exploring and perhaps shopping here but we only had a couple of hours on a busy tour schedule and a good part of that was spent having a beer in the sunshine on a rooftop restaurant which had a great view of the stupa ... Bliss!
Interesting. A short taxi ride from Thamel. An interesting cultural experience for the uninitiated. Plenty of shops in the periphery to keep ones interest, some eateries as well.

ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL EXPERIENCE!!!. The beauty of the Bodha Stupa is a combination of the architecture and the sacred ambience of this temple. We went the day of the anniversary of Mao's take over of Tibet so the Nepali riot police were clearly visible on every corner, but didn't cause any problems. You will appreciate the beauty of this site whether you are Buddhist or not.

Experience to Remember. The stupa itself is inspirational and well worth the time to go around (go clockwise) in contemplation of one's blessings. Do the prayer wheel circuit also for multiple good karma. Also take the time to visit the very interesting, and very old, monastery right next to the stupa, and infuse your spirit with the prayers chanted by the monks - wonderful.

A shrine among shrines. A symbol of Nepal shown on everything from stamps to fridge magnets, this is a required stop for first timers. Walk clockwise around the stupa, and if possible get to a second floor vantage point for selfies and a great view. Go early to avoid crowds.
Interesting place with nice restautants and Shops around it. This is the biggest stupa - you can even walk on it. I liked the athmosphere and the shops/restaurants around it.
Peace and quite. I had no enough time to stay longer,really nice, peace and quite. i bought thank, it is cheap and good quality.

Great place to explore and experience the Buddhist devotion. If you are interested in buddhism or in the tibetan culture, this place is amazing, you find good place to eat, shops with all kind of ritualist item, Buddha´s paintings (thankas), Monasteries to meditate or take courses in basic meditation practice and Buddhism. Also if you have a great karma you will meet high realized masters in the Tantra lineage. Anyway, is a great place to seat and contemplate.

The biggest Stupa. An interesting place to see, pls walk around clockwise! As it might bring you bad karma! However I did not think it was necessary to spend a lot of time there, so many other temples and Stupas of various sizes around, but this one is the biggest, visible even from the plane during landing.

The Best. The best site we saw in Kathmandu. A must see.It is the largest stupa in Nepal and the holiest Tibetan Buddhist temple outside Tibet. There is a certain tranquilty the place emits despite being crowded. Everyone walks around it in a clockwise direction. There are also a wide variety shops and Restaurants all round the outside where one can haggle for some bargains or get a drink and a meal. A really pleasant experience.

A marvelous day. Bodhanath Stupa is a outstanding experience. It is a better Stupa to visit then what is called the "Monkey Temple" . The area around Bodhanath has an interesting assortment of shops and has quiet surroundings. There is also a wonderful museum of artifacts of Nepal. it is within the Kathmandu area.
good. its cool but there are too many people, is loud, not recommended for families and people with reduced mobility
Nice place. Its very nice place and it was a good place for Buddha stupa and it was very nice place and had good time.
Very Good. Good tourist place part of which was closed during our visit due to renovation. Busy with different shops around it but they are more expensive then what you will find outside
Super Stupa. Thankfully there were not many tourists when I was there so I benefited from relative quiet. Amazing place and very spiritual.Always something happening around it also.
Praying place for Hindu and Budha. It was rain when we came. The place was nice and quite crowded. Surrounded by lots of souvenirs shops.

Meet peacefulness. You will leave behind you the noisy, buzzy, and crowded streets of Kathmandu to step into a world of peacefulness. As you arrive in the site, suddenly your serenity level increases, your mind is carried into the prophecies of buddhism and pressure is dropped. Very pleasant place, could have spent several hours just contemplating the magnificent invigorating stupa rising before me. This place is a must when sightseeing in Kathmandu!

Beautiful, peaceful, though can be crowded. A beautiful place. I enjoyed visiting and walking around there and also going to a monastery. Next time I think I would plan on spending more time to explore the area around the Stupa.

Sanctuary in the city. Visited here as part of a city tour. Very calming. Great place to see monks, relax and reflect with a drink overlooking the stupa in one of the many restaurants with rooftop view.There are also many shops around the stupa selling Buddhists trinkets.

Definitely worth the drive. The Stupa was breathtaking deffinately the most magical place I went in Kathmandu. Just make sure you keep your taxi driver if you plan on returning to Thamel after an hour or so because return taxis can cost as much as double what you paid to get there.
Great place. loved the vibrant colors and accompanying shops around the stupa. we circled the stupa once and went up to get a higher view. Visited nearby monasteries and had a cup of coffee too.
Beautiful colours. Very interesting place full of colours and little shops. It was very pleasant to walk around to appreciate view from all sides.
A Must See. It truly a magical experience to visit here. Listening to the Monks chant, hearing the drums and spinning the prayer wheels all add up to a not to be forgotten experience.
Good especially at dusk. Get here just before dusk with transport back home. Lots of nice cafes and gift shops. Hard to navigate if wanting to walk from here to pashupatinath temple.
Beautiful.. Must visit this place. Entry fee not too expensive. Lots of souvenirs to buy. This place is so serene and beautiful.

Three Times Around!. The Stupa is interesting from a historical point of view, but there's not that much to see. You walk around three times and take a few pitures. There are lots of shops around and some good buys if you have time to haggle.

Nice one. Recently visited. Huge gigantic structures surrounding the main one
Monasteries all over giving a pious feeling. When we visited a religious ceremony was going on,really got to know how the Buddhist carry out the religious ceremonies which I was not aware of.
One more thing you get lots of small things around which are worth taking a look
peaceful place. environment over there was awesome. we visited this place two times between our 5 days trip. i like most.
Beautiful Place!. I have visited this beautiful site with my girlfriend in September. We spent 2 hours there, it was wonderful experience. This Bouddhanath is huge Stupa in Kathmandu.

Monkeys galore. :). We visited in the morning and there were quite a few tourist but not too bad. It had lovely greeters with long tails and excited to greet just as my friend discovered when he thought it would be a great idea to start eating a granola bar. Once one of the monkeys jumped on him he quickly got rid of the bar but the monkey stayed clinging onto his leg long enough to take a picture. Needless to say, don't eat around the monkeys; and there were a lit of them. Now walking to the top section gave good views of Kathmandu; although it was still smoggy. I highly recommend this be one of your stops whether it's a short or long vist. We were also there for 2hrs.

Worth your time. The stupa is amazingly good looking. We spent our late noon at one of the rooftop cafe overlooking the stupa, chanting in the backdrop and numerous followers walking round the stupa and saying their prayers. It was quite an amazing sight. The stupa lit up nicely as the sun set and monks and lamas join in the walk later in the day. Suggest to stay till evening to see this if you intend to visit this place. :)

One of the best spots in Nepal. Absolutely stunning. This is a must see. You must keep at least 5-6 hours for this place. Go around the temple touching the prayer wheels. Visit the other smaller temples and monasteries in the courtyard. There are shops selling all kinds of stuff around the temple - i found this to be the best place to pick up gifts. I picked up a few Buddhist chant CDs as well from the small shops some of whom were playing the CDs. Sit down in one of the cafes when you are tired.

unreal. amazing bosnath i spend one full day in this place turning with old women around the stuppa great moments good vibrations cos buddist sanctuary very important place for nepaleese people many prayers wheels you have to turn all the way around the stuppa

Very peaceful . This is a Tibetan sort of Buddhist Stupa. Once while trekking in Nepal, I saw the exact same replica except bigger and more tranquil because it was in the mountains so it was very peaceful whereas this place is a little more congested. Therefore it was a nice reminder but not the best. Having said that, when one comes here, there is this sense of peace and serenity that arises among the chaos around. And it is very big and impressive. The good thing is that the Stupa is in a middle of a square. It is a bit commercialized - All around there are interesting cafes and restaurants and hotels in case one wishes to take a break.
OK. Nothing Great. Its just a big Stupa. Nearby shops are costlier for tourist. Cleanliness is not proper.

Peaceful. Came here several times both during the day and at night. 250 rupee entrance fee for foreigners. This is one of the largest and most significant Buddhist monuments in the world. It was never that crowded or busy. Surrounding it, are a large number of tourist shops and rooftop restaurants. We ate at several of them. At night, there is a candle lighting ceremony. The shops generally stay open until 7 or 8pm - or later.

wonderful!. A place full with some strange spiritual energy, surrounded by monasteries and small temples. It is surrounded also by shops and restaurants, but this does not seem to interfere with the special atmosphere you can feel there. Go to one of the terrace restaurants for an atmosphere of tranquility and serenity!
Peaceful Serenity. Went at night and walked round the temple listening to the Buddhist monks meditate, extremely peaceful and an incredible stupa
Surreal Surrounding. It's like stepping into a difference dimension. It was not so crowded. Surrounding by lots of souvenir shops and some restaurants. Close to the airport.
Great first stop. This was the first place we went. And it was fantastic. We walked around several times and did some shopping. There is lots to see here

Peaceful and serene. This is one of the seven World Heritage Sites in the Kathmandu Valley. We took a local bus from Gwarko Intersection and got off at the Boudhanath Stupa entrance.There is an entry fee (NPR 50 per head for SAARC nationals). The Stupa is ringed with prayer wheels that pilgrims turn as they perform the Kora (parikrama) around it.There are shops selling handicrafts, food, jems and jewellery, etc all around and in the narrow bye lanes leading to and from the Stupa.

Amazing spiritual and cultural experience. There are times when circling the stupa is the heartbeat of the Tibetan exile community. It's compelling, mesmerizing and empowering. We drew grounding and strength from our time here and found ourselves still circling at night after everyone had left.

This place is special. I am normally not affected by so-called holy places or monuments of religious importance, yet this Stupa radiates something exceptional. A certain calm and peace aura which I have not experienced before.This is in spite of the waggonloads of tourists who make the experience a crowded one.Recommendation: reserve a place for lunch in one of the rooftop restaurants and enjoy the view from the top...
Peacful. Just to relax there and feel the ambiance. It is the spot that I enjoy the most in Kathmandu. During the evening there would be candle lighting ceremony, which is very worth experiencing

Peaceful Stupa. A beautiful Stupa set back just enough from the main roads to be much quieter and peaceful than the main area of Kathmandu. You can have a meal on the balcony of a restaurant overlooking the stupa, do some great shopping, and walking full around the stupa is also a great experience (and makes for some great pictures).
Namaste. This is a wonder of the world !! and the mix of people there in one place appreciating the sights, smells and sounds The largest Stupa in the world.

An amazing sight.. The area around the stupa is buzzing with interesting things happening throughout the day and evening. The stupa itself is a remarkable structure viewed from the perimeter by walking clockwise around it's base or by crossing over its surface or, better still, from one of the roof top cafes from where the surrounding hills form a magnificent backdrop.
Loved it!. Wonderful place to browse through the numerous shops ,shop for knick knacks and pore over the Thangkas. Great food in the cafes, especially Roadhouse Cafe

Colorful Temple. I like the shops that built surrounding the Stupa, they are painted in multi colour. It is very cheerful to look at those colorful tiny building. There is rooftop cafe where you could sit back and relax. It is amazing to watch how devoted those devotees doing the prayers to the Lord of Buddha.
peace & serenity. wonderful place to lose your self away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. Visit during the night and it's even more spectacular. Nice coffee shops and restaurants around.

Great Stupa, A must see. The Boudhanath Stupa is a large white Stupa. Buddha's blue eyes watching you is stunning.You can climb up and walk round the Stupa and get a view of the Boudha area with its numerous monasteries and the Buddhist community. The whole area is full of restaurants and shops and it is a good idea to visit this Stupa in the evening. Once you have visited the Stupa one can spend time visiting some of the other monasteries and shopping and tasting some of the Tibetan food.

A spiritual trip. Go if you follow Buddhism or if the philosophy inspires you in some way. We learnt a lot about Buddhism, its history, tradition and significance at this place. Also enjoyed the heritage feel & architecture of the place and got lost into the lovely culture and its rituals! Overall a satisfying experience.

Sacred temple. well define Tibetian culture. many shops surrounding this Stupa. Good experienced to view worshippers conducting their ritual prayers. Grab a cuppa coffer at nearby terrace overseeing this Stupa. The govt should have lower the entrance ticket fee which is costly

Best Stupa. The Boudhanath Stupa is stunningly big. Its surrounded by temples, shops, restaurants and big path walks. You can go at any time of the day, whereas the Monkey temple is ideal for sunsets. Only 250 Rupees entrance fee.

A colourful religious site, great for people-watching. This was my first stop upon arriving in Kathmandu, which makes sense since it is relatively close to the airport. If you are not a Buddhist and visit this as a touristy site/sight, this will cause a degree of photo-frenzy. The temple itself is of course impressive and best enjoyed by climbing to the top or by looking across from the upper floor of one of the other temple buildings opposite. But the pilgrims and devotees are what makes this place really come alive. Tibetans, sherpas, a great variety of people of all ages and different geographical backgrounds and outfits walk around the temple, lighting incense and candles, clacking the prayer scrolls... Around the stupa there are many small shops selling jewelry, shawls, knick-knacks and medical supplies and a variety of restaurants from which to enjoy the view.There is an entrance fee of 250 rupees for foreigners. Keep a hold of the ticket; even though it says it's valid only for one day, in my experience nobody minds multiple entries as long as you have a ticket. The fact that there is a clean toilet for tourists shows that the money goes towards making this site comfortable as well as atmospheric.Surrounding the temple square are small roads filled with more shops and several other small temples and monasteries, e.g. the Shechen monastery, which has a few small stupas with placques telling the life story of Buddha, and a garden restaurant with great vegetarian food and even a variety of trustworthy salads.

Massive Stupa, good place. This is a nice place to stop after a sightseeing trip to Everest. We spent about a two hours here having lunch, circled the Stupa and got some of our best pictures from Kathmandu. The amount of restaurants around the Stupa, I would recommend coming here around meal time. Otherwise it would only be a 30-45 minute stop.
Holy and peaceful bliss. The inside area of the stupa is sacred and ideal for some quiet time. Please respect it and stop bring in tourists from disrupting it.

What a stupendous stupa!. This is the main site for Tibetan Buddhists in Kathmandu and attracts large numbers of devout pilgrims and/or visitors. This is important because the considerate visitor will not want to give offence by walking around the giant stupa in an anti-clockwise direction. Just "go with the flow" and follow everyone else. Being a stupa, there is no internal space to enter but you can climb up the lower levels and just soak up the atmosphere as you circulate the prayer flag be-decked structure.What is a stupa? Put simply, it is a solid structure in the shape of a squared circle that is like a 3DMandala,( a symbolic model of the universe used as an aid to meditation). Underneath a stupa there should be a relic of the Buddha or one of his followers. That is a ridiculously simplistic explanation, but it might get you started!In contrast to the simplicity of the stupa, the circular area surrounding it is a busy mix of temples, shops,cafes and handicraft stalls. In contrast to some other reviewers, I have never felt pestered by any of the retailers or seen any beggars during my 4 visits in recent years. If you want to buy something, however,you can expect some "spirited" bargaining. As well as plenty of tourist tat, there is a chance to buy some beautiful work of real quality; particularly thangkas of Buddhist deities.Even for returning travellers, this should be at or near the top of any "What to do in Kathmandu" list. A rare oasis of peace and calm in the beautiful chaos of Kathmandu.
Breathtaking and thought-provoking. An absolute must-see - teeming with life and culture. The epitome of Buddhism from a photographic poiint of view. Prayer flags and more.
a must!. Amazing. Our favourite place in kathmandu so far. Love the ambience and the energy of it. Just a half an hour drive from thamel . A must see !
High on Kathmandu list. Highly recommend, visit the temple to the side while there and get a blessing and great view of the stupa from the roof. Peaceful area

bouddhanath. Really beautiful and clean good shopping but food expensive
If you go there take all day because you can take good picture there and it is a good memory

Religious Trip. The place is always crowded by people from different countries.
You can find all variety of traditional, cultural and others useful like souvenirs items along the whole periphery.
Above almost the shops, you can open roof cafes and eat joints.
Overall just pack your bags and explore yourself.

Amazing!. It's once in a life time experience! It's amazing to go up on the Stupa and feel the experience !
There are shops around the whole place, & one has to bargain for what you need. But still it's unique !!

Peace and devotion . I used to go Boudhnath stupa quite often in the evening and spend few hours on the upper most step. These days I still go but once in a while with family or with visitors. Experience depends. In the morning, you have devotees circumambulating the stupa, few beggars, practitioners who would prostrate on the eastern side. The monastery on the west that houses big idol of Matreya Buddha opens only during morning. This is one of the most interesting sight for me. The afternoon is for tourists and visitors with Tibetan devotional songs on the background. The evening is generally special for me. If it is other than full moon, it would be relatively quiet but still you would see devotees offering butter lamps. During full moon, this place would be bright with butter lamps. The sight of full moon from the stupa is special.

Stunning!!. The moment you step in... its just stunning. Its a photographers delight. Around the Stupa there are shops selling beautiful handicrafts (though expensive... one needs to bargain)..there are cafes and restaurants..and mystical chants to relax you.Its an absolute must visit place.
what a place. This is a very busy site but it is breathtaking, well worth visiting if you are able to get there and with an important history

A must visit when in Kathmandu!. This is the main pilgrimage place for many Buddhists. It is a most impressive structure and is always crowded. The street vendors can be a nuisance, but just regard them as part of the experience.

Seeking Peace & Enlightment in Boudhanath. Boudhanath (pronounced 'Bo-da'), is home to one of the largest Buddhist stupas in the world.It has been an important place of pilgrimage and meditation for the local Nepalis, Tibetan and Buddhists. Around the Great Stupa of Boudhanath, there are more than 20 Tibetan Gompas and Tangka Centre.For daily ritual prayer(please respect):People walk three or more times around the stupa at the clockwise direction chanting the mantra 'Om Mani Padme Hum' while spinning the prayer wheels(clockwise). If you are keen to take photos and not there for the prayer, please stand aside from the prayer wheels, you stil will have a good photo shot. If you are interested to try Tibetan cuisine, there have a few cafes and restuarants served delicious Tibetan dish like momo, thukpa and many more.There is a small entry fee, but if you stay around the Great Stupa, this can be waived.

One of the largest stupa in the world. Boudhanath is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Along with Swayambhunath, it is one of the most popular tourist sites in the Kathmandu area. We visited there along with the Swyambhunath as well as Pashupatinath temple in our day tour. Among these, I liked the Boudhanath stupa.

A serene feeling. The Stup is impressive and huge. When you enter you will be surprised to discover that the place is wide and very calm. The atmosphere is quiet and peaceful and there are loads of small gift shops to visit. The entrance price is very attractive (250NPR) and this place is definitely worth it!

Amazing!. Truly amazing place! You feel transformed into a different world. Kathmandu is this hectic city, and Boudhanath although in the middle of it all still offers peace and tranquillity.
Our favorite place in Kathmandu so far, would love to come back!
A MUST if you are visiting Kathmandu!

Most special place in Kathmandu. Boudhanath would have to be the most special place in Kathmandu. The atmosphere of the area is magical and once you step inside the stupa area and the leave the hustle and bustle of the Kathmandu city life behind you are transported into a different space altogether. There is much to see and do and there are lots of interesting people to meet. You could easily spend the whole day, enjoying the moment.

Amazing place. Inspite of thousands of tourists it's really a shanti place. If you stop and listen sounds all around you will be confused by "om mani padme hum". As it's not easy to recognize if it's playing in your mind or far in street shop. This place should have a tag "must visit"!

Simply Incredible. I have never visited anything like this. The Stupa is immense and it is surrounded by a circular road of buildings and shops. You can climb up onto the Stupa and look down on the surrounding buildings and people. It is also worth climbing to the top of the temple opposite the entry to the top of the Stupa (it is not a shoes-off job) which also offers views as spectacular as they are fascinating. This was quite simply the most interesting and impressive site which I visited in Nepal. It is well worth visiting.

Highly Recommended. I am an American in Kathmandu, Nepal on business. I had a day off so I took the opportunity to obtain a guide and tour some of the temples. I visited The Great Boudha Stupa. To say it is huge is an understatement. It is very impressive if only for its size. The prayer flags give the Stupa a very festive look, but I am sure that is not why they are there. I can only say that this should be a stop on any sightseeing excursions in Kathmandu, Nepal.

A must visit, a place to watch and be in awe. An enormous place to be in awe--- watching the pigeons fly and fed, people circling around the big stupa, believers praying up and down. Relaxing as well to watch the scene from one of the rooftop cafes around the stupa. A lot of nice shops to buy souvenir from as well as most sell cheaper than in Thamel.Nice to pay once to contribute to the maintenance of the place. However there is also a way to enjoy the scene everyday, should you be staying in the neighborhood. ;-)

The biggest & the glorious. There are many buddha eye stupa around Kathmandu, you will find it even though yo are not necessarily looking for it. But this particular Boudhanath Stupa stands out from the rest. and it definitely should. It is gigantic. It is located quite outskirt of Kathmandu, but definitely worth the visit. There is a tibetan monastery opposite, so be sure to visit that as well. Well this is the stupa in front of the Lonely Planet cover, so yeah, a must go.

Buddha pilgrimage. This place crowded most of time...many Tibetan people around..good time to visit this place are morning and afternoon time..nice to see people praying and doing some ritual...worth to visit

beuutiful site. this is a giant Stupa in downtown Katmandu. You can walk around on it..if fills up an entire square with shops and rooftop restaurants on all sides. Across the entrance is a monastery where you can be blessed and also an art school where they make Mandalas.

Breathtaking Boudhnath. i love the area, everything about it, the Stupa of course, but also the small shops around it that you can buy small gifts to take back home, numerous cafes with a wide variety of condiments

Good if you are in the area. I wouldn't say 'very good' but better than average. If you are in this part of Kathmandu then worth a visit but not worth traveling to specially. It's the biggest Stupa so it is an impressive sight.

The Great Stupa. Of all the places I have visited in Kathmandu and the surrounding valley this is the one that will stay with me. I came here first some twenty years ago, having already visited Swayambhunath, and expected it to be similar. It's not. There is something extraordinary here. The power of the place is palpable. Twenty years on and nothing has changed. Swayambunath is still beautiful but nakedly commercial now whereas Boudhanath has, if anything, gained in power and majesty. There are shops to visit, restaurants which will give you a decent meal and a great view of the place but, even without these, it is still the place I shall go to my grave recalling. This time I managed to hear a service in one of the monastery chapels and was very deeply moved. An utterly unforgettable place.
Superb. Great buddhist moniments and world heritage site or art and culture. Hiring car we went there and spent our memorable three hrs.

Good place for both pilgrims and tourists. Full of people spinning prayer wheels and circumbulating the stupa...there are also many doing full prostrations. This is an real religious monument that is widely used by devotees in their daily routine and not just a tourist site. Nice view from many upstairs cafes surronding the stupa. Good place to get mala beads and other religious stuff. Good fun for non-religious visitors to people watch and get hands on to spin the prayer wheels. Go into the many small alleys to get better deals and discover many hidden gems of monastry all around.
Magical, unique. This is a place not to miss. Plenty of shops around. THERE are many restaurants at the top floors of the surrounding buildings

Beautiful experience!. The Stupa is really grand, huge. The prayer flags moving with the wind are dreamlike. Its a very picturesque area, good restaurants all around, and you can see the traditional thanka painting school which is also there.

Boudha Stupa. The stupa is overwhelmingly beautiful. A trip around it spinning the prayer wheels will set your mind right for Nepal. Have roof top tea overlooking the stupa at one of the hundreds of tea houses. Best shopping ever.

Beautiful Stupa. We visited here in the evening and it was very beautiful. It was within a leisurely walk from the Hyatt Regency where we stayed. There was much activity with many people and shops circling the site. It seems a peaceful and reverent space in the midst of a very busy city. It is a must see when in Katmandu.

What a great place to visit. if you want to see many pilgrims from Tibet praying at the stupa, than this is the place to go. Day and night people come to pray and walk around the stupa. Very fascinating! Take a seat and looks what all around!
Nice Place To Visit. it is very nice place to visit buddhanath, we can most of old things here. as well as very superb stupa. i like to visit once again

amazing place. Very clean and reminded me a lot of old squares in European towns. The stupa is not so spectacular but the atmosphere is very nice and relaxing. Had lunch there but recommend only having coffee on one of the roof top restaurants.
Buddhist Pilgrimage. We really liked the place, the Boudhanath Stupa, a Buddhist cultural place & the ancient Stupa is one of the largest in the world. It was awesome view in the evening.

A true wonder. One of the seven wonders of Buddhism in the world - a place not to be missed when you visit Kathmandu. We had a nice lunch at a roof top restaurant facing the Stupa, where we could appreciate this fantastic temple and watch the world going around.
Fascinating. This is a must see in Kathmandu. The prayer wheels are turning, the people are circling, and it is so interesting just to watch it all. Everyone is busy moving and praying.
Round and Round. This is a great place to people watch from Buddhist monks to pilgrims turning the prayer wheels as they circle the stupa.

Amazing. This place is a must go. I spent 2 hours on the stupa. So crowded yet so peaceful. Truly spiritual.
If you are in Kathamndu and have the time, do go here, great vibrations.

very nice and spiritual place. the biggest stupa in Asia. The place is very spiritual especially if you get there at the prayers time. The square surrounding the temple reminds me of Venice though. Visit the temple also and don't miss the view from the top floor. Easily reachable with local buses, a short ride from Kathmandu.

Boudanath pleasure. This is a very special place and is worth going to because it has a different atmosphere compared to the rest of Kathmandu. It is Buddhist. Prayer flags flutter by the thousands. Vehicular traffic is limited so there is peace and calm, complete with doves. The circular "square" i surrounded by shops selling paintings, religious objects and other related paraphernalia. In a painting shop you can ask to see the production process. Much of it is "colour by numbers" but the results are delicate and exquisite. Bargain to obtain a canvas at a good price. You can walk around the stupa itself and each turn offers a different visual delight. Do It and take your time. You will see locals in dream-like devotion, tourists, and other visions unexpected. It is a pleasure and one of Kathmandu's most revered Buddhist places. Ring the large prayer bells in some of the temples fronting the stupa. Take your shoes off and walk inside the Buddhist temples and take in the reverence and solemn moments of worship. You are welcome even if you don't observe the ritual. You will learn something about this gentle culture. They will welcome you as long as you are respectful.Nearby is a children's orphanage. Just look or ask the way. More pleasure. You can get a taxi to and from here at a very small fare. Or you can catch a bus from one of the many bus stops in Kathmandu. A pleasant afternoon adventure and well worth the visit. Remember that Pashupatinath is very close so you can go to both places in the same day. Take time to walk in the local streets and try some of the wonderful local street food on offer if you don't want to spend more in a westernised restaurant. Bless.

A must visit in Kathmandu. Try to time your visit to coincide with morning or evening prayers, when most locals attend and give the place an amazing atmosphere.
Shopkeepers around a friendly, but you must bargain very hard to secure a good final deal.

Magnificent. That's the largest Stupa in the world. I had an impression it looks like Kraków in Poland a little bit - not Stupa but surroundings - Old Market, pigeons, lots of people & tourists. There's many Tibetans livings close to Boudanath area so it's great opportunity to know them better with their culture, habits, language, way of living. Not to mention Tibetan chang beer! I really enjoyed living so close to Bouda. I could see it from the roof of my guest house. It has extremely good vibe. It's impossible to go outside and not to circle the Stupa.

big stupa. Big perimeter there are more devotees circling. Big Buddhist flag fluttering with air suppose to touch the blue sky. Enjoy the coffee at the roof top restaurant, feel spiritual. white colors with peaceful pigeon flying around.
Osho vision treks private day tours. Was excellent day and places Kathmandu . Buddha . And many other placesThe trip was arranged by Mr. Dinesh Osho vision treks private day toursDec 2014
Tranquility at its best. It a soul cleaner. You need to be there to actually feel free. Must visit if visiting Kathmandu Nepal. Historic site.

Join the crowd of walkers! You will fit right in. Devout Buddhist worshipers will walk around the Stupa 108 times. It is so interesting to see everyone - young, old, dressed in modern dress or traditional Nepalese dress, monks - everyone comes and worships by walking. Surrounding the Stupa are many shops and restaurants. Many places have a medieval feel to them. Wish I were back there right now............

Love the energy of this religious shrine. Visited the Stupa around 6pm when the monks are chanting and Buddhist practitioners are praying and bringing offerings. So much energy and spirituality from the crowds.
boudhanath Stupa. worth the climb up the steps - take it slow and you will get there. lots of souvenir shops at the top -

Surreal Experience. In the heart of downtown Kathmandu, the colors of the prayer flags, the beautiful temples, and we were lucky enough to be invited to a blessing inside the small temple. It was a wonderful place and I left with wonderful memories, def a must see.

A bit of Tibet in Kathmandu. A piece of quiet away from the traffic mad-house. Lots of people for sure but for good reason, it is well worth while. A couple of nice roof top cafe's, lots of souvenir shops for those last minute trinkets you can't do without and need for the next garage sale. All told we like it and it's a go to place every time we are in KTM. Make sure you bargain with the taxis before you get in for your return trip.

Another historical stupa. This important and historic stupa - a Buddhist place of worship - is a wonderful place to visit either early in the morning or late afternoon. You could also combine this place with Pashupatinath Temple, either before or after. The walk between these places is not more than 30 mins.The stupa is surrounded by curio shops, cafes and restaurants.

THAMEL,Kathmandu-"The memories will always stay with me".. Kathmandu gateway to Nepal tourism, is the nerve center of the country’s economy. The city is surrounded by four major hills, namely: Shivapuri, Phulchowki, Nagarjun and Chandragiri.We freshened up by 11 am and went down to have a first experience of the city. We strolled around the area surrounding the hotel and interacted with a few locals and shopkeepers to gain some knowledge of how things were. With everyone we interacted we felt a sense of inquisitiveness and connection they showed and overall the treatment meted was more of elderly brother(DAI).As colorful as the set for the next Bond movie chasing scene,The district of Thamel in Kathmandu has been a traveler’s hub for many years. Thamel is like a theme park built for Tourists,Photographers comprising of rows after rows of yak shawls shops,Pashmina, Jacquard and Cashmere shawls, second hand bookshops, money changers, restaurants offering western food,outdoor gear store,cheap accommodations, Internet cafes,laundry and courier services, trekking equipment stores, restaurants that serve burgers, pizza or Japanese bento boxes, you name it they have it.Few hours of walking inside the touristy district of Thamel is more than enough to let you know everything you need to know.These streets offer a glimpse to the daily city life of the locals. It is an unmasked version of Thamel, here every turn leads to a fascinating encounter, even the smallest passageway is so inviting to enter. The rickshaw, the textiles, the mannequins, another feast of colors matching the celebratory mood of no work Sunday.After a small sunday walk we had our Brunch and came back to our rooms for a small napA week around Thamel, I will be perfectly honest, a part of me misses the comfort and strange familiarity of India but there is a part of me willing to let it go, be contented of the memories of the life spent over there.In love with Nepal over and over again.
A serene pilgrimage.. Boudha,is a must visit for all tourists of nepal.The ambience and serenity is ultimate.The restraunts and the cafe's are also a treat for excellent quality time.

Stunning to Visit! A must when in Nepal. Hinduism is the dominant religion in Nepal, but Buddhism is the second more prevalent religion, and Bouddah is a great opportunity to see this. Boudhanath is the holiest Buddhist temple outside of Tibet, and you can see why when you're here. This massive Stupa attracts tourists and Buddhists alike, and is unique in it's own way - like a little village inside Kathmandu itself. When you're here though, be sure to go to a cafe inside the complex and sit on the top balcony. Stunning views cannot be avoided!
Nice Place. This is a nice place to be in where on one hand you can see the spiritual thing going on and the peacfull atmosphere makes you feel safe and feel the warmth of the place.
Great Breakfast at Boudhanath. Near Boudhanath Stupa, there are some beautiful terrace and we had great breakfast there. It's a great place with friends.
Nice place. I like the place even though I don't understand their culture & rituals but I visited the place with my family & liked it a lot

A personal favorit. The more crowded and tangled traffic becomes, the harder it is to find a pleasant walk in the cities of the Kathmandu Valley, which means that the walk around the Boudha Stupa becomes not just a trip into the heart of historical Buddhist pilgrimage sites, but a welcome pedestrian reprieve.

Sacred Buddhist site. If you are interested in Buddhism, go! But be prepared to face Kathmandu's horrid traffic. You could combine a visit there with a visit to Kopan (hike or take a taxi) and Pashinupath (I would recommend a taxi because of the traffic). That's what I did and it made for a great day-trip.

Standing Tall. Beautiful and provides you an opportunity to see the buddhist culture around. Lots of shops around this and felt very crowded in the afternoon/evening. Mornings are better times to meditate here. Having a guide helps to understand the history. I believe bhuddha's nails are kept inside the stupa. You are able to go around the stupa, but not inside. My guide spoke very good english and was able to explain all details of the stupa. In spite of the crowd, there was peace everywhere. Nepalese are in general very friendly, even though Kathmandu might have become a lot more commercial. Stupa stands tall and the holy eyes are watching you all the time. If you ever go to Kathmandu, it is worth including this visit to your itinerary. There are other adjacent places (like bazaars) you can include for shopping as well.

A Quaint Buddhist Place. there are little shops around the Stupa that sell charming Buddhist souvenirs , art , clothes etc.
the roof top cafes are avoidable .
the atmosphere in the evening is lovley.

The center of Sherpa culture in Kathmandu.. This place defines holy for the Tibetan and Sherpa of Nepal. It's a bit overboard on the commercial aspects, but you can study with a Lama, learn meditation, study Tantra. Underneath the tourist traps you will find real Buddhist culture and learning. DONT MISS THIS PLACE.

Tibetan Connections. The Boudhanath Stupa lies 5 kilometers or so from central Kathmandu. It is a major Tibetan site that originally was well outside the city. Go early and you can see many of the local (and non-local) Tibetans carrying out their circumambulations.

Ancient Beauty and Timeless Traditions. Centuries of history on display here. The climb up the steps at this altitude is not for the faint of heart. The endless array of examples of the faith are beautiful and moving.

Colour and bustle. The biggest and busiest example of a Buddhist stupa in Nepal this is definitely worth a visit. The place is full and hustle with pilgrims and tourists constantly jostling for space. Look for some of the biggest prayer wheels on the planet and breathe in the heady mix of incense. If you need to get away for a breather there's an ample selection of restaurants all with rooftop dining or pay your respects in the main temple with a quiet balcony overlooking the stupa.

Sublime. How do you review a site as ancient and sacred as the Great Stupa? Every path in Boudha leads to the stupa, and the major common activity is circumnambulating it, saying prayers or chants or just walking. Mornings and at dusk, it's a jam of people of all kinds circling and circling before cutting away for breakfast or bed. Go early, and go around sunset -- it's quite beautiful and active.

Iconic site that you MUST visit. Whether you're a tourist, pilgrim or just a regular visitor, this holy site is a must see! In its aerial view it represents the Mandala, but you'll be VERY satisfied just circling the stupa clockwise 3 times and rotating the prayer wheels. Better if you have a guide to explain the intricate details of the stupa such as the flags and the eyes and what they represent, but that's something a quick google search can fix. Shops circle around it, including the famous Thangka painting school, and more shops with funny names (I'll let you discover it on your own as you circle the area). Another interesting spot just near the stupa is a Buddhist temple where you can enter and actually take pictures of the Buddha inside, as opposed to the usual no-photos-allowed rule that most temples have.Overall, this place is worth another visit for every time you find yourself in the middle of Kathmandu. If you know anyone who is travelling to Nepal, encourage them to give this place a holler. It's worth it, and make VERY good photographs and memories.

Iconic temple of Kathmandu. One of a couple of iconic temples in Kathmandu not to be missed. Enjoy people watching, the peaceful atmosphere (except when overrun with tourists), and.... of course.... the EYES!!!

Worth several visits. The Bouddhanath Stupa left a big impression. Our hotel was nearby so we went to see it several times. It looks different every time you see it, depending on the sun and the light. Go and sit on a bench and watch te people who walk 3 times, or sometimes even more, around the Bouddhanath.It's very interesting to see the different nationalities and types of people who come to pray.Also go the rooftop of a restaurant. During the day choose one with the sun in your back. You can take better pictures this way.

Om mani padme hum sounds like the shining jewel in the Lotus.. itizens, pilgrims, monks and tourists circle the stupa clockwise and rotate the reels. This movement around the stupa, after the Sun, is a common Buddhist practice, a counterpart to the prayers. To achieve the best results, it is advisable to bypass the stupa 108 times so. .. But such are the few.
Great place to visit. I love architecture here and old style of Temple! I could stay longer to enjoy this place with my friend, i recommend all people come here when they enter to Nepal.

Beauty, peace, bliss.. Beautiful and big Buddhist stupa! You can take a walk around it and go up with the stairs and watch the area from above. Around stupa you will find picturesque and colorful shops with souvenirs, little restaurants and roof tops where you can rest and take a cold drink on a hot day. View from restaurant roof top is amazing with the mountains in distance, perfect white clouds and blue sky. Buddhist monasteries are in the complex also, so at this place you will see Buddhist monks in their beautiful red robes, praying and meditating. Entire atmosphere of this place is magical. I enjoyed every moment being there. You have to see it too.

Definitely a must see in Kathmandu. One of the largest Buddhist stupas I have seen! There were lot of tibetan buddhists praying. One can get to the upper level of the stupa and circumambulate the stupa. Lot of colorful buildings around the stupa including souvenir shops and restaurants.One of the main tourist destinations in Kathmandu and definitely worth a visit!
Incredible experience. Walk clockwise, spin the prayer wheel and visit the shops closeby.Lively and inspiring, take your time and do people watching.

holyness all around. This place is very magical around sunset, the monks and other pelgrims come to do their 'puja'. A religious ritual. it is very impressive to witness this ritual from the balcony of the monastery!

Beautiful, Must visit place in Kathmandu. The beatiful Boudhanath Stupa is most beatiful stupa I've ever seen. You will be spellbound when you go into the lane from the main road as you reach near the stupa. Its big, really big.I reached there during the sunset time. Just walk around the Stupa and enjoy the place. Once just visit any of the roof top cafe to enjoy a cup of tea/coffee and to see the sun set behind the stupa.

You can't miss this one in Kathmandu!. Located in the heart of the city, one cannot believe it exists on such a busy street. But once you are in the compound, its a totally different experience. Tagged as the biggest Stupa in South Asia, this monument is an architectural masterpiece. Bit crowded though but one of the few Buddhist places which allows you an insight to their lives. There are few monasteries with in Boudhanath one should definitely go to the Sechen monastery there, its really peaceful and very pretty!

Stupa to stop you. This was one of the first places that I visited in Kathmandu, when just arrived and before the Annapurna trekking. It was fun getting there cause I decided to do that not by taxi but by public bus which was quite a challenge to find on a road. I kept asking: Boudanath? Buddanah? (those who knows Russian will understand why it sounds so ridiculous, he-he). Finally I found the right one and had a nice trip sitting close to nepalese women with kids.I entered the place and paid for the ticket (recently I heard there's some guesthouse in Tamel which gives a password so that you can enter for free). I didn't know what exactly to do and decided to roam around. As in some other touristic places, I did not understand the beauty of the place at first because of the crowd. It takes time to appreciate it. It takes time to slow down and relax, and see how meditatively people walk around the stupa and whirling prayer's wheels, how calm some people sit and behave, how funny and friendly the dogs are there (just fell in love with them!). So this is something one should do first when enter such places. Calm down and relax. There are actually a lot of things to do apart from selfies with stupa and beautiful flags (which I started with). They say you should go around (circumambulate) the Stupa 3 times clockwise and you get happy. Made it :) You see, I am!I enjoyed some names of guesthouses and cafes around (like Happiness Guesthouse) and there are many shops with souvenirs. Being not a fan of shopping I decided to go to one cafe on the second floor of the building (I think the name was something like "Great view"). Yes, very much enjoyed the view and veg momo (Nepal dumplings). And there I understood what happiness is. Without any rush or worries, without any expectations, just sit and look at the beautiful Stupa and breath the air around. Just be, here and now.
Walking distance to the Hyatt. Large. Nice shops around it. You have to walk in one direction only on the stupa. Area around it is busy and interesting. Felt very safe

Awesome !. The specific monument is a diamond in Katmandou valley .i recommend you if you are found in the valley to visit it to feel the calmness and the perfectness and to hear the whisper of millions of souls who have passed from there for centuries!!!!!!

Must see. The biggest stupa in the world, of course biggest tourist attraction. Try to do not get stuck in the small shop, prices are really not friendly. Ticket to enter: 50r locals and 250 SAARC and other countries
Very impressive stupa. If you want a great overview then visit one of the many restaurants on top of the surrounding buildings.
For the most amazing view of Kathmandu. For some it could be difficult to reach. We cycled all the way to the top. The mesmerizing view of Kathmandu just made all the effort worth it.
Get away from the honking horns. A must for early morning to enjoy a coffee and/or go in the evening when the lights are on. A lot of great little shops to check out here as well.

Interesting historical site. It's an interesting site to visit and walk around. Within it's dome lays the Buddha's relics from generations. Many souvenir shops surrounding the site if you are interested.

Gret Buddhist monuments. If any one have time to explore Kathmandu, dont miss to visit Buddhanath stupa which is about 8 km from Thamel. I enjoyed the buddhist activities and great cup of coffee viewing stupa from stupa view restaurant.

Excellent place, very peaceful. Boudhanath Stupa was the last attraction we visited during our trip to Nepal. Situated in the busy market area, it is a huge meditation site. Beautifully decorated, it has lots of shops, eateries etc beside it. A must visit.

The Icon of Buddha's Eyes of Nepal Tourism with a heartfelt story of how it was built. A must to visit and try to get the bio-history how the place was started with an old lady in 14th century ago. The stupa formed as the mandala and path to the enlightenment. You may offer to hang the prayer flags with a fee; light butter lamps on the left side of entrance; Circumambulate clock-wise to signifies its auspiciousness.

my favourite. I find an inner peace each time I visit boudhanath - been my favourite for the last 50 years!!!! you enter a different world once you walk through that gate and see the enormous all seeing eyes of Buddha.

Amazing place and people. I came to boudhanath possibly every other day when I was in Nepal. I fell in love with this place. Love the a restaurant called Garden Kitchen but just the people in this area, no cars and peaceful within Kathmandu. Stupa ofcourse is amazing to watch while having lunch and watching the people walk around. Highly recommend this place

Huge. This place is huge. If I remember correctly our host said it is the larges Stupa in the world. It is absolutely massive. It was fascinating to walk around. The Stupa is completely surrounded by wonderful shops, some with some amazing deals.

The Big Stupa. Yes this is a really big Stupa , 1 of the largest in all Nepal. You have to pay a fee here which is kind of a rip off. There is just the stupa and a lot of shops with trinkets and you can walk around it pretty quickly. This was 3 blocks from my hotel, so I give it a thumbs up.
A Must Go..!. Quite peaceful and relaxed. Good place to pick some Nepalese Souvenirs. Nice to see the Buddhist rituals.

Great place .... Huge and magnificent stupa is dedicatedly an awesome shot of the wide angle lens...To capture the entire stupa and pigeons flying best place is the building terrace opposite the stupa.Lots of cafes and restaurants around so food not an issue.
I am a regular visit to Kathmundhu. All the ancient shrines are a must to visit, especially alone so that you can stay focused on where you are. Patricia giudice.
Sightseeing. Nice history and new expirience for me to learn more about the City . We used a full Day to excurse the Place

Peace. A place you don't want to miss when in kathmandu. The stupa Is a place you will witness a lot of tourists and a lot of meditators. It's a unique experience and very tranquil if you can find the quiet. The wheels and all the temples around are fascinating and beautiful.The shopkeepers around the area can be strange to say the least. While some you meet will warm your heart.a place for anything Tibetan.
Grand historic place. The stupa is grand and majestic. A lot of Tibetan monk come to visit and pray this Tibetan Buddhism historic place. It's the atmosphere the you can't find anywhere in Nepal.
Great Buddhist place. The Stupa was really good like Mandala. I would love to back here again. The ticket was reasonable and there was clean enough. We walked around the stupa so we enjoyed here.

The biggest stupa ever. Worth a visit to see the largest stupa in the world. It has 400 year old statues just past the entrance to the platform of the stupa, which lets you look down onto the people circling the base and watch relatively unobserved. This is the true attraction here, as you will see all types, from peasants in traditional dress devoutly circling the stupa, to modern youth glued to their cellphones and taking selfies. Many stores and restaurants surround the square, more expensive than elsewhere in Kathmandu. If you are limited for time, to my mind Swyambunath is the more interesting site, but if you have time, go here as well.

WOW!! THIS IS THE KATHMANDU YOU MUST SEE. This is the largest and most impressive stupa in Nepal. You can take stairs up onto the first level and walk around it (clockwise, don't forget) and it's size is still impressive. You can watch the devout make their offerings, their prayers, their turns around the stupa and chanting as they turn their prayer wheels. There are many small terrace restaurants around the stupa, so make this a break in your day, have lunch and watch everything from a higher view point.
One of the place to see. There's nothing spectacular but it is fascinating. Cultural experience is what you'll get and it's amazing!
Great. Great Place to see in Nepal. Really enjoyed our time visiting this place. We want to go back again when time permits.
An oasis of calm. This stupa is an oasis of calm mellowness amidst the frenetic chaos of Kathmandu. Take as much time here as you need to restore your soul.
Amazing place. A must-see! Because it's Boudhanath, because of the athmosphere there. I find going there is always a very special moment.

Largest in World. This is an extraordinary place, even for a non-Buddhist like me. A very moving experience. Walk clock-wise around Stupa. Light candles (always odd number) - they show you how - for small donation. Explore the monasteries. Really glad I went.

Meditative. Watch the monks go round and round, always clockwise. Don't be a bad tourist by going around the wrong way. And I believe you should always encircle it an odd number or times. You're also allowed to go up on to the next level of the stupa but I was told shortly after that to do that is actually quite disrespectful (maybe because of tombs underneath). Anyway, the place is bustling and lively and the shopkeepers around town are fun to chat to and barter with if you keep a smile on your face.
nice place. It is a nice place and also has a lot of shop surrounded . i like the place personally :) I would recommend it for everyone who is visiting nepal .cheers !
