Beautifull Stupa !. On of the best view of Katmandu, peaceful place with great and so gentle people, harmony and peace, mix of religion, culture, colors and aromas...great place for shopping too with a lots to Tibetan shops...a must to visit while in Nepal.

Stunning. I had only read abut stupas, and this was my first sighting. It's one of the most beautiful religious buildings I've ever seen. And so much bigger than pictures can convey without seeing an aerial picture. The whole area surrounding it is somehow peaceful despite the bustle of tourists and monks all around it.
Great temple. Simply Awesome to see and photograph. This is a very holy place for many people but I enjoyed the atmosphere and colours most!
Stupa. Very nice site with a beautiful view of Kathmandu! A lot of Monkeys though! A must see in the area and one of the most sacred sites for Buddhists!

lovely place. We visited this place and we were very amazed by the calmness of the people. We immediately were taken in the prayer rituals and observe with complete respect for these local people. it was a relaxing place after the madness of Kathmandu. Nice rooftops to have a drink ! it’s worth visiting !

Lovely monument. Not as spectacular at the Swayambhunath stupa, this one in Bodnath is impressive inits own way and feels much bigger. It's certainly ors accessible, being at street level and surrounded by several shops. Worth a visit. A short taxi ride from Kathmandu downtown.
Respite from decay. Beautiful temple somehow better kept than others thanks to the thriving Tibetan diaspora. A rare place in Kathmandu to calmly walk around and visit.

Must-see. Sightseeing doesn't get any better.. Its also a nice little area in contrast to the rest of Kathmandu. I visited the squatter's "village" just a block away and found families living in makeshift bamboo huts covered with plastic tarps. I was invited there by a shoeshine guy in Thamel. Your taxi or tour bus may cut through the area to get to the Stupa. It's a scruffy, big open area full of animals, litter, playing kids. Take a good, but quick, look. It will complement your experience.

Om mani padme hum !. A bustling hub of much activity .. on one hand it is a touristy place typical with shops selling Tibetan souvenirs, jewellery, antique pieces .. and on the other, the locals and Lamas were going on with their prayers and other religious activities.. the Stupa was huge and very impressive with people climbing all over it..
Rooftops offer the best views!. Definitely go on one of the restaurant rooftops and enjoy the view while eating a lovely meal! Nice place to relax.
lovely Place. If you go to Kathmandu you shouldn,t miss it as this is beautiful stupa and better to be there by the morning time as there would be 100 of people will be praying and playing maniwall.

Peaceful inside valley. Its loneliness and history fascinated me to visit in Boudhanath Stupa area where, i felt really peaceful, friendly looping people around stupa, charming and didn't feel like was inside city or crowd.I really enjoyed in that place and planning to visit again in the near future.

"Majestic". This great majestic Boudha Stupa stands in an area of approx. 6,756 sq m. The dome is approx. 120 ft in diameter and 43m in height. Buddhist people believe that the relics of the 3rd Buddha of Bhadrakalpa were enshrined in the dome. It's also called the Stupa of Enlightenment. It's also one of the largest and most significant Buddhist monuments in the world. It is religious and cultural and was enlisted on the "World Heritage Site" by Unesco in 1979. Today it's a major destination for pilgrims from all over Asia and the principal centre of Himalayan Buddhist worship and studies. People walk around the stupa in a clockwise route, called circumambulating. All of those who do this will acquire the 7 qualities of the higher existences! I am sure you have seen the two eyes on all stupas, these are the symbol of Method and Wisdom! All in all, a very holy and sacred place. Definitely one to see!

Stupa. Easy to reach by foot from the Hyatt, it is the largest stupa in kathmandu, a landmark of the city. It dominates Kathmandu's skyline and if you are an early riser, and yoga enthusiast, you may want to vist really early in the morning and join some locals in their yoga salutations!
Excellent. Great history, A lot of things to see in and around this area. Bought some great gifts to bring home.
Excellent place to visit!. Serene, peaceful and huge.... Mesmerizing, to say the least. Nice coffee shops & eating joints around to sit back and experience the place.................

Walking with God. This was such a beautiful and peaceful experience for us. Not being overly religious ourselves, we found this to be the best experience in Kathmandu. Everything from the stupa, to the monks gives boudha its harmonious environment. We recommend getting lunch and chai at one of the many rooftop restaurants. Over the years, however, there has been an increasing number of children begging outside the entrance. And our last trip saw us being very strict with them to leave us alone as they were very persistent and wouldn't stop following us. Just be weary of this but dont let it stop you from visiting a MUST-SEE!! A taxi from Thamel to Boudha cost us about 200 NPR [Oct 2014].

Incredible. Most fascinating sightseeing for me. One can feel the sacredness of this holy place that is a constant attraction point for thousand of devoted Buddhists, not only from Nepal and Tibet, but from around the globe.
Don't miss it. It's a must in Kathmandu and you will enjoy it. Shops all around the pagoda and the people walking around it makes it a nice place for the tourists. great for taking pictures
Must go. This is the must-go place in Kathmandu. We were there in a Sunny day in winter. Feel so warm and peaceful to walk around under the sun.

A worthwhile destination. Not to be missed if you have a few days in Kathmandu. The Stupa is beautiful to behold and the presence of monks and meditators all around provides a sense of beauty and harmony even if the site is crowded, loud and dusty. The pigeons are a bit of a nuisance.

Very nice place. I love this place. The architecture of the sputa and the town around is really neat. I do not know if is true but our guide told us that is believed that the second Buddha ashes were placed there.You should walk around the little town and see the Tibetan monks and the Thangka art. It is interesting to see how they prepare the paper and how the paint the mandalas. My daughter loved it

Temple at City Centre. Beautiful temple in the city centre. Easy acces.
foreigners always pay more for entrance fee. But the officer did not care who have purchased a ticket or not. some motorcycles allowed to enter the area. a little disturbing.

A great place to people watch. Unfortunately we visited on our last day in Kathmandu and didn't have as much time here as we would have liked, but it is a great place to visit and take in all of the sights.
Go there when you're in Kathmandu. You shouldn't be disappointed.

Big and beautiful. This was not our first stupa but it was very different from the first. It was big and beautiful and we enjoyed walking around it, observing the people and rituals, and just soaking in the atmosphere. It is very old, but again still very much in use.The stupa is surrounded by a lot of delicious cafes and interesting stores. For a very minimal fee, we were able to have our pictures taken in native attire complete with headdress and jewelry. That was unexpected as it was just from a street vendor, and a lot of fun.

One of the Largest Bhuddest Shrines. A very large, and imposing, shrine that is viewable from most of Kathmandu. The stupa is 328 ft in diameter and 130ft in height and may be the largest in the world. A large base to walk around and viewing of the valley below

Take a few minutes to view the Stupa. There was a service going on while we were there, so a bit crowded, but it also provided us the opportunity to observe the service. Mostly just a walk-about, and you can go up on the Stupa.

Go for late lunch or sunset. No need to book in advance, just turn up and pay a small charge at the entrance. Must have a driver who can drop you off and pick you up as parking is impossible. This is largest Stupa in the world. 100 years ago it was surrounded by fields. Now it is encircled by 4 storey buildings that create an almost magic circle full of atmosphere. Walk clockwise around the 365 prayer wheels with Buddhist monks. Browse the many tiny shops & haggle for original crafts. Must do is take refreshments on the roof top of one of the two restaurants that look over the Stupa. One is called The Golden Eyes Restaurant & Café. I cant give website address but google it and add Kathmandu and you will find the site. Attached is a picture from its terrace. You look directly into the eyes of the temple. Prices are cheap for quality Nepalese dishes or just delicious lemon and honey drinks. Next door there is another restaurant equally as good. We sat there for sunset and enjoyed the calm then joined the crowd of worshippers to walk round a couple of times. Best to set aside 2 or 3 hours and combine this experience with some other things like the several Word Heritage sites easily found on Tripadvisor. More interestingly go off the beaten track and visit Kirtipur, a nearby hill town now encircled by the sprawl of Kathmandu. Ascend the steps and you enter a world time forgot. No cars on the narrow streets and alleys that join together all the temples. You will be the only tourists and see Nepalese life the way its been for centuries. We were lucky enough to meet a guide Rajesh Shahi who took us. Totally trustworthy and able to bring what we were seeing alive. Speaks perfect English and Spanish. He can be reached on +984 193 8015.

Spectacular Boudhanath Stupa!. Because it was a holiday, there was lots of activity at the Bodhnath stupa. No matter where you looked it was a scene worthy of a postcard. Incredible site. Great surrounding shopping area as well.

Very calm place to go. We visited the stupa and over cone by the calmness of the people. You immediately slow down take in the prayer rituals and observe with complete respect for these people. The beautiful and colourful stupa with prayer flags is something that will always stay with me. Night time is beautiful to visit when the lights are on and you can light a candle in prayer....really enjoyed this experience

Artful world's largest stupa . Very interesting and artful stupa. Alot of Buddism activities around. Very spiritual and great location, Boudhanath Stupa is one of the world's largest stupas. We visited it at different times of day ,We would recommend early morning or evening, as there aren't so many people then, and the light is best for photos.
Nice!. Loved walking around the Stupa, sitting on the rooftop cafe enjoying the beautiful and peaceful sights and of course shopping for knick knacks.
Relaxing. Liked that it was a relaxing place after the madness of Kathmandu. Nice rooftops to have a drink watching over the stupa.

Huge Structure with Puzzle. Boudhanath Stupa is huge structure with puzzle about what is inside this structure. It has very good value of being holy place. Most people visit this & Pashupatinath temple while they are in Kathmandu. There are shops, mini temple with attractive idols around the stupa.
amazing. we arrived during the prayer. gorgeous! I was moved.better to go at sunset and stop some time making the rounds of the stupa walk with Tibetan monks
Interesting. Very interesting site, but not much to do and it's annoying you have to walk round clockwise. Cool atmosphere though and worth a visit.

Beautiful stupa surrounded by lots of shops.... Beautiful stupa, has an entrance fee to enter 250 Nepali rupees for Foreigners and 50 Nepali rupees for Indians.. Just go around the stupa, small temple at the entrance.. Lots of shops surrounding the stupa.. Most charge triple the price for goods that you purchase from them..

Understanding the culture. Going to Nepal. Then you want to visit some of the Buddhist stupa's and Hindi temples. They will give you a good insight into the culture of Nepal and the lifestyle. Well worth the visit.

Definitely worth a visit. The Boudhanath Stupa world heritage site suddenly appears amidst the chaos and bustle of Kathmandu. It is at first striking and stands the test of closer inspection. The best time to visit is sunset when the evening prayers begin. You can join the circular walk around the stupa. Watching the sunset over the stupa and observing the many worshipers from one of the nearby restuarant balaconies is a treat. There are other temples nearby/within the actual stupa's compound and loads of stores as well. Definitely worth a visit.
Nothing much to see. There is nothing much to see around. There is a market surrounding it, but that's it. You are not allowed to go up top, so that was a shame.

Peaceful Abode. In the midst of hustle bustle of Kathmandu city stands Boudhanath Stupa, its a world heritage site. The minute you enter through the crowded entrance and look the beautiful site of the stupa, you get hit by peace. We reached their at the afternoon time when monks were finding their way to sit down for the afternoon prayers. You go for a full round of the Stupa which is covered by art prayers tied up all the way to the top. The stupa is surrounded by lot of monasteries, you can also visit them and light ghee diyas.It absolutely a wonderful place to be and a must visit when you are in Kathmandu. I loved this place so much that I visited it twice. It 2 minutes from Hyatt Regency hotel.

Great by day, greater still after dark. The Boudhanath stupa and its surrounding area is home to Kathmandu's greatest density of Tibetans. The large stupa is constantly being circumambulated by believers and enlightened tourists alike, and the sound of shuffling feet and spinning prayer wheels fills the whole square. The area hosts many tourist shops as well as Thanka studios and restaurants, many of which are worth a visit. This is one of the places where vendors probably won't harass you and call out to you on the street, but as always remember to keep your wits about you. During the day the sun gleams off the gold atop the stupa, but at night the whole area comes alive with the small flames if thousands of butter lamps and candles. This is most prominent during full moon, but you will probably see it on a somewhat smaller scale every night. Remember that you should always proceed to walk clockwise along the stupa, and never turn widdershins but rather walk around again if you miss something. And don't pretend you couldn't do with a bit more excercise.

Must see in Kathmandu. Loved the atmosphere of this Stupa. The shopping and cafe's that circle the area are fantastic! There are beautiful cafe's where you can enjoy your meal on the rooftop overlooking the entire area.
Magic .... We accidently found ourselves in the middle of the annual Nyingma monlam celebration. Fascinating if you take any interest in Buddhism.
Serene. The stupa's massive mandala makes it one of the largest spherical stupas in Nepal. There's lots of shops around and rooftop restaurant to get the best view to. Must Visit!

Worth A Visit. Frankly, the daytripping options around Kathmandu city leave me a little cold - you feel that you are here and you should visit these places, and you should, but a day on City attractions is enough before you escape the dust, and get out and trek or raft or whatever adventure brought you to Nepal.
Indeed, really peaceful and beautiful. Pictures don't give justice to this landmark. Visit it yourself. Walking distance from the Hyatt. Entry charge.

Peace of Mind. Quite impressive the way it is built and resonantes peace and calmness all arround. Had been on a day when afternoon or weekly prayer was going on. Wonderful to watch devotion , humbleness of the people around.
Breathtaking. Every time I go here it takes me breath away. The colors, the culture, they prayer wheels. I don't think I'll ever get tired of this place!

One of the must visits in Kathmandu. Go here not just for the beautiful stupa but also the number of cafes around the stupa. The sunset is beautiful here. Pick any good rooftop restaurant, soak the sun, have some cocktails and your day is set! The crowd can get a bit weird, so be careful of your belongings!

AMazing Structure. Wonderful place . Very beautiful in the evening when the lights start shining. It immediately tells us why it is called a world heritage structure. Must watdh. And do not forget the run through the prayer bells specially the largest one.
The shops around the site also look stunning

Serene with nice shopping around. The hustle and bustle of Kathmandu is left behind as you enter the stupa area. You hear Buddhist chants and see a nice stupa. We walked around the stupa, rotating the prayer wheels, and soaking in the serenity. Of course there were lots of people, some worshipping, others just tourists, and many interested in shopping in the little shops around the stupa. Fortunately it is a no vehicle area, so you can walk freely and at your own pace. A must see.

Tibetan Kathmandu at its best. This is one of the must-see sites in Kathmandu. Being Nepal's largest stupa is quite impressive at its own right. The gompas (monasteries) around are another reason to visit this place and learn about the Tibetan legacy of Nepal.And don't let the hordes of tourists who regularly frequent the place put you down. After all, you're most likely to be one of them.

Beautiful. An easy long walk from Thamel area wondering the back streets of Kathmandu. Just head off in the correct direction from Thamel and every so often ask a local "Boudhanath Stupa?" and they point the way. The stunning Stupa stand high and proud srtong as does the Tibetan culture that surrounds it. You pay to get in, but there are plenty of side streets that lead to the Stupa for free, which helps if your satying there :)

Love love love this place. This is always my 1st and last place to visit in Nepal, no matter how many times. After 14yrs, it still remains 1 of my favourite places in the world. It can be busy and crowded however nothing compare to the peace you can still find when walking around the stupa with its prayer wheels, temples, tibetans, locals, tourists and all sorts coming to this place. I am happy & joyful to have chances to pray, find myself and find peace here! wonderful! love this place!

A unique location. This is a very unique location, with a beautiful Stupa. There is a very big Tibetan feel to the square and you will see a number of Buddhist monks walking around the Stupa itself. It is a very culturally and spiritually significant area and you can feel that significance by walking a couple laps around the Stupa in a clock-wise fashion. Well worth the visit!

Very cultural and calming feast for the eyes. Commonly known as Bouddha Stupa there is something or someone to see. Follow the large Tibetan crowd that comes down from the mountains to pray as they walk around the stupa in a clockwise fashion, chanting a mantra and spinning the prayer wheels while dressed in their colourful traditional clothing. Sit back on a rooftop garden cafe and take the most amazing photos of the people and buildings.
Awesome Nepal. Im realy maximum enjoyed this trip... one of my unforgettable country. Exspecialy, mukthinath temple at mustang jomsam beautiful place..

Organized our Nepal and Bhutan tours. Like your Thamel tours organized our Bhutan trip. They arranged whole package including bhutan visa, flights and tour on full board. The accommodation was excellent and the hospotality was perfect. The guide and jeep driver were very friendly. Back in Kathmandu we took their sightseeing services and it was equally exciting tour.

Best attraction in Kathmandu. If you're visiting Kathmandu and only have time to see one attraction, then Boudhanath is the place to go. The White-washed Stupa is awe-inspiring, and the encircling shops are always fascinating. A must-see.
A nice place. A nice addition to th tour. Good shops surround the temple and the area lacks the intimidating nature of other tourist areas. A great spot for pictures and a bite of lunch.

Walk around 3 times clockwise for a peaceful mind. Well worth seeing and experiencing. The deal is to walk around clockwise 3 times spinning the prayer wheels and chanting Om mani padme hum which is a chant which helps you cleanse your body, mind and spirit from negative thoughts so you can receive positive ones. So we gave it a go. It takes about 10 minutes to do one lap so we were committed to doing this for 30 minutes. I did find it relaxing mainly because you clear your mind of thought except the chant. Nice to have a peaceful mind. We then headed on top of the stupa and our guide asked us to walk around the top in silence.The stupa is 120ft in diameter and is 43m high. The area of the stupa is 6,756 square metres. The stupa has been on the UNESCO world heritage sites list since 1979.Worth a visit.

Make sure you visit. this is well worth the visit. It is always pretty busy but it's some,where you can't miss. There is plenty of shopping to pass the time if you're not into the religious side of it all.
Devotees palce to visit. This is one of the most ancient temple in Nepal. And located in Kathmandu valley. you may travel by three wheeler or taxi.

Magical. What I like is the ambience with that roiling of each aum mani padmavati hum wheels just magical after puja we went to boudh restaurant and we had really gr8 food it's just awesome just try thuppa of boudh restaurant
Try it at twilight. Come around 6 pm in the evening (or early in the morning) to truly see it alive with devotees. Wonderful atmosphere, safe for solo women.

a "must visit". I'm a people watcher. This unique Stupa in the middle of a big city, was a surprise to me in its layout. People were walking around it in a clockwise direction, bordered within a wall with all the many tempting shops on the edges of the big circle. I enjoyed being a witness to the people's devotion there as they prayed as they walked, some with beads, and also to statues in the open air. Children climbing the walls and teens sitting on a brick wall with lots of merriment to be together. Devotion takes many forms, it doesn't have to be all too reverent......it's what in your heart that counts!

Must Visit!. This stupa is one the largest and oldest buddhist shrines in Nepal. Apart from the religious importance, the stupa is a very good place for tourists with restaurants and shops all around it. I went there on atleast two occasions during my brief stay in Nepal!
A Great Stupa !!!. This is a land mark place to see in Kathmandu. Had a great experience walking around -- on the top of this stupa.
Beautiful. This is big & beautiful. We wandered around with a smile on our face feeling humbled. Watching the monkeys play it was very relaxing.

A charming place. The centuries old stupa is well maintained. But the prime attraction are the restaurants, hotels and curio shops selling everything from wooden masks and tangkha paintings to brass objects d'art and Buddhist figurines. The place is very well maintained and clean and the restaurants offer a wide variety of excellent food.

A Special Energy. To be honest the temple is very simple, and you have other monuments that will have a bigger impact on you.However when you are there, due to the temple and the surroundings, you clearly can feel a special energy in there, something that will make you happy to visit this place.

Nice blend of east meets west. We spent several nights here.......nice room, very friendly and helpful staff. They have a nice outdoor pool and deck, and a decent weight room and sauna. The two resturants were awesome.....especially the Indian one. Not near too much.....but a good centeral location in kmd.
GREAT. Mindblowing. A must see place in KTM. The structure is magnificent and the reverence of the buddhists is quite stunning.

Size does matter. An interesting place to visit, make sure you walk around clockwise as it might bring you bad karma otherwise:-0
With so many, hundreds of stupas and temples in KTM, this one is the biggest visible even from a plane, so unless visiting it for religious purposes, there is no need to allow much time there.
Stupa not Stupendous. Its big but not that flash, a dome you can walk on and around, nice restraints and shops surrounding make it worth a visit

Must See. Beautiful Stupa. A few restaurants and pubs around it you could chill at while observing it.
Behind it is a Tibetan community living in small street with shops unlike elsewhere in Kathmandu. Go through it for a unique insight into a Tibetan neighborhood.
You could enter from the backside and skip paying entrance.

Largest Stupa in the world. To get too the stupa you have to go through one of four gates. Once inside the location you can how big this stupa really is. Its full of Colour and lots of monks chanting on their way round it. Like most big attractions there are a lot of tourist here, however don't let this put you off visiting as it is worth a visit. I first saw this when I was on a small plane flying to Lukla to start a trek.

Around and around. Beautiful experience- take your time and make several circuits of this massive, gorgeous stupa. Some nice cafes surround this gorgeous stupa, and pop into the monasteries to meet some friendly Buddhist monks.

Worthy visit if in Kathmandu. Great place to expose yourself to religious rituals done by monks. Quite a tranquil place, however this was slightly dampened by the amount of tourist that was there. The presence of monks were often overshadowed by foreigners. However you can escape from that by finding a high point view either from the rooftop of a cafe or entering inside the stupa and sitting on its high ground edge. There is an entry fee of 250npr. This attraction is not large at all and may only take approximately 1hr to explore (because you're only allowed to walk in a clockwise direction, entering and exiting the stupa structure itself may involve several laps). Overall, a site worth seeing

Different if new to Buddhism. Stoupas are all over Nepal as such, this one however is the said to be the holiest one. The rotating jewels, and knowledge around the Budha eyes and significance of their God is enlightening. I'm told you can catch the monks singing prayers, and performing rituals if you visit in the wee hours. We instead caught some music shops playing them (which was equally soothing) and some other old folks performing the prayers at noon. Haggled some more to shop within some of the stalls there as well. All in all a must do if you have never been to a Stoupa (not same as a monastery).
A very creative place. This place is very colourful, creative and filled with tourist. But you still feel calm and peaceful with the monks, chantings around you.

Loved the view.. Many of the building surrounding the Stupa have rooftop restaurants. Any one would be a perfect romantic stop for lunch. I imaging at night would be even better.
Reminds me of being in Sienna.

Mystic, powerful place. This is like an oasis within noisy, busy Kathmandu. When you enter the Stupa area, it is like you step into a totally different world. It is amazing, how naturally and intensely spirituality is lived there. The impressive size of the Stupa is overwhelming, it's energetic power stunning. I actually don't find the right words to describe, you have to see and feel yourself. A MUST see in Kathmandu!
well worth seeing. loved the whole experience, especially sitting on a roof top, having lunch and watching the activity below

A must see. At one level, it can be a little underwhelming as there is nothing architecturally great about it. Yet, the sheer size and the sight of devout offering prayers is humbling. Don't forget to feed the piegons on top of the stupa

A Peaceful Haven. For me this is one of the top attractions in the Kathmandu Valley, about 5 km from Kathmandu. You can get to it by minibus which you catch at the main bus stand. You need to ask around, and eventually you will find the right minibus. Much better than a taxi, and you get to experience authentic Nepal.The Stupa costs about 200 or 250rupees to enter, which is fair enough, but if you are a regular visitor, you will quickly clock that you can easily enter for free, just 100 metres from the main gate, but really, you should pay at least once, just to contribute to the upkeep of this remarkable monument. It is truly beautiful, magnificent and serene.
Much Religious Activity. There are pray wheels in action, monks in their robes and much prostration on the special platforms.

Special place to be. A place to see and to sit back and relax the view and absorb Buddhism. We did visited this place many times and also special when they fire up the butter lamps at festival evenings.

Peaceful and spiritual location. We took one full round of Stupa touching almost every prayer wheel. It was a peaceful site. Small vendors around the market complex were selling religious stuff like booked, decorative items, CDs etc. Tourists were all around. Two big eyes on Stupa with a nose was very nice to see. We all liked being there. A must visit if one is in Kathmandu
Nice and quaint little shops. It is a good place.shops there give an old world feeling.clean campus.overall agood experience,we had a coffee and jhalmuri there it was also good
Great Place. Nice art and story behind it. I am happy with The great Adventure Treks and Expedition for organizing this trip.

A must-see in Nepal. This is a must-see in Nepal! It is incredibly beautiful. Take a walk around (clockwise!) to admire the Stupa and make sure to do some people watching too. We were there around 4pm and many Buddhists came to walk around the Stupa, prayer beads in hand. What an experience - highly highly recommended!

Nice place. It's very nice place to visit once and we had really great time on this peaceful place we have stayed at hotel in Thamel and it's not that far to visit. Our hotel suggest to take taxi and it's easy to get.
A must. Its a must when u r in KTM. One or two times is enough. Great restaurant near by = Road House. Go to the top floor and you can see the bird eye view of the stupa from there.

great shopping and sightseeing area. love the rooftop restaurants and the variety of souvenirs around the area.
We lunched at a rooftop restaurant overlooking the stupa. Food was decent.

Iconic kathmandu stupa.. The atmosphere here at Boudanath is one of authenticity, as many monks and Tibetans circle the stupa to pray. There are plenty of shops and restaurants to sate the tourist palate, but there is also the opportunity to soak up the Buddhist calm if that's your choice. Wonderful! I'd stay here next time overnight to savour the experience more.

Monkey World. I was up there in November and you shouldn't miss this one! Don't have anything in you hands or the monkeys may give you a surprise. the stairs are hell but that's the only downside. There's a little spot to get the obligatory tea off to the end of the parking area. Quite a bit to see here
A very Quiet and Exciting Place!. Very good place to visit in Kathmandu....you will be delighted to see the structure, how it is built. Must visit place in kathmandu.

Impressive site. It was a festival while we arrived at site, many people were walking clockwise around the immense Bodhnath Stupa, praying, singing. Many shops are located around the Stupa, I have selected a singing bowl and a Tang-ga painted by a lama. We will surely come back to see the great Stupa again.
Little Tibet. If you've never been to Tibet, walk around Boudhanath for a small taste to it -- the smells, sights, and sounds.
Beautiful. Little far from kathmandu,, lies far also from crowd,, its made amazingly,, the structure is so beautiful, we cant stop to see everything there,,, must visit place in nepal.

Great Stupa. This stupa is one of the largest and most significant buddhist monument in the world and was enlisted on world heritage sit by Unesco in 1979. Normal tour will take 2-3 hours but for me is not enough. You can actually spent a day here. There are some good restaurant on the top floor where you can dine and view the stupa at teh same time. Lots of bazaar and shopping to do and stuff here is cheap if you know how to bargain. Bargain for 50% discount. Start walking from your left side once you are at teh entrance.This is 1 attraction you don't want to miss.

Awesome, but touristy. The stupa itself is amazing and beautiful and a wonder to behold. The area directly around it is just a bunch of the same old shops pressure selling you the same stuff you see everywhere. There are a few guest houses around the stupa as well that look promising mainly because there are no cars or motorbikes allowed in the area. That is the best part!

The sites, sounds, smells ..... This is a great attraction that I wouldn't miss. There's really a lot to take in. There's plenty to see (amazing colors). There are quite a few monkeys hanging around and stalls to purchase locally made items. Definitely a site for the senses.
Love the colour, the crowded and the restaurants around this area. Like: The praying ceremony, the pray flags colour, Love the colour, the crowded and the restaurants around this area.Disliked: none

Number 1 are you kidding me !. I went yesterday and spent all of 10 minutes there and that was stretching it out ! Really not worth the 25-30 minute taxi ride and just really stunned this is the number 1 attraction in Kathmandu! I just don't get it !!
nice place to visit. Second time visit this place. Many people pray at here. We also follow them to round the Stupa. The surround building is very beautiful. And you can do lamp offering at here.
Beautiful tour. Loved- the scent, the stupa, birds and view.A visit to kathmandu is incomplete without a peek to this monastery.

Something worth seeing in Kathmandu. Take a couple of hours and visit the Stupa. Stop in for lunch, walk around clockwise a few times, grab some souvenirs. Its also a quieter place to stay if you're in Kathmandu for awhile.

Cold in the morning but best time to visit!. I went with my family at 7 because we read that people through paint, but we were not able to see that, instead the buy some paint powder, give money in exchange and throw it in a small place in the floor. We were impressed by the crowd early in the morning, its interesting to see how they pray.
Impressive structure. Boudhanath Stupa is impressive from any angle. It is massive, but clearly well-maintained. The atmosphere is also serene despite the number of tourists and pilgrims.
something different. The Stupa was excellent, fine way to spend your morning, a must see in Kathmandu, however I did prefer the Monkey temple and Durbar Square.
Huge stupa well worth a visit. Amazing Tibetan hand-painted art (shopfront at approx 4pm on clock if stupa entrance is noon) is well worth viewing. Then we bought some!
Boudhanath Stupa. Great place for photos of interesting historical buildings. Lots of history here and well worth 1/2 day visit. Easy to get to because it is part of Kathmandu.
Great at Sunset. Really enjoyed visiting here as my last stop before the miserable Kathmandu airport. Caught sunset and a very colorful sky. This is a must visit location!!!
A wonderful experience. Walking around the Stupa was a wonderful experience. We see the Lamas chanting and the atmosphere transforms us.
Worth a visit. If you are in Kathandu you cannot miss this Stupa. The experience and the photographs will last a lifetime. There is also great shopping around the Stupa for souveniers.

Centre of Bliss. The Stupa is a centre point for a vibrant Tibetan culture that has settled around it. The street that goes around the Stupa and is used for walking around for prayer. On this very same street now lies stylish cafe, souvenir shops, Tibetan art works, herbs, jewellery and the works. There are Spanish, Japanese Italian, Indian... Restaurants of all kinds. This is the place that holds JOY, and exudes Bliss. the stupa is an anchoring point of Peace for the Valley. A must visit. Great architecture, good food. Great finds.

Shopping and worshipping. I'm living just outside the main area and it's really lovely to be so close to something so amazing. People watching is gold here and you could sit and watch all day. Watch the sunset and on a clear day if your on a rooftop you'll be able to see the snow capped mountains in the background. The shopping is also good and reasonable with loads on offer. The restaurants close by are expensive but as soon as you go outside of the circle it's cheap again.
It's ok...nothing special. Its just a very large dome which to me was not very impressive. Liked the Swayambhunath Temple much more.
Perfect serene white stupa encircled by amazing eateries and hideaways!. Perfect for an afternoon walk enjoying the beauty as the day turns to evening.A must visit that you will forever cherish

a good insight. We didn't have long enough here. I think 3 or 4 hours would be good. I enjoyed the Stupa itself and the surrounding buildings but observing the people partaking in rituals was the best. The monks, prayer wheels, chanting all contributed to a great experience

A most spiritual place. By far my most favourite place, the atmosphere around Boudhanath Stupa must be the most spiritual in all Kathmandu. Ringed by little shops and cafes, they do not detract from the aura felt here, with a constant stream of people circling - day and night - around the magnificent Stupa.

Boudhnath, Kathmandu. The most revered Tibetan buddhist shrine in the Kathmandu valley, Boudhnath definitely has a certain air of mysticism and sanctity. Saturday early morning is probably the best time to visit, when the local Tibetan community are out in force circulating the stupa in what is known as kora, spinning their prayer wheels and chanting mantras. The scent of juniper incense and the devotion of the worshippers, many prostrating themselves full length as they make their kora all add to the atmosphere. There are a number of restaurants around the base of the stupa of varying quality serving an eclectic array of dishes. There are also numerous shops selling curios and CDs of buddhist chants. Tibetan festival days are particularly lively, but worth a visit any time.

Nice to hang around for a couple of hours . Shopping small touristic things. Have a lunch, write your familly name on a banner of "flaggs" get it up in the top and get good luck... Dont pay for the service puttning it up thou, even they try to get you to pay. This time i brought my granddaughter (6) she liked it alot
Great Temple to Visit. It is absolutely gorgeous and a must visit while in Kathmandu. There are great restaurants with rooftop dining that I would suggest doing while there.

Shanti Stupa. I LOVE Boudhanath!! It is like the calm in the centre of the Kathmandu storm. I go there to chill out in the traffic free street surrounding the stupa and the rarefied air that seems to follow Tibetan culture where ever it lands! I don't like that there is a entrance fee, though I guess I understand. There is a nifty modern tourist toilet facility that I'm sure was paid for by this entrance fee money!!

Good experience. It's a nice stupa, but it's more of a commercialized tourist trap with not much else to do there other than visit the shops and restaurants. We did get a guide for 400 rupees to learn more about the history, but although genuine in the information they provide they end up taking you to a Thanka artwork school that professes that the proceeds go to the students painting the Thankas, which is just a tactic to sell overpriced paintings. The paintings are highly overpriced and you can find them all over Nepal. If you are looking to buy the paintings from this area make sure to bargain similar to any of the other shops in Nepal. It is still a great area to visit in Kathmandu given the cool restaurants, shops and the stupa.

A very spiritual place. Not to be missed.. We attended late afternoon and it was a great time with hundreds of monks, locals and tourists walking clockwise around the base to pay their respects or soak up the spiritually.There is also an upper section where you walk amongst the prayer flags and can take some wonderful photos.
Poor maintenance !. The place has a history ! Well , but isn't maintained and now this place needs heavy care! Cleanliness of the compound is what it is missing the most !
Very interesting. This is 1 of my favourite stupas in Kathmandu. You get a real sense of Buddhism here and if you are lucky have the opportunity to speak to a monk.

Beautiful and serene. Boudha Stupa is an oasis of peace and quiet in the so noisy Kathmandu. All the area around it's clean, you can eat at one of the restaurants near it. Don't miss it if you are around!

Beautiful place, must be seen. Beautiful place, must be seen. Very peaceful place. Highly recommended to visit by night with all the lights. Go out for a dinner in one of those restaurants around that have terraces to enjoy the setting.

Interesting. It is supposedly a very important stupa in Nepal. I found it interesting enough and enjoyed the view walking around but didn't like the souvenir shops and guesthouses in such close proximity.

The Great Stupa . Wonderful place to visit - particularly for photography.
Fascinating variety of colours surrounding an huge and elegant white Stupa.
Another interesting aspect are the eyes of Buddha - looking in all directions.
There is a belief that visitors should encircle the Stupa at least thrice - clockwise. It brings peace & good luck.

City centre temple. This is right in the middle of Kathmandu and you would miss it if you didn't know where it was. You just go through an alley and then ithere is a massive opening where the Boudhanath Stupa is situated. Interesting to look around and also there are little craft shops around this.

Annapurna November 2014. Atmospheric, photogenic, noisy, busy, crowded - absolutely brilliant!
Amenities, food and beverage close at hand.
Fabulous. Great to understand the depth of faith of nepalese buddhists. Lots of shopping around too, if you need incense or Tibetan style curios.

Important Shrine for Pilgrimage. For Buddhists, the Great Stupa of Boudhanath is one of the most important pilgrimage sites in the world. The stupa is enormous and the sight of it exceeded my expectations. The UNESCO World Heritage Site is breathtaking with its thousands of prayer flags that flutter under the watchful eye of the Buddha. Everywhere are Tibetans in splendid costume and everywhere the faithful spin prayer wheels and light butter lamps in the hope of protection, purification, and fulfillment of wishes. A lovely town surrounds the huge square containing the stupa and the streets are lined with great shops with a variety of merchandise for sale. There are cafes as well. This is a place that begs to be photographed. Don't miss it.
Very moving & fascinating place to visit. Great sights, sounds, relaxing, peaceful, good food and drink. Great photo opportunities. One of our best places we visited in Kathmandu
Big Stupa in a little area. Stupa was great - however don't be fooled into thinking its out in the open the stupa is walled in by shops/restaurants on every side!!!'

Great place to visit. The Stupa is really huge and impressive. There are a lot of souvenirs shops arround and some roof top restaurants with great view over the Stupa. My friend and I was there during the sunset, seating in the roof top cafe, drinking beer and watching how the last rays of sun reflects on the Stupa peak!.
Wonderful experience. Very spiritual place. Walk 3 times around the Stupa, spinning the prayer wheels as you go. Lots of places to eat nearby.
Relaxing after Everest trail. Biggest stupa in Asia (presumably therefore in the world). Walk around and over. Excluding travel to get there and back, allow a couple of hours for a leisurely visit

Great Stupa. This stupa is so different from many others in this part of the world. I had seen many photos but the reality exceeds my expectations. It is also surrounded by many lovely shops that still provide traditional Tibetan and Nepalize items for the tourist trade that are rapidly disappearing fron the rest of Katmandu as it rushes headlong towards western dress and culture! Ideally one would spend a day at this site and take time to drink tea and take in the magnitude of th site, it's history and the stories of the Himilayan peoples and their culture...
Close to the source. I like the laid back attitude of the Nepalese towards their religion. There has been a huge change over the last 40 years, life has become much tougher since then.
lovely and happy place in KTM. I just loved to go to Budha and just join the people on their koras. It is a fabulous places, with a very special atmosphere about it.

Large and Majestic Temple. The temple was like nothing I had seen before and was an entirely new experience for me. It was interesting to see the cultural happenings and there were plenty of side shops and things to see on the outer edges of the circle.You can walk and climb the temple and there are good viewing points all round as well. Only difficult thing was the parking since it was across the busy road but hey, they are small laneway roads and it's an old city so what can you expect! All part of the culture.
Definitely worth a visit. This place gets very crowded and hot. If you come near lunch time, go to one of the rooftop restaurants and enjoy the views down and maybe a cold beer.

Atmospheric stupa with fluttering prayer flags!. This stupa is located in Kathmandu city centre and suddenly looms in front of you when you least expect it. It is a great sight, the prayer flags fluttering in the sky and all of the prayer wheels surrounding it. This is a must see when in Kathmandu!
Boudhanath. It is one of the best place to visit in Kathmandu valley. It is not only religious to Buddhist people but also for Hindu.

Ordered chaos. When you go to places like this that you may not completely understand all the rituals, it is eye opening. Loved the seemingly ordered chaos...without full understanding of what is happening, that is what is appears to be. I learned so much from a guide...fascinating and a must visit.

Always worth a visit. I always make it a point to visit whenever I am in Kathmandu. It is a lovely spot to people watch and absorb some the atmosphere. It really hasn't changed much in the past 30 years, except the traffic between there and the city center has gotten much worse. For this reason, don't even think about going at midday. Much better to plan your trip for early morning or evening.
Ho Hum. A big stupa, lots of flags, and over priced. Walk around a bit and leave. Sorry, did nothing for me.

Very impressive stupa. This is the largest in Nepal and has a great atmosphere. We opted to watch the sun go down whilst having dinner at one of the roof top restaurants which was a pleasant way to spend the early evening and helped us to avoid the worst of the rush hour traffic.
A must-see!. I stayed in a hotel located in the Boudhanath circle, and got to walk around the stupa a lot. Awesome thing to see, if you're in KTM you gotta stop by at least once!

Gimmick attraction but worth a visit. This is another gimmick attraction aimed at tourist and over pricing everything there.Tourists are charged money to enter but if you ask your taxi to drop you to one of the many alleys that doesn't have a entry fee you can avoid this extortion.

Loved the Buddha eyes. A unique experience to be at the stupa. The budda eyes take your breath away. Counted the prayer rings (which you move by hand) all put together there are more than 700. We tried moving all of them. A very good place to buy souvenirs (but don't forget to bargain)

Go before sunset. We visited this place before sunset and stayed for quite a bit in one of the restaurants that had a good view of the stupa. Despite the crowd, I still found the atmosphere very relaxing. If you love taking photos, the sky is amazing before and after the sun has set.

Big Stupa. Great place to grab lunch on a roof top cafe and people watch. The history of this stupa is amazing and the shops around are the best (best prices in Nepal). The feel around the area is special and make sure you walk 3 times clockwise around.
Buddism beautiful stupa and good souvenirs. Peacefull and beautiful stupa and surrounding buildings and people.Nice and relaxed shops for souvenirs.
Corner of Tibet in Nepal. Amazingly huge temple complex surrounded by shops and monasteries. Tourists mingle with devotees but it is impressive

World Heritage site.. Good and very clean, will be of great interest to Budhist people.
People from all over the world come here for visit.

Peaceful Monastery. Buddhanath is a peaceful clean place , auspicious for Buddhist and others for common hangout place . Different restaurants available and may offer rooftop view to stupa . It's better to visit this place in the morning or in the evening when people offer special prayers and you can fell the positive energy the most .
SPEACHLESS. Mainly go in the morning and evening, when you will see the monks praying around it.. The inciense, the music, the atmosphere, simply is magnetic
Must seen. Beautiful Energy and Powerful Place. Must wake up early or come at the sunset... and then the magic can start
Buddhist magical atmosphere. I loved being in the Tibetan area of Kathmandu where Buddhists walk their daily clockwise kora (meditative walk) around the stupa.

taste of buddha simplicity. this is an unique place that gives you a feel of buddhist culture and tradition. check out the several antique shops and the thanka paintings . also check out the antique shops for some good picks
Amazing !!. Wonderful , surreal , beautiful, a great place for people watching and many places to have a meal or a coffee.
step into Tibet. Wonderfully atmospheric at dawn and dusk - walk around the stupa with Tibetan pilgrims and visit monasteries. If you can't stay just enjoy the views from the rooftop restaurants.

Nice. It was nice however even nicer if you go to Pashupatinath Temple first than take 2.5km walk to Boudhanath Stupa. You get to walk through back streets of a little suburb and just observe life. Stupa was nice however I have seen bigger and more impressive ones. All the same I would recommend it as a half a day trip. There are also souvenir shops and restaurants all around so you can have a lunch there before continuing somewhere else.

Wonderful Ancient Buddhist Stupa. For Tibetan Buddhists, as well as for Buddhists from all over the world, Boudhanath is a very holy destination. The largest Stupa of its kind, it traces its root back to shortly after the Buddha's death over two millenia ago. It is quite an experience to join Buddhists of all nations as they walk around the Stupa (always in a clockwise direction), sometimes chanting, sometimes spinning the prayer wheels, sometimes meditating, sometimes prostrating themselves, but always with a degree of reverence.I originally sought refuge in the Buddhist community at one of the gompas (monastery) at Boudhanath a few years ago. This November, I returned to take my lay vows and was treated to a blessing ceremony conducted by three monks at the same monastery. It was quite elaborate, with singing, chanting, music, prayers and blessings. A very memorable and moving ceremony for me, and one that I will never forget.There is a lot of commercialism surrounding the Stupa, but the stores are fun to poke around in. You can always find a good souvenir to remind you of your time at this magnificent site.

impressive bhuddist temple. although it can be viewed from up high from across the city, it is tucked away and hidden at street level, this is quite an impressive building. small shops surround it. toilets were clean. go up inside the shops for a better view although the stairs are a bit steep. worth a stop.

Great Stupa. This an enormous stupa, very clean area and is certainly worth visiting. Access is through busy and dusty streets! The immediate surrounding area is pedestrianised making the visit pleasant. Unfortunately for a religious shrine it has become very touristy and very commercialised.

Ideal time to visit is dusk. You can't miss this one. The entry is NPR250, a bargain. This is a world heritage site and the largest buddhist stupa in Asia. When you enter, notice the flow of traffic. Everyone is walking clockwise. Do not go against the flow, then their saying is you are going against the flow of the future. Stay awhile, visit the monastery nearby and observe the buddhist rituals, perhaps you will catch a glimpse of the monks making their rounds on the stupa. It is truly an amazing experience. Stay 2-3 hours or longer and entertain/amaze yourself.

Awe inspiring. Useful to have a guide to explain history, religious and cultural implications of the Stupa. Like most tourist sites most of the shops charge a premium in this area, more competition and variety of gifts to to found in the Thamal district

The feel around the place is unique. Just walk around the Stupa, well maintained and clean walking area outside. Shops and peddlers are not intrusive. Lot of decent restaurants where you can go for a quiet dinner as well.

The largest and most significant Stupa in Nepal. What an experience! This was the most beautiful and religiously significant Stupa I visited while in Nepal. It dates back to the 14th century but is so well maintained it looks it is difficult to imagine the age. And it is huge. Walking clockwise around the Stupa takes a bit of time especially when stopping to reflect and "live the moment". It is also ringed with shops, restaurants and temples which add to the incredibly moving experience. Plan on spending a couple of hours at least at this site.
great restaurant!. great place to eat! the staff is really slow! The price is great and the atmosphere is nice. I recommend this place.
A Must see. Visiting Kathmandu without Sehring Boudhanath Stupa is Not complete. It. Is very atmospheric, especially in the evening with all the tibetans walking around.
Boudha Stupa. Despite the crowds this place did feel holy- a great centre for Tibetan ( and western) Buddhists.Lots of music and smells of incense and chanting monks.

Boudhanath Stupa visit. My visit to Boudhanath Stupa was in a sunny day. It was crowded but clean place and where I could taste nepale food for the first time and where I knew the hilling ball. Was a nice time expended there..
Nice square. i love the shops square near boudhanath. Even the price is a bit higher than thamel, but i felt comfortable to walk in there, less-crowd and no cars.

The heart of Kathmandu. Love love love
A real must see!!!
It has everything for everyone.....the spirituality is palpable, culture a plenty,
great little restaurants, fantastic shopping,
Walking around the stupa , looking up the stupa......cannot be missed

Boudhanath Stupa. This was interesting to my wife and I. We had hired a driver and tour guide from the hotel. It was about $50 for both for the day. This was our stop around lunch time. We ate on a rooftop restaurant and we were all the way up on the fourth floor. The view of the stupa was very good. We had a nice hot meal and a few beers and bottled water. It was a great vantage point to people watch. We had very good view of the Kathmandu Valley and the aircraftlined up for final approach into Kathmandu Airport. It was a beautiful day to sit in the sun or in the shade of an umbrella as we did and relax for an hour. After lunch we explored the stupa and we were encouraged to walk around on the roof of it as others were doing. There were all kinds of street hawkers selling wares. I admit to being interested in "singing bowls" but quite honestly I had never heard of one before I arrived in Kathmandu. It is no different than a tuning fork that puts out a sound as it resonates as it vibrates. The bowls resonate and it is a pleasant sound. I was not willing to spend so much on spun metal though. the stupa was beautiful and you should go see it. Counting lunch and walking around we were here about two hours.

An impressive Stupa. I've been to Tibet and seen many Stupas and this one rivals those. You can walk around the Stupa and visit the many shops that surround it. You can't take a bad picture in this location
Amazing. My wife and I celebrated out 20th anniversary in Nepal. This is a must see location to visit. Wish we had more time...
An Experience. The size and magnitude of the temple. The variety of people. The atmosphere including all of the stops along the way . Very participatory.

One of the largest stupas in South Asia. Set within a circular, Tibetan district of shops and restaurants this magnificent Stupa is a compelling and colourful sight. The whole area is full of character (and people!) and has a fascinating Hindu temple opposite. One of the major sites to visit in Kathmandu, we spent about an hour and a half there.

Don't Miss This. This is the largest stupa in Nepal, possibly the world. it is colorful, with a variety of building styles all around the circle here. There are several Buddhist monasteries here. There is reasonably priced shopping here but the whole atmosphere is not to be missed.
Amazing sight. The size and stature will astound you. Make sure you have a guide as there are so many links to culture and religion that you could well miss so much
Lovely ambience around the stupa. Peaceful, calm and colourful in an amphitheatre type setting. Excellent place for a roof top lunch overlooking the Stupa.

Not much to see. Entry ticket is too much for a site like this....they are not even provide tourist with any guide support. Why on earth someone pay 200 NR just to see a stupa if there is no one around to brief the history.
Big White Stupa, Tibetan Style. I it this place much, I can see the Wisdom Eyes from far away. I like the way of the prayers arount the stupa. It is the must see place in Nepal.
Amazing place. Great energy! Really bhuddist place. The area around is really charming. Definitely worth attending. Don't miss it!

Worth the visit. Amazing area, you will love to experience it.
There are many people around but that won't bother you.
Enjoy the atmosphere, it is unique.
Should go. Nice place to visit. Careful with pick pockets! Places inside are expensive to eat, I wouldn't reccomend eating there. Our guide made us eat there.
Boudhanath - beautiful. One of the Buddhist refugee settlements of Kathmandu. Really nice place to relax and shop! Didn't really dislike anything about it. Beautiful things and nice prices.
Beautiful. Amazing, busy yet peaceful place to get away from the congestion of Kathmandu. A must see sight in Kathmandu
A beautiful place. This Stupa and surrounding Temples were very interesting and beautiful. It was also cleaner and quieter than other places I have visited in the Kathmandu area.

The best place in Nepal for me!. We visited Boudhnath stupa on our last day in Nepal and it was the best bit of our travel. The stupa is huge and although looks maybe ordinary there is this beautiful feel to the place an almost positive energy that makes you smile all the while.There are huge crowds of tourists and monks even locals praying. Nearby there is a monastery where prayers were going on and one can visit as well. Many folks were sitting below and meditating. We just walking clockwise turning the prayer wheels :) Lots of restaurants to chill out close by as well. a wonderful place one should NOT miss.
Worth a look. There was a fantastic feeling around the Stupa.. Its a buzz with shops , devotees and loads of clour.
nice Stupa. Very interesting and artful stupa. Said that it is the largest stupa in Asia. Alot of Buddism activities around. Very spiritual and great location for a lunch.

Peaceful despite the bustle. It is hard to imagine that such a structure has stood for so long. Always remember to circle clockwise around the structure. You will know if you get it wrong because so many people will be walking the other direction. Day time or night time, the place is always busy right up until about mid evening. Despite the noise from the outside world, this is a place for reflection. And if you are lucky to be there for a full moon festival, the structure is festooned in colourful lights. Be mindful of scammers and pickpockets but otherwise it is a place for believers of any belief system to find serenity.

Special place. This area and the giant stupa always impresses. After walking round it a couple of times I always go to a rooftop café for a tea and just to meditate upon the stupas history, its very old and is quite special. I always go there for an hour if I am in Kathmandu.

Visit Boudhanath Stupa. Please when you go to Nepal and arrive in Kathmandu, visit this amazing beautifull stupa. The greatest stupa in the world and amazing Tibetan place in Kathamandu. Please visit this place.
The Biggest Stupa youll ever see. If youre in the area at all you should def try and call out to Boudha to see this, its well worth it. Theres loads of little things going on all around it.

Enjoy lunch on a terrace overlooking Stupa. This is the biggest Buddhist Stupa. It is surrounded by plenty of tourist shops. A Buddhist monastery is also here in the circle. Another interesting place is where they are training future monks with a very large statue of future Buddha.
lively. very nice and lively place. it has many huge buddhist bells which my kids enjoyed rotating... had many terrace cafes and a good lively market

Big. This massive Stupa is a must see. Walking around it shows it in all light and shadows with the prayer flags reaching into the sky. The surrounding shops are clean and reminiscent of any quaint western tourist villiage.

Just love it. The best thing to do after you have walked around as much as you want is to find a roof top restaurant and then sit there and soak up the views. It is one of the busiest temples in town and there's lot of tourists yes but you are a tourist too so you must accept this.
lovely stupa. it is interesting place to visit, but careful with monkeys family as they will catch your bag to take food even they dont care what you have or not...:)
Lunch with a view. I loved the rooftop restaurant terrace where we had lunch and watched the migrating around the Stupa. Great way to take it all in before getting amongst it.

Biggest Budist temple in Nepal so do not skip it as it has many Tibetien culture around it.. I liked to withness genuine worshipping people.Lots of great artifacts.You can find great wood paintings from Tibet.Second level of temple offers a great viev of area.Go around clock wise as it is the Budist way otherwise you ruin the flow as ı did by mistake.
Big. It's beautiful and big! You have to go around, like three times! It's awesome! And also, It was the ony place where I found very nice souvenirs...

Peaceful, beautiful temple - great to see the people of Nepal. I went here a few times over my week's stay in Kathmandu and would highly recommend it.Please walk clockwise around the Stupa (just follow the crowd). I found the best time to go was around 7am and 5pm, as you can see the local people worshipping. You can easily spend an hour, two or few here, if you enjoy watching people or their Buddhist practices. It was quite peaceful to walk around the Stupa. There is also a temple right across to Boudhanath's entrance, that you can walk up for a nice view of the area. It's free and would suggest taking a look.There is a fee to come into Boudhanath from the major streets, but found early in the morning, no one is there. There are also side streets to enter on.There are a number of shops, cafes and restaurants around the site, although I never tried any of them.I would highly recommend this site - just beautiful, as are the people of Nepal!

Great energy. This holy site has a lovely feel, this time was an evening visit and many of the store holders closed. Though the stupa still had great accessory and was quit awe inspiring in the lights. There were monks chanting and still much to see and feel. It has a very calm accepting energy.

Biggest Stupa in Nepal. It is the biggest Stupa in Nepal, it is a place that you must visit when you are around Kathmandu. Well maintained and there are lots of flowers around the Stupa, colorful prayer flags makes it very photogenic. You can do some shopping as there are lots of shops surrounding it.

Great Buddhist Shrine. It's a world heritage site of Nepal. Visiting this holy & very beautiful monument of Kathmandu, Nepal offers visitor a great spiritual satisfaction and also provide opportunity to be acquainted with this World heritage of ancient Buddhist Stupa.

very good. A must see place !!! One of the biggest and well maintain stupas in Nepal . Please visit it and shows your support as in Nepal most of the aciant building are slowly desappiring down in rubles

Wonderful site. This si a quite large, white stupa where thousands of Buddhist pilgrims circulate around it. A chance to see the devotions of people from around the world. Colorful prayer flags all around the area make it a festive place and quite photogenic. The stupa is surrounded by a nice selection of shops, restaurants and tea cafes. Well worth a visit.

Top Buddhist Cultural cite. I have been over hundred times to this Buddhist Stupa and each time I visit I like it more. The round about (Kora) is so clean, wide and picturesque. It gives me peace of mind, retreat and mental satisfaction. The views are fabulous from any of the restaurant like Stupa View, Cafe Du Patan, Sakura especially valley and mountains.
A Temple worth visiting. This is a beautiful Temple which is circularly surrounded by shops and restaurants (many with roof top views). It has a great vibe.

The largest temple in Nepal. As you enter the gateway into this area you realize that you are in a special place - looks like a quaint village with this huge Buddhist temple in the middle with everyone walking around it clockwise. After studying the temple you can shop 'til you drop with all the merchants in shops around the perimeter. Looks like a place I would like to return to and say in one of the old guest houses/hotels.

Impressive. A must see place !!! One of the biggest and well maintain stupas in Nepal .Please visit it and shows your support as in Nepal most of the aciant building are slowly desappiring down in rubles !!!Anto
BUDDHIST TEMPLE. An amazing place with several Buddhist temples & locals paying respect to the biggest Stupa in Nepal.

Very interesting place with great atmosphere. very interesting place with great atmosphere, history, vela different people and pigeons;)splendidvelmi zaujimave miesto s obrovskou atmosferou, historiou, vela roznych ludi a holubov ;)Velkolepe

Interesting Place. This place must be visited if in Katmandu. I found the place very clean and totally loved the vibe around. Just outside the main area are lot of restaurants, some of them 2 storeys high so you can take some good photos of the place from here.
A great experience in the heart of Katmandu. Time spent at the stupa is well worthwhile . It is a vibrant location with an incredible atmosphere at the heart of Katmandu , well worth a visit.

Boudhanath. I regularly visit Boudhanath and just felt this ,If you guys really want to see the true beauty of Boudhanath please visit either in early morning or in the evening those are the peak times when,lot of people come to worship in Boudhanath and you can truly feel positive energy all over the Boudhanath.

Do not miss. Boudhanath Stupa is a really impressive stupa and worth spending a few hours. It's a bit outside the city and you will a taxi. Usually overcrowded by pilgrims and/or tourists but a really spectacular place for pictures. Go around sunset time, the light is much better (really bright white stupa!)
Himalayas. Liked it all......there was nothing i particularly disliked about the trip ! The visit to Bhutan was excellent !

A site of intense devotion. Boudhanath Stupa is a site like no other, imbued as it is with the daily devotion of tens of thousands of Buddhists who circumambulate at dusk and dawn, chanting mantras, counting rosary beads and turning prayer wheels, all out of the faith that these actions, performed with the correct motivation, will add to the world's much needed store of spirituality and peace. It is a colorful crowd that walks around, generally at a healthy pace, including Himalayan folk from across the entire mountain range, including Bhutanese, Tibetans, and many others, all in their local dress. Try to come on the full moon, when the stupa twinkles with lights, and the crowds are even larger. Have tea or a meal in one of the many cafes that sit two floors up, overlooking the world going by.
Very old amazing Stupa. Every time I come back see more and more improvementsAlso around the Stupa many nice shopsIt is interesting also walk around in the streets behind the Stupa

A Temple with a great feeling of peace. By peace I don't necessarily mean the noise, it's quite a busy place so is full of chitter chatter and languages from all around the world!I speak of the peace this place gives your soul. It's hard to explain but after you've been there you feel better for it.Just find a place to sit a while, then watch and listen, basically letting the world pass you by.The colours of both the buildings and the people are majestic.If you go by taxi or car, a tip is to get them to let you off on the side of the entrance, the road is a very busy one and for some, a nightmare to get accross!The Temple Square is shut away from the road and pedestrian only, noise from traffic is zero.

Awe-inspiring. The Boudhanath Stupa is one of the world's largest stupas. We visited it at different times of day during our stay, as our hotel was only a short walk away. We would recommend early morning or evening, as there aren't so many people then, and the light is best for photos.

One of the highlights of the Kathmandu Valley. An important place for visitors and disagree with the reviewer who says you pay more if you are white. It all depends if you know the language or not Having taught Nepali and Sanskrit and taken lessons in Newari I am sure that I paid no more than an local Nepali. I visited Baoudha many times cycling there through sunshine and heavy rain as well as on public transport.
Must see place in KTM. One of the best things to see in KTM. The place has amazing senes of peace to it, even though its located in midst of all the chaos of shopping center all around
The most amazing journey of self discovery!. I was so amazed at the history and beauty of this Stupa. The culture and history was fascinating and enlightening.
Stunning attraction. Very nice area, many great rooftop restaurants, good shopping and a beautiful Stupa, our guide was excellent explaining the history of the area

Wonderful. A huge Stupa located in a lovely square. The strings of colourful prayer flags contrast well against the white of the Stupa and the wonderful all seeing eyes. Lots of pilgrims in the square using the prayer wheels, giving the site a lovely serene feel. Plenty of shops if you want a souvenir. A must see site in Kathmandu
very good site to visit. Larger stupa in Nepal, a Tibetan site not to be missed. Easy to reach from Kathmandou. A peaceful place.

Excellent. lovely place, big stupa lots of shop around it.
very Buddhist people are walking.we like it..................
Interesting stupa. You will find a lot of shops and buildings for photo taking. Give yourself plenty of time to be there.
Simply blissfull. Busy but always calming ... if you look past the travellers, its still a significant place for believers

Must Watch. Boudhanath Stupa (or Bodnath Stupa) is the largest stupa in Nepal and the holiest Tibetan Buddhist temple outside Tibet. A nice place . It is the center of Tibetan culture in Kathmandu and rich in Buddhist symbolism. One must visit here . Historical place and a nice monuments.

Stupa-endous. Well the Stupa itself is pretty sweet. It's drab white with the golden steeple, and hundreds of colorful prayer flags hanging from it. Take a closer look at them, there is a prayer on each one. We didn't go inside but there is plenty of religious things going on outside to get your inner golden child flowing.. Including huge prayer wheels that you can spin in outlying temples or just the small prayer wheels on the temple itself.The property itself basically consists of a round temple which is radially lined with souvenir shops. One thing about these shops... If you must purchase here, bargain. Hard. The shop owners will come up with every excuse in the book as to why they can't come down in price. It's all garbage... For instance we found these mini prayer wheels for sale for 1800 nepalese rupees, we got them for 1000 after some bargaining. (Disclaimer: I've spent some time in this part of the world, so I'm pretty good at bargaining. The trick is to get them to smile.)If you have time to shop elsewhere I promise you that you will find that one-of-a-kind precious bespoke heirloom at ten more stores and much cheaper than this location to boot. I promise. Oddly enough we found an item that we were searching for from a shop here at the stupa much cheaper in Thamel shopping district. Stupa shop price 4700npr Thamel shop price, no haggle: 3500npr. Shop smart.I suggest when you come here you dine at a rooftop restaurant. Then you go to some of the open temples around the stupa itself, spin a prayer wheel or two, take a couple of photographs and get the hell out.Shopping tip: never go the the main frontal stores, instead go to the ones in the back allies, they need the business more. And are more likely to come down in price. Don't beatraid the allies here are safe.
worth visiting. It is a stupa with circular plaza with shops around it. crowded and lively. can do religious shopping too
Hot and crowded. Interesting. Crowded and hot on the day we were there. Doing maintenance throwing Lime over it. Lots of shop and dogs around it.

Simply amazing. A beautiful stupa that embodies living ideas and a slice of history. While the tourist shops can be a bit overwhelming, the rooftop restaurants allow for some time to gaze over the monument and people watch ;D A must see for anyone in Kathmandu.

The Stupa is one of many, but the "square" is beatutiful.. On a day trip of Kathmandu and this was the last on the list. Had to fight to get to the pay window. Westerners have to pay to get into the square. But, the "square" is really "round. A beautiful round square that reminds me of Belgium of all places. Anyway the Stupa is good, but the surrounding buildings would get a 5 star by themselves.Go see it.

Colourful ,crowded ,yet peaceful. This is about 20 min out of Kathmandu (but visible and walking distance from the Hyatt. Check out the pictures .it was very picturesque ,and has coffee shops and restaurants for sitting and relaxing .there are also some market stalls.its outdoor location means the people traffic seems to flow smoothly.,so it's not crowded. Remember to dress appropriately(covered shoulders and lower legs). It costs about 5 dollars to get in

Crowded, but still great. maybe it's more peaceful in the mornings, we went there on sunset and it was bursting with people. the Stupa itself is great and definitely worth a visit, there are monks playing various instruments and chanting, we were lucky to sneak inside one of the buildings and listen to them closer))) great experience. shops are also nice, although it seems a little bit too commercialized, but what can you do

A divine cultural and commercial centre. You will be surprised as soon as you enter the circular plaza with one of worlds largest Stupa is placed . It is impressive and a massive structure . You can walk around with a lot of devoted pilgrims,elderly people or go up and wonder around on it. One very quickly be a part of the building and begin to find unending details with people waiting around or sacrificing or details of the place. If the enchanting music or the odor of the fascinating incense does not get you the shops around the stupa will most certainly will. Some of these shops are like local museums . You can without doubt spend a whole day here. The cafes and restaurants around will also give you possibility of looking all these happenings from top thus you get the fifth facade of the Stupa, the roof. A fascinating place you will come again and again .
Interesting Place. Very interesting place and there is a lot of shopping surrounding the site. Buddhist Temple and other historic sites and many shops with great values.

Tibetan culture on display. Enclave of Tibet in Kathmandu, superb ancient Stupa, great art on display and to buy, good eateries and cafes, an oasis of peace but busy, a Must see on any trip to Kathmandu
Beautiful and impressive place. Very impressive place, and nice neighborhood. Stupa is beautiful and it is surrounded by nice houses, shops, galeries and monasteries. City inside city.
Manic Nirvana. Even if you never manage to get to see this stupa during your lifetime it will certainly be one of the highlights of your life in paradise.
What else?. I think that boudhanath is the more peacefull area in kathmandu and the big stupa is the best attraction of the best area in Kathmandu... What else?is like be in a dreammust visit it

Buddhist temple !. My first visit in the morning hours was to the Boudhanath Stupa. It is situated on the main road and the antiques which are available there are unique. There is a small fee of Rs. 50 for the tourists.On the same road, the market is very nice where you can get clothes, specially, warmers. This is also one of the tourist spot.

A wonderful place to spend hours. Not quite as serene as you would expect a religious site to be. But the area bustles with activity. Some wonderful shops, very friendly people and a bunch of good restaurants. A place that must be visited.

Little Tibet. The Tibetan community populates this ancient site. Colourful, magic, enchanting. Pilgrims from far away in the mountains come her to do the kora. They are manly elderly and wear traditional dress. It is a photographers paradise. Good food too in top floor eateries overlooking the stupa

Good Vibe. Special place . . .liked it a lot : )
Has a 'special air' to it. Good selection of things to buy. Great photographic opportunities for those who like that
Staple but not the most impressive. I basically just went since this is a major pilgrimage site for Buddhists. Seems very commercialized though. Lots of shops and dining esp on rooftops.

A Living Ruin - if that makes sense. It was really quite amazing to see such a place in person.... the worn stone steps expose the vast processions of wide eyed wanderers who had come and gone in droves long before my arrival. The mechanics of prayer wheels and flags profess an effort to assure a continual blessing, while giant plexiglass coffers display wishing well style offerings of mostly the smallest denominations. The charm for me was found in the culture of tourism marketing mixed with the ancient architecture and the kitsch of spiritualism - somewhat of a living ruin where the present is overlaid on the past.
