A great place to people watch, to view the KTM Valley, to catch the scent of history and to add to your treasury of experiences...

Worth a visit. There is entry fee but pay it - worth it. Imposing, impressive and interesting history. Has an amazing atmosphere with people praying and shops open around. Definitely go.. One thing - we encountered the biggest amount of scammers ("buy milk", hungry baby) just outside the main gate.
A must see whilst in Nepal. Arrange a guide to give you the tour of this area and explain all about Nepali history and culture. A most enjoyable and educational place to visit.

Boudhanath Stupa, Kathmandu. The symbol of Kathmandu is the Buddha eyes near the top of this stupa which is the largest in Nepal. It is the size of a city block. There are shops and restaurants all the way around this round building. Worshipers walk clockwise aroung the stupa worshiping Buddha and spinning prayer wheels. There is a Buddhist temple nearby with many worshipers. Lots of people watching and sites to see.
Love it. Very nice place to visit;I recommend you find a local taxi other than the taxi provided from the hotel so you can negotiate the price and get way cheaper than what the hotel has to offer.
Very good. Excellent place . I like this place . I will again come to visit this place. Stupa was very beautiful and old also

Great site to visit. Went there in the evening and walked around the beautiful enormous stupa with hundreds of other devotees. very peaceful experience. there are many shops surrounding the stupa so a great place to buy souvenirs.

Wonderful visit. The stupa itself is pretty grand. It's wonderful to wander around the stupa and soak in the sights. There's also a lot of restaurants, shops and other things around the stupa. It's even possible to organize a trek, buy all the trekking supplies and anything else that's needed all near the stupa. It's also worth it to go to the monasteries right outside the stupa, very good visits.

atmospheric. Worth a short visit as situated in atmospheric square and you can see the monks circling the temple and postrating themselves before it. You can't go inside so 30 mins stop ix probably sufficient.

Fun if you know what you're looking at!. Go with a guide, it adds quite a bit to the experience! We had a nice person explain to us everything, and we walked around 3 times, which definitely gave us an appreciation for the people who do it 108 times each day!

Beautiful stupa, well maintained area. Now this is one World Heritage that actually seems to have gotten a return of investment from the entrance fee of 250 rupees.The stupa iself is enormous and marvellous, but what sets this site apart from the others is the surrounding narrow paths have a new and smooth stone surface, improving mobility and the atmosphere. The buildings surrounding the stupa are laid out nicely providing enough space at ground level with benches for sitting, and at the right distance so they're not suffocating the stupa itself. Plenty of 2nd and 3rd floor cafes are available if you don't mind paying premium for the food, but if you go, relax awhile and enjoy the view.
Peacefull. I go round the clock off four so that I can see and hear the Poetjas.Great to hear and see that. Friendly monk's. Always to see the pelgrims around the stoepa.

Worth a visit. 400 rupee taxi from Malla (Thamel district) and 200 rupee entrance ticket. Spent a happy two hours walking round the large stupa; a great place to take photographs, with prayer flags hanging everywhere to add colour. There are a selection of tourist shops, but my experience suggested Thamel district offered better opportunity to haggle for value for money.
Beautiful. Very nice place to visit and get to know a little more about the budhist culture. Souvenier store all around and nice places to have lunch.

Great Budhist Place. During my visit to Nepal with my family on the month of may,i got the opertunity to visit there.Very big n beautyful stupa.Its an Budhist heritage temple.Very well mantained.Around the stupa there are lots of soverniour n garment shops.Also lovely resturants around there.Really i enjoyed my visit there.If u are at Kathamandu,then Boudhanath Stupa must be in ur visit list

Amazing place. There're many cafe restaurant there, try one of the roof top cafe and chill there.Not sure how the steps of praying goes but definitely worth visit place, it's a must go place where you couldn't find somewhere else in the world.

Absolutely Beautiful. Boudhanath Stupa gives a wholesome and unique view into the spiritual background and belief system that Nepal is founded on. The entire temple which is surrounded but towers shops and cafes, enables you to really take a moment to browse their culture, while giving it the respect it deserves. It was a truly beautiful monument and a must see for anyone who visits Nepal.
Its a very amazing temple. Their are very amount of markets. Its also a huge temple and too much fun. Everyone should go their for marketing and for peace
Impressive. Not to miss, by far the most impressive stupa. Take the time to walk around, visit the backstreets and sit in the inner "gardens" where people sit to pray.

The Stupa in a Mandala. One of the largest and most amazing stupas in Nepal.
It sits in a huge mandala that people can actually walk in.
Surrounded by many shops and restaurants. Try the Kori restaurant for their hospitality and great food.

Awesome, must for Nepal Visitor. Swayambhunath Stupa is the most ancient and enigmatic of all the holy shrines in Kathmandu valley.
Very peaceful place and from there a good view of Kathmandu.
I spent my one hour there and really it is no one place to visit when you are in Kathmandu.
Good Visit... Great Place to Visit...The Stupa is Beautiful and Many people/monks come to do their Pilgrimage their..Loved it

A little piece of refuge in Kathmandu. Loved, loved loved. On the advice of a fellow traveler, I decided to stay in Boudha my first couple of nights in Kat. I loved the area and the friendly people. Such a far thing from Kathmandu. The hotels are clean and budget friendly, as opposed to hotels in Kathmandu, which tend to be pricey. However, the cab price back and forth will put you out 400 Rs each way, so be prepared to just sit back and enjoy Boudha rather than go to Kathmandu every day.

Great Historical Temple. It also called Monkey Temple. It is a lovely temple that you must pay a visit to it. Although I have visited this temple for almost 20 years ago (1994)...but it always have a place in my memory... No matter you are a buddhist or not, believe me..you will love this temple and it is unforgettable.

Very Atmospheric. Say what you will about the tourist shops all around the edge of the temple, but the music (or I guess I should say mantra) the stores are all piping does add to the overall feel of it. This place is amazing and will probably stay ingrained in your mind for years to come. Some of my favorite photos while traveling (anywhere in the world) are from here. You would be remiss to come to Kathmandu and not visit Boudhanath. There are a few restaurants in the area that have seating up high, definitely worth looking for one to sit and enjoy the view of the Stupa.

Holiest Tibetan Temple outside of Tibet. Striking building surrounded by tourists and worshippers. Walk clockwise around the structure or enter the grounds and walk on the upper level, where you can observe worshippers praying and Buddhist classes in the gardens inside the walls.
one of the must see places in Kathmandu. Immaculate and stunning this place is just stupendous with a lot of atmospheric streets and Tibetan culture

Oasis of serenity. Buddhanath is a buddhist pilgrimage site. As soon as you enter the site, you will believe you have entered into a portal. The pollution, noises, traffic rush get all behind. You will feel an immense peace. The monument is located in the centre and you have to walk clock wise turning all the wheels. There are many nice places there to eat and to sleep. I recommend the roof top restaurants, from there you can sip your massala tea and observe the emotions of the buddhist pilgrims who have waited their entire life to be in here. Then you will understand how privileged you are to be there.
Very peaceful. this place deeply moved me... I felt a very good vibe, and was amazed by the energy around. I think its a must if you are in Kathmandu.

So beautiful at sunset. If you want to find serenity then Boudhanath is the place. This stupa is the sanctuary from the chaos that is Kathmandu. There is an entry fee of 200 rupees but you can sneak around the guards if you are good. Go and find a place high up and watch the sunset and also pay respect to this religious place. So beautiful
Peaceful. Nice to see all walks of people at this place.....the chanting by the monks are so peaceful.....we experience a great time at this stupa with the lovely rainbow
Boudhanath Stupa, worth to go~. It is worth to have a visit because Boudhanath Stupa is the biggest one. It looks great.

My favourite Stupa in Kathmandu. I love this stupa surrounded by the buildings with rooftop cafes where you can have a drink and bite to eat while watching people doing their 'Kora' or just shopping! On a clear day from the roof top cafe's you can have great views too...or join the local worshippers and walk around the temple too or do some shopping in the surrounding stalls and shops! When you come off the main street you are often taken aback by the size of this stupa almost hidden away!

What am I missing?. Impressive in scale but otherwise the Stupa is badly maintained, dirty and very commercial. If this is such a holy site, why isn't it treated as such? Instead, the paint is pealing and pidgins are encouraged to crap everywhere. Shopsellers blast out Buddist music on poor quality speakers to lure you into their shops selling fake goods.About as religious an experience as visiting a burger restaurant.
Amazing. The biggest Buddhist temple in Nepal, the Boudhanath Stupa is a must-see! Perfect for picture-taking.

Boudha Stupa. very spiritual with lots of vibrancy,great cafes more cost effective in side streets, good locally produced gifts again wandering the back alleys lead to better value and genuine tibetan/sherpa shops
peacefull. I like to take roundings and enjoy even there is a lot of peopleThe stupa is historical and very beautiful

They CHARGE you to enter this site!!. Other than the huge Stupa, it is all shops, restaurants and merchants! Why would you pay to enter a shopping site that surrounds this structure?!?! Was not worth it, but cheaper than the rip off prices to visit Pashupatinath Temple or Bakthapur!! They take advantage of their tourists with these entrance fees while not offering any services. I was not impressed!
biggest in a world. you should just see it - really impressive - big stupa, nice music, lots of people around - very interesting place
Amazing. An amazing place, you can stay for hours and meditate, walk around, feel the special energy, pray, take pictures, sit and relax, take a coffee, wait for the sunset...
BEAUTIFUL!. What an amazing site in Kathmandu. This is stunning and definitely a must see when visiting the city.
Spiritual Place. A very spiritual place, some lovely cafes and restaurants and felt very safe. Just walk around with all the locals to experience local life.

Simply amazing!!!!!. Breath taking. Once in a life time experience to write and hang prayer flags. Stunning and spiritual. Take time to watch the throwing of turmeric over the stupa which then resembles a lotus flower and gives the stupa another unique appearance. Feel very lucky to have visited here.

Awesome stupa!. The stupa is the cover of lonely planet nepal. The stupa is ong the important religious temples in nepal. A visit there will make you understand buddhism more. You will have a feel of tibet here by seeing monks and locals pray. My taxi driver accompanied me inside and i was not aware that i have to pay an entrance fee.

Just a great monument. No shrine, just a monument. Lots of Buddhist art shops around. Worth a visit. The visit becomes more interesting if you seek the history of the place and try to understand the spiritual significance.
Awesome Visit. The most interesting places in Kathmandu city. Great attraction for Kathmandu, holy Stupa for Tibetan Buddhist. Located in peaceful site. Really worth visit.
Casual Visit. Great ancient Buddhist architecture. Don't miss the evening lights though. The souvenir shops are also available for exotic gifts.

Awesome... . Got struck with the divine environment of the place... lot of artefacts and souvenir shops are there surrounding the stupa and that makes the place a bit chaotic.. requires entry fee for Indians as well as westerners.. for locals it's their evening stroll at the park..

Nice stupa. Very nice Stupa situated in a small square with shops and restaurants around it. It's not very expensive to get in there in comparison with other places. It's a nice place to go to spend half of a day.
Outside of the square there are some monasteries to see and quiet streets to walk around.
Paradise. We visited on a early morning of a day so bright and sunny to pierce the eyes! The white dome glittered and the chants of monks filled the air with blrssings!

Better at night. Around 7 p.m. candles are lit up around the stupa and the place turns to something magical to look at. Have dinner in one of the roof-top restaurants around the stupa for a better view and photos. I do love coming here because for some reason, even though it's often crowded with tourists, there's still peaceful feeling about it, especially in the evening. Do visit monasteries in the areas as well if you have time.
Stunning. Our guide Krishna was very knowledgable, and made it interesting. Nothing to dislike, just bask in the culture and the people
Great temple and interesting Nepalese crafts. close walk from Hyatt great temple. Worth a visit. Go to on of the roof top restaurants. Lots of craft stores around.

Best of Nepal. I got my first glimpse of Boudhanath when i was taking off for mountain flight in the morning. You won't miss the majestic white stupa which is surrounded by Nepali houses/shops.Visited the stupa in the evening for the sunset view. Feeling awesome just standing and admiring the surrounding or walking clockwise around the stupa.There's roottop eateries and lotsa souvenirs shop. Chilled and relax at the roottop eateries and enjoy the aura there....

the most beautiful stupa in the world. just don't miss this place...if you want to feel the holiness of Buddhism...this is the place...you'll see many monks wandering around, and pilgrims all around the stupa, rolling the prayers wheels...

Buddha bliss. Amazing place, mix of nepal and the himalayas!A large tibetan community and the stupa of bouddha is just something out of this world!deeply touched by this place where a lot if going on, from tibetan hawkers to indian fast food, to buddhist chanting n monks, simply a cultural gem of nepal!make sure you take a walk in the ares surrounding the stupa, its really kool and has some very nice street art!

Awesome tibetan stupa!. This place is a must visit if you come to Kathmandu. It is a Tibetan stupa. Very big and it is surrounded by many shops which is selling any kind of souvenirs and cafe or restaurants.

Uplifting experience. This is a must visit when in Kathmandu. If you can, aim to go there around 4pm and explore the stupa at ease. As sunset approaches, make your way to the many restaurants that face the stupa and watch the sun come down over Kathmandu. The stupa is even more beautiful when lit up at night.

How do you review that feeling. Boudhanath, we were told stands for the past four thousand years, it means nothing really. After all, the scale of numbers and years is lost to our senses, really. That's when you haven't stepped into Boudhanath. There are many legends about the place, about how it transformed lives, made men out of devils, was the temple for weary travelers and so on, believe none of that. Until you step in. Then let your senses travel to the end of universe and back. Because even if you are surrounded by a thousand onlookers, tourists and locals, you are locked at the core of a typhoon. An amazing bombardment of peace petals puff your body and mind. You feel at ease, as if you belonged there, as if you have been there before, as if it was home all along. So many soothing thoughts come to you at a pace and rhythm that sings along the hum, a mélange of chanting of the monks. For them it is routine, for you weary traveler, it is reconnecting with where you came from.
Great to visit. Good place to interact with locals. Area was clean. Great restaurants and shops in the area. You must visit in the area.

inspirating. go there on a fullmoon eve. give yourself some time to listaen and hearing less talking!watch the candells moving as it being lighted by hundreds of celievers. walk around the stupa clockwise and feel the emptiness fullfiling you.

A review. It was kind of expensive(250rs) to look at a big white time dome, but a nice opportunity to find out more about the Tibetan community and a good place to find their food. It about an hours walk from Tamel if your ok at reading maps, if you have just done a trek and find your self with to much energy for just looking at time in Kathmandu.

Must visit place in Kathmandu . Impressive Boudha Stupa standing tall & majestic you should not miss when you visit Kathmandu. Even the heavy rain did not stop us from walking around this place, admiring the beautiful stupa. If only the sun is out, I am sure it will brings out the glamour gold colour. No wonder it was listed as UNESCO in 1979.

have done four treks with this company in the past year and both were 100% amazing.. I have done four treks with this company in the past year and both were 100% amazing. I highly recommend this company to anyone interested in trekking and tours in Nepal.See you Next Year 2015!
Peaceful. Nothing else to say... Each time you go there, each time you feel good and quiet. It is beautiful, boudhists are welcoming and the atmosphere incites to pray...

Awesome Sight to See. I'm very happy we took the time to visit the Boudhanath Stupa. It was a great place for photographs and people watching.The whole Stupa is surrounded by shops and restaurants so there are plenty of places to get out of the sun. If you are looking for a bite to eat, aim for a rooftop restaurant so you can get even more views of the Stupa.
Day Visit. We enjoyed seeing the stupa, temple and surrounding shops, stores and restaurants. This place is worth seeing for the historical and religious significance.

Unforgettable experience. This was our first visit to a Stupa, and we will newer forget it.
Our guide took us to a walk from Pashputinath and that was wery interesting.
I can recommned a lunch or refreshemnt at one af the rooftop resturants.

Good Place. This is very peace place even it is around in kathmandu because kathmandu is very crowdy place. This Stupa is very beautiful at night and more peace as well. There are very nice restaurant around this area also.

Wow!. This was my favourite sight in Kathmandu to see. It's a real wow factor when you walk through the doorway. It's lovely and evocative at dawn - I also stayed in a guesthouse here, which was brilliant to see it day and night. Lovely little shops all around. Only thing to be aware of is it pretty much shuts down at 9m, including the restauarants, and I arrived late so struggled to find my guesthouse and get in its door!
Boudhanath Stupa. Interesting. When you have nothing earthly to provide - god is the solution for the throngs. You`ll find many similarities on the way...

Imposing stupa!. Well worth a visit. Grand and imposing structure with historical and religious significance. To take it all in, get a table for lunch at one of the rooftop restaurants where you can soak it all in.
Good even in the rain. One of the must sees I suppose in KTM. Worth the trip out and get there over lunch as there are lots of good resturants with terraces overlooking the stupa.

Well worth a visit for the scale. Having seen stupa after stupa in the various durbars around Kathmandu, this is the one to visit just purely because it is huge!The fact that it is surrounded by everything else around it makes it so easy to maneuver. There's also less busyness here as it does not have to compete with the various temples as found in the durbars.
great stupa. i really like this Boudhanath Stupa which is selected in world Heritage site.it is really best and largest stupa.Buddist people believe buddha.

The Picture i was dreaming. When I decided to come to Nepal, not only the big Mountains were appealing me : I remember I saw somewhere the photo of this Stupa, and I was amazed by the whole scenario; when finally I got the taxi to reach it ( in the town itself) I was a bit concerned about how I could have been disappointed by seeing it for real; instead it's really WOW!The square full of local giving votes, many tourist too, but no big crowd or long queue to take a nice shot..; also, all around the square there are plenty of "roof top" restaurants from which yopu can enjoy an even better view of the structure: definitelly a MUST GO for any traveller!Big tip: if you enter the main entrance, you, as a foreigner, are required to pay a fee around 750 Rs ( 8 USD, roughfly); but if you walk hundred meters forward, you see a small narrow alley leading directly in the middle of the square !

Historic key Buddhist site. An obvious place to visit if one is in Kathmandu. Imposing and even majestic, it is vast and despite being in the city is almost a peaceful haven.Hawkers are fortunately not aggressive so are only a minor annoyance.Did not visit the nearby monasteries so cannot comment

"The best place for peace". I usually hang around Boudhanath Stupa with my colleagues in my free day. I feel very safe and peace when I am here at the stupa. You also have better option for food and drinks inside the stupa. One of these might be Stupa Rooftop. The food are great but The LAssi is just amazing in the hot summer.Love to visit thrice in a month on my off days.
Bouddna ath. Very fascinating area, a unique place to be, a lot of beautiful people, nice shops, interesting antiques from Dolpo and Mustang, nice restaurants with roof tops and delicious food
Awesome place. Peaceful. Make sure you go to the temple opposite where you can access roof top and get an awesome view of the place.

Absolutely grand!. Great stupa, and a lively circle of tibetian traders. Colourful and vibrant. Only thing that marred the trip is the thungka workshop. Our tour guide assumed we would like the place, yes it is an authentic and traditional workshop but it was manipulated by money and business. I would imagine it should work around an ethos of charity. The stupa itself was magnificent, and worth a visit.

Festival at Boudhanath Stupa. It was a festive day for the Buddhist on the day I visited the Boudhanath Stupa. It was on a Sunday and packed with locals as well as tourist. My friends and I were lucky enough to be tour guided by one of the monks who happened to be living in Kuala Lumpur for the past years. What I can say is its interesting to have a glimpse of knowledge on other religion and culture. It is not always about the differences, sometimes you could see the similarities.

Impressive Boudhanth. The central "pagoda" like structure is impressive and constructed on a hillock; that is unique. There is a steep staircase leading to the Stupa, from Kathmandu, though we did not see anyone using the same when we visited around 1030 am. The view of Kathmandu from the Stupa location is good.
Pilgrimage. The place for Buddhist pilgrimage. It's peaceful surrounded by humble Tibetan people/ monks. Good place for Tibetan food.
Buddhist splendour. Enormous stupa surrounded with beautiful Buddhist monasteries (just few are open to public). A unique devotional atmosphere especially in the morning or after 4 p.m.

So Butifull and tranquil. One of the most interesting and nive places in Kathmandu. A mystical place. You can find around it even places to see art , shop and also sit for a nice tea or coffee and think about the "meaning of life". A must see place if you are in Nepal.
Nice, clean and peaceful. must go, a beautiful place to go. went there and i feel peace there. nice places to shop and relaxing music add to the features of this place.
AWESOME. You must experience to know the feeling. Your brain will overload. You will be transported to another time and place. the inscence smells terrific. Reverance

Peaceful, well maintained and scenic . Perfect combination of location and atmosphere. Gives you an insight into the Buddhist lifestyle. I did not particularly like the commercialisation prevalent around the place.
Peaceful. Wonderful to sit and relax and people watch. Had lunch on a rooftop restaurant. Very nice. Able to see all the activity around the Stupa.

its a shame to visit Kathmandu and not go there. A calm place with a lot of nice coffee places. just sit and look at the people wandering aroung and join them afterwards. Try to come on sunset when the clouds turn red and you'll have a grreat photos from this place.
Amazing~~. went for the rooftop cafe for a great view of the Stupa, great for people watching and just relaxing

A fun district and a spectacular building. I visited the Boudhanath Stupa twice during my recent trip, while I adore the architecture, more than that, I love the everyday-ness of the place, people praying and monks preparing for rituals, all set to the sounds of the inevitble commerce that the tourists have bought to the area - its colourful and fun and a great way to spend a couple of hours in the sun, particularly taking in the view from a rooftop restaurant around the perimeter.
It's a beauty. Just few mins from the main city. It's a place for all people. 1 hour will be enough to visit. I most interesting thing is Jabjantar.

Peace and Calm. Visited twice on my visit to Kathmandu - found the atmosphere very spiritual and the people I met there very friendly - excellent for people watching and getting the feel of Tibetan Buddism
really nice. we visit buddhanath stupa. its really nice places where we can enjoy with alot. if you are visiting kathmandu then dont miss it

interesting walk from Pashupatinath. It is a large and pretty stupa construction surrounded by typical Napalese buildings filled with lots of souvernir vendors with varying degrees of quality. Nice to stroll around half an hour or so. About half an hour walk from the noth-east entrance of the Pashupatinath temple, through little streets and local life.
Stupa View Cafes. The cafes around the stupa offer a lovely view of the stupa. It is a lovely experience sitting there watching the sun set.

Awe Inspiring. Visited in October, 2014. This stupa is a world heritage site. Very peaceful atmosphere. Has many shops selling antiques and religious items along with eating places. Has shops where you can get excellent tibetan paintings having mantras, meditation paintings and songs in CD. A must visit place in Kathmandu.
Peace place in Kathmandu . Buddhanath is biggest stupa in Nepal .you can enjoy a lot .you can have good energy at evening candle light time .positive feeling ,be happy.

Amazing site. The history with this Stupa is amazing....worth the visit.
The guide provided an insight to Buddha and Hindus alike, all meant so much more. Arranged through Outfitter Nepal

Beautiful. I was here for Tibetan New Year and it was great to see. Everyone out in their traditional dress, dancing and singing. It's great to walk around the actual stupa. Also to take in the view from one of the many roof top restaurants around the stupa. There is mainly just souvenier shops around it. Just outside the entrance gate are some money changers. Stroll through the back streets away from the stupa to see everyday life. I stayed nearby for a night and it was nice to see it at night also. There is no entrance fee late in the evening. It is very quiet then! It seems to attract quite a few spiritual seekers, there were quite a few people meditating on the base of the stupa. Don't forget to always walk clockwise around it!! You can walk to/from Pashupatinath temple from here, which is a nice walk through a more suburban neighbourhood.

around monks !. the biggest stupa of buddhism in Nepal, as I was told. A very big circle with many stores around and coffee shops. You may drink your coffee or traditional massala tea, watching buddhist monks take a stroll. Sadly, it closes at 17:00.

Must see - eat, shop, and meditate. Another great attraction for Kathmandu - certainly in the top 5 for the city. Get some shopping done, eat at one of the many roof restaurants in the circle and watch the Tibetan monks.

Great. Yes its big. Lile really big. There are shops and restaurants around it. Making the total picture very nice. Entrance was 250 npr each. If you go from here to thamel. Make sure you don't go with the taxi maffia who all ask 500 npr. Walk 50 m to a side and you can go for 200 till 230 npr.
Quiet retreat. Hearing monks chanting was a treat! Peaceful area from the immediate hustle and bustle outside the Stupa
Busy religious site.. Loved the atmosphere - Buddhists and Hindis walking round in prayer from daybreak until very, very late.Lots of beggars and street dogs.

A Classic that never ceases to amaze. This must be one of the highlights of KTM. This beautiful square will throw you back in time, withits great facades, well maintained, and its mixed populated Nepalese etnicities who come to pay tribute

Heart of The Trip, Definitely Worth A Visit For All Walk Of Life. Regardless of your backgroud, this place is an eye opening experiences to explore beliefs and its beauty.Every details of structure have meaning, deep ones. Being one of the most important Buddhism places, it fills with histories not only permitted to Buddhists.Surrounding structures also in themselves beautiful, filled with restuarants and shopping choices.Nepal can't be achieved without visiting this place :D
Stunning. Stunning atmosphere, must see destination in Kathmandu. A lama led us to a shrine at the northern corner to receive blessings.
Awaking your senses. The feeling of walking back into time. The colors, smells & sounds mixed in with spirituality is all breath taking.
Tibetan area. Well worth a visit, especially if you are interested in Tibetan culture. The hotel will organise a car to take you to the area.

Not to be missed in Kathmandu. Bodnath is a peaceful and interesting place to visit. The Stupa is a place where the faithful Buddhist's visit to pray. You can spend as little as 30 minutes visiting or stay in the peaceful environment for the afternoon. There are many quaint shops, restaurants and temples both on the grounds and in the surrounding aea.

big,. Very big stupa. It was holy stupa for Tibetan Buddist. It was located not far from airport area, at eastern outskirt of Kathmandu. It was built at 14th century, afetr Mughal invension. As the Tibetan Mandala, four of the Dhyani Buddhas mark the cardinal points, and the fifth, Vairocana, enshrined in the center . The five Buddhas also personify the five elements (earth, water, fire, air and ether). The bottom of stupa is surrounded by 16-sided wall. It closely associated with the Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara (Padmapani), whose 108 forms are depicted in sculptures around the base. The mantra of Avalokiteshvara - Om Mani Padme Hum - is carved on the prayer wheels beside the images of Avalokiteshvara around the base of the stupa. During the festival of Losar (Tibetan New Year) in February or March, Boudhanath hosts the largest celebration in Nepal.How to go:- Taxis are available on the main road by the main stupa gate.- Local bus (mini van) to Chabihil , from Chabihill, take one of the many buses/vans to the 'Bouda Stupa main gate' ,or walk for 20 mins. up the Boudha road to the Stupa. -by bycle (that's waht i did)

Walk around clockwise.... This temple is beautiful and calming as there is a monastery right by it (you can actually go in and up to the balcony of it.) But walk around the same way that everyone else is, otherwise you'll go against the flow of the circle that surrounds the temple itself. (There are shops all the way around.) There are beautiful prayer wheels surrounding the temple as well that you can spin to restore your karma. I loved the idea.
Quick Kathmandhu. Stupa was very busy the day we visited but beautiful nonetheless. Lots of people eager to go inside and queuing right around the Stupa

King Stupaaaaaaaaaaaaa. One of the biggest stupas in the world! I also liked walking around the stupa to get a taste of local life. There were plenty of shops and restaurants in the area, perfect to enjoy the stupa and its surroundings.

Largest Stupa in the world. Walk around the outside (in a clockwise direction) and spin all the prayer wheels. You can also go in and walk around and put up prayer flags in memory of those no longer with us. A beautiful building and well worth a visit.
perfect place. The boudha nath stupa was one of the best place for visiting and for to discover buddist history. it looks like tibetean society lives here.its is very good and very nice place.

Fabulous. This stupa ( temple ) is a brilliant sight .All day pilgrims mostly Tibetan perambulate around it. Around the perimeter are excellent shops also mostly Tibetan where you can buy good quality souvenirs

Magical place, a must see in Kathmandu. There are few places in the world that strike you as viscerally as the Bodnath Stupa. As you walk around the Stupa you feel the traditions, people and reverence of the place. My words are not adequate enough to give you a sense of the place. Sacred (even for non believers), spirit filled and altogether magical!
Nice one. It is a huge white stupa, one of the best in Kathmandu. You can make a quick visit or stroll around with slow walk. Great view and environment.

Must see. Take a look at this huge stupa that is surrounded by lovely houses and reminds of a market square somewhere around the globe. However, in the middle you have this huge stupa with lots of believers walking around. Great atomosphere!

great spot. fantastic area for a lot of reasons, spiritual, historical, shopping.
You can spend a few hours just strolling observing taking everything in.
It's Big. It's big and there's lots of flags! Also a nice cafe around the outside with great views........................
Nice place to hang out around sunset. Come here to enjoy the stupa at around sunset at one of the rooftop cafe, it's quite nice. Easily the most enjoyable temple in Kathmandu area.

Feelings of mystical energy and compassionate vibrations. Boudhanath Stupa oozes good vibes and a holy aura! Go early in the morning and catch local Tibetans making koras (clockwise circling) and offering prayers. If you're not feeling very religious you can shop around the local owned Tibetan handicrafts, leathers, textiles and others.
Interesting site. One of the largest Buddist Stupas in the world! Very colorful and interesting, surrounded by many small shops and restaurants

Amazing atmosphere. The place is just bustling with people, loads of unusual craft shops, restaurants and beautiful temples - but it was the whole atmosphere that I found just amazing. Small charge made at the entrance for foreigners but definitely worth it just to see the thousands of prayer flags fluttering overhead.

Lonely Planet. There is a reason for this to be the cover of Nepals Lonely Planet. This place as a whole is cultural heritage. Walk around the shops clockwise to pay respect to the local people. Or decide to walk turning the prayer wheels, also clockwise. Very spiritual place with great roof terraces that overlook the stupa for lunch or dinner. Prices went up to 250 for foreigners, but well worth it!

Best landmark in Katmandu. There is no way to describe being in Bodnath Stupa, we were there near Sakadawa, which is one of the most sacred days in Budhism. We loved being part of the tibetan scene, the smell of inciense, the prayer wheels, the small shops, the feeling of being inmersed in a different, ancient culture. We felt spiritually fulfilled.

A must!!!!. This is probably, a long with Durbar Square, one of the most famous sight to visit in Kathmandu. Is really Beautiful and Vibrant but, we felt a bit disapointed. Don't get me wrong, it's really beautiful but with all the "advertising" there are better places to visit as well in Kathmandu. But, It's still a must!!!

Amazing. The view in the stupa in the early morning is very serene and inspiring. The entrance stops in the evening after 6pm and one cannot go up the inner levels. It is very peaceful during the day and doing the parikrama is very relaxing.
Nepalese culture. The spiritual welcome, bargains at the shops,and information from the locals nothing in dislike,allowed to take photographs around the Stupa
Was great interacting with the Monks.. It has a serene atmosphere. It was amazing to watch the monks praying in the monasteries. I will definitely return.

nice white temple with prayer wheels surrounding. A very peaceful place which u can try going round the temple by turning the prayers wheel clockwise. many local and foreign Tibetan Buddhist making their trip to seek blessings and to pray for the world
A lovely place.. Circumambulating the stupa, turning the prayer wheels is a lovely profound experience. Recommended as a place to visit.

Great place!. From the minute you walk through the entrance all you want to do is take continuous photos of the stupa, the prayer flags, the shops, the antiques.. It's definitely a great way to spend an hour in Kathmandu - having a wander round looking at what is being sold and watching the locals visit the place of worship. I loved this :)

Buddhist Pilgrimage - Holiest of Holy Sites. You can feel the energy here - steeped in history & devotion. One of the holiest places for buddhists. A sure fire DO NOT MISS on your trip to KTM. After all, this is why you've come, no?

Powerful place!. One of the "must go" places! See the amazing Stupa, walk around and feel the power of the place! The view is great from some of the restaurants! You can get some good bargains on buddha statues, malas and paintings!

Amazing Place to See. We took a street taxi from our hotel in Thamal at negotiated price and enjoyed this place very much. It is on a hill with lots of trees & greenery and the stupa and monkeys on the grounds make for excellent photo opportunities.
Good for the Soul!. No matter what religion you follow, Bouddhanath Stupa will make you feel peaceful inside. It has a nice selection of cafes/restaurants, shops, etc around the stupa.
lovely. Before to exit go up to a roof and take a look. In the afternoon is lovey with everybody walking around it.

Must visit !!!. Most beautiful I ever visited, so peaceful,mind blowing and magnificent. The history behind the building and spiritual relavance was wonderful. I enjoyed buying Tibet prayer flags in the surrounding shops as a reminder.
great place. we like this buddha stupa is so much it 10 km fra from \thamel and it is such big temple when onces you visit there then you know how great temple this one !

A must see. Fascinating site. A must see if you're in Kathmandu, particularly for anyone with an interest in history. The overall atmosphere is captivating to say the least. Would love to go again at least once in life.
Best and temple. When we visited there we like so much it is great and lovely place to Kathmandu we spend there five hours
piceful. To relax you have to go to Bodhnat. Even there is a lot of tourist stuff it is a nice place to go. Tak a round three times the stupa and you feel good

Massive Temple and Tourist Area. As you come to the entrance you will pay your tourist fee. As soon as you walk through the gates there will be people trying to sell you things or take you around. Put your palm out as a stop sign and say no and look them directly in their eyes. Otherwise you will have someone following you for the next 50 meters selling you something. Its a necessary thing here to enjoy the site.As you enter there are eateries and souvenir shops that surround the landmark. You will see locals turning the prayer scrolls. Pick place to eat/drink that has the sun to its back so you can have great views and photos of the temple. Don't forget to explore the side streets for smaller temples and seeing some shops. Everyone seems to walk to around the same way to the right from the center of the temple. There are birds culled in a small area near the entrance of the stupa that can be fed. The stupa can only be entered from one side and can be walked upon 1/2 way up. I do find that the best views are from the cafes above or the shrine next to the stupa.

Serene place with restaurants and shopping. It is surrounded by small eateries and shops, one of the best markets i found in Kathmandu. It was a pleasure to walk around the stupa which is majestic and at the same time do a little snacking and window shopping :D

Great place for pilgrimage.. Boudhanath was probably built in the 14th century after the Mughal invasions; various interesting legends are told regarding the reasons for its construction. After the arrival of thousands of Tibetans following the 1959 Chinese invasion, the temple has become one of the most important centers of Tibetan Buddhism. Today it remains an important place of pilgrimage and meditation for Tibetan Buddhists, local Nepalis, as well as foreigner.

Boudha - Tibetan community. This is perhaps one of the last strongholds for Tibetan Buddhism. Best time to visit would be early morning or evenings as the pilgrimage crowds do the kora around the stupa.

A religious site with great cultural value. Bodnath Stupa is one of the most favorite spots of mine in Kathmandu Nepal. The Stupa is not located as high as Swayambhunath and can be reached very easily by taxi. If you are coming from anywhere near city center, it should not cost you more than NPR 300 for the taxi ride. The place has a very peaceful and serene environment that would make your senses numb. The best time is to go at around 5PM and stay there to see how the temple in lit with thousands of lights during the evening. There are food courts circled around the Stupa but do not expect meaty meals in them. Some monks and sorcerers may come and ask you for money. I guess you should know well before you pay them. usually they take the payments in form of donations and they also give you a receipt. Overall the spot looks great. If you are in Kathmandu for more than a day and you didn't see it, it should be on top of your list for the next trip.

Best Buddhist Stupa in the World.. Bodhnath this is the best and biggest Buddhist stupa in the Asia. if any one interest about the Tibetan Buddhism you can visit once. This is world best heritage sight too. there are many people visiting to see this Stupa and Tibetan Buddhism culture.
Great place to visit!. Boudhnath is a great place to visit. It is a Buddhist shrine located in Kathmandu. You can feel a great spiritual experience while being here.
Great Afternoon Trip. Take time to see the Stupa and then sample some lunch or drink in the many restaurants surrounding the temple
Bodnath. What isn't to like about the biggest stupa, build in the 14th century, a place of worship and the most holy location for Tibetans outside of Tibet. Lots of monasteries around the stupa.

The stupa to visit in Kathmandu. If you haven't got a lot of time to spend In Kathmandu (even if you do) make sure you don't miss the Bodnath Stupa. It is not very easy to find but definitely worth the visit. The stupa is located in the Tibetan quarter, in a courtyard and is surrounded by colorful buildings, shops and rooftop restaurant where you can enjoy momos with a nice cold Everest brew and watch the world go by. You'll also have a great view over the stupa in one of the many rooftop eateries and take great shots. Off the stupa, you can also visit the monk monastery where not a lot of tourists go simply because they don't know it's there!
Truly atmospheric and memorable experience. Boudhanath is a must-see, and even better if you stay for a night or two in a guesthouse attached to one of the monasteries.

Very interesting. Interesting place, very historical and holy for the locals. A lot of shops and restaurants surround the Stupa. You will strike beggars, but this is like a lot of Kathmandu with tourist sites

Nice place. One f the best place s to visit around Thamel. Cool shops, nice cafes, good view f the stupa. Fed the pigeons that was fun a few good clicks as well. Def recommended if u going 2 kathmandu.

An enlightening Experience. I have visited this stupa on all my eleven trips to Nepal. It is an amazing place, so clean and friendly, with beautiful shops all around it. Fantastic eating places and a lovely calm as you walk round clockwise. At times it is not possible to go up to the top because of repainting but if you can the view is lovely. Well worth a trip. Although a fee is paid the money is put into the Buddhist community. If you are ssolo and want a guide this is also an easy option.
Best in Ktm. No wonder this place is so famous in the world for peace seekers. Only by looking at the majestic dome one feels awed and inspired by the Buddha

One of the biggest stupa... Lying in the center of city, the place is really picturesque, surrounded by small shops restaurants coffee corner its a mix of traditions. You can see people praying and others cliclking pics by their side. Nice shopping area.
what a place. people of all walks mingle and pray and lovely Stupa although needs some care as steps were very slippery surrounding stalls also help if you asked hardly saw any beggars around here

Areal of stupa is large. It is very nice stupa, where you can see many Buddhist people doing ceremonies. You can go to the stupa and make circle there, you can just sit in some restaurant watching people. Areal of stupa is pretty large, so If you want, there is a map (on the wall in front of main entrance to the second floor of stupa) and climb the hill and visit some another monasteries. If there is a sun in Kathmandu take some hat and sunglasses. Sun is very strong there.
Beautiful. This stupa is very big and beautiful. There are many good restaurants around the stupa where one can sit and have the best view .

Another nice experience. Visited Bodnath Stupa with friends. Guide was explaining me every step they perform. Nice and huge statue with many eyes in all directions. Many shops and restaurants. Gift shops everywhere. Found some western people performing pray. I think they are followers. Nice flowers. Some people with masks where singing and dancing and people do take photos with them and give them some money.
Take your time and watch the people. The Stupa itself is not that interesting, but if you take your time and watch the people, it is fascinating. Visit all the shops, linger for the atmosphere.

Kassapa Buddha's place.. Seems, Kassapa Buddha's body (5 meters long, actuall) been really buried there, so impressive the place is. Early morning the best time for kora. Some musicians are singing around.

Huge & Blissful Stupa !!!. Very very important and most visited stupa in Kathmandu, easily accessible from all parts of Nepali capital,Just by entering to the temple we can feel the positive vibrations over there,When we sit in silence inside our mind and body will be very peaceful,This is a high energy place and it's a must visit place for all age groups.Loving you so much ...Peacefully yours.S M Bega Raaj.
Very interesting Holy place. Everytime I come again in Kathmandu, I see lot of improving at this old site.People renovate more and more
A Place for peace. A Place to visit while seeking inner peace or into to oneself. Located in middle of everywhere, with not so visible approach. Has been commercialised a lot from across and around

A wonderful place. Such a great place for an inspiring walk. It is a magical place with all the monks and Buddha devotees worshiping this holy monument. You will hear the sound of Buddhist chants and smell a mixture of incense and different foods from the surrounding restaurants. Many little shops selling malas, prayer flags and all kinds of souvenir surround the stupa as well as restaurants and guest houses.

the centre of the universe. i love going to bouddha when i am in nepal, its a world of its own and i can spend hours walking around chanting om mani padme om and spinning the prayer wheels -flavours cafe does great food -the greek salad is the best and excellent coffee in their peaceful garden -light a butter lamp visit the temple and people watch -the clouds circle around the stupa as if it is a giant magnet

Be aware of frauds around this holly place. It is unlikely other temples in this country where you see just lots of buildings and crowds, here lots of tibetans come through a long way just to worship. It is quite touching when you see those elderly people making their daily walk around the stupa morning to night. However, when we went to there, like anyone else just started walking around the stupa, a man approached us making small talks. I consider myself generally a nice person so we didn't turned him down, kept talking with him like where we were from etc, and he praised us and gave us some Tibetan scarf as gifts. We gave him some same kind stuff as in return. Then he led us inside the stupa and suddenly changed his face, saying he got some medical problem, asking us for money, specifically stated UK money! We were stupid enough to give him a few notes as the conversation before had been well. Then he wasn't satisfied with £20, kept asking for more. We had to run away so to get rid of him. It is such a shame as such a thing happened in such a place. I believe that wasn't the first time the man did such things as we thought back. The whole thing was well planned. I believe there are more like him, not to mention everywhere in Nepal especially in KTM kids on streets asking for money out of the blue. Anyway, the whole time in Nepal is quite an experience for me.
Mystical. Mystical and charming. great for curios and shopping souvenirs. The Stupa was beautiful an I was mesmerized by the history. Avoid crowed evenings.

Bodnath Stupa is Super!. You need up be up with the larks to get the true atmosphere of this amazing Stupa. People galore walk around its perimeter, taking a clockwise route, turning the prayer wheels. It just took my breath away to sit on the pavement and watch. I've never seen anything like it. You really have to be there to experience the atmosphere. At 7am, the bakeries and the cafes open, the stores open, selling singing bowls and Thangka paintings. I loved it here. We joined the throng of people walking around the stupa. You can even walk around the next level, taking in the huge white dome, that represents the womb, and the cube shape atop with the eyes and the third eye of Buddha. All around the square, prayer flags flutter in the breeze. A wonderful place to visit, take my word for it, readers.

Nepal's Iconic Buddha Eye statue. Really great few hours exploring this temple and taking many snaps of it and around the area. Just a few rupees to get in and had lots of restaurants around in a circle so you an enjoy the view from all angles. This is one of Kathmandu's major sights and I highly recommend :)
Must Visit. Great place to see. only a couple of minutes of drive from the International Airport. Will take only a few hours to see the place including travel time.

Boudha - A Must See. Boudha is a wonderful place, particularly at sunset when all of the locals (as well as tourists) are doing their circumambulations of the temple. The area is also a great spot for shopping, as tons of stores line the pilgrim path. Be sure also to venture behind the temple and see some of the other monasteries in the area, particularly Sherchan.

Something so holy and peaceful.. The Stupa is a nice place. Worthy to visit. Its peaceful, calm. I loved this large place with surroundings and a great views of Pokhara. Dont go at the afternoon. It will be close. In front of the Stupa, there is a restaurant. You can have a best view from there. Eating there would be great experience too. You will have to walk little high to visit stupa. Its ok though. You can do it.Note that, you can come to stupa from Phewa lake by boat.Enjoy.
spiritual ecstasy. This temple is a must visit.. Not just inside the temple but entire surroundings are blessed with spiritual aura.

Lovely place for a visit. I enjoyed visiting this area. Keep in mind that it can be crowded at certain times, especially on weekends. Getting there is easy, there's no need to spend money on a taxi, take a shared local vehicle (25 Nrs per person as of August 2014) from Ratna Park bus station (10 mins walk from Thamel).

A bit of Tibet in Nepal. As I walked around the stupa with many pilgrims, I could feel as if I were back in Lhasa circumambulating the Jokhang. Smiling exiled Tibetans, for the moment forgetting that they have uncertain status with the Nepalese government - and small shops where one can purchase excellent quality prayer flags. I feel at peace here.
Highly Spiritual. This is quite the experience. Hundreds if not thousands of people circle this stupa everyday. It's just an amazing presence.

Great half day. We went to visit this stupa for morning and had a great time just walking round it and stopping at a cafe. it is probably the most impressive stupa in kathmandu in my opinion, mainly just down to how large it is! well worth a visit

Beautiful and very large stupa with fantastic views from rooftop restaurants. This is a nice, clean enough reprieve from the dirty living in Kathmandu. Tibetans are seen thoroughly cleaning the roadway around the stupa and the atmosphere whilst we were there in the morning was very relaxed and managed to catch it on a clear day. Definitely the highlight is sitting on rooftop restaurant and watching the people go by.
Stupendous. Has to be done if coming to Kathmandu. Pilgrims from all walks of life it would appear come to visit with plenty of souvenir shops and eateries bars etc.
what amazing energy. This is at must visit, go feel the energy. preferably in the morning or late evening, in order to get around the tourist.

Fabulous Place. The bustle of the Stuppa is great and it is a great example of a Stuppa if you can't get to Tibet.
The pure basic awareness of the Buddhist religion and what a Stuppa looks like can be found here. This is the largest in the area.

Worth a visit. Definitely a great place to visit.Extremely. quiet and organised for Kathmandu.This is a beautiful stupa with plenty of interesting people to observe.We went to a Tibetan cafe ,didn't enjoy the Yak's tea but the memos were good.
This is a bit out of town but we'll worth the effort.

Must must visit. One of the two MUST visit historical stupas of the Kathmandu valley.. A very sacred pilgrimage place for centuries..go clockwise around it as the Buddhists do... Wonderful atmosphere !!!!

Bouddha. There are many stupas I guess,in KTM but this ones most renouned and significant.Was really nice to walk around it,sit on a bench and just watch everyone.There were many people feeding pigeons with grains and that was fun towatch too.

Maybe just a bad day ?. I have been visiting this stupa since 1977, and this time it felt like the pressure of commerce had tilted the balance away from the stupa's main purpose of serving as a beacon of inspiration. This was accented by running into an old friend who said he had been charged 70 rupees (less than 1$) to walk down a street leading to the stupa ! it is still colorful and entertaining, but the depth seems gone.

Beautiful place to visit in the evening and walk around the stupa.. People walk around the stupa in the evening clock wise. The place is really peaceful and beautiful. The pre dominant color of the place is red.

Round place with Stupa and lots of cafe and restaurants. Nice enjoyable walk around this place full of old but nice buildings surrounding the Bouddha Stupa.No shortage of restaurants and cafes - try to find one with a terrace on top of the building to get the best view possible.Do not forget to also visit the temple in front of the main entrance of the stupa.

Fantastic!. The Stupa is a phenomenal place to visit, walk around the outside in a clockwise direction, you can also walk around the 1st level of the Stupa. Around the surrounding square there are two other temples both are also worth a visit.Numerous stores selling tonka paintings, brass and gold plated items.Great places to eat with roof top gardens the ones that springs to mind is Golden Eyes who serve one of the best curries we had in our visit to Nepal.The entrance fee to the whole area is 250 Nepal rupees, don't forget to keep the ticket so you can return without paying again, this was our local attraction as we stayed in the Tibet International a 5* hotel at a 2* price.
World Heritage Site. Loved our visit thoroughly.. We visited the stupa on our way to the airport.... Good place to shop traditional ethnic handicraft items.... It is a world heritage site

Incredible vibes. Excellent to visit. Walk round clockwise only. Walk round 7 times for good luck. A must see...Great atmosphere. A chance for a real cultural experience. Also lots of tourist shops to visit on the way round.

Beautiful. Great place to visit. Not too crowded, calm. Exact oppose of Thamel. Walk in a clockwise direction so you don't embarrass yourself. After the visit try Circle Street Coffee - it's on the right as you come in through the Boudha gate. 250 rupees per adult to visit, nothing for children.
Magical Place. An extremely relaxing place, worth a visit if you are into religious and cultural monuments. Would recommend it for sure.

Incredible. Bodnath was one of the highlights of Nepal. So beautiful, I literally could spend all day here. Lots of amazing people watching here, and a chance to snap some incredible pics of Tibetan pilgrims. The area itself is quite cool and there are a few activities to do here.Try and go early or late in the day for the best pics.
must visit. spirutall value, soothing atmosphere. many people especially in the morning to pray. I am almost every day there because my yoga studio is closed to. highly recommend place!!!!

Go there in the evening time. I visited here at midday in the pouring rain and it was impressive. Came back the next evening before sunset and it was really impressive! The lighting at sunset really added to the atmosphere and there were many monks visiting and praying at the stupa. I recommend that after your visit to the stupa you adjourn to a nearby rooftop bar/café and sit and watch the sunset and the activity below, while having a drop of whatever you fancy.
Tranquil Environment. Bouddha is hands down the best place to visit in Kathandu. It has a soothing ambiance that will make you want to stay forever.

Lovely and Peaceful. the stupa itself it quite impressive, but the surrounding area is really nice to chill out if you spend too much time in thamel (like me!) so many cafes with stupa views to choose from, none amazing in my experience but they do the job. Just a really peaceful place :)
Nice. we really enjoyed walking around the stupa and the lovely paved streets. A nice change from the craziness of Thamel.

Tourist trap but worth the visit. An iconic landmark surrounded by plenty of places to buy a well earned drink. Personally, if you're after buying gifts or souvenirs, I'd recommend shopping elsewhere as prices are definitely for the tourist market here.
Worth a visit for plenty of photos and the unforgettable atmosphere.

Amazing experience. I have wanted to visit the Stupa for many years and was fortunate enough to be taken by some local friends tonight. They delayed my visit so i got to experience it in the darkness and I am so glad they did.It was an amazing experience even though I only managed one circuit, visit inside the wall then watched, listened and ate at the golden eyes overlooking the Stupa as the rain fell. The lights reflecting off the wet structure made the experience even better.A good day to be alive on planet earth :)

What better place to understand. Pigeons, dogs and cows are welcome guests to the shrine, and often given blessings from visitors to the shrine. A beautiful place to have a guide teach you about Buddhism.

little tibet. simply magnificent, a must see attraction. Easy to get to in the center of Kathmandu. Lots of monks and nuns, colorful shops and the stupa was the largest I have ever seen or walked on top of

Busy yet peaceful Boudanath. I could spend days sitting here watching the world go by. It's such a contradiction of calm and busy. Plenty of places to purchase food and drink, and full of gift shops selling good quality goods.

Experience Nepali Buddhism!. Go ahead, walk around the temple with hundreds of men, women, children, monks and travelers, while chanting Buddhist preyers and spinning the cylinders filled with holy scrolls. This was great to live the moments and experience life in Kathmandu!
place must to visit. very nice tourist spot. Not very much far from the city . you can busy souveniers and gift to the friends and family.

Amazing !!!. Botnath Stupa is an amazing place,i really enjoyed experiencing to calm and peace of this place. The icon of Nepal, should not be missed. Apart from the pigeons, the square is clean and a walk around the square is fulfilling.
peace - Buddha teaching. Though there are lots of shops and cafe's surrounding, people every where , you will still find peace with in you .
The Spirit of Buddism. This is not a touristy place...it's a place to share in Spirit with wonderful places to eat and great opportunities to purchase gifts for loved ones.

Quiet and intersting. Quiet neighborhood and many shops and cafe's surrounding. Amazing mountain views!
very recommended area to stay for few quiet days.

Excellent Heritage site. Had an excellent experience visiting this place. The whole surrounding though commercialised yet was great standing in front of this stupa and taking a picture. The place was crowded with tourists from Malaysia, Sri Lanka and India and the shops in the locality were doing a booming business.
Bodnath Stupa. unfortunately rather commercialised however the building is phenomenal and certainly well worth seeing.

Beautiful Temple. Avoid a taxi and take a hike to the stupa. You get to see much of Kathmandu, it's completely safe. The Temple itself is beautiful, if you're lucky you can sit in on a monk prayer ceremony.
Have to see.. Big and great stupa. It is typical of Nepal. Near by there are many nice restaurants with good view for stupa.

Magnificent site seeing. Kathmandu is a magnificent place to go site seeing. The Temples are everywhere, and most of them require a sturdy pair of legs to climb with! The views are quite staggering and you can normally see in any direction. Kathmandu is a very basic and scruffy looking town which is a good 20 years behind anything that you you expect in Europe, but then that is what Kathmandu is all about. The toilet arrangements are few and far between, and when you do find the toilets they are extremely primitive normally only providing a whole to crouch over. Be sure to take copious amounts of water when travelling Kathmandu, and be very careful what you eat, or you will be going more than you are site seeing...
Great. You just have to go and walk around a few times to know what it is all about. Don't miss out on the biggest stupa in Nepal!
Spiritual Journey. Loved the spiritual influence of just being there. The sights from this Stupa are magnificent and even if not a spiritual person the views alone are worth the visit.

Cultural Classroom. A visit to the Bodnath Stupa area and its surrounding shopping and restaurants is a unique cultural experience. Populated by many Tibetan Buddhists and lined with an array of shops, Boudha offers a friendly and inviting environment. The Stupa area attracts tourists and locals alike, so meeting a variety of people is possible.  Meeting the friendly shop owners, engaging conversations is a wonderful way to learn more about the culture of Nepal.

Interesting, don't linger. Went here with my wife to see this as it is the number one attraction, however would not recommend spending a lot of time here unless you are a devout Buddhist. Not much to see and after a while you are getting in the way of those there to pray. We did see some tourists who spent a long time taking photos and were asked politely to move on by their guide. Just common sense but sometimes not so common. Very worth the visit, but can be done in 20 minutes.
A "Must Do" for Kathmandu. Large beautiful Stupa in the heart of Kathmandu. Don't miss touring the monastery just around the corner!

Fantastic place to visit. Bodnath stupa is simply very huge and magnificent place to visit. Surrounding the area, there were souvenir shops and restaurants. A must place to visit if u happen to be in Kathmandu.
Amazing area. The history behind the building and spiritual relavance was wonderful. I enjoyed buying Tibet prayer flags in the surrounding shops as a reminder.

Peaceful holy place. I visited in the evening and saw pilgrims circling around the huge stupa. I couldn't imagine before entering through the gate. My forgotten religion wanted to come back as I saw men and women paying homage to Buddha in their own ways. Surrounding the stupa there are a number of souvenir shops and restaurants and cafes. A must visit place as well as Pashupatinath and Swambhunath.

The Bodha Chörten. The Bodha Chörten stands large in my memory. The time to see it is either early in the morning or at dusk - because that is when hundreds of Tibetans cicumambulate (walk round) it. It is a religious form and one to be respected. Uou walk in a clockwise direction - and it is a delight for anyone to join the throng. No one is excluded and it is rare to be part of something like this. In the day the chörten is a charming circle of shops that sell Tibetan arts and crafts. The are many fine restaurants there and you can eat somewhere different every day fro both lunch and dinner.
Amazing Site!. Bodnath Stupa was the best part of the trip!. It's a very nice place..with shops around it. This place has some calming effect..though it was crowded..
Amazing structure and great shopping area. Felt very happy and enjoyed the Golden Eye Cafe twice. . .Loved the shopping experience, and had Tibetan bowl sound therapy while there.

Interesting to visit. The Stupa is one of the top attractions in Kathmandu. We were there in the afternoon and spent several hours observing the people and shopping in the many shops which encircle the religious site. Everything is for sale from singing bowls to prayer flags. There are restaurants on the roof tops of some of the surrounding buildings which offer an excellent view of the stupa. We sat and watched workers stringing new prayer flags from the center of the stupa as we consumed a cold local beer.
A must visit for all peace loving people :-D. Beautiful temple,peaceful and calming.Amazing Tibetian treasures and spiritual bliss.A must visit when in Nepal!!
A must-see for Buddhist visitors. One of the most important landmarks for Buddhists, make sure to circumambulate an odd-number of times. I was told by a local that even numbers were bad luck.

Remarkable!!!. Bodnath is one of the most amazing site I've ever visit. The stunning landmark carries an amazing spiritual energy and it certainly didn't disappoint in any sense. Best spot to shop for souvenirs and try some of the delicious momos on roof top cafes surrounding the majestic Stupa. It is a must in Nepal.
Beautiful & Peaceful. I really enjoyed experiencing to calm and peace of this place. Go and relax and let the peace was over you.
Nice place. Nice place. Too crowded too. Avoid during rush hours. In the middle of road, so getting taxis and buses is easy.
Amazing. Its a place whea u can find lot of diferent things, people, culture and all.. so good to be here... its a big WOW

peaceful bodnath stupa. beautiful and peaceful area, solace-giving
a bit smoky
sad that we are not allowed to see the inside of the stupa

Worth seeing for sure. This area was very interesting and there are schools around the stupa that teach painting. My family picked up a few Mandalas from the artists who were right there to meet us. It was great. The Stupa itself is also very beautiful and it was fun to hand out there for a few hours.

vibrant. go late in the afternoon, no entrance fee. Around 18 hrs. masses of people encircle this stupa; all clockwise. Interesting.
Quiet toward 19.15
Monkeys Yay. Nice temple. Good vibes. Busy. Great views! Monkeys are fun. Friendly spot. Is this 50 characters yet?
Nice Place. Boudhanath is very nice place for visit which is located at the heart of Kathmandu City. It is a very famous place of Buddhist.

Beautiful wonderful place. I enjoyed my trip and stay near the Stupa. What a joy it was to sit and watch and walk and take in the wonderful atmosphere around the Stupa, which I did many times, morning afternoon and also evening time

Alive and with an enviable history. This is a super place to amble around. There's a lot going on (although bargain hard if you're buying) and there's an incredible history to the place that's well worth researching. It's not surprising that Bodnath is so valued by Tibetans.
Unique - Must visited. Stupa is beautiful , Pls take a guide if you need detialed explaination , If you are from India or China . Pls carry a Indentification proof

Wonderful !. If you are in Kathmandu, this is a must to visit !Spend time walking around the Bodnath, taking it all in, and feeling the energy of this spiritual place. Make sure you walk the right way !!! Don't worry, you'll soon figure which way is right ;)Do a prostration or three to really impress the locals! :)108 times around is your challenge.... take a packed lunch and a rain-jacket just in case ;)Spend time in a cafe overlooking the Bodnath to contemplate your experience.Bottom line.. Just do it !... it's worth it ! Enjoy...Namaste !

stunning. A must place to visit... it is beautiful, peaceful and you can go right up to the top. You can go and sit in a restaurant looking over the Stupa. ring the prayer bells it makes you feel all warm and cosy....

The Must-go place. Bodnath Stupa is the must-go place for any person who comes to Kathmandu at the first time. It's not only the sacred Stupa but also the place where you can feel peaceful when going around (as much as you can).
A Must Be There Spot @ Kathmandu. The icon of Nepal, should not be missed. Apart from the pigeons, the square is clean and a walk around the square is fulfilling.
calming. Had oppurtunity to visit last year.... the outside was simply stunning, the aura was calming... bliss
for 1st timers in Kathmandu. If its your first time in Kathmandu , yes you must see it but its also very touristic. if you shop around the stupa make sure you cut prices by 4 or 5. Really

Peace in the eyes of Budhha and singing bowls.. In the middle of buildings rising suddenly is the Bodnath Stupa. Sitting heavily in the middle of a square surrounded by shops the stupa blankets everyone who gets close enough with a hush.We had a guide for the day so the information we got regarding the stupa was more detailed and in depth then f w had been on our own. But the guide bok shave plenty of information as well. Walking clock wise circle the base of the stupa and look at the prayer wheels. Follow the crowd and turn them as you pass, keeping in mind your hopes and dreams. Then after your full circle come back to the stairs and ascend. Continue moving clockwise, dont go against the flow now. Look u and see the eyes of Buddha watching over everyone. These eys appear repeatedly in the Nepalese culture as they are indeed believed to be watching you all of the time. So be good always basically. The flags are prayer flags and are many. Walk amongst them.Up on the stupa it is even more peaceful and the continuos Ohm Mane Padme Ohm from the shops can be very soothing. Take your time. When you come back down the stairs its time to visit the shops.This probably the best place to buy Thangkas and SInging Bowls. Thangkas are priced according to who has painted them and size. They depict stories of buddha and beliefs. Choose carefully and be honest with what you can and cant afford. The salesperson when I bought a small thangka for my husband couldnt believe that $1000 AUD was out of my price range. !!!!Singing bowls bought here are the best. This is not the only place to buy them, but the best that I found. Each bowl reflects the 7 chakras withing the body and is made up of 7 ingredients. A well made bowl will resonate after being struck for an exceptionally long time. I did pay a few hundred for a small to medium bowl but am overjoyed with it. You can get singing bowls anywhere in Thamel, I knw this, but keep in mind f thats what you are happy with, thats fine, but it does not have the same quality. A proper singing bowl will resonate and have only 7 ingredients, not 9 and not 5. 7. Around the stupa you will also find many cafes. I wish I had paid more attention but we visited a rooftop onethat had an awesome mojito. Perfect lunch time beverage to go with my momos. Momos and mojitos. My suggestion is visit the stupa, look through the shops, get you haggling out of the way then stop for a bite to eat at one of the roof top cafes.
Nice attraction. The stupa is beautiful and we can actually go on top of the roof structure. The shops around the temple are good too.
One of the best place in world . I am visit this place with my family. Really so peace full place we love it.this is Asia biggest stupa .. I am coming soon ...
So beautful. A must see, go in the small side shop and explore, so much fun. Had lunch just looking over the stupa, a magical place

Another temple to see. There is a tourist fee to pay for entry which is 3 times higher if you're not Indian or Chinese citizens so bring along your ID to avoid the higher charge. Once inside it's a small area and we had lunch at the Best view restaurant which lives up to its name for pics on the roof terrace. You can't go inside the temple as such, but can walk around it and is still used as a place of worship.

Biggest Stupa of the Asia. Boudnath Stupa is the one of the wonderful place to visit in kathmandu.Polite and very happy people of Nepal always smiles on their face with.Namaste!! greetings by lots of people and no doubt this place is one of the wounder of Nepal. Nice architecture we stay there for an hours.Recommend everyone to visit once you were in Kathmandu.

Must visit place while being in Kathmandu. This place is a special one and you must not miss it while coming to Nepal. It will leave special memoties in your mind after visiting it. A lot of tourists, a lot of locals, shops, cafes, etc. around... Also, there are ticket counters at the entrances but no one is forcing you to buy a ticket. I did, it is Rs.150 and you get a thanking message for 'contribution' on it. So, it's up to you...
Unique Monuments!. Full of art,amazingly good place to visit.Best to visit at evening for breathtaking views of kathmandu valley
Peaceful place to visit. Its a great place to visit and walk around the stupa..unless you visit the stupa you wont be able to understand the calm and serenity of the place..

GREAT. A very big Stupa in the midst of the city. One can not appreciate its hugeness by the road, when one enters premises, then there is this big temple. There are lot of Tibetians around, many are obviously praying. There are rotating drums all around stupa (I do not know what it is called) that all people rotate while encircling stupa. You can stroll around the stupa; there are lots of shops around. A short visit to the Boudhnath is worth.
Lunch at the roof-top to watch activities around Bodnath Stupa. We had lunch at one of the roof-top restaurants and had a marvellous view of the stupa. It looks very grand.
World Heritage Budha stupa. Great size with lot of tourists. You can circle it round. Lighted lamps are available on sale on the sides for prayers. People were also offering money to poor.

don't be hurried. The idea of the Stupa for me was to buy the prayer flags, write every one of my family and some friends names on each flag, have the flags blessed, and a man will tie them up for you, usually the one who you bought the flags from..Only make sure your not hurried by him to tie the flags before they'rve been blessed by a monk. Also a beautiful temple with Buddha's of all types everywhere, I found the food around the stupa to be excellent, the japanese was very clean and hoshi, and there was one restaurant after Illi cafe , where you climb high, it offers a view, although hot in the day, the Dal Bhat(Nepalese rice plate) veg and chicken was the one of the best, theres also a quaint spannish restaurant that I had a large watermellon juice which was well needed after doing a round of the stupa, the chant of om nama padme om continues creating a most meditative vibration, I'vw been a few times, 1 time there were too many tourists with cameras which turned me off, theres also a Thai foot massage which was just ok..

Great Peaceful place to Visit. Boudhanath is the largest Buddhist stupas in South Asia, and it has become the important point of Tibetan Buddhism in Nepal. It is located at about 11 km (6.8 miles) from the center and northeastern within Kathmandu. When refugees entered Nepal from Tibet in the 1950s, many of them decided to live Boudhanath area. They established many gompas (monastery), now this area is known as the "Little Tibet" of Nepal. I visit almost most every weekend to make my mind and body peaceful. I like to visit early in the morning or late in the evening with pilgrimage and find a good place in rooftop restaurant, have a nice cup of coffee with peaceful view of Boudhanath.

Don't miss the Boudhanath Stupa. The first time we went to the Boudhanath Stupa it was Buddha's Birthday (Buddha Jayanti). The Stupa was crowded with Nepali people walking the circumference and on different levels of the Stupa. New prayer flags were being hung and the shops and monasteries around the stupa were crowded. We were hustled into a Tibetan Thanka gallery and studio for a demonstration and sales pitch. There are lots of shops selling Tibetan Thankas around the Boudhanath and prices seemed reasonable.When I visited again 8 days later the crowds were gone and I was able to make a couple of circuits of the Stupa, spinning the prayer wheels and going up one level for another circuit and some nice photos. If you find the room with the two giant prayer wheels go in and give them a turn. There was a small monk in the room who, if you made a donation, would tie a string around your wrist. Om Mani Padme Hum

Wonderful experience. The Bodnath Temple at Kathmandu is is must see for visitors. It is relatively modern and close to central Kathmandu. The site has everything to offer from a tourist view point. Spiritual, handicrafts, Curios,good restaurants etc.
