Best in Mandu. Really Peaceful place. Be sure to grab a drink on one of the many terraces in the area. Relax, enjoy the breeze, zenGot 500 Rupees from Thamel to here. You can have both way and have the driver wait for you for about 800 Rupees.
Unique place. nice place, very special, definitely worth a visit, recommend if you stay a couple of days in Katmandu,

Impressively large Stupa. Definitely one of the recommended sights to visit. The stupa is the first thing u'll see as you enter the gates, a large, white stupa, well preserved with a circular path around it which is lined by shops and eateries. and be careful as you may only walk clockwise around the stupa, so if u missed something, u'll have to make a full circle to get back to it :)

Amazing. Definitely one of the must-see attractions in Kathmandu. In the afternoon people are praying and the monks are chanting prayers, what a view, especially in the afternoon. But be prepared as they close the entrance to the stupa around 6-ish (i did not remember exactly). All and all, worth seeing!
Bodnath Stupa. Excellent introduction to culture in Nepal, remember to walk the correct way around the Stupa! - fabulous shopping and eating

Wonderful. A lovely place, day or night. The stupa is a wonderful sight, though I have to say it's one step down from the magnificence of the Shwedagon Paya in Yangon. Walking in a clockwise circle around the stupa with monks, worshippers and a few tourists is a great experience. All around the circular path which surrounds it are shops and small restaurants, many with rooftop areas so you can eat, drink and gaze at the stupa. It's about a 15-minute taxi ride from Thamel. You pay a couple of dollars entry fee to the area during daylight hours.
WOW. Really impressive... amazing vibe about it and you can really feel the overseeing eyes of the buddha... was very impressed!

Peaceful Location in between a crowded market. Its a mammoth Stupa in the middle of the market, yet it is very peaceful. Worth a visit.Best season is to go in winters as summers are generally hot in Kathmandu.
peaceful and happy atmosphere. i love it! There is nothing to dislike, except perhaps the journey! I walked but it was not a very pleasant walk due to all the construction work along the way

Great Stupa. an truly scape from the noise and rush of Kathmandu.I think this is one of the best things of this stupa, that it's clean and quite... rather than the stupa itself. After spending soemtime in Kathamndu, you will value those things, trust me. Try to come here early and spend as long as you want breathing tranquility.If your are staying at Thamel, don't forget to bargain the taxi price... wel that's a general tip for Nepal, always laways laways bargain!
Soak in the holy atmosphere. If you like ethnic community, especially Tibetan Buddhism, do not miss this holy sacred place. Die die must visit and stay at least 2 full days.

really nice place. You can take some interesting photos there, Im not sure how I did this but I didn't pay to enter, there is no rally place to pay, local guards just catch you on the streets and asking to pay.some nice shops around and cafes with free wi-fi. see my blog for more details.http://doleczkitravels.blogspot.com.br/2014/02/nepal-himalayas-kathmandu-pokhara-trek.html

Great but not amazing ! . Looks just as it does in all the photos. Great sight to see but not sure if it deserves the number 1 spot ! Lots of places to eat - wish I had of looked on trip advisor and written down the names of some recommended spits prior to visiting.Nice photo spot !

Next time I will stay longer and do more laps of the stupa.. Boudhanath Stupa was electric. Caught with the crowd we walked around the stupa like trout with the throng of people. Lots of monks. Lots of locals. Lots of tourists. All walking around and around the stupa. I can't wait to go again. Next time I will stay longer and do more laps of the stupa.
Wonderfull Place. I was there twice to see the sunset vies and greatest stupa's pic.If you travel to Nepal you shoun't miss to be there once.

Great place!. A great place to visit! The only remark is that the Stupa is surrounded by dozen and dozen of touristic shops! It's very chaotic! Well, it is a sacred place and according to me it should be more protected...
lovely pizza place there and street dog care sat am. worth a visit for shopping, nice pizza and beer and streetdogcare visit saturday mornings each week and are just round the corner.
Love this place. Love this place. Really good in the evening, very peaceful and great Buddhist environment. Love the Stupa and restaurant near by too.
kathmandu city tour. one of the largest stupa of asia,,,all we love to be this place for whole day and every day,,very good !!

Moving experience. This is one of the iconic sites in Kathmandu and it was nice to become part of the busy clockwise walk around the Stupa.There are plenty of souvenir shops close by and free wifi in the many eating places.
Incredible..... Incredible place to visit in kathmandu... just walking around the stupa gives a great feeling and cafes around give a nice view..

One stop spiritualism and shopping.. People seem to really love this place, but I wasn't that excited about it. However, I still think it is worth going to and for some reason I am compelled to give it a "very good" rating.The stupa is in a large round courtyard that is completely surrounded by souvenir shops and restaurants. The place is filled with locals, monks, dogs, pigeons, tourists, and more. I personally found it a bit hectic.Despite the semi-chaos and slight annoyance of people trying to sell their stuff, there was a certain charm to the place and a sense of peacefullness hidden beneath it all.

Site seeing day. Our day began with a taxi ride through Kathmandu, we were dropped off walked to the stupa entrance and before us was one often highlights of the day....such a beautiful iconic image of Nepal and the people, set in the heart of Kathmandu the stupa can't fail to take your breath awayWe have lunch over looking the stupa,to complete a magical few hours spent in that area.

Amazing. I joined the morning prayers and it was such a lovely experience going around the stupa early in the morning. It was cold and raining but a lot of people came to pray. You can also light up candles by the stupa and also feed the birds. There are a lot of lovely little cafes around the stupa with free wifi.

Definitely worth seeing!. Although the place was being repainted when we visited and we were thus not allowed inside to see the Buddha's "relic bones" (though we did get to donate some paint as an offering), this place is still definitely worth a visit as a microcosm of the city itself. Vendors, restaurants, singing bowls everywhere-- it only takes about an hour to see and is a delight!

Peace in mind.. I pretty much liked this place as it is peaceful meditative feeling as Buddhism owns that capacity. It's not a very neat place yet not bad. Just outside of the attraction happened to have crazy traffic and fur but it feel much different in de steps away. Loved it. Cheers !!Idea ChuaSingapore

Very exciting. I love Bodnath Stupa. The Stupa is very beautiful and I love seeing all the folks walking around and around turning the prayer wheels. The older Tibetans come at 1500 every day to walk together along with several monks. It is worth the trip just to be involved with the shopping and the spiritual feel of the place.
Big Experience. This Stupa is the most impressive historical experience I ever made.I´d suggest to drink anything in this area. Any café around provides a nice view on this Stupa.

Found myself In Boudha Stupa. The great Boudhanath Stupa is a jewel point in the center of natural mandala, a store of scared energy and an important place for not only the buddhist to pilgrimage, but also the principal centre of Himalayan Buddhist worship and studies in Kathmandu, met a few travelers and commented the best place to get peace of mind in Kathmandu.
Quintessential Kathmandu. This place is simply iconic and not to be missed when in Kathmandu. Great views from the nearby rooftop restaurants -- Roadhouse was impressive as was the food.

Impressive!. A must-see and even more impressive than the pictures. Great to go during a festival. Surrounded by lots of curio shops and restaurants rest and refreshment is not far away when sight seeing

Our favorite place in Kathmandu!. Very good energy. With a lot of people at day time, but still very quiet. We just love it! Went there almost 10 times during our stay. People there are very nice and helpful. Don't have much comercial feeling yet. Hopefully it will keep that way.

Place where I feel relaxed. This is the place where I use to visit when I feel bored.entering inside this area every time I used to feel just relaxed. During night time due to the effects of light it seems wonderful!so I wanna ask you why not to visit this place at least once!!

Superb place. You have to go there.. Incredible place in nepal. Beautiful stupa and buddhist atmosphere. I spent my afternoon there enjoying monateries, musics and nice places to stay. Really nice experience, I just can recommend to visit Bodnath once in the lifetime.

A must see!. Tour guides will tell you to go to places like Durbar Square, pashupatinath, monkey temple and the garden of dreams.. and while they are all nice places, they don't compare to Bodnath Stupa. This place has a mystical and very spiritual atmosphere to it. You won't see many tourists around, instead you will be faced by thousands of locals doing the traditional laps around the stupa and many prostrating in prayer.It is a giant and beautiful structure with much religious value and a must see when visiting Kathmandu. If you have a local friend or someone who could go with you to explain what is going on, this would be ideal. Otherwise, you can still enjoy this marvelous stupa unguided.

Excellent Atmosphere. Monks, music, incense, shops and no motorized vehicles all contribute to the peaceful yet exciting atmosphere. Have some Nepali tea in a rooftop café overlooking the stupa, and join the monks on their walk around the stupa at dusk.

Wonderful especially if you haven't been to Tibet yet. It is within walking distance from our hotel in Hyatt so we spent a relaxing afternoon hopping from one roof top cafe to another to watch the prayers walking in a clockwise direction (and of course some tourists going in the opposite direction with their eyes only on the souvenirs!).It is especially impressive to go on a sunny day where the gold painted stupa reflects beautifully and photogenically. If you are interested in shopping there, better compare prices. We had wanted to buy a book about Nepal in English, one shop offered the price of 1,300rupees (probably expecting me to cut it down to 1,000). The other shop (near the Himalayan cafe, also called Himalayan Crafts or something like that), only 10 steps away from the first shop, have prices on every item and the same book only cost about 500! After all my shopping, the honest owner even gave me further discounts on the entire bulk I bought, without pushing at all.If you are looking for mountain or trekking gears, better go to town. Choices are very limited here near the stupa and qualities don't seem as good.

Amazing view and energy. The commanding stupa is just one thing you cannot miss when you are in Kathmandu. The entrance fee is pretty affordable too (Rp 150) considering this is one of the 7 heritage sites acknowledged by UNESCO. Find a cafe nearby and spend a good time admiring it and do some people watching.

Impressive!!. This world famous stupa is the most holy of Tibetan Buddhist shrines outside Tibet. During prayer times it is very crowded so try to go after people have come in the morning and before workers get off from work. There are many interesting shops in this area and art work bone by the Buddhist monks can be purchased . The "Wheel of Life" is one of the main tenets of the religion and there are many prayer wheels around the perimeter of the shrine. It is traditional to walk all the way around the perimeter of the temple.
Best attraction in Kathmandu!. This is a must visit, and hopefully you will find a ceremony going on. Market was also reasonable in prices, and you can find very nice souvenirs there
Serenity admidst chaos. Liked this more than Swayambunath for the sheer size and peaceful atmosphere. Try having lunch on a rooftop restaurant to get a bird's eye view of the city and gorgeous Stupa.

Awesome feeling !!. Bodnath Stupa is one of the largest bhuddist stupa. It can be reached by taxi from every part of city and the taxi would probably cost between 500 to 1000 Nepali Rupee. Also there are buses & micro (Shared Auto-rickshaw) services available to reach Bodnath. Entering the stupa, the atmosphere completely changes from that of traffic to that of monks and tourists everywhere around. There is a huge praying wheel in front of buddha temple which has to be rotated in odd number and while rotating one has to say "Om Mani Padme Hum". The aura is really peaceful and its really relaxing !

Most prettiest white dome. The area is very beautiful, Tibetan people circling the white dome with prayers wheel, amazing view of stupa from monasteries right in front of it.. Especially during evening you feel awesome, I am hundred percent sure ..

Nepal spirit temple and budism culture. All in this place is a wonderfull experience. The temple is a wonderfull arquitectura heritage. The shops, small scultures, the pilgrins, nepal people and atmosphere is really special, a place that you must to visit in your stay in Nepal. It is very near to Kathmandú.

one of the hearts of Kathmandu. This stupa was by far our favorite sight. The pleasant circle of shops (some very nice thangka - Tibetan Buddhist painting - shops) and cafes around it, and the fact that you could walk around it without worrying about traffic, made it very visitor friendly. You can feel the influence of the large Tibetan community here. Very simple, stunning, and peaceful. An absolute must for any visit to Kathmandu.

Beautiful. When you walk around the Stupa you can hear the monks chanting and it's very spiritual. There are many shops in the area and it is easy to take a cab there. Negotiate with the driver before you get in 300 NPRs is the local rate from the Thamel area. 400 is still a fair price.

a must visit. I never knew that this was the world's biggest Buddhist stupa, unless i visited the same. Loved the place. you will find monks, tourists and shopkeepers all around.lots of artifacts and handicrafts to buy from along with money exchange counters, I found the rates best in the city.
always go here when I'm in nepal. love the atmosphere the people the food !!!!!you can sit and soak it all up or do your rounds!it has a special magic

Buddhist stuff. the place is so packed with people, tourist monks and locals, i even met again the monk i met at the airport on the other day.the place is so busy with Buddhist activitiesThere's so many shops selling souvenir from India Nepal and Tibet.If your tired on walking, there are so many roof top restaurants so you could have a better view of the stupa and the Kathmandu valley.

Two eyes are not enough to glance World's Largest Buddhist Stupa. After cancellation of my Lukla flight, I got a chance to roam in Khatmandu city and visited BodnathStupa. Location is easily accessible being at City center. Lots of artifacts and handicrafts depicting Buddhist culture.Got chance to see praying and offerings of Buddhist culture. Must visit place in Khatmandu.

Interesting place where you can spend some time. The place is indeed worth a visit if you are in Kathmandu. Although, similar to other Boudh stupas, the place is a good visit as it is surrounded by various shops, eateries and temples. The presence of many monks in the region does give it a religious touch in a interesting way. You can find the monks playing and feeding the pigeons.You could shop and eat and have your photos clicked and also visit the interior of the stupa to get that religious touch. Overall, worth a visit at-least once.

Interesting place to spend several hours..... Lots of artefact and handicraft shops.....you don't get hassled as much as say in Thamel. Still have to barter, but that's part of the game!! Plenty of good value restaurants too.

Religious place. I visited this place days back and was a little crowded,, very religious place. . I loved the environment. The restaurants around the stupa seems to be relaxing. And stupa it self was also very relaxing.
Very interesting place. Just amazing to watch all those people walk around the Stupa every evening just before dawn. Looking at all those calm different faces gives you some hard to explain energy.

Absolutely stunning giant stupa. If you come early in the morning you will experience the Buddhists in their morning prayers. Feel free to join in, walking clockwise around the base, spinning the prayer wheels as you go. Next enjoy some milk tea and breakfast at one of the adorable cafes overlooking the magnificent stupa. The shops around the stupa are halfway between charming and annoying. All-in-all it is a beautiful experience, take it all in.

A must-visit in Kathmandu. One of the biggest stupas in the world, Bodnath stupa attracts a lot of Buddhists and it's very buzzing. It is actually a very impressive construction and quite interesting to just sit and watch the people and the pilgrimages!

Peaceful Temple. This is a Buddhist Temple worth visiting slightly away from the main part of Katmandu. The entrance fee is only 150 and once you go inside there are plenty of shops and cafes to relax and spend time enjoying the peaceful atmosphere. You can also walk on top of the stupa and go all the way around and get a view of monks and Buddhist people meditating and giving offerings which can be interesting.

my fave place on the planet. Do not miss this incredible Tibetan Buddhist stupa. Walk some rounds, spin some prayer wheels, breathe the incense. For me, this is the most sacred place I have ever visited.

One of the must see temples in Kathmandu. This is a very unique temple that is worth the visit. I enjoyed all of the people that were there. There were a lot of Tibetians who are known for their pilgramages.
Around the stupa are a lot of shops and cafes, so you can take your time to visit.

My favorite place. I love to go to this stupa. You can feel the calm essence of peace from the place and the surrounding neighbors. The surrounding area is full of Buddhist monasteries, monks and nuns, and people that make the famous Tibetan paintings. There are many visitors and Buddhist people making a circuit of the stupa and offerings.

Well worth a visit. I believe it is an absolute must in Kathmandu to visit the Stupa. Spend a couple of hours walking around (clockwise).... it gets very busy sometimes and you can feel the incredible energy of the place.

beautifull location, plenty to eat. Great location, very busy lots of shops that where pricier than thamel, lots of restaurants and cafes.
150 rupees to get in but is valid for one week
would reccomend pricing your shopping there and comparing the same price in Thamel normally much cheaper

Beautiful place. You are transported back on time wheel. From religious point of view also. and you can have a nice view of the town from the top. Buy local ornamental and decorative items from the numerous good shops on the way

Visiting Nepal. The Great Stupa of Boudhanath is approximately 6kms from the centre of Kathmandu.it is an amazing place full of little shops & roof top cafe's that overlook the Stupa.Whilst we were there yesterday there was a monk's ceremony with heaps of chanting & drinking some kind of milk as we viewed the scene from a roof top cafe.Lunch @ Th Cafe Tempo was excellent,great views to see the Stupa,excellent food @ a heap price & friendly service.Hightly recommended.We had lunch the day before @ Hotel Padma also overlooking the Stupa & it was not as good.Much more expensive albeit the service & views of the Stupa were great.Many small sops where one has to bargain extensively,otherwise The prices are high.People are very friendly?Traffic in Kathmandu is frenetic,yet we have saw no accidents @ all.Lots of dented cars,1000's of motor bikes & push bikes.Roads are terrible,dirty & dusty,yet the place has an excitement all it's own.We highly recommend Kathmandu & the Great Stupa of Boudhanath as worth going to see.

Beautiful stupa--a must see!. Bodnath Stupa is a beautiful structure and iconic of Kathmandu and Nepal.The stupa is massive and surrounded by tons of shops and restaurants, a busy hive of activity. We visited around noon and there were hundreds of monks attending a prayer ceremony at the stupa. Walk clockwise around it for a great experience. Admission is NRP 150 for non-SAARC, which is a steal in comparison to other sites in these area. Highly recommend!

Lovely Buddhist Stupa. There is a serene purity to this temple that I found nowhere else in Kathmandu. No merchants are allowed on the stupa itself (different from Swayambhunath) which cuts down on the carnival atmosphere. It's lovely to walk around, but even better is to sit in one of the restaurants that surround the site and watch tourist and pilgrims alike walk around it, many of them turning the prayer wheels as they go. Don't miss this if you are Kathmandu.

atmospheric place. A great place to soak up the atmosphere of Kathmandu. The devout circle the Stupa in a clockwise direction- many people, men and women, yound and old, in traditional and western dress. Wonderful

A fascinating slice of Tibet in Nepal. So busy, yet so calm .... and above all spirituality is evident. Mumbled mantras, pirouetting prayer wheels, and pious pilgrims. Honoured to observe all this in practice.Entrance fee: kids (free)/adults (NRP 150 - non-SAARC/NRP 40 - SAARC)

Buddhist temple and that's about it. If you are going there with a view to admire the architecture then its not all that great.
But if you've never seen a stupa then its worth the visit.

That's one big Stupa. The size of the Bodnath Stupa was truly amazing. Visiting this shrine was one of the most otherworldly parts of our trip. We arrived at dusk and the scene was still active and surreal. Hundreds walked the perimeter turning prayer wheels and browsing in the surrounding shops. Relics of the Buddha are purported to be contained in the site. We ate overlooking the stupa as darkness fell. I regret not arriving sooner and having more time. I would allow 1-2 hours depending on whether you wish to eat while here and how many of the surrounding shops and attractions you would like to visit. There is a small fee for tourists. It is a crowded area so it is wise to plan a meeting spot both for your fellow travelers and, in particular, for your driver if you have one. While in Kathmandu I would not miss seeing this important Buddhist shrine.

Love this place. We've been to Nepal 3 times now and each time we make sure we visit here and have lunch at one of the roof top restaurants overlooking the Stupa. It's lovely watching the tourists, monks and pilgrims walking (clockwise of course) around, spinning the prayer wheels, taking great photos and enjoying the atmosphere.

great place. the time when we went a major uplifting was going pn as a result most of the sections were closed for the public. the place is awesome, easy to reach. it is sorrounded by abundant restraunts of all choices and options.
Interesting site.. A lovely peaceful place and a must see place in Nepal. Very large and very photogenic. Just remember to walk clockwise!

A wonderful spiritual site like no other!. a sense of calm and grounding energy prevails in and around the Bodnath Stupa. It is an amazing area that feels like a small village focused on an intention for health, peace and harmony for all beings. The stupa is beautiful and the surrounding buildings seem almost old world European with Tibetan design and monastery art thrown in. The rooftop restaurants are a great place to watch the sun on the stupa and the movement of people below. I loved to walk the stupa every day to the sound of 'ohm mani padme hung' cd's playing around the site. loved, loved, loved, everything about it!!!
best place to visit :). I highly recommend this place to everyone who visits Kathmandu .Specially during morning and evening time ...
Amazing!. The stupa has such a significant energy to it. A must visit for those who are interested in Buddhism and Hinduism alike.

Amazing and clean. It is a great area and good to walk around it i preferred it then the monkey temple which was dirty and had people spitting around it. You can also go into some of the older buildings around the area and get some nice views.
calm and spiritual. a great place to sample tibetan culture in kathmandu. worth going in the evening when the stupa is candle-lit!

Boudhanath stupa is like a tiny piece of Tibet in Kathmandu. Its a calm place after the noise and bustle of the streets.. The roof top restaurant has a great view of the stupa and Kathmandu. The food is good and cleanly prepared too.

we went there everyday, a wonderful place to spend time. we did three rounds of the stupa everyday, and ate at many of the places that surround the stupa. the place is alive with the energy of people walking, chanting, being with friends, feeding pigeons, buying and selling things, etc.
Beautifull location. One of the must sees in Kathmandu. Very beautifull temples, with gold en wooden artcraft. You have a good overview of a part of Kathmandu, and if clear, also of the Himalaya.

Fantastic. This amazing stupa is a MUST see in Nepal. One of the biggest & most important landmarks in Indian subcontinent. Tip: have a drink in a roof top cafe to view the whole structure. Best time: dawn & dusk to catch the golden reflection of the stupa.

a must. I was astonished to see the devotion of locals as well as to see foreigners praying and chanting, the place was packed with people all worshiping, walking with beads on their hands praying or sitting in meditation (as much as you can because is a little noisy) very impressive! great pictures!
Mystical and Soothing to Your Soul. I lived here at a guesthouse for 2 months and it became my home. It's ancient otherworldly and amazing. Your spirit is renewed here.

Heaven on earth. Boudanath Stupa is a World Heritage Centre. The Stupa is magnificent. The atmosphere at all times is to be savoured as locals walk around with their prayer beads, rolling their prayer wheels and praying. An eclectic group of people gather here daily for those of you who enjoy people watching. Tourist shops (in the flavour of Nepal) and restaurants with roof top views of the Stupa abound. Enjoy!

A must do in Kathmandu. . It is very hard to not feel something while walking around this stupa. I'm not a spiritual person, but did feel very peaceful here at the largest stupa in Nepal. Maybe the traffic free ruling added to the wonderful atmosphere at this site. For whatever reason, The Bodnath Stupa can't be missed. Enjoy!

Tibetan Budhism. If you are looking for architectural grandeur, then this is not he place for you. However, the entire complex is a must for those who want to experience a different culture and religion. There are numerous monasteries around the main stupa, do visit them to check out stunning murals and statues. You can also eat at the Tibetan restaurants or buy authentic Tibetan knick-knacks. If possible, light a butter lamp in any of the monasteries for the health, happiness of your loved ones.

Amazing. The stupa is a pilgrimage site for Buddhists in the Himalayan region and beyond. Take time to wander and cut out the hustle and bustle of trade that goes on around it. Visit early morning or evening when the visitors are mainly locals
Very peaceful. A street away from the business of Kathmandu, and very atmospheric. it is what I expected Kathmandu to be

The center of the Tibetan Community in Nepal. It's an amazing place to sit and people watch or to walk around with the hundreds of others that are there. Make sure you go around clockwise to get the proper karma boost.

bodnath stupa kathmandu. Very impressive. a must see. Make sure you cirlce the stupa gliding your hands on each of the drums making a prayer as you go around. Lots of places to buy touristy items. I usually dont buy anything but I went and bought a healing bowl for my friend who does meditation.

Must see in Kathmandu. The place for the tourists visiting Kathmadu but unique and of long history behind.
I really recomend it as a place of interest there.

Go first thing in the morning. Fascinating place with a spence of calm first thing watching the locals walk clockwise around the stupa. Later on there can be crowds. Don't try to walk anti clockwise not the done thing

Wonderful. Highly recommend a trip here as part of any visit to Kathmandu.A taxi will cost you around 500-600 NPR from Thamel (don't pay more) and is a much better idea than trying to walk as the roads around it are incredibly busy.Once you've walked around the temple make sure you have a drink in one of the many cafe's that circle the temple and soak in the atmosphere from the roof top terraces.Amazing.

Unforgettable experience!. So much more of an experience that I had expected. Definitely try to come early morning or after 4:30pm when you will see hundreds of monks and Tibetans circling the stupa. You'll see the women in their beautiful traditional clothes and others praying by lying stretched out on the ground, before standing upright and then repeating dozens of times. Look out for the ones, wearing gloves and sliding grips on long wooden boards. Fascinating place to 'people watch'. The stupa itself is magnificent with the eyes peering out at you, with the gold at the top, contrasting beautifully with the simple white of the lower part of the stupa. Hundreds of prayer flags flap in the breeze overhead, while drumming and chanting can be heard in the various Tibetan monasteries in the area - also worth a visit for their elaborate interiors. A truly wonderful place to visit and surely one of the highlights of any visitor to Nepal.

Wonderful. We were taken here as part of a rail journey in India extension and this turned out to be probably the best part of the whole holiday. Nepal was shown as just a footnote at the bottom of the journey through India and we almost missed it. Whilst the 2 weeks in India were great, Nepal surpassed it all.We were just being shown around Kathmandu when, down this narrow alley, was this incredible white dome. For a while, we just stopped and stared. There were people just slowly walking around, gently sliding their hands around the gold coloured drums and turning them. We now know them to be prayer drums. The idea is to walk around the Stupa, clockwise only, rolling each drum and praying. I am not really religious, but this was just breathtaking, peaceful, awe-inspiring... the list is endless. I would go back in an instant.All around the Stupa are small shops selling everything you may want. Food, gifts, clothes.Fantastic.
Good Stupa and Shopping. We spent around 2 hours overall in this area. Good Stupa, worth watching if you are in Kathmandu. Shopping nearby also good with many roof top restaurants around.

Calm and quite in a crowded city. This place reminds one of tibetian style locations.Calm and peaceful than any other tourists spots.Plan to spend some time in this serene enviornment.Also avoid costly local cafes and other overpriced shops.One thing to notice is that this place is less of a place for shops than say other spots like temples in kathmandu

Really interesting. I went to visit the Stupa as part of a tour with my trekking company. It was interesting and I think it is worth a visit. We visited the monastery which is in the same square where the monks were singing and playing instruments which I really enjoyed.

Breathtaking. It was filled with lots of Buddhist pilgrims and served as a place of overwhelming peace. We got some prayer flags and wrote our names on it before getting them blessed by a monk on site. The local boys then helped us tie the flags to the stupa. Definitely worth a visit.

Colourful and buzzing. Loved the beautiful flags. The place gives you a sense of balance and even the most hardened soul can't help but be inspired by the sense of scale and dimension of the faith that brings people here to worship. There are some hawkers around the edges, but they are insignificant compared to other places.

Join the locals. Put off your trip to Bodanath until at least five in the evening (or go the early). At dusk the atmosphere comes alive as all the Tibetan community and other Buddhists come out and make 'kora' - three laps of the stupa, clockwise. Enter the gate and do a lap of the stupa up on the first terrace for great views. Eat at Stupa View, Casita or the new Roadhouse on their terrace. Bouda is a great place to stay and far nicer than the bakcpackers ghetto of Thamel. I live about twenty minutes walk north of Bouda at Kapan just below the gomba. There are a system of homestays there or use the Shambala Village Resort (nice people, clean/simple rooms). Shopping at Bouda is generally more expensive than Thamel. Change your money outside on the main road for better rates. Try lunch at the Chechen Gomba for a peaceful meal.
Amazing space. Was amazing space to be in. Hidden by surrounding city. You locate through an alley and the amazing white color of this shrine and the immense size surprises you.

Inspiring!. Had only one full day in KTM decided to do one attraction inside and out, so chose the stupa. Not disappointed and I left inspired and tired from my long day out. Took in the glory of the stupa during the morning and early afternoon before lunch at a fantastic burger joint somewhere in the "town" area behind the stupa itself. Most of the joy of this site was exploring the township around the stupa and finding as many monasteries as I could. The monks and nuns were very open to visitors and were all friendly. Wandered around the shops surrounding the stupa and just people watched for a while as I saw other tourists, locals, and pilgrims come to worship. Amazing experience!! A+
Simple & easy to navigate. Walked around the stupa in clockwise for good luck. Lunch at the rooftop restaurant to get the whole bird eye view of the stupa.
Interesting. There is a very nice Tibetan backpacker restaurant called Double Dorjee. It's family run, really peaceful and good. They also serve Thomba, the famous "barley" beer from Nepal.

Eye/Catching premises. To get to this UNESCO World Heritage Site from Kathmandu airport you may take a taxi which would cost around 350 Nepali rupees. The taxi guys may quote a higher price you would have to bargain to get upto350. The time taken is approximately 20-25minutes depending on the traffic.There is an entrance fee for entering the premises. Depending on the nationality it may vary.It’s like a little town. Stupa in the centre and n number of restaurants Tibetans and Chines favourites, Guest houses, currency exchange centres, travel agencies, souvenir shops, local stuff shopping, medical centre and many other things fencing it.It’s very eye-catching and a charming look of the premises doesn’t make you feel as if you in Kathmandu. You may get to see many Tibetan monks here.Over all this pilgrimage and meditation place is very photogenic.

A very spiritual place. The minute I walk through the gate and set eyes on the Stupa I was in awe and felt the spirituality of Bodnath Stupa. I stayed in a hotel a couple of minutes walk from the Stupa and after having ventured out into the craziness of Katmandu to return to Bodnath was relaxing and calming. I spent hours just sitting and watching the mainly Tibetan Buddhist undertaken their devotions while walking clock wise around the stupa. It is one of the few places the shop keepers do not hassle you. The monasteries which are adjacent to the Stupa are while worth a visit. I could lie in bed and around 5 am hear the drums and horns as they started their prayers.

Many Many Monkey. I love this place because there i can see many many Monkey. They are really funny and it is peace place ( middle of Kathmandu ). From here good view of Kathmandu city is very good specially at night.

Amazing Stupa. To the north of Kathmandu, Boddhanath is really hugh & beautiful stupa. We were making around the stupa playing the prayer wheel & we enjoy the art of monasteries around it. The restaurant near buddhanath offers best view.

Stupafying!. Not like anything I'd seen before (including Borobudur). Simple architecture, but very attractive. Surrounded by clockwise-wise walking monks, tourists, and pilgrims (keeping god on their right side). Some interesting Buddhist monasteries, and lots and lots of souvenir shops and guesthouses. Best views were in fact from rooftop cafes associated with the guesthouses.
Bodnath is worth the trip. Nice oasis from the typical Kathmandu chaos and a good place to people watch especially if you haven't visited any Tibetan places.

Very peaceful. Was really nice. Enjoyed this over many other sites as it's quiet and visually stunning as opposed to many other places that are crowded and full of people haggling to sell you stuff or tours
A must for the culture, the peace and the shopping.. Lots to see while walking slowly in a peaceful environment; it means a lot to me! Nice restaurants also.

Wonderful and enchanting place. Especially magical at sunrise and sunset, the Stupa is like no other place I've ever been. It is so pleasant doing the Kora with the many Tibetans and local Nepali, watching children feed the birds, the smell of incense, hearing the music, and seeing the people light candles at night. This is a place full of life and many exceptional memories for me.

Great place. I firmly believe that a tourist should learn about other cultures, their history, their beliefs and their traditions. Visiting some of the outstanding stupas are a part of this. Yes, there are souvenir shops but no one has to purchase anything but there are some very interesting nooks and crannies.

Grand. Very big and grand stupa surrounded by lots of souvenir shops and roof terrace restaurants. Entrance is 150 rs per person but there's no one manning the entrance. Visit if u have time or its your first time in Nepal.

Bodnath Stupa Hike. Amazing Hike to reach Bodnath Stupa with Breathtaking view. the hike is about 3- 5 hours. Our guide was very nice and knowledgable. He was recommended from Adventure Bound Company.

Go if there is time. too touristy. souvenir were much more expensive.
roof top cafes are nice.
the monastery around the area is more interesting.

A must see. The stupa is an amazing piece of architecture. Take your time walk around and appreciate the details. Also make sure to go up the little stairs to get closer to the top.
Certainly worth a visit.
Interesting place. Beautiful stupa and nice place to sit around, have a drink on one of the roof tops restaurants and shopping at the square
nice buddha place. although the roads are so hectic, after reaching bouddha, we are relaxed. lots of people praying and chanting. this place is good to be.

bodnath stupa. the architecture of the stupa is very good around it are colorful shop to buy soveneirs
what i didnt like was no guides to know about it nor ant written information
Great. A true experience. This place and aura around it is surreal. Great shopping and plenty of rooftop restaurants. Spend some time walking around the Stupa!

Bazaar. The stupa have turn into a big bazaar. As you enter the Giant stupa from the south entrance, the ticket counter is on the right. There is another entrance further east and the entrance has no ticket counter. You can find souvenir shops much like Thamel but the prices are double if not tripled. Same goes for the restaurant too. However, on the rooftop you can see great view of the magnificent stupa with the Himalayan mountain as it's back drop.Lots of people circumambulate around the stupa. The excess to the stupa is on the first level only.
Magical Bodnath Stupa. Beautiful Buddhist Stupa. Lovely to go at dusk as all the local buddhists walk around the stupa and the smell of juniper is in the air.

Very peaceful. This place is an awesome sight for its architecture and peacefulness. The monks going around the stupa, the market inside the stupa and the rush without much notice is awesome. It is a place to be visited at least once in lifetime

Serenity Personified. Kathmandu can be rather daunting for tourists. Most stay in Thamel and continually are besieged (politely) by hawkers while being honked at by rickshaw drivers, taxis, and motorcycles... all while viewing endless rows of souvenir shops with countless trinkets and goods. Walking paths to Durbar Square are always crowded and the Monkey Temple is often overloaded with both tourists and nasty tempered monkeys.But one spot remains relatively serene--Bodnath Stupa. Unlike most religious shrines in Kathmandu, this stupa remains relatively simple and is maintained by Tibetan Buddhists. A feeling of reverence prevails as you circle the stupa clockwise, and you can visit a number of monasteries that surround it to further your experience.I visited twice during my 3 week stay in the city, both times in the late afternoon when the sunlight is optimal. Catching it near sunrise would also be recommended.It's not walking distance from Thamel, so be prepared to bargain with a taxi to get here. There is a nominal fee for westerners, but the ticket taker may be on break occasionally (I didn't have to pay for my second visit)
Inspiring and beautiful. As a buddhist, it was very meaningful for me to circumambulate the stupa and admire its beauty while enjoying sharing the experience with other practitioners.

surprisingly calming. Despite being in the middle of kathmandu, surrounded by battered roads and even more battered traffic Bodnath manages to retain an aura of calm devotion. It is very moving to see the deep reverence with which those processing obviously feel about this place. A visit in the early morning, as the sun rises is an experience that will not dissapoint. dont forget to move clockwise! I did not pay to go inside Bodnath on any of my visits, so I cannot comment.
great stupa. we been in night time there, oh!! fascinating with oil lamps and devotees circle around the stupa. surrounding the stupa there are monastery and cafe. Really it is tranquility places.

A great atmosphere. This place has great atmosphere not too sure whether it's because of or despite all the tourist shops that surround it. To suddenly see the stupor after walking through an 'ordinary' street was breathtaking. Not a bad place to shop as there is a lot of competition to keep prices reasonable, after haggling of course

Lightness and Energy. We stayed at the Happiness Guest House in the Bodnath stupa village two times because the vibes at the stupa are just SO good. If you do stay in the stupa village, check in before 9pm; the entire place is shut down by 10pm, and you'll have to make loud noises if you want a place to sleep regardless if you made a reservation or not. It's about a 400Rs cab ride from Thamel and 300 from the Kathmandu International Airport, and we payed 1500Rs per night for accommodation. They charge 150Rs per day for non-Nepalese to enter the complex unless you tell the guard you're staying inside. The collective energy of the monks and visitors will make you feel like a happy little balloon, especially at dawn and dusk when the most people come to walk around the stupa and pray (always walk clockwise!). There are tons of shops and restaurants along the outer wall selling clothes, jewellery, art and snacks that you can bargain for. A few ragged dogs live in the stupa village that sleep all day and make aggressive sounds at night, but they seem pretty harmless otherwise. Most restaurants have wifi but the two best connections are at restaurants called Flavours and The Roadhouse. Definitely worth a day trip at the very least but we recommend spending a couple nights!
Best place to be ! . Wanna feel cool ? Be there in stupa and enjoy . Best place in kathmandu valley . Buddhist monks are very kind and appreciable there . Its an easy destination too.

The best place to be seen in Kathmandu. If you can, come here for the sunset! Monks pray and sing in nearby. If you are keen on walking, it should tae you about 60-90 minutes from Thamel and you can see "real Kathmandu" on the way.

The best in Kathmandu. Kathmandu has plenty of sites & you can easily spend a week looking at them all, but we just love Bodnath. It has a calm Bhuddist atmosphere, pedestrian only area (take notice Kathmandu) & great restaurants.

Beautiful and magical. Boudha Stupa and generally the entire area around are a wonderful experience. Once inside, there are no cars or motorcycles and the atmosphere is very peaceful. Watch pilgrims walking around the stupa, spinning the prayer mills or lighting butter candles. Absolutely magical is the late afternoon, when the sun is low.

Cool Place. Pretty cool place where you can walk around take pictures and have lunch on one of the rooftop restaurants. We visited on a beautiful sunny day with a view of the mountains in the distance. I would go here first before visiting the monkey temple as it didn't look as big as I thought it would.

Impressive. It is set in the middle of a very busy part of town. But the moment you enter the traffic free stupa environment you think you're in another world. The size of it is imposing. The colors spread across it also. Walk the circle around it and climb on it.There are hundreds of shops around it, visit them, they are interesting, but don't buy there because of the astronomic prices. Same stuff you can get much cheaper downtown.Beside the shops there are plenty of restaurants around the stupa. Each one has a roof balcony with fantastic views on the square and the stupa itself. Make sure you have a lunch or even a drink there to soak up the beauty of this place.

the eyes have it. It was pictures of Bodnath that first attracted me to Kathmandu and the reality exceeded expectations The scale of the stupa is imposing and the setting in a car free area makes it pleasant to visit The area is a real mixture of tourists and the faithful , holy sites tourist shops and restaurants but all blend together and work well alongside each other We only had an hour there - just long enough to soak in the stup and immediate surrounds but for those with more time there are other monasteries and sites to see in the neighbourhood
Tibetan Buddhism is alive here.. I got a real sense of the living tradition of Tibetan Buddhism here living naturally, side by side with the local Nepali Hindu culture.

should visit. it was just located 2-3 mins walk from my hotel. this stupa is alsways busy with tourist. has excellent restaurant around and also many shops . make sure you visit all the shops around stupa unless u make a decison to buy them .
Worth the trip. An amazing sight! Just don't get lured into purchasing the expensive tourist items without negotiating!

Budhists Temple (Stupa). It is a huge stupa dating back to realm of Emperor Ashoka in India. Must see for visitors to Kathmandu. A lot of opportunities for meditation and also mingle with locale as well as Budhist monks.

A Unique ambiente. Try to go there either very early in the morning or at about 6 p,m. because then you can watch the many devoted Tibetans doing their koras or even prostrations (inside the stupa). Stay a bit longer than the average tourist to 'inhale' the unique atmosphere of this place and sit down for lunch or dinner in one of the many restaurants with a view of the stupa.
Heart of local Buddhists.. A must see in Kathmandu. Peaceful, holy place. Colors are beautiful. See the monastery. Few too many hawkers but it is Asia after all.

Amazing. If you ever find yourself in Kathmandu, go and have a look at this stupa. It's quite a sight and has the history to go with it. For the retail therapy eskers, there are lots of souvenir shops around the site, so something for everyone!

Mingle with the local pilgrims. If you want to see Bouddha light up at night make sure you visit on the full moon night. Very interesting cultural sight, sounds (of bell ringing, chanting), and smell of incense.

Excellent Place to Visit!!!. We had Visit this plces August 2013.Drive a short distance from Kathmandu to Bodnath where you will see one of the largest stupas in Nepal. A small Tibetan settlement has developed around this important religious sight. Many Tibetan Buddhist festivals take place here, and you can visit the Tibetan monastery close by. Wonderful place to Visit here Will visit again.

Worth a visit. If one has a few days in KTM, the Bodnath Stupa is definitely worth a visit. Even if you're not into stupa's there are many shops/monasteries/cafe's for you to check out and take in the KTM breeze :)
Nice view from top.. Like this temple very much.Beautiful KTM and mount view from the temple.Many painting shops here.Walking distance from Thamel area.
Cultural experience. Wonderful place to experience the Buddhist practices, as they take place all day long. The shops were fun to explore:)
Very Large Stupa. A well kept Buddhist monument that is best appreciated by taking your time and exploring. Set in a square where you can both eat and buy souvenirs.

Wonderful to see it at last!. This, reportedly the largest stupa in the world, is an icon of Kathmandu, especially those Buddha eyes. The best views are from the shops and restaurants on the top floors around the circle, and the owners are great about allowing looks and/or photos.
Nice place to spend some time. One of the cheaper things to see in Kathmandu, you can spend 30 min or so walking around this stupa. Then spend a few hours in the area eating, drinking, and shopping.

Buddhist Haven. This Stupa is a grat place to get a taste of Buddhist culture. They are circumnavigating in prayer all day and the shops are wonderful. Have lunch on the roof top of any restaurant to take it all in.

Truly impressive. This iconic structure can take your breath away. The size and grandeur of the structure cannot fail to impress you. With the Eyes of Buddah looking down on you, you truly feel that you are in a "holy" site.
An oasis of peace. An oasis of peace and calm surrounded by shops and cafes where it is safe to have a drink. At sunset you can get a wonderful view over the city

World Heritage Site. Among the attractions in bio-diverse,culturally rich Nepal,the Bodhnath Stupa stands majestically tall.It is a great source of spiritual energy and is one of the largest and most significant Budhist monument in the world.

Not to be missed. If you visit Kathmandu this is a must see site. The stupa is surrounded by numerous shops and restaurants. It is in an area of the city that's very busy but when you walk into the area where the stupa is situated it is very quite and peaceful. There is a nice restaurant in the square where you can have a roof top meal with views of the stupa.

om mani padme hum. What a peaceful place to walk clockwise with all the boudist that are silent and quiet. The central nexus od Boudha neighbourhood in Kathmandu. The favourite place to walk along with no motorbikes or noise around. Go when the sun goes down and you can as well have a cup of coffee in on of the rooftop terraces for a different view

A must see site in Kathmandu. It is iconic and the stupa itself can be explored and walked around (clockwise) then the square itself has a lot of interesting places to visit and sit and take in the atmosphere of the place. We went with a guide and that made it more interesting as we were told about this history and some details which you may miss if you visit alone. I spent a good couple of hours here and could happily have stayed longer.

Best sightseeing. This place is the best sightseeing place in all Kathmandu. It is a wonderful sacred place of Buddhists where one can sit, meditate and not be disturbed. People throng the place at dawn and sunset, but everyone is quiet and go about their prayers. Wonderful

Iconic. Seen the photos and have now visited this huge stupa. Wonderful experience seeing it in the flesh. Walk clockwise around it and go up onto one of the roof terrace restaurants for a drink to have a really great view.

Bodnath Stupa. My understanding is the that this ancient stupa is one of the largest in the world. It is also a Unesco World Heritage site. It is definitely one of the most popular tourist sites in Kathmandu. It is a must for any tourist visiting Kathmandu.

Simply amazing. This was our second visit to Bodnath Stupa and we were wondering if it would make the same impression on us as it did the first time, 7 years ago. And yes, it did. It just is so grand and majestetic. We enjoyed also watching the Tibetan pilgrims making their rounds around the stupa over and over again. Of course there are also street vendors trying to make a buck, but that is not surprising knowing the amount of tourists visiting the stupa every day. They did not bother us. And one cannot forget the music coming from the shops - well, you heard it everywhere - the Tibetan music and Om ma ni pad me hum -chants - but here the music really added to the overall experience.

Stupa greatness. Bodnath stupa is definitely one of the best stupa in Nepal without a doubt. It tours over the entire piazza (the whole area reminds me of an italian piazza) but with a Nepalese feel.A lot of devotees were walking around the stupa and chanting when we were there. There were also people meditating around the stupa. There are enough touristy shops around if shopping is what you're after here. Although the highlight would definitely be the stupa itself. There is an entrance fee of 200 rupees and you're given a pamphlet to read about the stupa.Definitely worth visiting!

Not so buddhistic anymore.. Boudhanath is one of the wolrd's largest buddhistic monuments and has been a destination to almost every pilgrim in Nepal. When Tibetan borders were still open, it was a blessingspot for most of the merchants and travelers. It has a lot of legends and myths around it and buddhist monks cover the area. Though almost everything around the stupa is now commercialised. There's thousands of annoying merchants trying to sell you exactly the same goods, tons of taxi drivers waiting for you at the gate, beggars etc. Even some of the monks tie a wristband for you, only to charge you 100 rupees. So the inner peace is not reflecting anywhere from here... But still, go take a look, it is still huge with Buddha eyes staring at you :)

Biggest Stupa. This place is very interesting. The stupa is the biggest one in Nepal and beautiful. It is worth to spend time walking clockwise. While walking, you could learn the way of local people respect to Buddha. Also, you could explore to the tibetan culture as the stupa is surrounded by the tibetan style buildings and temples. The taxi fare from hotel (Rama Inn ; 15 min walk from Thamel) is 500 Rs (Oct 2013). Anyway, I believe we should get a little bit lower if we negotiated. I didn't negotiate at that time coz it was our time to call taxi in Kathmandu so we had no idea about the taxi fare.

A must see!. Give a little extra time for your visit,as sitting on the temple soaking up the atmosphere is worth it.And the best time to visit is around sunset, as the sky against the stupa and flags is beautful.
Bodnath Stupa. It was this HUGE stupa in the middle of Kathmandu and very special! Very interesting and highly recommended

if you're visiting kathmandu, get a hotel nearby this. probably the cosiest spot of the city despite the amount of tourists, it's a fun and safe place to walk around. discovering all the little bars and terraces is a joy, everything's pretty cheap and tastes pretty good. loved watching hideously traditionally dressed western people make stupid pictures on the stupa whilst slurping my blackberry lemonade. also om mani padme hum all day every day
Beautiful and Serene. Worth the 500 ruppe taxi fare - beautiful and vehicle free - a real bonusLots of cafes with free wifi

Great Experience, Albeit a Tad Touristic. Large and mesmerizing, the Boudhanath is great because visitors are also allowed to climb to the base. We came in the morning, and it's busy, but not too crowded. There were still chances to get good pictures with not so many other people around us. I was informed that Boudha was also home for Tibetan refugees. There's a lot of Tibetans wearing traditional costumes. The temples around the stupa were also gorgeous. The surrounding is very touristy. We also met a Tibetan gentleman who started off being nice, and ended telling us how his old mother was very sick and he did not have the money to buy medicines. Well, us travellers could help in some other, wiser, ways, I believe.

Beautiful, magnificent Buddhist temple. This temple is absolutely beautiful. The people are kind, and the whole place just has such a vibrant energy. Can be a deep meditative space. Must go if you go to Nepal!

A fascinating insight into another religion. An amazing very old Stupa which has a rich history and where you can feel the emotion of the building. You need to take your time in walking round it (clockwise) and you do not realise that inside the walls it is angular. A fascinating experience.
Still after many visits. Eric Weiner, NYT author, says this is the thinnest place in the world. A place where heaven and earth come closest together. Each time I visit, my experience deepens.

Tibet in Kathmandu. Go about 4pm and join, or watch those walking round the stupa, turning the prayer wheels. It is colourful, interesting and while you watch what is happening, you in turn are watched by the eyes of Buddha looking down from the stupa.

A quick trip and a must-see while in Ktm!. This is a great place to go for a short trip (or a longer one) depending on how much time you have. It's beautiful and is one of the holiest Buddhist sites. It's really a must-see and can be done even if you don't have a lot of time while in Kathmandu.
Fabulous. I loved wandering around this area, the stupa is amazing and the whole area is clean and fascinating

One of Nepal's holiest places. Boudhanath is one of the holiest Buddhist sites in Nepal and one of the largest stupas in the world. It’s located on what was a major trade route between Nepal and Tibet and was used by traveling merchants as a resting place. In 1979, it was given UNESCO World Heritage status. The stupa is surrounded by dozens of Tibetan handcraft shops and lots of restaurants and cafés, many with rooftop gardens. It’s great to sit up in one of cafés and watch the world go by below. Boudanath is a fascinating place, very spiritual and serene after the chaos of the city. This is a ‘must see’ in Kathmandu.

go in the early a.m.. Early in the morning, before the tourists arrive by the busload, is a wonderful time to visit the Stupa -- you'll be less rushed, get a better feel of the religious function of the site, and will be able to linger to take photos or see things close-up.

so peacefull. there aren’t so many things to say. This place must to be visited. So peaceful, so colorful, so full of people. One of the best place I saw in Nepal. You must go also if you must pay a ticket... but it is the bigger stupa in all over the world.
Very impressive!. Must see place, nothing more to say.Entrance fee 150 rp per person.Many budhist temples around the stupa, we got lucky and spoted monks praying. Awesome!

One of the icon of Nepal. Located near central Kathmandu. We took the city tour to get there. Nice cafes and restaurant around the stupa. Exchange shops are also available nearby. This attraction is a must for the first-time-traveller to Kathmandu.
Marvelous atmosphere. Wandering around the perimeter, climbing up to a higher level, and watching the surrounding activities, is relaxing and enjoyable.

What to see in Kathmandu if you miss this..... History, religion, peace and the culture of Nepal in one place. Kathmandu is a dirty, crowded city. When you enter this place you suddenly see the change of environment into a peaceful place. The history goes back to more than 2000 years and you can see the Buddhist architecture, influenced by Hindu culture...

Peaceful. This is well-worth seeing and spending some time taking it all in from one of the rooftop restaurants surrounding the stupa. You will actually be able to think clearly without the usual noise of traffic that besieges so much of Kathmandu.

Wonderfully peaceful, tranquil stupa.. Set in a square surrounded by the usual Tibetan-style curio shops, the stupa towers over everything with a be-calming tranquility. Prayer flags flutter in the wind and Tibetan incantations waft over you from the surrounding music shops. It's a great place to linger and soak in the atmosphere. Head for one of the roof-top cafés to complete the experience.

Not to miss. This stupa is magnificent, the second bigger in Nepal. Don't miss it!
Entrance to walk on it is free, you just have to pay the fee to enter Bodnath (500 Rs per person).
In front of the entrance, near the bell, there's a stair from which you can reach a balcony with a great view of the stupa.

The stupa is in the center of a circular avenue. It's about a $3 taxi ride from Thamel to Boudhanath. The first time I went, the taxi stopped on a city street and I couldn't see where I was until the driver pointed out the entrance. The stupa is in the center of a circular avenue which is about 30 meters wide. On the outside of the circle is a wall of shops, cafes, temples, and hotels so that while you circumambulate the stupa you can also window shop or take breaks for real shopping. You can also enter the stupa area proper and walk around on the stupa itself. There are benches here and there, in the middle of the avenue, where you can sit and feed the pigeons or take photos of monks and other devotees. It's a relatively quiet and worshipful area separate from the general Katmandu chaos.

Beautiful courtyard stupa, with excellent views. The stupa is huge, and beautifully decorated with prayer flags, flowers, lights and greenery. Surrounded by shops, the courtyard is a quiet destination in a chaotic corner of the city - the shops are fairly priced and tended by non-aggressive personnel. There are mountain views visible from the rooftops. A lovely place to visit.

Love this place. A mixture of spirituality and commercialism but one has to go there to witness the devotion of the pilgrims as they walk around the stupa turning the prayer wheels as they go. Great place to sit and people watch.

Amazing. I've been to Tibet and many Tibetan parts of China, and this was a really relaxing activity, particularly after the overwhelming impact Pashupatinath had on me a short while before. Even in the rain I walked around and around with the pilgrims until I lost count. Lots of decent and bad shops alike littering the lining, but it's all about the sights sound smells and people there. Don't miss it.

Just have to visit here, it's a must !. Difficult to find the entrance to the square, so ask the taxi driver to drop you at the entrance. Make sure you walk round "clockwise" !! And after you're finished, end up With coffe or lunch at one of the rooftop restaurants. Perhaps Roadhouse Cafe where we havd an excellent beer and pizza 1

One of the worlds largest Buddhist stupas. Also known as little Tibet settled by Tibetan refugees circumambulating with innumerable shops selling Tibetan handicraft , Jewellery , Thankas and carpets.We loved the atmosphere, going to different Buddhist monasteries, pigeons for kids and monks and tourists! We went to different shops but we were not able to buy anything in the area because of the high prices compared to different shops in Kathmandu - highly touristic area. Of course, shopping could be an option for most of the tourists!Great fun for the family - lots to do at small fee!
A must see in Kathmandu. Beautiful place to visit, lots going on and lots to see around here, i particularly like all the rooftop cafes where you can get great views of the Stupa
don't miss it. Magical place, not far from city center. Take tempo number 2 and you'll get there in 20 minutes for just 20 rupees.

Dont miss Bodnath Stupa. This is a place to visit. The stupa is beautiful. There are plenty of things to see I visited an art school which I purchased a Thanka painted by a master. The work is amazing. Great restaurant looking over the Stupa. Fresh MO MOs yummy. Well worth a look

Enormous. Well worth seeing. It was fascinating to see all the pilgrims praying and using the prayer wheels. We had lunch overlooking the Stupa and watched daily life going on three floors below us as we ate a typical Nepalese lunch.
great. It is beautiful and with very active community life to observe. We saw ritaul white / orange washing of the dome. Go early in the morning to see active worshipping.

Impressive!. It's very big and cleaner than I've expected after walking around Kathmandu for 4 days. It's a really impressive temple under the blue sky, the shops surrounding were also nice and great for sipping a cup of coffee and sitting there looking out to see people walking around the temple, really NICE!!!I went there by local transport, don't know it's called tem-po or something, it's a small car which everyone could get on although it's already full. I took it on the way to city bus park, it could be seen easily where it is or you can ask locals around there, they'd tell you the way. It cost only 15-25 rupees one way, that's really cheap compared to taxi which will cost you around 300 rupees. Besides, I think it's really good way to know more about how local people live, and talking to local is a really good thing to do in this city. ^^

A Serene Place hidden in the Chaos of Kathmandu. Its a great stupa, with interesting shops filling the outer range of the stupa. An interesting place to sit down, sip some coffee and watch the world goes by.
Bodnath Stupa. Very impressive. Shops are really nice. Beware of con men though! Visit the Thangka studio to see the art being made.

Boudhanath Stupa very Beautyfull and impressive. I visited again on october 23 th, on my birthdayI noticed there was also lot of restoration on the houses going on and also sidewalk improved a lot.Lots of restaurants and shops around the Boudhanath StupaDon t forget to go into some other streets around and after the StupaVery interesting and impressiveI m sure you like it.

Fantastic!. One of the most awesome places I've ever experienced! Went here 3 different times and each time was great. From the spiritual of sitting with chanting monks to the entertaining as I watched a Bollywood movie being filmed here. The shops were nice without the hustle but the best experience was circling the stupa with the crowds and spinning the prayer wheels. A must see if you are in Kathmandu!

excellent views!! beware of steps~. if im not wrong, I read from somewhere that there are total 365 steps. but if you are trekking in Nepal, then this is nothing really. along the way up, there will be some people selling their items, its really nice to see them making them right away. mostly, they will ask you to buy. at the top, the view is awesome!! and you will see lots of birds (vultures; eagles) flying around, and they are huge. the temple is really big, its worth climbing up the steps :)

Important place in Katmandu to see. Very nice place, an enchanting experience having a quite environment...The handicraft shops around were managed by people that did not try tu pull you in or trick you with insane prices.

Must see. Beautiful and lots to do nearby. Its quite a site and if you come during the early evening it is even prettier. Be sure to walk around it clockwise and check out the good shops and dining nearby. You'll pay a little more at the shops but there is a great selection of things.

some peace and quiet at last. The stupa itself was impressive, watching people meditating around it was not bad. For a change it was nice to get out of the crazy Kathmandu traffic and crowded streets (20 min of taxi and 700Rs away :) ) and find ourselves in a quiet and friendly environment, where everyone was just minding their own business turning around the stupa. The handicraft shops around were managed by people that did not try tu pull you in or trick you with insane prices. Almost like in Europe. We entered 2 gompas, they were amazingly beautiful. Overall, it really felt like a mouthful of fresh air!
good walk and interesting temple.. very interesting look of temple, and there are a lot of restaurants and cafe there you can have lunch or ejoy the view of the temple.:)
Worth the visit. Just an amazing place to visit. It's worth to spend the night and be awaken early in the morning by the chanting moks in the monastery.

much better in person. this place is much more impressive in person than in photos. we allocated an hour but should have had 2-3 in order to cover the surrounding shops at a leisurely pace and sit in at the monastery. i was taken by the atmosphere -- the soothing music, the incense and the service by the Buddhist monk. we took a cab and he waited for us so we had to hurry on to the monkey temple. otherwise, we would have stayed and enjoyed the peace and spirit of this place.
must go place. road is a bit hectic but as you reach this place, you will like it. best time is to go in the morning. a real lots of people come here and worship.

peace & calm in to your mind, sule,,. The stupa is looks wonderful,its hasale free place among all in kathmandu we must thanks to managmeant teems,,clean very peacefull place, slow tibetan music give pleasent & happy,we see more tibetan in Budhanath then Lhasa, i bet,early morning around 8& 9 afternoon 3& 4 thire pray time making left to right hand one by one touching praywhil, sorounded stupa,,if tourist missd this stupa he missed Nepal.

Hidden Buddhist Gem. Hidden down a side street and a strange mixture of tourist kitsch and a wonderful 14th century stupa.Lovely chilled out people. Have to say that as an atheist,Tibetan Buddhism can teach the Abrahamic religions much about toleration and peace.Brissie Dave  .
Excellent Iconic Buddhist Stupa - Fabulous. Fabulous iconic stupa that remains hidden from the main road. However beware this is a tourist trap!A definite 'must see' when in Kathmandu
Spectacular stupa. The most stupa in all of Nepal we had a wonderful view while eating lunch at the square couldn't stop taking picks of the eyes that are painted on it

its a stupa. we enjoyed visiting all the little shops selling tibetean and buddhist crafts and paintings which encircle the Stupa. As far as Stupas go in other parts of India, and Far east, this one is not architecturally so stunning, but it is of great significance for Buddhists and certainly worth a visit. Its in a very conjested part of Kathmandu, so try getting there early before traffic picks up.

Great vibes despite the surrounding touristy shops. Fascinating paradox of the material and the spiritual side by side. In the centre is Boudanath Stupa with devotees praying and tourists clicking away their cameras. Surrounding the stupa was a circle of shops and restaurants catering to tourists; however you shld visit the small but beautifully decorated temple in the midst of the shops; you'll find Tibetan priests inside; if you make a donation, no matter how small, they'll pray for you and give you a blessing.

A must see in Kathmandu. I choose to walk there across the city. And it was a pretty good idea as you get to see the normal parts of the city that are not touristy. The place itself is awesome, despite the fact that the tourism business is taking over the spiritual idea of this place, the locals and the Buddhist monks will make up for it. You want to walk around ( anti clockwise ) and spin all the bells. You want to walk up to the Buddhist Temple and get a blessing by a monk. As from all of Nepal Kathmandu was in my opinion the worst, this place and few others are worth all the India-like experience that you don't get in other places in Nepal.

Interesting with guide. I saw then through an official guide and it was really interesting and fascinating to be told about the culture and religion related to the Stupa. I am not sure it would be as interesting without a guide and explanation.

Unique area. The area is a very unique area. Budnath Stupa is a very special area in the middle of the city. There are very unique shops, cafés, restaurant and cultural store. Many of restaurants are on rooftops and present unique views of the valley.

Nice place.whole kathmandu city view we enjoyed from this place.. Bodnath stupa very nice place.on that day many tourist liked this place.we round ed stupa.shops and art gift centers. We prayed for peace world and harmony.Nepalis are cooperative and informative and friendly in nature. That is why tourism developed here.

Represents a town square. Bodnath Stupa is known for its grandeur. So imposing is the structure that one stands in awe. What I liked about the place was the life around it, row of shops and rooftop restaurants. Thunga paintings, little artifacts, clothes, trekking gear, you name it and it is there. You can see hoards of tourists strolling around doing window shopping. The rooftop restaurants that dot the stupa are no less attractive. Food is a tardy expensive but with the awesome view of the stupa and the himalayas in the background no one complains.
Largest Stupa.. I understand Tibetan Buddhism in detail. And, I can watch the largest Stupa.A lot of photographs come out while walking slowly because it is wide

Wonderful area to walk and shop. I went here twice during my stay in Kathmandu. It was a quiet oasis with nice restaurants and shopping and the Stupa was interesting to walk around. It was a great place for people watching.

Bouda. Bouda stupa is very old, have an imposing and grand desig. Have an genuine tibetan atmosphere. If you are looking for thangkas, tibetan religious paintings, this is a good place to get them. It´s a must for every visitor to Kathmandu!

Bodnath Stupa - a must in Kathmandu. I have been in Kathmandu 4 times on my way to trekking. Every time, even if I had only a few hours, I have to visit Bodnath Stupa. I think it is a special atmosphere around which draws me there, especially in the late afternoon with all pilgrims going around and peaceful Tibetan music coming from music shops. Good place to contemplate and a nice, calm place for a meal and drink in contrast to the busy and air polluted Thamel. One warning, If you go by taxi from the city and already decided fare for the trip then some taxi drivers try stopping about 10 min earlier at the "small stupa" making impression that it is the Bodnath Stupa!

Definitely worth visiting... It is nice to be away from the centre of Kathmandu and see the Stupa and worshippers who come from the local area. There is a peacefulness that waifs through the area and captures you and makes you want to learn more about this place and the surrounding area.Met some visitors from other countries and talked about the homey accommodations they stayed in nearby.Good place for coffee or tea and walking...I am happy to have visited and would recommend it.

Nothing Special. This a very important area for Hindus to visit. However, there are vendors everywhere along with lots of tourists. I didn't get the feeling that I was on a very religious site for Hindus. The highlight of the trip was seeing monks conducting a religious ceremony. (15 seconds)
well worth the visit. brilliant place to experience the Buddhist culture . nice place to sit in the any of the restaurants and watch the world go by . well worth the visit

Don't dare to miss it. This is the most relaxing place in the suoer busy city of Kathmandu. From Thamel you can take a taxi( 300 Rp each way) to get there and expend some our soaking the Tibetean atmosphere. Take your time and enjoy the fulfilling experience of being there

Bodnath Stupa. What a delightful place to spend the morning. Have a cup of tea on any one of the second floor restaurants and relax and watch the life happen inside this beautiful holy site. It's a great place to visit.

Tibetan buddhist monument - a unique experience in Kathmandu. After visiting the Durbar Squares, this Buddhist site was a totally different cultural experience. Very interesting observing the pilgrims and their clockwise rotations around the monument (eyes on every corner and thanka flags adorn the place)
Good to see. Nothing special for seeing, but must for religious purpose. I went there with my son, wife and mother. Plz don't buy anything from there as the shopkeeper will charge very higher price.
Must see place in Kathmandu. even though all places charge expensive entrance fees it's worth while every dollar spent mystical and spiritual you feel great when you leave..........

Boudnath Stupa. Boudnath Stupa and the surrounding monasteries is a place where you can spend many days or weeks in Kathmandu. If you only have a day to spare, visit the stupa early in the morning or later in the evening and walk with the local Nepali and Tibetan people as they circumabulate clockwise around the stupa offering prayers, lighting candles and meeting friends. Boudnath Stupa is one two main Buddhist areas in Kathmandu, and is home to many Tibetan, Sherpa, Tamang and Gurung people as well as many other Nepali people. Walk out of the stupa area to visit one of the many monasteries in the area - each one with different traditions - all welcome visitors to sit in on a puja (prayer ceremony) when they are on. Go up the lanes to leave the stupa area and you will find lots of little shops and cafes which cater for the local people. Ask someone to show you the way to walk from Boudnath to Kopan Monastery, high up on a high about half an hour's walk to the north. Boudnath Stupa is 'heaven' on earth in the chaos of Kathmandu - a peaceful, clean and special place which is a must to visit when you are in Kathmandu.

bodnath - definitely a place to visit. there are so many inspiring and impressive places to visit in Kathmandu, but the stupa at Bodnath is a must. Its a sight to see, walk on and around and marvel at what it means to the thousands of Buddhists and others who make the journey here. Visit the shops or even stay in a small hotel nearby to relish the atmosphere of the place at different times of day and night.

Buddhanath Stupa. Buddhanath Stupa is one of the major focal point for Buddhist pilgrimage in Kathmandu which also into the World Heritage Site, It looms 36 meters high and presents one of the most fascinating specimens of stupa design. There are more than 45 Buddhist monasteries in the area. We can see many Tibetan influence as Tibetan Refugees came in 1950’s and stayed near buddhanath. This awesome place gives very relaxing & it is more to read about the Buddhist.
Awesome!. A beautiful, peaceful and enlightening place. I spun every prayer wheel I could find here and prayed for all of my loved ones.

Nice Stupa. Lots of tourist shops around the Stupa, a lot of them sell oil paintings that are highly detailed which we loved. They range from low to high quality so it's worth it to spend a bit more for the clearer and more precise ones.
