The Stupa iteself is surrounded by locals, monks in robes and tourists which was fun to watch.

Devine. Very impressive.Very relaxed and peaceful...........unlike the Indian temple Pashupatinath Temple where there is pushing and rushing. At Bodnath you can also take photos, which you cannot do at Pashupatinath.

Nice stupa. I'm glad we made it to the stupa. It was a great break from Thamel and worth the taxi ride. If you're sightseeing you might as well add this to the itinerary. Cleaner than the monkey temple and nicer vibe but I do love monkeys so I'm glad I saw both.

Feel the Energy. My wife and I prefer to stay in Boudha when visiting Nepal. Much quieter, calmer and cleanerthan Thamel district in Kathmandu. The many monasteries and nunneries enhance the spiritof the Great Stupa and spending time (more than one day), allows you to slow down and opento the experience. Pilgrims walking Koras and prostrating, monks chanting, and pujas combine tocalm the mind and open your heart. Food and shopping is better in Thamel, just a 15-minute busor taxi ride away. Walking around the Stupa's many roads and alleys is a wonderful way to spend a day or two.

Interesting. Worth a visit. The Bodnath Stupa is worth a visit. There are delightful shops surrounding the temple and we purchased a beautiful oil painting from one of the local stores. It is interesting to compare the living history of Hinduism and Buddhism within Kathmandu.
Little Tibet. The Stupa is impressive. Around are many little shops where you can buy handycraft. The restaurants offer good views and food.

Largest stupa. it was one of the largest stupa, which i have had in my traveling career. when i been there, chanting of Buddhists mantras made me so spellbound. I found t the real peace environment over there.
Amazing. One of the most beatifull place in Kathmandu! Amazing experience and I just love the atmosphere! I would recomande a visit.

BUDDHA'S EYES. the legend says that long long ago a pious woman asked to a king so much land that she could cover with a buffalo skin.the skin agreed,so the clever woman sliced the skin in so slim slices and cover so much land that she could build the stupa upon it.Boudhanath stupa is the largest of its kind,and one of the most beautiful.for the tibetans is one of the most holy places in the birthland of Buddha since centuries.the care of the stupa ha always been a duty for them,and many tibetans live in the area.for the tourists this is also known as "little Tibet",but the stuoa is a perfect work of newari art,and in the small chapel at the main entrance is possible to see the newari priests,even if the devotees touring around the holy monument are almost all tibetans.the sight of the devotion ,especially in the evening,is wonderful and touching.around the stupa there are interesting shops,now mostly overpriced or selling cheap stuff made in China,and nice small restaurants.during the full moon nights and festivals the stupa is surrounded by small oil lamps ,the lights and the chanting of the mantras make a magic esperience.

Great Experience. This world heritage site is worth the time to visit. It is like an oasis in the middle of the hustle & bustle of a very busy Kathmandu. Suggest also visiting the Buddhist Thanka Centre which is one of the many places that encircles this famous Buddhist Stupa. One can see how these special artworks are made by the masters ... quite fascinating to see the dedication and patience involved.

Must see, must do. you must see the Stupa and do the walk around it. it is relatively quiet compared to the rest of the city and there are many lovely shops around the stupa, some playing chants. You definitely get drawn into this atmosphere. There are some smaller temples around the plaza worth seeing as well. You can spend quite a bit of time here: contemplating, shopping, seeing, believing.

Well worth spending a few hours here. I really enjoy this lovely temple. I expect that the best times to see it is early morning and late evening - when the lighting is gentler. I missed the full moon which would have been wonderful. I went in the middle of the day and it was still worthwhile. I recommend spending at least 2 hours here – time to walk around the temple, explore some the of the small stalls and also to take the time to enjoy one of the rooftop cafes. Sitting at one of these cafes allows you a quiet moment just to enjoy the temple and surrounding s. I had my taxi wait for me so took a round trip from my hotel to the temple. exploring the store is also very pleasant

good to start Kathmandu. It's a small oase of quiet , calm place in the busy and noisy city of Kathmandu. Go to the roof terrace of the Padma Hotel to drink a tea and have a nice view on the Stupa and the people around

Great experience. Only 10 minute walk from our hotel, we walked to the Stupa in the late afternoon where all the monks and locals were singing and praying. Surrounded by local markets we really enjoyed visiting.

Symbol of Peace and Harmony. Boudhanath stupa is only 10 minutes drive and 5km from the main tourist area (Thamel) and it is is historic and amazing site which also presents rich Buddhist culture and urge everyone to visit this place while you are in Kathmandu. When you reach this site you will find peace within yourself and enjoy the great view of the stupa and the local shops...

Top sightseeing. Do not miss at any cost. Go with someone who can explain the richness of the Buddhist culture and you will have the time of your life. The monument is astounding, a white gem with beautiful wind flags as ornament. We are acutally thinking to reside around here in our way back. There is plenty of hotels and guest houses.

A must see while you are in Kathmandu. A great place to learn about the Tibetan culture especially buddhism. Entrance fee is just 150 ruppees. There are many shops and restaurants around.Try to get there late in the afternoon to see beautiful sunset at the Stupa
peace and relax. when ever i get upset or stress on work, i go to bouddhanath, i feel peace and relax there, In the evening is my favorite time when they make fire lamp around the sputa.
must viit. travel agents generally do not add this in your itinary, insist them or you go own your own, hire a taxi, bargain,and pay.
Arrange a guide. There's so much going on here-particularly early in the day. To get an understading, we should have hired a guide. Well worth the visit

Serene place. I arrived in Kathmandu in the afternoon and headed straight to Boudnath Stupa. It was the second day of Lhosar or Tibetan new year. All Tibetan guys and girls were dressed up and gathering around the stupa. Mixed in to the crowd circulating the stupa was an other-worldly experience for me. The time seemingly ticks different here.The less exciting part is the dusty road oh the way to this place and occasionally some kids will asked money from you. I just refused boldly and eventually just ignore them. The local adults would scold the kids when they get persistent.

Magical place. My favorite place in Nepal, and in the top 3 of my favorite places in the world. I have been to Nepal twice and spent most of my time volunteering in Kathmandu. I went to Bodnath at least once a week. I could stay there for hours. It is such a magical, relaxing and peaceful place. People praying and walking around the stupa. You hear relaxing music from the little stores and if you are lucky monks praying. There are a lot of restaurants and little stores. It is great to go to one of the roof top restaurants and enjoy the magnificent view.

Fantastic place. Great place to see a bit of Tibetan culture. Could have sat and people watched for hours. Go to one of the rooftop restaurants for sunset and hope for a awesome lightening storm in the distance like we had.

Little Tibet in Kathmandu.. Great place to visit. Allot of history restaurants shops.The 3rd largest Stupa in the world.. its huge.Lunch at Boudhas Kitchen a must.. and free wifi of course. youl spend and hour or 2 there for sure.We enjoyed ourselves very much!
Nepal culture at its best. Absolutely awe-inspiring, beautiful landmark you can't miss.Out of all the stupas in Nepal, I'd say if you can only see one, this should be it.

A large stupa hemmed in between small stores. A great place to observe worshippers walk around the and run the prayer wheels. Park yourself with a 200 mm zoom and you're guaranteed great shots. A 14-24 lens works well here too.

Big Stupa. This is a really big stupa with a thriving Tibetan community around it. There are excellent shops selling a range of clothing, artefacts and jewellery. The area is quite clean and well ordered with all pilgrims circling one way. There is a small admission charge, well worth it. We came here at around 3 p.m. We were welcomed by friendly monks, were given tea and soup and listened to their afternoon prayers.

Majestically stunning. Each place of worship/beliefs has it own beauty, and this is 1 place which I really felt it has the overwhelming beauty, and wished I would have time to see it at night as well!

great stupa. my request to the management of TripAdvisor.............Please change the name from Bodnath to Boudhanath Stupa which is locally and officially recognized name. History might be anything but now it is known as "Boudhanath Stupa'. Name must be correct...what do you say?

Early morning Bodnath. Best visit early morning when the locals do their rounds before getting off to work. When the coffee shop opens up, have your coffee there, it's near where they feed the pigeons handful of corn, you may be lucky to witness the painting of the stupa or notice on another day that the pigeons peg away the green algae which collects on the stupa overnight. By 10:00 in the morning the pigeons have cleaned the whole stupa back to white again, remarkable sight!But once in a while the whole stupa is painted, a great sight as well, I was lucky to film the whole process when I got there one fine morning. You may check this out on YouTube in November 2013.Willem Rieder

Good spot. Cute shops, interesting temple, and good restaurants in the area. Pick a roof terrace cafe for a lovely breeze and try one of the set lunches! Won't take long to get through. Be sure to check out the monastery, singing bowl makers, and the paintings. Tourist prices, expect to negotiate.

High climb to history. Be prepared to climb steep stairs. Tons of people selling jewelry, stone carvings or souvenirs. You pay at the top. Monkeys were hilarious on the way up. A ton of cute babies. Very pretty architecture and religous site. People selling water. Monkeys all around to watch.

“Very Nice place”. We came here at around 3 p.m. We walked around shopped a bit and visited a buddhist centre on the south side on the firtst floor. We were welcomed by friendly monks, were given tea and soup and listened to their afternoon prayers. We had dinner just outside near northwest exitt. There was a small local restaurant where many monks had dinner and watched tv. Back to stupa which was nicely lit and filled with a lot less tourists. Many people were praying and their was a nice athmosphere.
Great Heritage. Must see place in Kathmandu. We reached in the afternoon, and it was nice to see the local community. check out the shops on the street.

A must see when in Kathmandu. This is a really big stupa with a thriving Tibetan community around it. There are excellent shops selling a range of clothing, artefacts and jewellery. The area is quite clean and well ordered with all pilgrims circling one way. There is a small admission charge, well worth it.

Nice place. We came here at around 3 p.m. We walked around shopped a bit and visited a buddhist centre on the south side on the firtst floor. We were welcomed by friendly monks, were given tea and soup and listened to their afternoon prayers. We had dinner just outside near northwest exitt. There was a small local restaurant where many monks had dinner and watched tv. Back to stupa which was nicely lit and filled with a lot less tourists. Many people were praying and their was a nice athmosphere.

It's so beautiful~. Truly a crown jewel of Nepal. An amazing sight and a must visit, do go if you can! It's cheap to get in 150 rupees I remember, so basically pennies! It's astonishing and I cannot summon words to do the place justice. GO GO GO! Also, cabs from Thamel should be about 350-400 so don't let the cabbies overcharge you- make a good bargain!
Great work of an architecture!. An excellent architecture with the Mandala shaped stupa. The Biggest stupa of the world with the Tibetan environment.

Very disappointed. As with most sacred attractions in Kathmandu it is not maintained or very clean. It's very sad that this Stupa along with many other places in Kathmandu have gone to waste along with their culture.

Something to experience rather than to describe. One of my favourite places in Kathmandu! You can climb the stupa and walk around on different levels and get different views of the location. As soon as you get through the gate that separates the chaos and noise of Kathmandu from the peace around this enormous building, you realize the visit is worthwhile. The area around it is pedestrianized. I loved those watchful eyes of Buddha’s (that attract you), the blessings, the smell of incense, the brightly coloured Tibetan dresses, the flags around the stupa, the guest houses, the restaurants & the souvenir shops around. All your senses are assailed and overwhelmed by the experience!Walk around the stupa (clockwise of course!!). Enjoy Tibetan people walking kora (peregrination) turning the prayer wheels around the perimeter. Witness devoted religious people meditating and praying to the stupa. Admire all the little Nepali flags blowing in the wind. Listen to the soothing music coming from the Buddhist singing school. Turn the great prayer wheels. Experience this ancient monument and its Medieval feel! One could just stare at the Stupa for hours and watch the world go by. Peaceful, enriching, relaxing, profoundly spiritual for people of all faiths. Good place to see something of the Buddhist culture of Nepal.This World Heritage Site is something to experience for yourself rather than to describe (as pictures don't do justice to this attraction). Foreigners must pay admission fee.A one of a kind experience! Well worth a visit. Very enjoyable. A spiritual and magical place, ideal to meditate and thank Nepal for places like this! An absolute must for spiritual seekers.

peace circle. just circle around Bodnath Stupa and you will find what is peace.really it has peaceful environment which is greate palce to go. shops and colourful buildings are plus attraction of this place.

A historic place with a wonder .. Its an amazing place in the busy streets of Kathmandu. you enter the temple complex and you are taken to a different world. You need a whole day to explore the whole place...

Great area as well as the stupa itself. As you walk around the perimeter of the stupa (clockwise of course!!) you walk past shops and colourful buildings so the whole environment is great. At the far end is a monastery you can enter and it's ok to photograph inside. Good people watching as the Tibetan people walk around with their prayer wheels and turning the prayer wheels around the perimeter.

Really cool experience. A really peaceful place, and beautiful temple, even though it's touristy around it, it is wonderful to witness very devoted religious people meditating and all the little Nepali flags blowing in the wind. It really hits you that you're in Nepal

have to see. you have to see this temple but first of all you have to read more about to know what it means the sad thing is it surrounded by so many shops that you can find in all over Nepal i didn't like that bcz it's suppose to be a prayer place not a market place

In Awe.... This place is just so amazing. Your senses are overwhelmed by the experience. The size of the stupa is stunning. The ambience around it is also very friendly, welcoming, and colorful. A one of a kind experience!

Lovely place to visit day or evening. In the evening candles are lit all around the stupa for the faithful using the prayer wheels. There is a lovely family atmosphere and the smell of incense. Buddhist monks do the circuit along with regular people. The Paradise Restaurant on a rooftop of the square is a great place to watch the festivities while enjoying a drink or meal.

Feeling Buddha, with Calmness. This is a incredible place. Not crowdy most of the time and days of the year as it is traditionally run by Tibetan Buddhists. The restaurants around the stupa but inside the main area have good scenic view of the Stupa and the mountains near the valley.

Powerful place. Go there,experience it for yourself.The blessings,the smell of incense,the brightly colored Tibetan dresses,the Pigeons,the dogs,the shops,the people. I could go on but I won't.Go early morning to see masses people doing Kora and go again in the evening when the stupa is lit up with thousands of butter lamps.Explore the shops where you'll find lots of lovely gifts and dharma items as well as antiques if you know what you're looking for.

The largest stupa in Asia. This is a very colourful place to go. The shops surrounding the site are brightly coloured, their wares are brightly coloured and the flags around the stupa are primary colours. Music and incense were all aroundso all your senses are assailed! It's certainly worth a trip if only for the sheer size .
love it!!. It was such a serene place to sit and have milk tea. One could just stared at the Stupa for hours and watch the world go by/

Tibetan Buddhist Stupa. The stupa is situated within a confinement of houses & shops. Has a few Buddhist monastery in the surrounding. In addition there are several guest houses, restaurants & quite many souvenir shops around. During good weather in the morning during winter, could get a view of snow mountain peaks from the higher tier of the stupa. Beware of pigeon droppings, bombs away.....Very close walk from the back of Hyatt Regency. Foreigners must pay admission fee.

Touristic place with mix of commerce and history. The stuba itself is very nice and really enjoyable. The bad thing is that it's just another place that is crowdy and prices are not realistic for the quality you get there. Of course - there are some nice restaurants - but mostly just with international food - so the origin is really missing - it's more or less a commerce place where tourist should pay for everything a to high price.

Beautiful. I visited this large stupa with its watchful eyes and found it well kept and very accessible. There were several temples in the area which you can visit and I was given a special blessing by a Buddhest priest in one temple. You can climb the stupa and walk around on different levels and get different views of the location. Given that it is only one stupa the visit is relatively short.

could be cleaner. the roads are in a bad condition at the moment so it was a bumpy ride there. the surroundings were very dirty. a little more care could be taken towards getting rid of all the waste where the people enter into the upper portion of the stupa. worth a visit if you have time
its nice and historical place to visit.. if you have time , spend some time there in some quite place and enjoy the Buddhist spirituality with some tea,

Without a doubt, must see!!. Very impressive stupa with a nice restaurant area around. Enjoy the view of the stupa and people walking around it. As a day trip you can combine Bodnath with Pasputinath and walk from one to another.
Wonderful. One of my favourite places in Kathmandu. Lovely to sit and just people watch at any time of the day. Some lovely rooftop terrace restaurants to eat at.

Peace, quite, and Buddhist music. The best way to describe this place is as an 'experience' rather than a brick and mortar place. Nothing much extraordinary here if you look at only the stupa. But take some time to delve into the experience you see the extraordinary. read the story on the internet of how this land was allotted to the old poultry woman and you understand better the belief systems at work here. Watch the devout pray to the stupa, do grueling sit ups of sorts while chanting their prayers. And listen to the soothing music wafting from the Buddhist singing school in the compound.

#1 Tourist attraction in Kathmandu. A World Heritage Site, this stupa has great significance for Buddhists and a walk around (clockwise) is highly recommended whether you are sightseeing or shopping or just wanting to experience an ancient monument.
A Stupa you MUST visit. The stupa is gorgeous! It was peaceful and a wondeful place in a crazy city to sit and meditate, people watch or just be.
Huge stupa. There are lots of interesting shops around and you could walk up near the Stupa. It's the biggest Stupa in the world so it's worth having a look

Great visit - and learned so much from our guide. An imposing structure in the middle of Kathmandu. I love the architecture in this area. It really just fits in to the land. If you do have a guide don't be afraid to tell him you want to sit in the cafe area adjacent (very European in feel) and have a coffee of a beer.
Truly amazing. Profoundly spiritual for people of all faiths. Be sure to go into the temples and turn the great prayer wheels - don't spend ALL your time in the wonderful shops!

Do not miss this. A must see when you visit Kathmandu is the giant stupa at Boudhanath. Best time to go is late afternoon when the locals are all making their daily visit and taking clockwise circuits of the stupa.Visit the shops and cafes that ring the site and enjoy the sunset.The downside is the horrible drive from the centre of town but this should improve as the authorities get to grips with the road widening project

Peacefully Awesome !!!. Its really a nice and cool atmosphere there provided less tourist. I mean the time i been was like . Guide told that its not like that evey time. Nice restaurants around to eat as well. Had good time :)
best attraction to see in Nepal. beautiful place, well maintained and clean. the temple is simply stunning. If you can only see one temple in Nepal go to this one!!

Quick visit to Kathmandu. This stupa was walking distance from my hotel, and was a great place to spend the evenings and early mornings. Great places to pick up souvenirs and to see something of the Buddhist culture of Nepal. The streets have a medieval village feel and you emerge at the site of the beautiful stupa. Great place!

Discover nice places in the alleyways. This is an impressive Stupa, but what makes it even nicer is the surrounding settings; wonder into the alleyways and discover some nice places for food or just a coffee, or souvenir shopping.....

Large Stupa. It is right in the middle of the main city and therefore, you might find parking a bit of a trouble. This is a very crowded place. Nevertheless, the stupa is very large and beautiful with the eyes of the Buddha overlooking the city.

Great View, very peaceful place. I live in Kathmandu, but never had been there, but when I went there , wow I just kept on surprising, its really pleasurable place, i didnt expect it would be that much beautiful.

The best place on earth. A must go if you are in Kathmandu. Go around 5pm to see the community come out to do kora. There are lots of awesome rooftop restaurants and bars around that are great for watching the sun set.

great at sunset. Good shops - and haggle on prices! Grab a spot high up at dusk and watch the pilgrims walk round in a clockwise direction. Then watch all the butter lamps being lit around the stupa - magical!

Relaxing. There is something strangely relaxing about walking in a circle around a large monolith. You forget the hustle and bustle of the city and realise you're really in Nepal! Mountain scenery on a clear day can be seen in all directions, especially if you enjoy Mo:Mo's at the best view restaurant to the left of the entrance (Rs200). Very enjoyable.

What a place. i felt very good after visiting the place, i'm not talking about any spiritual feeling, the temple is so nicely done, there are some myth on it, the view of the city from the temple is great and just roam around the place.
Nice to Visit. It is one of the quiet and peaceful place out of other touristic place so i recommended you to go there once while you are in Nepal.

WOW nice place. Boudha is a particular focus for Kathmandu’s Tibetan community and throughout the day there is a constant stream of people circling the stupa spinning prayer wheels and reciting mantras. Surrounding the stupa are six major monasteries and a host of smaller ones as well as cafes, restaurants and shops selling Tibetan carpets and Newari silverware.

A gorgeous Sight. Standing at the narrow opening, and beholding the sight of the white washed stupa strung with colorful flags for the first time was a wow moment for me! The stupa with huge eyes painted on the top is the iconic attraction of Kathmandu. The best time to visit is in the mornings, unless it is a Buddhist holy day, when it is quiet and peaceful. The place is kept fairly clean, compared to most of the religious attractions in the city. What is great is that there are many restaurants with roof top dining options offering fabulous view of the stupa from almost a 360 degree angle. This is definitely a must-see attraction of Kathmandu!

Incredibly beautiful & powerful place!. Best time to visit is early (6-7am) or late afternoon (5-6.30p) so you can watch people walking kora around the stupa. After walking around the stupa a few times grab a table outside on the roof deck at Roadhouse or Stupa View.

Awesome & Interesting. Pictures don't do this attraction justice. The 40 minutes allotted for this stop just wasn't enough. The views and the people were a lot to take in and one could easily spend most of the day here just taking it all in. Shops surround the Stupa. People here were very friendly and it was no problem striking up conversations. Biggest regret: not enough time to take everything in and appreciate it.

Lots of tibetian people. Go early in the morning or the end of te day. Take your position with your camera and just shoot. U will have nice shots from beatyfull people. Go to buddist temple and get your blessing from the monks. Pay a small amount. Buy amulet on the stupa its self near the temple. They will bless it for you with a mantra. Thats nicer than the shop.dont forget to take umbrella when sun shines,

spiritual stupa. Boudhanath is a bhudhist tempel which is biggest and one one of the oldest stupa.Many Tibetans are staying monks in these monestery.Many restuarants and shops around the monestery where you can have a good view of stupa and mountains. We have to enter from south of the stupa and in west there is big monestery. In the north there are 10 monesteries but you have to walk inside for few minutes. On the full moon stupa is litted up with oil lamps.
Monks and locals. Central and lovely to stroll around for a few hours. Good shopping at tourist prices. Excellent photo opportunities of monks and locals.

Boudanath Stupa. This place has magic... there is a special something... It's also great to sit on one of the many roof terraces and just look at the people who practice their religion there, Sherpa's, Tibetan, Manangi, Butanese...

Don't miss out your visit of Boudhanath. When you are in Kathmandu for a visit; one should not miss out to visit the Boudhanath Stupa; which is located in North east side of Hubble and bubble city of Kathmandu; just 6 - 7 k.m. away.

Peaceful. Boudhanath should be visited in the evenings, especially on full moon or no moon day. The place is in its full splendor then! Thousands of lamps are lit, the place is crowded. But there is no hustle-bustle. Everyone is there to pray and its nice. Parking can be a bit of a problem. There are lots of restaurant around the stupa where you can go for dinner and see the stupa in the moonlight. You can visit this place, even if you are not religious - for the experience. Foreigners attract some fees. People from the SAARC countries have some concession. The entrance is free for Nepalese nationals.

Absolutely amazing place!. An incredible place of power, life changing experience. An absolute must for spiritual seekers. One can get an incredible amount of energy just by walking around this stupa...

Favourite Place. This is like the jewel in the crown in Kathmandu. A great place to go, where you can sit in one of the many roof top café/restaurants and watch the hustle and bustle below. There is a constant stream of people praying and walking around the stupa as well as those walking on the stupa. A fascinating place to just sit and people watch. You will pay more here for goods as it is an obvious tourist attraction, however, most can be bartered down to a reasonable price. Well worth a visit.
Great Place to buy a Thanka. If you are looking to buy a Thanka, let me recommend Sara Enterprises Bouddhist Thanka Centre. While there, of course check out the number one temple - the Bodanath Stupa
Spend some time on the stupa. It's peaceful.. Nice and peaceful place. I spent 2 hours here on the stupa. The weather was great so I was lucky. It's very peaceful and calm sitting on top.
great place to visit. Its a place to visit even for ppl of other religious beliefs. The atmosphere is to be felt first hand.

Mervellous! People are friendly and smile a lot. Almost no traffic for kathmandu a oasis.. One of the most beautiful buddhist site to visit. Quite and no cars. People are mostly Tibetan. Very smily. Try to be there at 6 am to breathe full buddhism admosphere. Remeber to walk in the right direction! Light also a Yak butter candle. And make a small offer.Worth to stay more then one day. Restaurant are pricely convinienr and food very good.
Beautiful and quiet place. Find rest in the busy city. It is clean and quiet and nice to enjoy an afternoon there. Also possible to walk from Thamel, so its a nice day occupation.
great atmosphere. don't miss while in Kathmandu. No need to pay the 300 NPR entrance fee, just enter the area from the lane left side of the entrance - for free!
Must see place. A must see location on any trip to Kathmandu wit plenty of restaurants nearby that over look the stupa

I love my country!!! Amit. Really feel proud to be nepali.. The beauty of my motherland cant just be counted in numbers. The history of nepal is not easy to understand every monuments u see has a vast explanations of 1000 yrs ago. Kathmandu is the capital city and three historical places (districts) is surrounded by high hills. Pokhara itself is a heaven.. And many places palaces has its own importance.i have visited many popular cities of the world .. No places is like kathmandu. Through this review i want world to know NEPAL was never a part of any nation.. It was indepent country. and The Light Of The World "GAUTAM BUDDHA " was born in nepal.the highest peak of the world "SAGARMATHA " lies in nepal.

in a crowded locality surrounded by garment and prsentation article shops. well maintained religious place and bargaining market. be aware of pick pocketing . very good bronze idol of avalotikeshwar. good no of rotaing prayer bells

Peace and Harmony. Once we get enter the main entrance of the stupa, the bright eyes of buddha attracts us. Huge in the size, one of the biggest stupa from about 4th century is still alive with its history. The different types of Budhha Cult and their monasteries can be seen inside the complex. Maitreya( the future Buddha), Rimpoche, Shakya mun i Buddha, Tara etc. are attraction of the monasteries inside. Not only it, we can see all the four different types of monasteries of SHAKYAPA, NINGMAPA, KAGYUPA and GELUKPA. Those who are interested to know about the budhism, it can be a nice place for them.The other interesting part of this place is THANKA painting, the paint based on the Tibetan Traditional Buddhism, exactly the same way and the materials that used more than 1000 years before. While get enter to the sanctum of the main Stupa,visitor can make a circle around of it. The different colors of the prayers flags blowing over our head look interesting. It can be nice to visit in the evening, when there we can see the prayers praying and chanting.If you are lucky, you can also see the traditional Puja ceremony in the some monasteries. Very interesting and nice place to visit, DON'T MISS IT..........

Lovely place to meditate. This was my favourite place in Kathmandu. We'd walk in to one of the monasteries facing the stupa and meditate. The pigeon square right in front of the stupa kept me entertained too. The energies in this place are amazing.
Great visit. Great place to experience the culture of Nepal, especially the prayer flags and Buddha eyes and watch the locals going about their business

Not to be missed while you're in Kathmandu. I went to Bodnath first day in Kathmandu, took a cab from my hotel in Thamel around Rs 300. From outside, the location seems like any other places in KTM, crowded with small shops and street sellers, but once you entered the gate, you will find amazing scenery of white-and-gold-painted unique building that could hold your breath for a while. The stupa is surrounded by shops, hotels and restaurants with wide pedestrian for tourist and pilgrim. You can walk easily to enjoy the view of the building from bottom, but it's better to step inside the stupa as there will be more things to see. Good thing about this location is, unlike Pasupatinath, no local guide who bug you by offfering their service once you came in. Also the entrance fee is extremely cheap, Rs 150. And if you want some refreshment, local shops and resto available nearby.

Impressive, not to be missed. We were told by our guide that this is the largest stupa in the world, not sure if that is true, but it's the largest I have ever seen! It's also a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is considered one of the largest and most significant Buddhist monuments in the world. It is encircled with small shops and rooftop restaurants, which give you an amazing view of the whole area. Also, some of the best people watching....monks, locals and tourists from everywhere. I bought an antique "singing" bowl for my son here and lots of prayer flags and beads too. We actually came back for a second visit on our own.

little peace haven. The Boudha gate separates the chaos and noise of Kathmandu from the peace around this enormous building. The area around it is pedestrianized so you can walk around it without jumping every 20 seconds. If you are staying downtown, do catch a taxi and pay Bodnath Stupa a visit. It should not cost you more than 300 rupies, although if you can't be bothered to haggle too much, most taxis will accept 350 without further questioning.There is supposedly a fee for this attraction, but I have been living in this area for a week now and no one has asked me yet. In any case all side roads lead to it, so you can easily avoid the gate if you wish

Do not miss. It is one of the most beautiful sightseeing of the city. The stupa is located inside a circular pathway so it is peaceful to walk around, without the usual traffic. The white dome is immaculate and all around a lot of shops for hunting tibetan curios

The Best Tourist Attraction in Kathmandu. The stupa is simple, but colourfully decorated with sutra flags. All you have to do there is to walk around the large stupa clockwise, making a wish. The admission fee is Rs 150. There are many restaurants and souvenir shops surrounding the stupa.

There's a reason.... The taxi ride to the stupa from Thamel is part of the fun (but then any taxi ride in Kathmandu is an experience). The stupa is huge, surrounded by 3 and 4 storey buildings, many with restaurants on the roof. It's a great spot to sit, sip a hot lemon, ginger and honey drionk and just soak up the atmosphere. The stupa has a presence which even the casual visitor can feel. Absolute favourite place in Kathmandu...we keep returning

Eyes of The Buddha. Bodhnath is one of the largest and most beautiful stupas in Kathmandu. Its easy to get here and dont need to climb many steps as you need to for Swayambhunath. The fact that it is white makes it more beautiful I am not sure if it would have looked as charming if it was in any other colour. If you are visiting Kathmandu during Jan/Feb dont miss the Festival of Lights at Bodhnath!
stupa. Very nice stupa.it is very big.i like the flage around.I recommend to visit this stupa once.highly recommended.

Peaceful!. I did the praying while wandering 1 round of the stupa. Prayers went in peace. Did enjoy the ambiance, the busy living environment around. Most impressed by pigeons there. So peaceful! Do not miss this attraction when you are in Kathmandu.

Don't miss visiting this wonderful stupa!. Wonderful Buddhist Stupa to visit! Walk around the stupa with the many other Buddhist pilgrims and spin the prayer wheels. You can climb up on the stupa for wonderful views of the areas below. Lots of great shops selling locally made products at good prices. Lots of good restaurants also. A great way to spend an afternoon or evening surrounded by locals.

Chill out in busy Kathmandu. This is a favourite place of mine especially early in the morning. It's a very peaceful place for a wander around and there's plenty of choice for a spot of breakfast. if you're just visiting Kathmandu, it's a don't-miss place. Don't be in a hurry - take your time!
A fabulous place for artefacts and Thangka paintings. Nice place to go around Try one of the roof top cafe for a lazy lunch on a winter afternoon. Expensive but the sun makes it worth it.

AMAZING. What a great place to be. Stunning, beautiful, magic and spiritual place with a lot of life around it. Love this place. A must to see and experience when travelling Nepal!!! I can recommend staying in a Guest House in Boudha, so you can surround the stupa every day!

Favorite Stop!. This is definitely one of the stops the guidebooks suggest you see while in Kathmandu and we couldn't agree more. This was our favorite touristy stop of the day. We went in the morning and it was so peaceful to just walk the edges of the stupa and climb up onto it to get a closer view. There's a small entrance fee (1-2 USD), but it's well worth it and we didn't ever feel overwhelmed by would-be guides or vendors. Everyone was very respectful. Just make sure you walk around the stupa clockwise out of respect!

Do not miss this. For me this is the best site in Kathmandu to visit because of the peace and calm brought about by the Tibetan Buddhist influence. I recommend this as an excelent place to eat in one of the many restaurants overlooking the stupa.One word of warning; there are lots of pigeons and their droppings can be very accurate.
a lot of prayer wheels...... go there at different times/ day or night/ and full moon days to see it come alive and experience its buddhistic atmosphere!
Must see.. Must see this magnificient Buddhist stupa. Inexpensive entrance fee and plenty of souvenir shops on the grounds.
Nice. Calm and peaceful place. Arguably one of the biggest stupas with a lot of religious significance. The shops around the stupa are more interesting though.

One of the most powerful holy places in the world.... I lived in the vicinity of the Bodnath Stupa for a period of about two years. It is without a doubt one of the most awe inspiring and powerful places one can ever visit. Once you become accustomed to the beggars and street vendors that are ever present throughout South East Asia you can really start to feel the energy of the place. Spiritual practice and mediation are encouraged and often enhance by the amazing setting. Take plenty of time to visit the Tibetan monasteries, shops, and cafes around the stupa as they are the most authentic window into Tibetan culture to be found anywhere outside of Tibet. As others have mentioned, full moon, new moon and special Buddhist holidays are always extra busy and there are often interesting performances or religious ceremonies going on. A visit to Bodnath is a worthwhile experience for people of all faiths but especially powerful for Buddhists.

Sanctuary. The meditative sounds of Tibetan Buddhism chants that can be heard inside the compound of this sanctuary is overwhelming. I felt so at peace with the place. The cleanliness surrounding the stupa by far the second cleanest. The first been the Dream Gardens. Considering that their entrance fees of Rs150 compared to others of Rs1100, the committee for Boudhanath is doing a great job in keeping the environment clean and also the conservation and development of the site.The downside is the harassment from the tour guides and beggars, old and young. Suggest that trained tour guides be given a permit to solicit but must back off once a tourist declines. As for the beggars, confine them to a specific location at the exit where tourist can make donations at free will.

Full Moon at Boudha. The best time to visit Boudha is when there is a special occasion, like the full moon evenings, the last day of the Tibetan month, all the month of Saka Dawa or Tibetan new year. The Stupa is very special and even people visiting for the first time, feel a special energy.

Worth The Walk from Kathmandu. This site is definitely worth the walk to see. Its nice to walk around the stupa, and there are several nice cafes for lunch where you can enjoy the scene from a terrace. Don't skip it.

A real gem in the city. If you only have time to visit one site in Kathmandu, this should be it. Boudhanath is a revered Buddhist site, and it is one of the largest stupas in the world. The place is beautiful, peaceful (even with the locals and tourists strolling about) and awe-inspiring.Entrance fee for foreign tourists is 150 Nepalese rupees (less than USD 2), which kinda shocked me, because the fee is so small for such a beautiful place. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site to boot, and so one must not definitely miss seeing the Boudhanath.Had a leisurely stroll here with my friend Madan, and I quite enjoyed looking around at the souvenir shops, which surround the entire stupa. Because I visited during the monsoon season, we encountered a light rainshower, which wasn't really much of a hassle since there are these quaint cafes beside the souvenir shop where you can sit and have coffee while waiting out the rain.Boudhanath Stupa is a lovely place, and everyone visiting Kathmandu should go see it.
A thing of beauty is a joy forever !. The atmosphere is charged with the grandeur of Lord Buddha . The song 'Om Manipadme Hum' giving it a divine touch. A must - see place in Kathmandu.
Very nice peaceful. the only problem is we had been there in the month of June, which was burning hot during the day time

Awesome. You should book two trips here or plan to be here late afternoon. The temple closes at 6:30 and there are 2 seperate experiences to be had. The temple itself and the 'after hours' expeience where the locals come and walk clockwise round the outside whilst chanting and lighting butter lamps etc. Both experiences are worth a visit and unfortunately, we missed the temple itself. Oh, and take a taxi but allow plenty of time to get there are KTM is madness on the roads. Don't be alarmed either as the entrance to Bodnath is through a small gate inbetween 2 shops . . .it looks 'dodgy' but it's fine. Haggle for the taxi price too don't forget.

Full of Enegy. A place full of positive energy! As soon you enter the place, music of chanting cd, lama's, devotees can be heard and seen, that eventually even though people from different places and religion are there. One will have innerpeace. There are many shops there which sells thangkas (buddhist art), buddhist sculptures, restaurants and so on. There are also a couple of guests houses there.

Best thing in Kathmandu. The best thing is the kora seen at night time in Bouddhanath .. so religious place ,, touching. Huge crowd of Buddhist people offering their buddhism prayers . The place is so huge and impressive .. white object in the middle of tibetan settlement.....
Nice walk. A walk around Stupa is good experience.Shops around are bit expensive, as every where in Nepal.feeding pigeons there is a good relaxing experience.
BREATHTAKING. very Impressive architecture, I clicked many pictures of the stupa & the market around it. This place is a definite must visit for those coming to kathmandu

peaceful as peace can be.... Bodnath Stupa has a charm which cannot describe by words. The devotees from all around the globe gather there without any religious gaps....It is certainly peaceful as peace can be...!!!

World peace Stupa. Bouddhanath Stupa lies lies about 6 km east of downtown Kathmandu and is the largest stupa in the Valley and one of the largest in the world.It looms 36 meters high and presents one of the most fascinating specimens of stupa design with hundreds of prayer wheels and 108 small images of Buddha all around. Just like the Swayambhunath, the stupa here is too has four sides with the watchful eyes of Lord Buddha. All the Buddhist throng to this stupa to take part in the sacred rituals during the Buddhist festivals.a World Heritage Site is also known as Khasti. There are more than 45 Buddhist monasteries in the area. Many have schools that teach young monks like those pictured here.

A place to feel spiritual. A nice place to check out that won't take too much of your time. The stupa itself was very impressive with it's massive size and fluttering prayer flags. This place is a lot quieter and peaceful compare to the other Kathmandu attractions. There are tons of shops and restaurants surrounding the stupa. We ate at one of the restaurants there. The food was okay. But the rooftop is a great place to just look down into the square and people watch. This is a great place to get a taste of the Tibetan culture in Kathmandu.
Large & impressive. It is a very large white stupa with those eyes of the Buddha that have become so famous, and has smaller stupas and temples surrounding.
The 'eyes' have it. Cannot imagine visiting Kathmandu and not visiting to see people circumambulating and praying. We went and ate and mediocre meal overlooking the wonderful Stupa

Top 3 MUST GO SPOTS!. Regardless of the amount of time you have while in Kathmandu, you must come here. This is one of the worlds most holy of Buddhist sites.Tibetan emperor, Trisong Detsän (r. 755 to 797) is traditionally associated with it's construction. My favourite time to visit is just before dusk. The entire area takes on an even more mystical charm as darkness falls and candles begin to glow by the thousands. Monks descend upon the Stupa and make their ceremonial laps, chanting and walking. It is a sight to behold.It is about 10km from Thamel and taxi is the best way to get there. There are limitless food and beverage options or just grab a coffee and pastry from the one of many cafes if you desire. I prefer to pick one of the many restaurants located high above, on the surrounding rooftops. Usually they are accessed by a long flight of stairs and are fairly easy to spot if you look up as you walk around. These provide an amazing view and photographic opportunity, above and across from the Stupa. You can easily spend a couple of hours lazing away an afternoon enjoying a good meal and/or beverage on one of these amazing patios, taking in the iconic views and spiritual charm. Some of the best keepsakes can be purchased from the "Stupa-side" vendors and street merchants. There are countless shops and opportunities to leave with a unique souvenir. Highly Recommend!
Impresive. impressive building great shops and great place to chill in many of the roof top café's with a cold Everest.

Jostling, beautiful, so much to see. The stupa is the central attraction, but there are also many cool shops, little temples/churches, etc. There's also a candle making little house nearby for the ceremonies. So much to see! You won't be heckled here by the shopsellers as I've heard happens in other ones. 200 rps entry fee. Well worth it.

Dreamily stupa. Towering stupa, people round clockwise way, Buddhist monastery in the side and shopping center as well as flattering buddhist flag. It seems, itself coming spiritual knowledge. tibetan songs, chanting, humming . Buddhist mediation in the flag around the corner of the stupa perimeter. I heard it is second big stupa in the asia. fee is cheaper then pashupatinath stupa.

Lovely!. I visited on my last day and after lots of other stupa's I was feeling a bit jaded. However, I wish I had gone earlier in my trip as I would probably have enjoyed a couple of visits. It's a lovely place to walk around and people watch.

This is what it is like ........ Saffron MoonriseBy Debbie GuzziThe full moon stood an immense pale, presence;dominant, and opalescent,in the pearl-gray, early, evening sky.The brick square about the stupaThrobs with throngs of worshippersand the curious tourists.High on the saffron-graced, circular dome,The huge, blue-painted, All Seeing, Eyes of Buddha met mid browfollowing the antlike rush about the baseRound and round. The favor seekers snake, somnambulant,spinning brass prayer wheels;placing incense into the arched fire openingswhich belch heated ash into the air.In altered states in an Escher-like reality of steps and platforms, appearingto go neither up nor down,upon a masonry mandala, the vibrant rainbow of saris weavethreads in the weft of time.The procession drones onlike the buzzing of a million bees.Shopkeepers hawk their wares, offering milk-tea and seats on straw stools to “Rest, look, taste.”Beggar children with limpid eyes and mud-coated feet run pleadingthrough the packed, pressed, pampered travelers.Their reality existing side by side with that of the well dressed foreign devils whose legs they cling too and whose eyes they beseech.

A retreat from dirt&hectic in Kathmandu. You should definitely have a visit to this place. It is very clean, kinda quite and the atmosphere is great!It's perfect to have lunch or a coffee. Afterwards you will feel relaxed again ;-)
Great Stupa. Huge Stupa.The four sides of the Stupa resemble the same. Prayers were going on. There are many shops around the Stupa for a good shopping.

Early morning excellence. The best time to visit Bodhanath is early morn just on sunrise.You get to see and feel the really amazing atmosphere of all the Tibetans and locals as they round the stupa. Lots of monastaries nearby to have a look at plus some reasonably good places for a coffee or bite to eat.
A true Holy Place. One of the most beautiful temples in Kathmandu and I should say Nepal.Real devotion can be seen here and nepalese people (especially sherpas) are nice and friendly to tourists.
Very good. It is so nice. It is so big setup. Quite i love it so much.wonderfull place .enjoing the walk around the setup .it is biggest setup in nepal
Huge. This is a huge & impressive structure where everybody walks around in a clockwise direction. It also has many shops and place to eat where you can sit and watch the world go by
Buddhist Temple. An amazing circular building, the paths so clean, and the tourist shops as well. Remember to walk clockwise around the Stupa. You will be then following in Buddha 's footsteps.
Wonderful place!. Mystical, powerfull, wonderful place! Kathamandu is a special city, Bodnath Supa represents it! Obviously, It is part of Kthamandu...
Om Mani Peme Hum.... Once you finish enjoying the walk around, strongly recommend a coffee/snacks break at rooftop restraints.

Cuture and history. The biggest stupa in Nepal and a sacred area for Buddest. This small Tibetan enclave within Kathmandu offers the biggest Stupa in Nepal and the biggest pray wheel.
A visit to the temple is worth a visit and a personal blessing by the monks.
Worth a visit. Interesting to see, gives a good hint of religious life in Nepal today. We spent a day visiting different templs, stupas etc and this one is in this case a "must".
beautiful but touristy. this is an amazing site in and of itself. the only sucky thing were the millions of vendors who were kinda pushy. it was still beautiful and I found some peace regardless :)
good looking. Excellent structure. Surrounded by many shops, you can buy some savounir. We picked up some local folk music cd, its really good.
This place really chills out!. Usually, a great place to get away from the hustle of Kathmandu and take a time for spiritual; recovery!
boudinath. Tibetien run buddhist monastry. Interesting to see Tibetian ways of life in Nepal. A better place to buy authentic Tibetien goods.

For me the most important place in Kathmandu. Boudhanath is the first and the last place I go whenever I come to Nepal or leave.
The atmosphere of peace and this feeling of a very special place I never forget.
Great historical place. The Bodnath Stupa is a great, historical place with lots of local people and very clean :-) Its a MUST see while in Nepal

Eat Pray Love. Visiting this site and watching the devotes pray will give you a sense of a higher being. After you get over the need to take pictures of this site, put the camera away sit down somewhere and watch the devotes. Then as Elliot M mentioned to really understand this site try walking around the Stupa, no camera, no need to take pictures, just with a need to believe.There are a few restaurants around the stupa but try the ones on the rooftops as the view form the rooftops are great, but if you have time try taking the little lanes that lead away from the stupa between shops. there are little pockets of stall and little eating places doted along the lanes. There was this one i discovered, Maya Garden Restarunt. A quite garden cafe with good food.
Now a tourist trap. Worth visiting, but overwhelmed by vendors and tourist traps. With all the better options in the Valley, I can't see why this is the #1 attraction. (Patan!!)

Peaceful and colourful. I very much enjoyed visiting the stupa. It has a peaceful vibe with the constant playing of Om Mani Padme Hum throughout the different stores. So lovely. The song stayed in my head for days and days afterward. We sat and enjoyed a drink and some dhal bhat while watching people stroll around the perimeter of the stupa. I would visit again.

Great Place for Lunch. Boudha Stupa is a famous Buddhist landmark. It is quite breathtaking to see a stupa this size. I recommend walking around it a couple of times. Particularly on a Buddhist festival, so that you experience the purpose of the stupa. Then relax at one of the restaurants to get a grand view of it. Roadhouse is one I would certainly recommend.

Meditative. This was one of my favorite experiences in Kathmandu. It is very meditative to walk around the stupa, surrounded by Tibetan Buddhists. There are lots of shops and restaurants around when you feel like taking a break. Entry was only 150, which is not bad at all!

Bodnath Stupa. This was a Huge beautiful Stupa with many Buddhist walking around it clockwise saying the 'Om Mani Padme Hum' prayer. It is one of the largest Buddhist Stupas in the world and is a UNESCO World Heritage site. We ate lunch on the rooftop of one of the restaurants surrounding the stupa and had a great view of the whole site from there.

Tibetan traditions in Kathmanadu. A visit to the Bodnath Stupa must be done during your stay in Kathmandu. Walking around the Stupa and eating in one of the rooftop restaurants gives you a good experience of colourfull Tibetan traditions

a must visit. Its a world heritage site so if you happen to be in Kathmandu do visit. There is a cafe inside the area on the 1st floor roadhouse cafe... best food we had in kathmandu was surprisingly there.Do not shop there Thamel is half the rate for everything.

Nice simple space. It is a great place like most places worth visiting, it is worth a bit of a read up on stupas in general in order to appreciate this big guy. The roof top restaurants are great the menus are not too different, I'd choose one with my back to the sun to enjoy the view.
Peaceful. Loved the environment at Boudha. I suggest that you visit in the evening to capture the scenes at best. Wonderful.

Just Beautiful!!!. It is a beautiful place of worship for the Nepalese and we are lucky that they allow us in.Just as you enter there is a tradition of going around and spinning the huge prayer wheel.You get to go on top and click pictures too which is really nice.You get a feel of the culture and that you are standing there.Definitely worth the visit.

On any tour of Katmandu. This is a must-see on any tour of Katmandu. It was our first stop and even though it is very touristy we really enjoyed the site. It is culturally significant and a great place for tourist shopping as well as people watching. The Buddhist temple nearby is also incredible to visit with the monks chanting and singing and the enormous prayer wheel outside.

Go on your own.. We went with the Riviera group and after the interminable hobby guide shut up we had twenty minutes to look around.We went back back the next day on our own, as did four other disappointed couples, we spent two and a half hours there without realising the time pass. Wonderful.Nice coffee place with Illy on the door.

Peaceful and full of colour. Bodnath is a great place to absorb Tibetan and Buddist culture. With pilgrims praying, monks chanting and Buddists (and others) rotating the prayer wheels surround the stupa. Find yourself a good seat on one of the roof top restaurants and just sit and watch. Best to come in the morning or later afternoon as there will be most people visiting for prayers etc.
Biggest Stupa in Nepal. In the very center of Kathmandu surrounded by nice restaurants and cosy shops. Especially the mandala shops and Lama Thanka center is nice to visit.
Great Temple. interesting temple with easy access and fun shops that cater to good negotiators...lots of good photo opportunity
Amazing. I liked the atmosphere and the vibe around this holy place.I went there early morning and enjoyed watching the devotees and the tourists.The architecture is very nice and very photogenic

1000 years of Mindfulness. You can just feel it. The peace and serenity of rounding the stupa as millions have done before. It's a must stop for me whenever I am in Kathmandu...I wouldn't miss it. Three rounds spinning prayer wheels, three rounds on the first level, and then lunch in a roof top garden overlooking...a recipe for a great day out in Kathmandu. It's also great to visit late in the afternoon when the sunlight gets low, the pilgrims come out to circumambulate, and the temperature drops from midday. Don't miss it!

visit in the evening. We went there during the day and it was too hot a chaotic. It was much better when we returned in the evening (right before closure).We walked kora few times with the rest of the people and then went into rooftop café for a pizza with a glass of wine with the most amazing view.

Ancient and Modern Buddhism in action. This is a major pilgrimage site but what i hadn't realized before is that it is also a center of Buddhist study. Scholars and devotees from all over the world come to study here. It adds a sense of modern relevance to the ancient significance. The shops around the stupa are quite commercial but on the plus side there are good restaurants too.
Don't miss it. It's a working temple so all around, people were dancing, eating lunch, praying, i.e. it's not just full of tourists.

Best place for Buddhist people. Its very beautiful place to visit. Lots of Tibetan monks comes for worship. But little crowed. Stupa is decorated with Buddhist flag. Peoples are engaging in white wash on dome of the stupa which one is most interesting moment during our visit.

TEMPLE TIME. Visited in the night..the temple was lit up with blue lights.Better to go in the night if you want to avoid the crowds.Go early in the morning if you want to see the locals performing their daily rituals.If you say you stay in kopan monestart you avoid the charge and get in for free!
Awesome. I loved this place. Little Tibet in amongst the hecticness of Kathmandu. Watched the people walking around and around with their prayer beads. Had a great view from a cafe up above.

Unique and inspiring Buddhist stupa. It's really a large village, not just stupa, but the shops, monasteries and homes of the Tibetan community and others encircle the stupa. Travelers to Kathmandu should not miss.

The only place worth visting and revisiting.. We found Kathmandu to be a big dissapointment. But this one small'ish square possibly provides all you need to know and see. Take a walk around, or even better, sit on a bench and just observe peoples faces and way or dress to get a proper cultural experience.

Gave me goosebumps. Walking around the stupa in the evening with the locals monks and devotees gave me goosebumps. A very spiritual atmosphere and you get lost in the atmosphere and all the walks of life that surround you. Makes you feel privileged to be part of it. Would definitely recommend staying a night here so you can visit the stupa at dusk and see it lit up my candles and atmosphere.
A place of tranquility and Buddha. I like the culture and the atmosphere of it. It was really blissful and i found myself so calm in its surrender. Overall it was a great experince..

Well, I might be biased, but..... As a Buddhist I loved this place, it had the atmosphere of a spiritual space and it was great just chilling on the first level looking at all the various pilgrims. Although there are loads of Tibetan shops all around, I didn't feel the intense hassle that you get elsewhere in Kathmandu...the 'come in and buy' pressure.I did feel a bit sorry for the poor street dog I saw there, who seemed to be plagued by flies and suffering terribly though. Maybe some day he will be included in the compassion?

really getting amongst it. the Boda stupa was my first nepalese tourist attraction so I wasn't sure what to expect. Couldn't be beaten for people watching. My only regret was not doing any shopping at the multitude of stores.

nice location. Among lots of stupa, I like this one because of the location,It has situvated in very good location.
Good place to have a visit when you are in Kathmandu.

So different from other stupas. It's like nothing you've ever seen, didn't realize it was surrounded by a Tibetan villiage of refugees from the 60's, tons of Tibetan goods & food. A UNESCO World Heritage sight, it's one of the few places that's been fixed up in Kathmandu & looks good. Doesn't feel like Kathmandu. Tons of rooftop restaurants that have a view of stupa. Did Swayambhu stupa earlier in the day & didn't know if I should do both but glad I did, they are very different. Highly recommended.

Amazing Culture. I never understood the history or religious connection to Stupa's and this one is just mind blowing. We also witnessed a Death Ceremony occurring as we circled the Stupa. A must visit when in Kathmandu and need to have someone who can explain it's significance.

Beautiful stupa in à nice setting.. THE stupa lies on in the middle of a nice square with restaurant rooftops. With a drink you have nice views. Its easy to walk from here to Pashupatinath Temple ( slow walking 30 min.)
Bodhnath. for whom who likes ethnics trip.. Budhnath isthe best place to visit in Nepal.. the food were very variaty..

Spectacular & religious place. Religious place you can see people's sincerity for praying although the place is not as untidy...Buddha does passed through tough time before he became Buddha, real practices....

Really wonderful. I saw this in a morning sunlight..what a beautiful place!! Marvelous structure..very peaceful place..you will feel a kind of inner strength when you be there inside..loved the place visited twice in my 2 days of kathmandu visit..a must visit place of kathmandu..in 150 INR / 225 NPR..you can get ticket. There is a stupa restaurant, who serves very tasty food and juices.
Nice place. Stupa was very cool to see. Many Monks were roaming there. The place was very calms and quite best place for meditation.
Highly spiritual place. Overwhelming. All around many Tibetan monasteries, shops, restaurants. Recommended even for atheists
Peace of Mind. Help you relax and feel something from your personal life, a totally peace of mind. I used to be here most of the time and it is always feels me something different than where i live.

What a great spiritual journey !. I went to Bodnath three times in my life all together and every time i went it was a new awakening a new fresh experience.I felt reborn i felt alive i felt like i am standing on the top of the world ! It was so amazing to watch sunset over Stupa and felt like looking in the eyes of God right there while people prayed i felt i am one of them even though i am not Budhist i felt we are all ONE ...it was amazing to say the least and it is eye opening experience like no other ....Please make a visit or you will miss something that might change your views of the world and your life forever.

Kathmandu - Bodnath Stupa - Enchanting. After an early flight to Everest in the morning and a long day in Durbar Square in the afternoon, I was afraid my fellow travellers had run out of steam for a visit to the Buddha Stupa, but having limited time In Nepal we made the effort. We were so glad we did. It is located on the edge of the city but a taxi ride through the manic streets of Kathmandu from Freak Street got us there late afternoon. A time which I understood was when all the Buddhist monks came out to walk clockwise around the base of the stupa and spin the prayer wheels. We entered through a gate area and paid the entrance fee but it seemed to only take us into the area where the temple stood. Not sure if you have to pay if you approach from a different street, but it wasn't much anyway. The stupa is impressive. Huge, with the eyes following you all the way round. The monks were certainly in attendance circa 5.00 pm local time and it was pretty crowded. This did not distract from the beauty of the place with many other religious buildings, shops and services, restaurants, cafes located in the immediate vicinity. We walked around a couple of times and spun the prayer wheels both around the base of the stupa and also the much larger ones located at various spots opposite. We were also able to walk up onto the upper level of the base of the stupa and walk round which gave you a different perspective of the structure and also the surrounding area. It really was beautiful and remains my wife's favourite place we visited in Nepal and possibly on our whole trip into India also. We were so glad we made the effort to come to this place late afternoon and as the sun dropped we just wandered around the local streets surrounding the stupa and took in the feel for this area of Kathmandu. You must see this place and although it is crowded the best time is late afternoon when you can be involved with the monks also.

Well worth the drive out there. One of Kathmandu's most sacred places, the Bodnath stupa is amazing.The endless stream of devout pilgrims walking around the stupa, the praying Buddhist monks of all ages, the sheer beauty of the stupa itself and the marvelous protector chapels - definitely make this an unforgettable experience

This stupa is worth seeing. This stupa is worth seeing, especially if u stay for example in Hyatte Regency hotel - it is within walking distance from the hotel and also a scene from your room. Very beautiful and photogenic. The place is full of tourist souvenirs shops. There is plenty of cafes on the roofs - choose one not for food but for magnificent view and take your breakfast there.

Beautiful and worth the trip. Its a gorgeous stupa. I highly recommend it. After spending the previous 5 months in Asia I was a little "templed out" but this I felt was unique and refreshing. It's well worth the 150 rupee ($1,75) entrance fee and transport costs to get there. The little oasis of a town that surrounds the stupa is a peaceful break from the exhilarating craziness of the rest of Kathmandu.

Endlessly Photogenic. The stupa is just riveting. It's big, beautiful and endlessly photogenic. As is the crowd circling the stupa every morning and evening, turning the hundreds of prayer wheels as they go.

Very very crowdy. Its good for economy but something should be down with so much rushing of visitors in this greatest place on Earth. If allowed, I will leave my bed and sleep here all of my life. But the parking facilities are poor, far and unsafe. Because of traffic mismanagement, it is even too risky to cross the road. Sadly, I recommend to visit the place only when city shuts down during political strikes.
My favorite place in KTM. Don't bother shopping here, it's way too touristy, just walk clockwise around the stupa and spin the prayer wheels.
A magic place. A very magic place to go particularly in late afternoon when tibetan religious are present, do not forget to get a drink in one of the roof restaurant on the place
Must Visit Place. I like this place .. such a peace place -- definitely visit during evening hours where all the locals walk clock wise in the sthupa..life time experience ..
Go there in the morning or evening, that's best. The peacefulness and the throng of worshippers makes it very enjoyable. Have a cuppa in a rooftop cafe and enjoy it even more.

Stupa visit. It was great.Again a short taxi trip from the Thamel centre. Really well maintained,clean and interesting. Small entry fee again it goes toward the maintenance. Received a blessing from a lama.Lots of interesting places to see around the actual stupe. opportunity to eat at various cafes and shopping of course

Peace prayer day. Could not beleve the crowds there as the day before it was quite empty. I think someone said it was the start of 40 days prayers but although absolutely packed did not feel threatened just honoured to witness this festival.

Must see when in Kathmandu and nice shops around. One of the nicest stupas I've seen and I usually am not excited to visit temples/stupas. It's nice because surrounding the stupa there are shops and restaurants so you could spend a couple hours just in the Bodnath circle. Overall, a must see in Kathmandu
Absolutely not to be missed. Beautiful Buddhist Stupa. Try an evening visit...dine in one of the roof top restaurants and watch the moon rise over this wonderful monument. Pure magic.

great spot. This stupa worth a late afternoon visit to enjoy the sunset in one of the coffee shops upper terraces. So you can observe pilgrims and enjoy panoramic view. Getting lost in small streeet all around is also really nice, come from the sides and not from the main entrance if you want to avoid the fee...
Some great souvenirs. Awesome temple with shops surrounding it full of some amazing souvenirs. This is a must see temple in my mind.
Most beautiful place in KTM. Boudha is my favorite place in Kathmandu. It's clean, beautiful and so peaceful. Go, walk around, drink a coffee, enjoy and definitely check out the artists/antiques.
Very nice relaxing place. Must enjoy the views from Rooftop cafes along side Boudha nath. They give you excellent view of the stupa and mountains around. Overall a relaxing place

Wonderful. One of the most famous sites in Kathmandu and worth the visit. The size of the temple is surprising, you can't really believe that something like that can be tucked away in the streets of Kathmandu. Leave plenty of time for wandering in and out of the surrounding monasteries and shops. Make sure to get a second floor view of it from at least one building surrounding it. Also, do the traditional walk around clockwise on the raised platform, very cool.
Must See in Khatmandu, Nepal. The Bodnath Stupa is the world's largest Stupa and one of it's kind. VIsitors from all over the world folk to this Stupa for prayers and for general viewing.

Awesome. This was a truly Impressive temple - possibly the best we saw in Kathmandu. We also had a meal in one of the rooftop restaurants - which proved to be good value and the whole experience was quite surreal. The entrance fee for Western tourists is slightly higher than for others which is a good idea but even then is relatively good value.

Heavenly.... There is such a peaceful and mysterious aura to this place, that I cannot really put it into words, it simply has to be felt....The Bodnath Stupa is one of the largest in the world and an important place of pilgrimage and meditation not only for Tibetan Buddhists and local Nepalis.Besides the shops there are lots of restaurants and rooftop cafes overlooking the stupa to eat e.g. fantastic momos, drink an 'Everest Beer', tea or coffee or just relax...So I think, it's an absolute must-do for anyone visiting Kathmandu.
Great Atmosphere. The big Stupa is really a must see in Kathmandu, we enjoyed the great atmosphere there and had lunch at one of the many roof top restaurants. Highly recommendable.

full power spirit. from all places boudha is having such clean and open energy that you will be just energized by it immediately. love this place and whole area with monks, monasteries and tibetan shops / restaurants)

This is a must. One of the most sacred places. You are realy thrilled even when approaching. Climbing the steep stairs up to stupa you are surrounded by children begging for money and locals trying to sell you their baubles. On the top you have to pay 200 Rs. entrance fee and once again - lots of locals who begin to tell you a stories and history of Kathmandu Walley.. of course for money. But of course - its Nepal. But the feeling is absolutely worth, stupa is amazing. Just stop for a while and enjoy the moment. And one small tip - enter the buddhist's temple on the right side of the stairs (when comming). I'm not rely sure if the visitors can enter there but we did and nobody ejected us. We spent there about 20 minutes listening proper budhists mantra singing accompanied with their typical music. What a power and energy, strong experience!

Excellent visit if you have limited time in Kathmandu. We had a total of 20 hours sightseeing time during our visit to Kathmandu due to business every day we were there except two. With that said, if I had one place to go again, I'd go back to Bodnath Stupa. It was breathtaking (and the taxi took my breath away thinking we were going to die, but that is a different story). You walk in from the chaos that is the street (look close or you'll miss the entrance) and suddenly there before you is a start white temple with a gold top. It is awe inspiring. As with everything in Kathmandu, the hawkers are everywhere. A good firm "no" and even firmer "I said no" generally keeps them at bay. There is very good shopping for anything you could want around the temple, along with some very good restaurants to find shelter during the mid-day heat. Both myself and my colleague did all our touristy shopping after spending time marveling at the temple. Easily and afternoon of time to have a very good lunch, enjoy the temple then find some "stuff" for the folks back home. Do not miss this temple if you have time for only one.

Beautiful!. We have opted for walking from Thamel to the Stupa as you see much more when you walk, and see we did! What an astonishing relief was it to finally reach Bodanath and find it within a beautiful tidy square in an area that is being looked after by those who live there. The Stupa was magnificent and although the square around it is a bit of a tourist trap with countless shops, much as anywhere in Nepal, the selection of rooftop restaurants was great and reasonably priced. We had much needed lunch for just under 500rs for 2, whilst enjoying a magnificent view of the Stupa. If you do choose to walk to the Stupa however, I would recomend investing in a better map than the one provided by the hostels...

Boudanath Stupa. This is one of the most sacred sights in Kathmandu. A gleaming with dome with a gold stupa on top. Thousands of Nepalese and tourists do the kora around this most recognizable sight in Kathmandu.

Don't miss it. This was our second visit to Nepal and second to the stupa. It is a magnificent structure within the 'Tibetan area of Kathmandu. We walked there from Pashupatinath. Despite being surrounded by restaurants and souvenir shops, the stupa retains its power to impress. Seeing Pashupatinath and Bodnath together shows how well Nepalis have absorbed different religious practices within their culture.

Tibet live!. the Tibetan quarter of Kathmandu with the biggest tibetan Stupa outside of Tibet, super exotic, super spiritual a must for every Nepal Visitor, good restaurants nearby and nice little lodges and Monastaries all over the place

Inspiring and moving.. It was my third visit and as inspiring and moving as always. The evening Kora was busy but well worth staying to see and do. I found the presence of the Nepali Police during the day intimidating and there seemed to be a much less 'free' atmosphere than 5 years ago. It all felt more controlled and less haphazard and chaotic but you cannot repress the devotion of the wonderful Tibetan people who have this as the centre of their community.

Visit early in the morning. We visited Bodnath Stupa at 7am as we had a flight in a few hours. It was the certainly one of our best experiences in Kathmandu. Having been to Swayambhunath (Monkey Temple) I was expecting more of the same. However I enjoyed Bodnath Stupa so much more and learned an awful lot more about Napali culture just before I headed for home. At 7am there wasn't another tourist or camera in sight. The Stupa was busy with many worshipers and many praying monks. It was incredible to join in with the crowds circling the stupa, listen to the prayers and observe the dress etc. There was none of the carnival atmosphere I experienced on a visit to the Monkey Temple. My only regret is that I didn't visit there at 7am also.

loved it!. Very beautiful and photogenic. Be sure to visit the street dog centre (exit main gate and cross over going down the lane. When road joins nother after about 150 m look for red gate on left before an open space/field. Shout and knock and be sure to leave a donation or take them some treats from home).... We ate at Roadhouse in the Stupa complex which was great....

The living stupa. The taxi ride through Pashupatinath was an experience, our taxi was involved in a crash..... but when we eventually arrived it was well worth the trip! The huge stupa is a community in it's self albeit a tiny one. Go for sunset and absorb children running along the stupa while young monks sit chatting and locals walk round spinning prayer wheels. Read the list of rules before you go up the stairs to the platform round the stupa...number 3 put a smile on our faces!
Boudha Stupa - one of the 3 self arisen stupas.. The area is very tourist oriented but the stupa itself is a marvel. Circumambulate and say your mani mantras.

Beautiful, serene place. The scene at Boudhanath Stupa is interesting. There is a legend to its building at around 500AD as history would trace back. Lunch was great, just overlooking the main Stupa. We had interesting tries - veggie munchurian, a kind of veggies deep fried ball in veggie sauce and chow-mein (sounded very Chinese).
