The munchurian dish is simple but goes very well with long grain rice. The 4 faces apparently meant as a peace prayer to the 4 corners of the earth. It is far bigger than we have in mind. White paste for the stupa wall as well-wishing can be bought (the workman will do the work on your behalf) at the entrance. Watch out for pilgrims who might bow and pray as they enter/walk around or in the stupa vicinity. Lots of paintings and tourists shops around the stupa. We also tried Nepal Thuli set - back at hotel at Nagarkot, but not as well adapted to it. We had refrained from raw veggies, fruits, yogurts, cheeses for instance so as not to trigger unadapted stomach. We ended up good, without any need for medication. :-)
nice temple. I love this temple a lot. It's unlike other places in Kathmandu which it doesn't have the chaotic environment. I felt peaceful in this stupa. It's a must to visit.
Nice One. I always go to visit Boudhanath every morning and evening. I really love to watch from there. Lots of people come for blessings there.

Beautiful and spiritual. It''s one of those places that's really hard to describe. If you are a buddhist, this is like the Vatican. High energy, colourful, mysterious. More interesting than the stupa are the people around who circumnabulate. The shops are also very interesting but apparently more expensive than other parts of Kathmandu. Ive been here 3 times and still plan to go back tomorrow before I fly out of KTM.

Absolutely must see. We visit the Bodnath stupa twice when in Nepal in march 2013. It is a magic place. Full of tibetans doing there walking around the stupa. Smiling, praying. There are lots of cafes and restaurants overlooking the stupa just to relax and hang around. On one of our visits we stayed overnight in a small guesthouse by the stupa. It was really nice to be there at night time and early in the morning watching all the people at the stupa. Absolutely recommend.

Bodnath: Tibetan Buddhist Vatican.... There is an aura to this place, that is hard to describe, it must be felt. When visiting be sure to bring a camera to capture memories of the place. Also make an effort to visit some of the numerous monasteries in the area. Westerners will find the White Gomba's (Phone: 014479870) Saturday morning Dharma talks led by Rinpoche Choki Nyma to be interesting, informative, and enlightening... Call them to check for exact times and dates.

Not to be missed!. I found the Stupa to be a very serene and calming place. The stupa itself is beautiful but the surrounding area is what really won me over. Many Tibetan refugees have made their home around the Stupa and there is lots of good food to eat, sights to see! There are many monasteries surrounding the area too. A good place to spend the day!

quiet clean than other parts of kathmandu. This is nice place to be when you want to avoid other dusty and crowded parts of kathmandu,energy level here is diffrent and quite comfortable..I also hear from locals that this place is mostly visited by people interested in sprituality or on the path of it..Most of the monks got quite rich in some years locals claim and latest gadgets like i-phone-5 to keep updated to this fascinating virtual world because of importance of this monument.

Not to be missed if you are a fan of Buddhism. Fluttering prayer flags, hundreds of pigeons and the hustle bustle of the shoppers greet you as soon as you enter. It is a very peaceful place and a must see if you are looking for Buddhist simplicity. There will be lots of monks in the vicinity. And, lots of options to shop and dine. There are some beautiful rooftop restaurants that let you enjoy the beauty with a tea or coffee. SAARC members get a discount on the entry fee. All in all, if you are in Kathmandu - don't miss this one.
Place to go. Not a buddhism, but the guide took us there... it was ok, but nothing really fancy or making me jamp..

cultural, colorful, blissful, and great place for shopping. you find peace once you enter the bodnath stupa, and get discountif you are SARC member. lots of shopping to do with bargained price, you can watch buddist monks praying, the biggest and most attractive sit is the stupa.

Buddist Stupor. Fabulous place to visit to find your Zen. Talk to the monks if you need to share a problem and they advise and send you on a mediation to help you think things through. Light some butter lamps if you need to let your problems go or to be guided in what you need to do in your life.Most of the members of the Everest expeditions visited this stupor prior to climbing to ask for guided and strength for their endeavours.

magical feeling especially early in the morning. Nice walk from Shambaling Hotel at 7 in the morning. Place was already alive with locals and pilgrims to the Stupa. Smells of incense, sight of the faithful spinning prayer wheels and minimal tourists at that time of day engendered a warm feeling of stepping into the local scene and not feeling out of place.
Nice View from the top. You get an amazing view from the top. The stupa is nice, clean and airy. Beware of loads of monkeys around. Warning : you have to climb about 80 stairs to reach the stupa

A massive stupa - with arena of shops.. Thanka art schools are all around here - their student paint the exquisite Mandala art designed in the '70's by the Dali Lama. But don't be fooled. If you want the real thing - thanka art done by a master, make sure it's signed.

Bodnath Stupa. Much nicer stupa than the monkey temple. Also visit the buddhist monastery further down in Kopan. It has a beautiful garden and you can also go and hear the monks chanting at about 6.30pm. It's wonderful!
Magical place. It's such amazing special feeling chanting and circumambulating the stupa with all the Tibetans. Especially in the early morning or evening. Very unique energy.
A Must While in Kathmandu. Several restaurants to choose from and great shopping for souvenirs. Nice views of the mountains from within the city.
Nice Stupa. Quite huge and impressive. The stupa is nice and has colourful flags all around. Its a nice sight and quite peaceful. Good to visit before sunset.

Toursity, but Worth Seeing. Surrounded by shops for tourists, is the largest Stupa in Nepal. It's a religious building worth seeing, but don't expect it want to stay longer than taking your pictures and leaving.
Largest stupa in Asia. Well worth the time to visit, walk around in clockwise manner, observe the Tibetan Buddhists praying and hanging prayer flags. The nearby Thanka painting studio is amazing.

Boudha .. Far to many tourists. I like the stupa and surrounding monasteries but it feels like one gigantic merry go round which is built to extract money from tourists. If you walk 15minutes outside into the local area,s everything halves in cost ?? Still worth the visit but not as good as Swayambhu for me !!
Big stupa, nice shopping. Walking around this huge stupa gives you a peaceful feeling. Then you can shop the area around it. A nice collection of things in a compact space.

stunningly tranquil spot. Walking away from the chaos of Kathmandu's crowded roads, it is fantastic to walk around the giant stupa, listening to the sounds of Buddhist chants. From the roof top cafes the views of the mountains in the background, with the stupa in the foreground, make for a memorable spectacle

The best sundset in Kathmandu !. We visited the Stupa 3 times, always at sunset. The colours, the views and the athmosphere are wonderful. We were surprised to find a new and extremely good espresso bar, called ariya, in the area too. We stayed opposite, at the Hotel Tibet International.

heavenly. Love the vibe around the main square: tranquil, interesting to view Tibetan culture and rituals, nice rooftop cafes, lovely incense and music plus many monasteries to peruse. Kept nice and clean- well done!
A must see in nepal. Awsome please, you have to feel it! and remind it for ever. You can o by taxi and after that visit the other unesco places

biggest stupa in the world. Nepal is a historical place in the world such as birth place of buddha and Bodnath was probably built in the 14th century after the Mughal invasions; various interesting legends are told regarding the reasons for its construction. After the arrival of thousands of Tibetans following the 1959 Chinese invasion, the temple has become one of the most important centers of Tibetan Buddhism. Today it remains an important place of pilgrimage and meditation for Tibetan Buddhists and local Nepalis, as well as a popular tourist site.babu thapa

worth the time to visit. This wonderful Stupa draped in prayer flags is a breathtaking sight. We were able to write our prayers on flags and watched as they were hung from the top of the Stupa. The saffron lotus petals were being refreshed while we were there and fresh flowers were being draped everywhere. The marketplace around the Stupa is quite good...be prepared to bargain and enjoy the rewards of your efforts....but remember that if they agree to your offer you should accept and seal the deal.

A stupa's a stupa, but the area is unique. Watching Buddhists be Buddhists is intriguing no matter which stupa you visit. This area, however, tends to be cleaner and safer than others. Proximity to the Hyatt helps with that. Loads of unique shops and restaurants surround the stupa, and the crowds of tourists and devotees provide endless photo ops for the photographers. Hang out at one of the nearby rooftop cafes and watch the action for an hour or two.
Be sure to visit. I wish that I had of found this little piece of heaven earlier. Keep at least 2 hours free for this.

Interesting, but nothing spectacular. As far as Buddhist temples go, the Bodnath Stupa is interesting, but there is nothing spectacular about it. The area immediately around the Stupa is quite clean and easy to walk around, and there are plenty of good cafes and restaurants nearby.

Quiet in the chaos. Stupa is located in a pedestrian square surrounded by stores so you don't have to worry about the usual cars and bikes knocking you over. There's a small entrance fee to pay. Wonderful place to sit and contemplate.

Well Worth Seeing. This is truly a holy place; vibrant and alive. Make time to circumambulate the stupa and make an offering of incense or prayer flags.
Then have some Nepali tea on one of the rooftop restaurants and watch the fascinating world go by.
Must see. Lovely place to visit in Kathmandu. Beautiful atmosphere and so full of interest. Definitely a must see when in Kathmandu.
cleane & peace. any one should visit this pace,its very big & looks nice,there is good place for shooping as well,budhha life...you have to learn more,

a must. If you can only do one thing in Kathmandu, this is it!! Watching them praise makes me tired, it's very active. It was neat seeing the prayer flags and watching people spin the prayer wheels as they walked by. Also a nice market to buy souvenirs.

One of the Holiest Buddhist Stupas in the world. Just after sunrise and just before sunset everyday (and all day long) Buddhists do Kora (circumambulation) around the stupa. Along with curious tourists and the dogs. It is a sight to see and be part of. Don't miss it.

A must. The most active physical meditation I have ever experienced. Energetically powerful, the beauty of thousands of prayer flags, the goodness of thousands of prayers. Join the rhythm. All surrounded by small stores and restaurants.
Kathmandu Stupa. Stunning open air square and in the centre is a huge white and gold Stupa (temple). With 1,000's of prayer flags waving off it. Really interesting, busy and beautiful site.

Buddhist satupa...handicrafts...coffee. A great place for shopping of Nepali and Tibetan handicrafts, thankaas...metal and wooden items...beads. The enclosure has several cafes and eateries. You can capture glimpses of Buddhist culture and lifestyle. There are also a few worshiping places. One can walk into any of those.

Amazing and not to be misses.. Bodnath Stupa is one of the truly awesome sites to see. The overall spiritual tone to the place is inescapable. Also, the shops surrounding the stupa offer some of the best, high quality shopping in Kathmandu.

Abode of Peace and Tranquility. Bodnath Stupa is one of the holiest Buddhist sites in Kathmandu,outskirts of Kathmandu. It has a lot of Tibetean Settlement around. Evenings and mornings will give a nice view for photographers. You can also go on a shopping spree at the local markets surrounding the stupa.Boudhanath is one of the famous UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Nepal.

Somewhat underwhelming. As my title indicates, I had high expectations for this experience that weren't quite met. I mean, the stupa itself is pleasant, but after walking around it, taking a photo or two (well, trying to between the foreigners and touts) and realising that the surrounding shops all sell the same stuff, there's nothing to really distinguish this from other places. There's little else of interest in the neighbourhood around the stupa, and getting to the area is a bit of a hassle. I'd recommend you get out of Kathmandu, away from the tourists and touts, and experience more of Nepal and the undoubted high quality (and far more 'spiritual') religious places that exist elsewhere.
Second visit --- still very good. This is my second visit to Bodnath Stupa; enjoy the shopping district around the Stupa. Nothing spectacular, but the area is well worth the entrance fee.

Nice and peaceful. NIce structure. Take time to walk around. Equally enjoyable to sit at a cafe on either the first or second floor and observe the going ons from there. You can get good photo shots from that level too.

Bentravel_13. Brilliant site to visit will do it again and again anad again and againBrilliant site to visit will do it again and again anad again and againBrilliant site to visit will do it again and again anad again and againBrilliant site to visit will do it again and again anad again and againBrilliant site to visit will do it again and again anad again and againBrilliant site to visit will do it again and again anad again and againBrilliant site to visit will do it again and again anad again and againBrilliant site to visit will do it again and again anad again and again
It is amazing to see a temple on such pick of the mountain. I was really surprised to see the temple and was thinking how they made it on a such high pick of a mountain

Indispensable itinerary item. Boudha stupa is one of the absolute "must-see" spots in Kathmandu, no matter what else you drop from your itinerary. An ancient site, sacred to Tibetans and Nepalis alike. The surrounding neighborhood is home to the TIbetan resettlement community, and thousands of recent migrants from Nepali hill and Himal regions, all settled near one of their most sacred sites. Give yourself a few hours to soak in the environs and to visit one of the 45+ monasteries that have been established in the area since the 1970s. Lot sof place sfor lunch around the stupa.
Worth a visit. We enjoyed sitting in the roof top restaurants watching the crowd walking around and over the Stupa. The various shops in the area are very interesting.
Awesome!!!!. Loved the energy!!!!! Pujas healing and well organized by Administrator Kiran Kumar Lama. Buddhists teachings by Khenpo Dorjee a must. Will return again.
Fantastic!. I liked everything! Easy to go, fantastic view, collors and contrasts, peaceful and the perfect place in Kathmandu to get in contact with budhism worships and rituals!

Worth a visit.... One of the highlights of my first Nepal trip was a visit to this stupa.Boudhanath Stupa is the largest stupa in Nepal. A UNESCO World Heritage Site, it is said to be the holiest Tibetan Buddhist temple outside of Tibet. The stupa is located in the town of Boudha, which is about 7 km East/Northeast of Kathmandu. The stupa was built around 5th century AD.Other than being a popular tourist site, the stupa is a sacred place for meditation for Tibetan Buddists and local Nepalis. The most distinct feature of the stupa was the pair of Buddha Eyes on all four sides of the square tower. I also noticed the symbol between the eyes which looked like a question mark. From what I read, it is the Nepali character for the number 1 and symbolises unity.Colourful prayer flags, mantras and prayers printed on them, are tired to the stupa. The surroundings of the stupa were also a treat for the eyes. Souvenir shops, Buddhist monasteries and nunneries, a few restaurants and cafes are found around the stupa.

Highlight of our city tour. This beautiful area was the highlight of our city tour. Holy place for the local Buddhist, it is sorrunded by monasteries of all the school of Tibetan Buddhism. One can enter the precinct and walk on the wall of the white dome. Amazing is the view of the devotees flocking there at dusk.
Circumambulate.... Such a beautiful and relatively quiet shrine. Lots of Buddhists circumambulating the stupa. Rooftop restaurants are pretty good and offer a great spot for photography.
Fantastic stop for an Everest Lager. There are many beautiful patios nearby to relax and enjoy the view. The stupa is beautiful. Definitely worth a visit.
Worth seeing. The stupa is worth seeing. Its quite large in size. You can shop for souvenirs in the area around the stupa.

Nice. People have made a lot of house around the Stupa which is not good looking. else is nice. Small area but nice. seems peaceful even so much people there.
Best time to go in Evening!
Atmospheric. The Stupa is a very interesting place to go, and is surrounded by lots of small shops selling souvenirs of all qualities and prices. A must see place in Nepal.
Breathtaking!. Was not prepared for the total splendor of the Stupa, first sight gave us goosepimples. Loved the fact that it was a spiritual place in every day use by all and not just a monument.

Amazing, incredible sight! Do not miss this!. What a stunning stupa this is! As soon as you enter the gate, there is this gigantic white stupa with prayer flags adorning it from all angles. Really, really impressive! Ringing this stupa are a multitude of shops and restaurants, all competing with each other, merchandise-wise, and price-wise. You can get some seriously good deals by bargaining here.
Amazing. The stupa itself is amazing, big and white dome with the Buddha eyes of wisdom on its golden pinnacle. One can spend days browsing for Tibetan curios and beautiful carpets. A must visit
truly special place. a spiritual home to me, beautiful and powerful place. Mesmerizing. Nice to go in the off hours, but also a remarkable thing to walk with the crowds circumambulating the stupa.

Peace. This is the best place in Neapl where you could find out peace plus the culture of Buddhist.My journey begins with MarronTreks which made my trip succesfill http://www.marrontreks.com/index.html
Peace. The good thing about these place is that it let you know what's Buddhist culture is all about..All thanks to MarronTreks

Terrific - worth visiting. The Boudhanath Stupa was fantastic. There were thousands of people there and everyone had to walk around it clockwise. It was surrounded by shops and restaurants, where you could just sit and people watch. This really is a must see if you visit Kathmandu.

Serene. A part from the Stupa you will love walking around little Tibet (another name for Bodhnath) it has amazing things to shop but be sure to bargain to less than 50% of the amount they quote initially.
Amazing. In bustling Kathmandu this wonderful edifice is simply the most spiritual and sensual masterpiece , an iconic temple that thrills and amazes in spades !

Boudhanath - a spiritual hub. I just stayed in Boudha for two weeks and it was an intensely wonderful experience. As you enter throught the gate and the stupa stands beneign, strong immutable before your eyes you can experience a rush of peacefulness. Most people especially the Tibetans make a small prayer gazing raptuously before moving on. Staying al day, you see the moods from the early morning Kora when hundreds of people circumnabulte the stupa, pausing to spin the prayer wheels around its edge, and often chanting Tibetan prayers or a simple Om Mane Padme Hum. Pigeons flock to be fed, circling the stupa rising and flowing each time they are disturbed. Sounds of chanting and Tibetan Buddhist prayers emanate from the various monsteries that are in the vicinity. Later, the shops open, the tourists come and take their requisite photos. It becomes a bazaar with shops selling magnificant singing bowls, prayer flags, incense, tibetan furniture, cute souvenirs and even solar powered prayer wheeels that will spin prayers into the strratosphere every time the sun comes out. Later in the day, butter lamps sellers set up their stands and you can pay to light lamps as a blessing for yourself and loved ones. The eyes of the stupa stare on sending out their message of peace. If you are in Kathmandu, you must go. It is one of the great power places and it affects everyone. With love.

Must see. Maybe it's touristic, but it's one of the place you have to see once in your life! The stupa is really impressive, atmosphere is unique, you feel the weight of history in this place. Do not hesitate to go in the other streets, sometimes you fall on nice treasures !

The Stupa is watching you. What a lovely place to sit, reflect, watch old ladies do their prayer. There is solitude here away from the hustle bustle of the busy streets nearby. Get your blessings in the Temple, give your gratitude, and always look inward... like Bhudda does.

The vibe doing a kora is unreal. Join the pilgrims walking around the stupa (kora). Feel the spiritual energy. The shopping is also quite good (the better shops are further away from the entrance gate).
The largest Stupa. The largest stupa in Nepal and one of the pilgrimage sites for Tibetans. Good restaurants around. It's worth checking.

Impressive stupa. This was definitely the largest stupa I have every seen. Very impressive. I looked the temple that was nearby with a huge prayer wheel. the stupa is in the middle of a great shopping district with no traffic.
Sacred space. Just off a main thoroughfare is this immense island of tranquility, a monument of great beauty and deep spirituality and certainly a must visit for anyone stopping in Kathmandu.
Very beautiful and peaceful place. Our best spot in Kat , very beautiful and peaceful , it is very well maintain and there isn't too many merchants around the temple.

Amazing!. This is Kathmandu. The front cover of Lonely planet. A picture we all recognise. Lots of cafes and shops around it and quite a calm experience. Lots of free wifi in the cafes which most of the hotels don't have.

Worth a Visit. A huge old stupa, whitewashed with hundreds of coloured flags its quite a sight to behold and 'must see' went in KTM. The Great stupa is one of the important Buddhist pilgrimage places. When you step into the clean 'court yard' type street area that surrounds the stupa although it has lots of eating houses and 'tourist' offering the area is surprising quiet and serene. After a walk around the stupa itself, there is nothing better than to partake in a cool drink and continue to admire this massive world heritage structure. Entrance fee 150Rs
What a place. i´ve have never been in a place with such a powerful energy...I had a wonderful winter afternoon there, walking in circles over and over again.

My favourite place in Kathmandu. This was my favourite place in Kathmandu. The stupa is impressive and very photogenic ;) You will get the best light in the afternoon but not too late as the sun will hide behind the buildings quite early. The shops around the stupa are also great - there are clothes there which you won't find anywhere in Kathmandu. The restaurants are also good, especially those offering roof top terraces and balconies. The whole area is surrounded by beautiful and colourful buildings, everything there is so peaceful - no motorbikes. A very good place to spend at least half a day!

Great way to start the day. Went here first thing this morning. What a great way to start the day. I am always weary of attractions this well known as they can be both over commercialized and over rated. This was neither. There were shops and stalls everywhere but no pushy hawking or annoying vendors. It was all very peaceful with the melody of morning prayers from enlightened monks mixing perfectly with the aroma from ever present incense.
A Must See. Great energy. This is a great stupa to visit in the evenings. The energy, the pilgrims and the setting is just absolutely incredible.

Magic. This place is very crowded, both locals and tourists are enjoying this amazing place. It's unique architecture, atmosphere and size sets it appart from the other stupas I had seen so far in Katmandu. And while interesting and colorful during the day, it becomes truly magical at night, lit by hundreds of candles, with the monks praying and singing in the nearby temples. A magical place and exactly what I was expecting when I decided on traveling to Nepal.

A moving experience. To see all the Tibetan ladies walking round the stupa spinning the prayer wheels was a very moving experience. It is an enormous construction and has many brightly coloured prayer flags fluttering in the breeze. It has many interesting shops built around the perimeter making the area colourful and interesting whilst retaining the spirituality of the place.

Worth a worship. This temple is a must must place to visit in Kathmandu. People continuously chanting prayers in Tibetan language. You will see a lot of monks around here also kind enough to take photos with you. The whole ambient is very peaceful. I also came across huge crowd of monks chanting loudly and walking around the whole stupa along with people following them. We also went on the rooftop pretty close to the huge doom for an ariel view. I just wished the surrounding area of city could have been a little less crazier but all together it was an awesome experience.

Must see in Kathmandu. Definitely on the list of "must see" in Kathmandu and worth the visit. Join in with the crowd as they walk around the Stupa. We went twice, once during daylight and once at night; two different experiences.If there is a downside it is the commercial presence that surrounds the Stupa.
Worth a stop. Interesting Buddhist site. The best part is watching people pour new paint on the stupa. They do it all the time

An amzing place of worship in heart of City. During sight seeing the first place we visited was Bodhnath Stupa. The entrance of this Unesco world heritage site is rather unique in the midst of market..But once you enter your mind is soothened with great monument...Lot of people were seen taking parikarma of this round stupa..The architecture is marvellous..Lot of pigeons were seen in one enclosure was a sight to watch... All aound there is a small market with eating places...

Boudhanath. This is a cultural experience that is fun and enjoyable. Boudanath is a white buddhist temple located in Kathmandu, Nepal. It is one of the oldest buddhist temples in the Kathmandu Valley. Once there you will find local vendors who are approved to be there by this stupa and have a variety of great items. No matter what spiritual or religious background, you have to visit this peaceful historic temple. Bring your camera!

Best sightseeing. This area of the city was very near to our hotel and we spent an entire morning around the old stupa, observing the devotee, shopping for colorful Tibetan curios and eating monos. Great day.
Cultural Highlight. This is one of the most historic and important Buddhist shrines in Kathmandu. Lots of excellent photo ops.

Great for what it is. It's a beautiful temple, surrounded by many devoted followers, but it has been encompassed by the tourism bug. I see tourists being doted on in a holy place and feel mildly sick, hence less than an Excellent rating, but it was still a beautiful temple that is worth seeing.
Must visit. Wonderful place, easy to spend half a day, and return several times, plenty to see, plenty of restaurants, and the most wonderful atmosphere
Excellent. It was great as i heard. Great stupa and whole environment all around. I was great to view stupa from rooftop restaurant with hot cofee
great place to visit a life time memory. it was excellent place with must every body visit in life time there are fine restaurant where you can hang out for lunch and dinner

favorite spot in kathmandu. Amazing feeling here. Go at sunrise or sunset to get the full energy of this religious spot.
We went back several times during our visit.
I love this part of Kathmandu. Lots of hussle and bustle, a beautiful Stupa, nice shops, good restaurants, lots of streets and alleys to explore.
A wonderful place to spend time. Great shopping, enjoyable restaurants, fun people watching. A nice place to spend time at in Kathmandu.
Charming place. Make sure you go to one of the roof-top cafes, enjoy a good snack and savor the momentum of the place. It is truly unique.

Probably the most beautiful and atmospheric of the stupas in Nepal. I couldn't drag myself away from the place. I liked this stupa far more than Durbar Square. The statues and art work are gorgeous. More variety than any other stupa in central Kathmandu.

Divine. The vibe of this UNESCO World Heritage site is truly serene. One has to be at the location to feel it. There are people chanting and walking around the stupa with deep concentration. There are monks meditating around the stupa. There is a distinct sense of stillness even in the midst of the bustling market around it.The market place was lined with interesting shops selling traditional Nepali stuff. There are cafes where you can sit and enjoy a lovely view of the monument. We bought many prayer flags, chant CDs and memorabilia from here.

A must. You cannot visit Kathmamdu without visiting here. Ok the shops surrounding it are very touristy but I loved the vibe of the place. Lots of places to eat surrounding the stupa. Good photo ops too!

very spiritual. its size and the mental bonding was something i am still to understand. The walk around this place was very satisfying and the disciplined crowd. The prayers and chanting after 5 pm in this place was something new to me and i felt really happy taking part in this ritual
Amazing site. Was there when the Stupa was completely filled with chanting Monks - one of the most memorable experiences and visuals of any of my travels

A Treasure. If you are at all interested in Buddhist culture, this is the place. The Stupa itself is beautiful. The devotion of Tibetan pilgrims that circumambulate the Stupa, sometimes in full prostration, is humbling. Plus, the sights and sounds of the restaurants and shops surrounding the Stupa are exhilarating. Follow the side streets to visit the many monasteries surrounding the Stupa and attend a puja. These are experiences you will never forget.

Definitely worth it. Nicest place we visited in Kathmandu, beautiful, peaceful but energetic - give yourself a couple of hours to walk around spinning the prayer wheels and looking at the lovely crafts...
Bodnath Stupa. Very interesting, spiritual place; better to have a guide, if you are not an expert in Buddhism; take at least 2 hours to enjoy plaza and see some shops
A busy, vibrant, yet calm place. It is amazing to see such a busy, often crowded place exude such a feeling of calm. The Bodnath Stupa is a must-see in Kathmandu.
May favourite place. A def see. This place is amazing and definitely worth a visit. Plenty of places to go for food or tea around and lots of shops to look in too.

Best cultural experience. This temple is beautiful. It is full of colour, culture, smells, soul and people. Out of all the temples I visited in Nepal, this was by far my favourite. It was busy yet peaceful. I urge anyone visiting Nepal to put this on their to do list!
Breathtaking!. Amazing stupa! You definitely have to go!There is great cafes from where you can enjoy the sunset over the stupa.
Amazing!. A beautiful stupa!! Visit at dusk and you can see them light the candles in the stupa....and then have a nice beer overlooking it at one of the local cafes.

Lovely Place. It's hard to describe this enchanting: I think it's a must-see if visiting Nepal. It brings so many aspects together in to a smallish area, and there is so much to learn. Enjoy this spiritual place and learn about both Hinduism and Buddhism... I loved it. Visually stunning, with the Buddha face and all the bunting, not to mention the monks in their orange robes, this is a place you will never forget.

One of the Meccas of the buddhist world. Well worth going to see the massive stupa, and also the masses of people making the kora round around the Stupa.This area is like a buddhist city, with many Tibetan shops and gompas, in the streets immediately around Boudhanath.Obviously too, where ever there are tourists, there are many scam artists and hustlers, which is normal for Nepal, so be a bit sceptical about people who approach with stories for money.Some good cafes and restaurants around the stupa itself, that have nice rooftop terraces where you can watch all the pilgrim action.

I did not want to leave!. This site is not to be missed. Amazing energy, great views, very accessible...my only regret is that I did not reserve a hotel room closer to this stupa. I stayed in Thamel, but easily hired a cab driver for the day at a reasonable rate.

A must-see. It's hard to describe this enchanting: I think it's a must-see if visiting Nepal. It brings so many aspects together in to a smallish area, and there is so much to learn. Enjoy this spiritual place and learn about both Hinduism and Buddhism... I loved it. Visually stunning, with the Buddha face and all the bunting, not to mention the monks in their orange robes, this is a place you will never forget.
Spectacular View. Great environment and Beautiful Place. Watch the crazy monkey doing crazy things.Have a drink or meal at a rooftop and enjoy the view. Just love this place.....
Great religious place. Sit around the stupa in one of the restaurant for a nice view. You would love it. Go during afternoon time to listen to the chants of the monks.
A must see when in Kathmandu. A 15 minute taxi ride from Thamel. We went out early and had breakfast at one of the roof top cafes and watched the locals doing their circuits and prostrations.
Splendid. This splendid monument is a large, white dome, containing Buddhist relics. Around the dome, thousands of pilgrims goes around praying.

Wonderful place. My favourite place in Kathmandu. Such a good energy around the stupa, great to sit in the cafes and watch the Sherpa ladies walking round spinning the prayer wheels. Visit on full moon day and the place is buzzing,special ceremonies taking place and butter lamps all around. A good place to stay, with cheap accommodation, often in or next to monasteries, much quiter than Thamel, but still caters well for tourists. Close to airport, so a good place to start or finish your trip.

massive stupa surrounded by its deal of interesting attractions. impressive stupa which you climb upon, in the middle of a huge place around which you would find a couple of interesting buildings and temples, and a few very interesting craftsman shops, selling beautiful mandalas (the seller explained us their symbolism and how to evaluate them), food, silk scarfs and linen, etc.
beautiful stupa. Great environment and beautiful stupa. Have a drink or meal at a rooftop and enjoy the view. Taxi takes you right to entrance so easy to get to. Worth the visit for a couple hours.

A world heritage Site. The Great stupa of Boudhanath stands approximately 6 km North East from centre of the kathmandu valley.Surrounded by hills,Boudanath stupa is a jewel point in the center of a naturale mandala,a store of scared energy.it is one of the most important place of pilgrimage for the Buddhist.
Must visit. Culture at the forefront. Eclectic mix of elderly Nepalese, monks and tourists. Does have the usual Tourist catch points around the stupa, which only adds more to the colors.

BEAUTIFUL! MUST VISIT!. Unique. In all my travels the visit to the Bodnath Stupa stands out as a unique experience. We walked there from Pashupatinath along the route described in the Lonely Planet guidebook and recommend the stroll through suburbian Kathmandu. Visiting the stupa and seeing all the Buddhist monks and hearing the chanting and prayers was marvellous. We stayed there for some hours and had lunch at the Stupa View Restaurant before joining the crowd and circling the stupa. The atmosphere was welcoming and friendly, we never got the feeling that we were intruding on anybody's private religious worship. A unique site, not only for Nepal, but for the entire world!

A must for all tourists to Kathmandu. The best place to visit as a tourist to Kathmandu! Walk around the stupa anticlockwise and turn the prayer wheels. Buddhist or not, it makes you feel good.

amazingly peaceful and clean!. It was interesting how as we walked towards Bodnath Stupa, the area became cleaner and cleaner. Wonderful bit of Tibet in the middle of Kathmandu. No one who visits the incredible city of Kathmandu should miss visiting Bodinath Stupa, and its surrounding Tibetan Buddhist temples and shops. It is as close as one can get to journeying to Lhasa, Tibet as it was before being crushed under the brutal de-Tibetanization cultural campaign of the Chinese government. Unlike in Bhutan, it is possible to take photographs inside the two Tibetan Buddhist temples facing the Stupa. The amazingly colorful people, most of them Tibetan refugees from Chinese-occupied Tibet, are a joy to see.

One of the most peaceful places...... Bodnath Stupa is a World Heritage sight that lies about 25 minutes from downtown Thamel. It is huge and beautiful. Hindu's/buddhists from all over the world come here to pray. The walk around the Stupa in a clockwise fasion spinning the prayer wheels and reciting their prayers. Some people out load and others to themselves. The faces on the local people who have come down from the mountains are a sight to behold....Very different as the mix of Tibet and nepal combined with the Himalayas has kept many people segregated. Great people watching. Enjoy Bodnath, you cannot miss this!

So much better than the photos!. The stupa has many beautiful photos taken of it - but nothing prepares you for the real thing. It's awe-inspiring!The square the stupa is in is just beautiful as well. The whole atmosphere is amazing.Make sure you visit!
Quite a place!. Temple a treat, the pigeons are a plenty, worth a visit, the place has a feel of calm amidst chaos, very busy

great city sight. nice place to visit - Watch ou for the monkeys and thief's best during the morning and sunset!!! nice place to visit - Watch ou for the monkeys and thief's best during the morning and sunset!!!

Memorable!. As they all say go there early in the morning or end of the day when the locals are doing their prayers around the stupa. Go up on the roof and look at the people below walking in circles, the energy is so powerful, it's amazing, I will never forget this experience.
Peace and good energy. As soon as you enter the area around the stupa, you will feel peace and calm and surrounded with good energy. It's a must-visit place in Kathmandu.

One of the wonders of the world!. We took a taxi out to Bodnath one one of our free afternoons. What an amazing place! There is a certain calmness even though there were crowds of people there to complete their prayers.
Awesome sight. Greatvplace to sit and relax - free wifi in most of the rooftop restaurants around it, can relax and chill

An oasis in a loud city. Probably my favorite site in Kathmandu. The stupa is situated in the large courtyard of a ring of buildings. Once you're inside the city noise fades away quite literally. There are monks and lay people alike praying and meditating, and its great for lunch or shopping. You can get great deals on beads and singing bowls and any souvenirs you want to take home. You can even get blessings from monks. The blessings are always free, but a nice tip of 5 or 10 US dollars to help fund their monastary is always advised. My wife and I visited three times because we loved the atmosphere at the stupa.

A must see. We stayed nearby at The Hotel Tibet International just steps away from the Boudanath Stupa. We could see it when we ate breakfast on the rooftop and made our way over to see it up close. Fantastic people watching- monks coming to pray, tourists, vendors all in one place. We wandered and listening to chanting which was so beautiful. If you want to immerse yourself in the culture, this is a terrific place to do it.
my favourite place !!!!!!!. i love this place....i love itevery time i visit nepal i can't wait to get to boudha and do a round!!!

The Bouddhhnath stupa is also known as Khasti Chitya.. This Colossal stupa the biggest in Nepal is situated about 7km. East of the capital. The Bouddhhnath stupa is also known as Khasti Chitya and is considered as one of the oldest stupas in the country.With a diameter of about 100m and a height of 40m, Bouddhanath is among the largest stupas in the world. The Bouddhanath stupa covers a vast area that has a circumbulatory path at the bottom and another path made of three-tier plinth. The stupa looks similar to Swayambhunath but many features in this stupa are pinnacles as well as 108 Buddhist Gods and Goddesses. The most attractive part of the Stupa is the all seeing eyes of the Buddha painted with red, white and blue. It is believed that King Manadeva built the Bouddhanath stupa during the Lichavi period. It has been renovated time and again and the present form of stupa was renovated in the 17th century.The most popular festival celebrated here is the Tibetan New Year festival Lhosar that falls in February. The festival starts with prayers and worship. Thousands, of Tibetans dress Traditionally and dance after lighting incense to Buddha. Lots of Tibetan comes from Laddakh, Sikkim, Bhutan as well as other parts of the hills to celebrate this festival. In Bouddhanath, there are many monasteries or Gompas. They are all beautifully decorated and colorfully painted. One can visit the monasteries and take photographs but you can always give small donation when clicking the photographs.

unbelievable. This is a must see sight. No matter how much the area has changed from my first visit in 1985 I still enjoy spending an afternoon and evening walking around the stupa watching the pilgrims do their prostrations and the endless ceremonies that are going on all the time. There are many cafes to sit and enjoy the sites

So worth a visit. For a cheap taxi ride out here it was worth every rupee. The people that were walking around the Stupa and chanting with the prayer wheels were from an incredible cross section of life. Was worth taking the time to have a coffee or tea from one of the roof top cafes.
Stolen Handbag. The stups is wonderful, we took 6 local kids/orphans there and went to a roof top restaurant as a treat for them. I had my handbag stolen off the back of my seat.

Fascinating. The stupa itself is beautiful glistening in the sunshine with lots of prayer flags fluttering in the breeze. Enjoyed people watching here: monks and local people circumnavigating, some people meditating or prostrating in prayer. also really fascinating to pop into nearby Shechen monastery around 5.00pm and watch the monks in prayer.
Fantastic. Went three times... wonderful place to practice and experience. Atmosphere second to none... a must for any visitor to Kathmandu.

Serenity at it's best!. The people here fascinated me! Being a Travel bug who likes Culture, I was fascinated by the Culture shown in just this one place! It seemed so reel! The shops which lined the stupa! The stupa! An amazing place to visit! The Culture overdose would surely get to you!
Pleasant afternoon. Good to visit and wander in the sunshine.Peaceful. The shops and cafes are full of interesting things which seem to be better quality than Thamel
Best place to see.. I love very much. I was been there 4 times.It was nice view from there. But Please from there ,they try to sell me some thanka
We are all equal and one under the eye of STUPA.... All visitors from around the world to Stupa...... love you all. To the pigeon resident...hmmm.. need to be careful !!!!!
Nice and peaceful. When you have visited Bodnath you do not need to visit other stupas. Here you get very close to Tibet.

If you visit one place in Kathmandu, visit Bodnath Stupa. The Bodnath Stupa is a unique place. The Stupa itself is beautiful, but the people, the atmosphere, the sounds are the real reasons that make this place so special. I'd recommend going early morning (7 am or so) and join the monks and other locals walking around the Stupa in clockwise direction, without all the tourists that show up later in the day.
Can't miss this place. Go here after visiting Pashupatinath. You will understand this better after the experience. Trust me.

Spell-binding Bhuddist site. The huge stupa, with its gold-embossed eyes at the top and lines of flags, is surrounded by a wall-enclosed praying area. All day but mainly around dusk, religious devotees including many monks, walk in a clockwise direction around the outside of the stupa walls. The entire site is surrounded by a square of attractive high buildings, some containing shops on the ground floor and others with roof-top restaurants from which you can observe the scene. It is a great place to be, just watching the multi-coloured throng constantly on the move. We visited with a guide as part of a group the first time, then re-visited via the 'cultural walk' from the Hyatt Hotel on our last evening in Nepal. We went inside the stupa walls at around 18.00 but found that we could not get out again except by circling the whole stupa, just inside the wall. This was slightly embarrassing because we had to step through densely packed areas of devotees praying, although they did not seem to mind our presence. Normally you can enter a shorter circular walk near the stupa itself, in the centre of the site, but this was already closed by 18.00. We had a meal in the Buddha Kitchen restaurant, from where you can survey the ever-circling throng from their first-floor windows. It was a hypnotic site to visit and will stay long in our memory. (There is a booth at both entry points, stating a 150 rupees charge for foreigners but no-one seems to insist on payment if you just walk in with the crowd.)
dec 2012. relaxing, very good. good shops and shop keepers not pushy. cheap. not too busy. excellent. would go again.
Visit this giant stupa. This is truly a beautiful stupa, but the area immediately around the stupa are also a joy to behold. This is a not to miss 'attraction'.
Go early. It gets quite hot at mid-day so my advice is to go early. Bring an umbrella for the sun. It's well worth the visit and many other attractions are close by.
spectular. Like: rich arteffects & various ethnic restaurants encircled around the Stupa.Area around the Stupa well maintained was clean & tidy.Dislike; Nil

A must see heritage site. This stupa is world known and quite interestingly set inside a circle of shops. We visited as the sun was going down and various religious ceremonies were beginning in the firelight. Worth seeing.

Breath-taking in the early morning. It is absolutely beautiful in the morning and in the evening when the locals do their walk/kneel around the stupa. The lamps in the evening add an additional glow to the stupa. Join the locals and turn the prayer wheels as you walk in a clockwise direction and experience the vibe. You will be amazed by the experience.

very great time for my life i also remember and wanna be back again. there is very nice and Holy place i love all of there all Nepal but for food there is much to resturant u can chose around town all of Kathmandu

Warning: This Place Will Turn You Into An Instant Tibetan Buddhist. Get up at dawn and walk around the stupa with the Buddhist monks, the old ladies, and the whole Tibetan community while the sun rises. I doubt you'll ever forget that!

Peaceful place, though bustling with tourists. Good place, very peaceful though it is bustling with tourists (like us). Would not recommend you shop there, as the prices are hiked up for tourists. Nice cafes available around the stupa where you can chill out.

must see. but over it after 30mins. Great place. Must see! but i got over it after 30 minutes. All you can really do is take photos and visit a couple of surrounding temples. the rest is just souvenir shops
must be seen. Fantastic spiritual spot, the most peaceful place I have ever visited. Need to be visited during daytime.

Bodnath stupa. Close to the nearby Hyatt Regency, this is a very active temple site with an almost never ending stream of people visiting it through to 10pm or so. Particularly interesting at around 0700 when a lot of people stop by on their way to work...

Visiting Bodnath. Fantastic place to gain the spirit of Buddism. You are looking for a place to calm down after running around noisy and dusty Kathmandu? This place is a kind of island with the culture of Budda.
A haven in the chaos of Kathmandu. This was such a good find it was so peaceful after the chaos of Kathmandu, it was hard to believe that you were still in the city.

Favorite place in Kathmandu!. This is a beautiful square with cool little shops, restaurants and of course the huge sacred Stupa. It is a wonderful place to spend a day and i especially enjoyed it because there were no cars in the square so it felt very peaceful, safe and clean. I will be back to visit!

By far our faveourite place in Kathmandu. We went here the first time at night just after sunset, and the atmosphere of the place was amazing. We returned the next day during day time, and the Stupa was absolutelty stunning. One of the most powerful structures I have seen, and strikes a cord with you even if you are not religious or a Buddhist. The Thangka shops around the Stupa were also some of the best and most authentic we have seen in Nepal and we bought some very reasonably priced Thangkas here done by Masters and not tourist quality.Definately recommend a visit.

The world's largest stupa. The world's largest stupa. Spend some time here walking around clockwise spinning the large prayer wheels, ringing bells, and offering a prayer. Then climb up and walk around under the prayer flags.

Better than the Monkey Temple. Most impressive Buddhist temple. Since you have to pay an entrance fee to get in, it is less congested within the gates than out on the streets. Shops and rooftop cafes surround the temple. I preferred this to Swayambhunath (Monkey Temple), except for the monkeys, but if you need a monkey fix, go to Pashupatinath...it actually has more of the little gremlins!

Cultural focus not to be missed. If you are interested in Tibetan Buddhism or simply want a rich cultural experience of Nepal this is one item which should be central to your itinerary. The monks swing incense and worshippers circumnavigate the huge stupa turning prayer wheels to the musical accompaniment of 'Om Mani Padme Hum'. This is the largest Buddhist stupa outside of Tibet and the area surrounding Boudha (pronounced bow-da) houses many Tibetan refugees. Buildings surrounding the stupa include a beautiful gompa (monastery), a thangka painting school and many stalls selling pashminas etc. You can enter and walk up onto the lower level of the stupa via a small door. Also recommended is the rooftop at Cafe du Temple at for refreshments and a great view of the stupa.

Beautiful & colorful. Simply beautiful..... a very nice feel by simply walking around the Stupa. The contrasting colours of the shops and flags against the pure white of the Stupa is a beautiful sight to behold. It would be even better if one could spend the late afternoon/ evening at one of the cafes sipping coffee while taking in the beautiful view.
Don't miss this. very nice place with many restaurants and shops around it. very clean and would highly recommend a visit

I heart this place!. Very chilled out place..its pretty much similar to Syambunath ( Monkey Temple) but in my own opinion its very laid back..you can sit in one of the cafes or just about anywhere and instantly feel at peace..It gets really windy here..cool afternoon breeze..you dont have to do anything but just sit still and take in all that Boudhanath has to offer you.Its a very spiritual and calming experience ,one that is totally worth it..Spend few hours here..have some tea..and dont forget to visit the temples as the monks will have their morning prayers and its really magical to watch them play their musical instruments..you could really feel the vibrations..
Serene and impressinve. Lovely stupa and area. I wish that I had spent more time there. Plan to visit for at least an afternoon.

Such peace. No matter what your religion, this is a beautiful place of peace. Prayer flags fluttering in the wind and the eyes of God watching over all of us. Hauntingly beautiful bamboo flute music coming from one of the nearby shops. An oasis of calm (no honking horns!) in a bustling city. Very spiritual.
Loved looking at the prayer flags. it was cool to see the sights. Recommend about an hour worth of time. Lots of small shops and cafes nearby.

Magnificent stupa!. very authentic Tibetan atmosphere! The stupa and shops around it are defniately worthwhile! It is also really beautiful to watch the sun set over the stupa, from a rooftop cafe, there are a couple of them around the Stupa!

Awesome place. Very beautiful, profoundly spiritual place, not at all set back by the zillion shops around it! I had lunch overlooking the stupa, and then circumnavigated (clockwise!). I just wish I had had more time.

Very Tibet like atmosphere. Definitely must see if you are staying in Kathmandu. VeryTibetian and spiritual atmosphere. If you are a photographer go there on sunset. It is very colorful and on sunset Bodnath stupa with all the praying flags and building around is just stunning. It is almost impossible to do a bad photo there even if you try hard :)
beautiful. A true Tibetan beauty. A must see to truly feel with the Tibetan people. Lots of shops for buying beads and colorful stuff. Go down a side street to get cheap local foods.

Visit in the late afternoon. Definitely worth checking out and only half an hour from Thamel. Although walking this massive stupa will only take around half an hour, it's worth it to see the locals worshipping and take in the size of the thing. There's plenty of guest houses, shops, restaurants and monasteries around it to keep you occupied. It's nice to arrive around 4pm for the sunset, which is when all the locals come down to make their offerings, and once it gets dark, butter lamps are lit and it's nice to sit on one of the rooftop restaurants and soak in the atmosphere of monks playing horns and drums as you look out over the stupa and Kathmandu.Don't miss the little doorway in the stupa wall on the north side, where you can climb up to the upper platform for a better view. Remember to go around the stupa clockwise to avoid offending the locals.
The best place to discover at kathmandu valley.. The stupa is so beautiful and i love this place very much. There were not crowded and the environment was relax and peaceful.
a piece of peace. though crowded ... a rather peaceful place ... great shopping deals if one is to bargain. just a walk around this makes one feel that we are in a land of the Budha..
Unique!. A landmark you should not miss! It is a great and movable feeling to walk around it in contemplation.
very nice. it was great to see and it wasn't too crowded, easy to get to, i recommend visiting it, and give yourself 45mins - 1hr to enjoy

Haven of Peace in busy Kathmandu. I loved it .. after a few nights in Thamel a friend and I arrived in the evening and declared we had landed in Paradise. Get up early 5.30 - and circle the Stupa with the monks and the locals and after some rounds, share a tea for Rps10 from the thermos flask sellers at the edge.. it was a beautiful few days there and something I will always remember.

Bodnath Stupa is an oasis in busy Kathmandu. Definitely a place to visit. Try to go inside the temples and talk to the Buddhist students or monks, it will give you another perspective and will be more informative than what you find on your guides.

Boudhanath A Must See. The area was well developed with shops and lovely cobbled pedestrian around the stupa and a few shrines around help tourist to spend their time there with some other sights than the stupa itself. Having my guide explaining the meaning of the structure, it has no difference to Monkey Temple however, if you want to spend time for some rooftop view while sipping drinks, it is a nice spot.

Boudha Stupa. Really liked the spiritual nature of all those who did prayers around this holy site & the sound of Puja's from the small Temples within the Stupa's circle. Heaps of shops around & you really need to check out prices. Don't be afraid to barter or check out other shops prices.

Peace Mind. I have been most of place in Kathmandu include Boudhanath Stupa, but once i reach this i feel peace in the place, with om mane padme............with many tibeaten influence and smell. once you are Kathmandu you should visit this place.
Atmospheric.. I love this place. It's beautiful and interesting. A must visit. Lots of interesting little stalls and side alleys.

Magical and stilling. It's so tranquil, especially coming from Kathmandu. We'd underestimated the importance of this place, attracting Buddhist pilgrims from all over Asia and further afield too. The feel is quite awe-inspiring, magical and naturally stilling. We circumabulated the stupa in silence, alongside monks, pilgrims and a medley of people from all over the world. It was really moving. Hearing the monks chanting in the distance as we settled down to sleep was also really special.

Beautiful. Beautiful stupa worth the cheap taxi ride to see. Very well kept. Amazing photo opportunities and accessible by all types both the young and elderly.Definitely favourite attraction in Kathmandu
senter of the world. The best and peasfull place i've ever seen. No gides, no asking...Someday you could visit it without paying in evening and come to upside to put candle in alcove

A beautifull place. I was very interesting and very beautifull. We were there at the time of the Buddhist new year and it was full of prayers and the athmosphere was so blissfull and beautifull. There is also nice shops selling buddhist items.

A spiritual place. This was the first of many religious sites visited on this trip-but remains one of my favorites. Despite being in a big city, I did not feel overwhelmed by the people. very impressive and more than 2500 years old. very nice to see with all kind of shops.
also the temples are very interesting.

3 Circles lead to Inner Peace. The bodnath Stupa is a journey to finding one's inner peace by mindfully walking 3 times around the top of the stupa. You will see devout buddhists praying joyfully, inhale the exotic incense and hear the chanting of surrounding monks. A sacred place. The trip was coordinated by Funny Nepal Treks and they were amazing as well.
Groovy Stupa. Nice atmosphere, lots of groovy little shops and cafes surrounding the Stupa, allowing you time to just cruise and enjoy.
Unesco World Heritage Site. Fairly touristy, but still very interesting. Great place to find a restaurant for lunch, some of them upstairs with wonderful views of the Stupa.

om mani padme hung. bodnath was my favourite area in Kathmandu, so peaceful, so inspiring, that i ended up spending a whole week there, traveling back and forth between other attractions in the Valley and Hotel Padme, which i really loved as well. do not go to Kathmandu without spinning the - more than - hundred praying wheels of this UNESCO worl heritage site.

Take the walk. Join the worshippers on their devotional circuit of the Bodnath Stupa. Its a walking meditation, Lose track of time, Lose track of self. "" Om Mani Padmi Hum .

Words can't describe.... such a peaceful and stunning beautiful place. Words can not describe it. Give yourself time to walk around, explore, come back, walk around some more, visit shops, etc. Don't rush this one and just snap photos - it is much more something you need to experience.
Very spiritual place. Dont miss a trip here if you go to Kathmandu...an amazing break from the craziness! The place is so beautiful and has such a nice atmosphere around it.

It is large and impressive and the focal point of Buddhist worship in Kathmandu. Without background, this would appear to be a big cement block. Best Stupa in Kathmandu. I liked Bodnath Stupa more than Swayambhunath. The place is peaceful and lovely. One of the best places to observe Buddhist people, you can literally see their affection towards all kinds of living beings. Circumambulate the stupa in clockwise direction (kora) to burn karma, spin the mantra wheels to release "om mani padme hum" mantra to the entire universe, enjoy the atmosphere. Besides, you can buy really cheap souvenirs from shops around the stupa! Entrance fee is 50 NPR (Oct. 2012)
Fascinating. Nothing to dislike once you get past the dirt, trash, dust that is ubiquitous in Kathmandu. Eye Popping.

The busyness and noise (most of it) of the everyday city life is left behind and you can peacefully stroll around, admiring the Stupa itself or perhaps getting a souvenir or two from local stores.Visit of the Boudha Stupa Thanka Center will give you a good introduction of how the paintings are made, you will be able to watch students working on some of them, and of course there is a store you can buy a genuine one right from the source.
Definitely worth a visit. An interesting historical and site. Definitely worth a visit when you are in Kathmandu. Interesting place to people watch.

Peacefull place, verry beautiful and great views. Verry big stupa, much bigger than I expected! The peacefull admosphere is a big contrast if you come from hetic Katmandu. The rooftop restaurants in de sqare around the stupa are expensive and the shops too.

As the moment I entered into it, I found a very big stupa in the middle and shops all around it. It took almost 12-15 mins for me to walk around the stupa.Beautiful place.

Peaceful stupa in bustling Kathmandu. Pedestrianised so one can stroll in peace. Pleanty of rooftop cafes to relax in and catch a cooling breeze. Minimal hassle. Plenty of surrounding small streets to explore.
Eye Candy. So much history, so much culture. The site is well maintained for being so old. Would liked to have spent more time enjoying the square around the Stupa

A great place to visit. A nice clean place, with a great view of the mountains. It also gives a taste of traditional Nepal. The place is clean, which is great, and also it does give you a insight about the Buddhist origin of Nepal.
A great place to visit.

Definitely worth a visit. This is definitely worth a visit. It is picturesque but to me the most interesting element is seeing the pilgrims in traditional dress walking by rolling the prayer wheels..quite the photo opp too!
must go. It iis a deep, purifying experience to walk around the stupa. It has a different look every hour of the day; the pilgirms, the locals, the pigeons ... many temples in the vicinity.

Most beautiful Stupa. A must visit when in Kathmandu
This place will take your breath away
It is easy to spend all day exploring temples, shops, restaurants & monastries in this special place.
Must see!. Very interesting...one of the biggest stupas in the world...not too far from Thamel district. We enjoyed visiting Bodnath Stupa.
Magical place. A must in Nepal. I rented a taxi from Kathmandhu the whole day and went there. The feeling of the Stupa is amazing!

Fascinating sight. remember to walk round the sight in a clockwise direction!
A superb Stupa surrounded by an array of differnet shops, which do not cause you any hassle if all you are doing in taking in the sight of the stupa.

Very touristy, but an impressive stupa.. A must-see if you are in KTM. If you've never been to a stupa, go to this one. It's impressive in size and importance to then locals. There's also plenty of shops if you need to pick-up some souvenirs at the end of your stay.

Interesting and busy. This stoupa is surrounded by shops and restaurants - some with wifi if you need it. Definitely worth a visit. It's also a short stroll by the back streets from the Hyatt Regency hotel. Like many attractions in Kathmandu, it could do with a little tidying up but basically it's a great and atmospheric visit. The numerous temple dogs seem to be relaxed and abound in all the temples locally. Access for people with walking and mobility problems would be difficult.
Bodnath visit. This was part of a 3-spot day visit. A must-see. Lots of rooftop restaurants to choose from, depending on the sun's angle. The earnestness of the devotees is powerful to behold.

Good Place. Best place to do Tibetan shopping but bargain at least 60% from the price.
Monastry had some chanting prayers going on, very nice to hear.
Overall a must see place when you are in Kathmandu

A very good place to visit to see traditional Tibetan culture.. Just an over all interesting and colourful place to visit. Also good food is easily aviailable. But they should notbbe charging ientrance fees.. It makes it feel commercial.
the closest to Tibet as possible. This is a nice palce to visit if you havn't been to Tibet. It gives you glimpse how life is there. Go later in the afternoon after all the tour groups have gone.

... one of these places .... if there is a "big three" to visit in Kathmandu, Bodnath Stupa would certainly be on the list of many. This is a very impressive Stupa and it attracts people from all over the world, Buddhists and non-Buddhists alike, to tour its base while turning the 540+ prayer wheels. All of the buildings surrounding the circular space that contains the Stupa depend on it. Most of them because they eitjer sell souvenirs or food and drinks, but apart from these there are also some monestaries that can be visited.

Eye Eye. Blink and you'll miss it (no pun intended) hidden in a myriad of stalls and mini shops it would so easy to walk past. The most splendid temple in Kathmadu - clean, hassle free and must br viewed from the roof terrace oppostie. Look closely for the 108 niches below the dome of the sculptured deities
Wonderful place!. Do not miss this! We visited after having been to the cremation site at the Pashupatinath and LOVED the peacefulness of the site!

Unbelievably spiritual. Go at sundown, get your mala beads, take your time to soak it all in. Just walking clockwise with people and monks from all around the world is just indescribable. You can't miss this.
Wonderful sight to start out with. Remember to walk clockwise when visiting a stupa. Many shops around the stupa. Wonderful walk from the Hyatt

start in durbar square, continue to Bodnath... perfect place, i hope that goverment is using collect money from entrance fee for renovation all area and support nice local tibetian comminity.you can have perfect authentic feeling of Tibet here,sometimes stronger, than in Tibet...recomend just dring masala tea on the roof top restaurant and forge about the time.just be HERE and NOW,enjoy it.

Dreamy stupa with mountain Air Guided Adventures. I visited October 12 in Boudhanath stupa. I feel quite difference than photo and documentary. suppose evening environment with the circled people signing spiritual song as well as counting the mantra Mane padme hu. Mountain Air guided Adventures provided me a excellent guide naba who described the history of this temple. There are also monastery, coffee shop, and dreamy lighting oil lamp. i feel iam in the new world.

Impressive... The fact it sits in a little Tibetan village is special, this was my first visit to a Stupa. We had lunch as well overlooking the Stupa can't remember the name but great for people watching.

Beautiful even day or night. We went there in the late evening, we couldn't see the colorful view of the stupa but we had seen its beauty in a different side. Also the ticket boots were closed when we arrived so there was no charge unlike the other tourist cites we had visited.

Bodnath stupa. Fascinating to see the monks chanting, and the size of it was overwhelming. A touristy area, but charming in its own way. There is alovely restaurant attached to a nearby monastery with organic food, v. clean and peaceful.
Must see. Fascinating to see the Stupa and all the little shops, artisan crafts and restaurants. Go to an upstairs or rooftop restaurant and try fried Momos.

Stunning. This is the second most holiest of sites for Buddhists. Go just before sunset to hear the Tibetans and Buddhists chant and pray to this amazing Stupa. At sunset they then walk clockwise around the stupa, it's a truly uplifting place and you can feel the energy. I even walked around the Stupa and spun some prayer wheels for family and friends. You can light some butter lamps on the side roads for Buddha. Lots of lovely Tibetan craft shops around which are very cheap and amazing quality. A must for anyone visiting Kathmandu valley.

Don't miss this!. You turn the corner to go up a street and boom: there is it. Very unexpected as I didn't know what we were going to see. Incredible and very large. Love the music that some of the vendors were playing. Went off to the side in one of the temples where there were large prayer wheels and lots of lit candles. Tons of people but they all seem to be there for a purpose. I always dreamed of going to Nepal and seeing this and now I have.
must see. magical and very friendly boudhistic area, a must see in ktm. The rooftop terrasses are cool ! a variety of restaurants and little shops, but still very authentic.

Tucked away giant. Didnt expect to see such a large stupa when I walked between the buildings. Was pretty impressive and, compared to a few other Kathmandu areas of interest, I found the entry fee fare and felt like it was getting used appropriately

When I visited Bodnath Stupa. awesome place to visit...for buddhists....but others can also enjoy there... I visited there ....I think 3 yrs ago.....with my family members....I will not forget this place ever....

A must see. Even though understandably commercial, the atmosphere is more laid back and the vendors more chilled than any other site we visited. Take the time to walk around clockwise, drop into the other sites, temples, restaurants and painting school. Definately somewhere to spend some time, not a fleeting visit. Soak up the atmosphere and reflect and enjoy.

Cultural Eye Candy. Largest stupa in Nepal, built 14th century, lots of interesting legends, history, visit the book stores that surrond the stupa and "dust" off some amazing selections. Great diverse people watching, wonderful shopping for traditional wares, all the colorful prayer flags tied to the stupa flutter in the wind, carrying mantras and prayers heavenward are stunningly beautiful. Just rich in color and history. Go in the morning or late afternoon as it gets really HOT about mid day!

Big Stupa. The biggest stupa in the world perhaps. Very quiet and serene place to get out of the noise from the city, but right in the middle of the city.Shops and rooftop restaurants - a good stop for lunch.

Peace & The holy place. we reached there by 6 pm, we went for dinner in roof top cafe, After 7 pm when they start make fire lighting around stupa, such a beautiful, if you want to make your mood fresh and enjoy with friends, this is the best place.
very peace full place.. best place for sightseeing. when you get there once, you never want to back without staying few hours there.it is very..

Cool place. We really liked this place, cool Stupa and nice restaurants/ cafes surrounding it...We stayed a night so we could see the place at night and with less people, it wasn't any quieter at night but was nice in the dark

an alternative to Thamel. Staying in this region has the charme to enjoy religious rituals that are missing in other parts of the city. And it is for sure quieter than Thamel during the night. We will definitely come again.

Lunch at a Rooftop cafe to get a feel then walk round. We arrived here lunch time and ate at a rooftop cafe admiring the view before walking round.Again a book or a guide is a must for this being one of the Holiest Bhuddist sites in Nepal.
Nice to walk around and visit the antique market. Nice to see all the pelgrims and other people. Also the antiques are beautifull to see. Just take a taxi from Thamel and go there.

The best place to enjoy Katmandu. The stupa is the largest and the most beautiful in Katmandu. The area is full of little shops, cafes and restaurants. The atmosphere is quiet and peaceful. Sit in one of the cafes, drink a cup and enjoy.

surprising and peaceful. There is no shortage of stupa's in Kathmandu. But this one was a true surprise. One aspect of it was its size. Another - atmosphere. It was a very pleasant place. Just spending an hour next to it makes you feel relaxed after Kathmandu noise and pollution.
A pleasant few hours.. Not much to do, but a lot to look at. Relax at one of the roof top cafes surrounding the stupa, or shop a bit.
A must go in Kathmandu. You have to be there and walk around the Stupa(clockwise). The sight, the smells, etc are unique. Besides there a few terrace restaurants with a great view and good meals.

Pretty area, great to wander around even if you aren't that into temple visits. We wandered around, ate lunch and people watched in this pretty area. Lots of shops and restaurants and there and is just outside the hustle and bustle of the streets.

Bodnath. Love the Atmosphere GREAT place to people watch
peaceful and serene and oasis in amid the hustle and bustle

Well we were there. Well yes just ok . If this is the type of thing that Interest you then you would like it . But for us it was a bit of a tourist trap. Maybe worth seeing while you are in the area but we would not revisit
Glad I went to see this. You might not be a Buddhist, but the stupa is something to see and experience the spiritual feeling of just being there.

most often i visit here.. This place is the most rewarded place for Buddhist but the way people have painted on the shrine is terrible and peoples running into the archaeological objects like a love-birds park..it is not fare..
A most see spot. better come in the evening, most tibetan will do the Kora in the evening when it's cooler, the energy in this place is very powerful any time of the day though.
best early in the morning. fabulous place to visit and walk around turning the prayer wheels. surrounded by tourist shops selling mostly the same items as in Thamel but harder to bargin here.

Quiet corner of Kathmandu. Kathmandu is busy and dusty, and walking through the gates of Bodnath is a welcome reprieve! The stupa is very impressive, have lunch on one of the rooftop patios for a great view from above.
Amazing!. Don't just hang around the main 'plaza' where the stupa is - get exploring in the backstreets. There are a number of monasteries that open their doors to visitors.
a paeaceful place to stay and maditate. Peaceful, buddism feeling, the harmony of building, the coulered monks, the pilgrims from very far lands, the way they pray

One of the most beautiful places in Kathmandu.. One of the biggest and most wonderful Thibet Buddism Stupas in the world. There is a unique athmosphere of peace and greatness. Taxi from Thamel to Bodnath Stupa costs (after the discount :-) ) 300 NRP.
Excellent place. You can see many Tibetan people . See the culture and Tibetan Budhism. Place to see third eye of the Budha.

Spiritual. Bodnath stupa is a place you would visit as a tourist attraction; when you need a spiritual place to sit and meditate; want to buy first class art mandala painting or just want to soak the atmosphere of one of the most popular Buddhist places in the Earth. Highly recommended.
lovely. So great! Try to eat at a restaurant with a second story patio to overlook the stupa and soak in the view.

One of the best temples. Really a lot of the temples in Kathmandu are overrated. Not this one, it is very beautiful. Perfect setting with lots of cute roof top cafes to sit and have a beer or lunch and admire the view.
alright for a look. Good for a poke around for about 30 mins but be aware of the many beggars inn the area and the kids.
Good place to while away an hour. Great atmosphere, we wandered round the stupa and had a drink in one of the roof top terrace bars that surround the stupa nad watched the world go by

Located at the crouddy area. Our cab driver droped us at the Boudhanath Stupa which is very nice place. We walked round of the stupa and bought gift. The area of Boudha is famous to buy the Nepalese Handicraft......

Good Time. The entrance fee was 150 Nepal Rubies which is less than $2. Seeing the temple was amazing and the area surrounding it likewise. We spent about 2 1/2 hours in the area eventually eating at Flavors Restaurant(good meal there) right in the compound. It was well worth the total experience.

amazing place to be!. a very beautiful stupa. with lots of shops around it.
a very spiritual place. it has been said that whatever wish you make , it will be fulfilled.

have to see it with own eyes. i have seen the Stupa 1000 times in books, on TV, but to see it with your own eyes are so different. I am totally fascinated when the Stupa finally appeared in front of me, and literally I was into tears when getting close to it.

magnificent sight. pictures belie the scale of the stupa. you'd have to see to appreciate the scale of it.
on the downside, there's little else to look at at the site as few of the surrounding monasteries are open to public
Downtown. Actually the surrounding areas were the truly attractive element of this site. We enjoyed the hustle and bustle of the place. Throw your maps away and just go with the flow.

beautiful and well worth a visit. You can do your research on why to visit this World Heritage Site. For me, it was so much more peaceful than visiting for eg, Patan Durbur Sq - we were not bothered by people pressing us to let them be our guide and we were not constantly badgered by hawkers. Perhaps the constant presence of Buddhist monks keeps this in check? It is a lovely monument, there is a good souvenir shopping all around and it doesn't take more than an hour or two to see it. Getting there may take another hour but hey, that's KTM!
Biggest stoepa.. A very peaceful and friendly place. Perfect way to end a trip in Nepal. Lot of shops around the Stoepa.
A great buddhist temple to visit. Just travel once to see the Temple, a great structure and a life time activity also get the aura of the peaceful environment.

A place to visit more than once. The Stupa is an active part of the daily life of hundreds of people, and the shops surrounding it provide diversion and interest for hours.
