Many of the shopkeepers are friendly and interested in the tourists, if you take the time to engage them.A visit after 5 pm, when people are leaving work, is very interesting, as hundreds of locals will walk around the Stupa three times as an act of daily worship / blessing. a visit at dusk or in the evening will allow one to see and/ or light a yak-butter lamp as an offering. the glow of hundreds of these lamops is quite inspiring, even to a casual observer.
BIG Stupa. Interesting to see the interest of the local people and mingle, just fun to be there, also, lots of tourists from around the world.
Incredible. This is a MUST see - absolutely incredible! It was also an interesting walk from Pashupatinath Temple to here that would be worth checking out.

Must visit. Peaceful and wonderful to visit. This was the first place I did the 360 degree round with the chakras. It was beautiful to go and sit in the cafe and sip chai and eat momos. We also enjoyed the weather, people watching and shopping. Very touristy Nepal experience.

Religious Pilgrims & Authenticity. Wonderful place to visit and do kora. Sit relax and people watch. Flavors is a good restaurant to visit while you are there. If you go in through the back roads there is no need to pay a tourist "fee" for being there. Locals do not pay.
peace of mind. Perhaps the best known symbol of Nepal, the Bodnath Stupa is one of the most beautiful and peaceful places I've ever visited.

A majorly important pilgrimage place. Beautiful, moving, though a bit more touristy than you would expect or like! Just like any other important pilgrimage place in the world! But no pushy vendors, no aggressive guides whatsoever!! It can become a once-in-a-lifetime spiritual experience if you allow yourself the time and the focus!

very interesting and cool place.. Boudnath stupa is the best place that make me really interesting to visit.It is the stupa of lord buddha. many buddhist people Go there to worsippd lord buddha.this is very nice place Fresh air,cool environmnt mak m really fun.
Stupendous!. The atmosphere was amazing, it's fascinating to watch the crowds of people gathered there and take in the sights and smells of this place.

Still great!. Although it now takes a while getting there from central katmandu its still worth it. Try to spend some time, chat to some monks etc. Ask if you can enter places like monastarys, many will let you in but always ask so as to avoid offending people. This is the biggest Tibetean worship site outside of the country. For a special experience come in the evening when most pilgrims are there and on many nights see it lit up by thousands of butter lamps. remember to circle it the right way - just follow everyone else!

A must see. I have always been interested to learn more about Buddhism and so, this is a must see. We've visited a couple of temples and I would say this is one of the most interesting sites in Kathmandu. so many things going on, from the Buddhist structures, to stores of different sorts. Plus lots of good restaurant too.
Monkey Temple. looks over the whole city of Kathmandu amazing view just be carfull of monkeys that steel your drink :)
A fun stupa. That stupa just makes me laugh just looking at it. There are loads of rooftop cafes and restaurants around the square where you can admire the stupa over lunch or a coffee.

loved it. ...... the size of this stupa is just amazing. It really worths the visit.
All the Kathmandu valley is a jewel.
High on hill but untidy. The place is nice to spend an hour or so but the place needs a real clean up. Too many dogs and monkeys make the place undesirable considering this is a place of worship,

Stupendous. amazing place.... if you are looking to get away from the hustle bustle of kathmandu, this is the perfect place to retreat to. we visited this place on Sunday afternoon (Sundays btw are working days in Kathmandu) and were delighted to find negligible crowd there. There was no rush and we took our time in soaking up the serenity of this place. Gen referred to as Little Tibet, this place is surrounded by multitude of shopping and eating joints.Must do: Have a bite at Flavors - definitely one of the best amongst the umpteen eating joints around this place.Avoidable: Shopping - grossly over priced and very rude staff at most places. i considered myself a pro at bargaining till i met the hard nosed traders here.
Must visit. Its a must visit place for all those who want to know and experience a bit of Buddhism. It was too crowded when I visited though

A Devine Abode. The place in Kathmandu to attain peace and serinitya must visit for all travelers an exellent place to shop for some souviniers, but the trick is to know Bargaining skills as the prices for some items may be highly pricedalso some Good resturants around the Stupa with excellent view
Good but not awe-inspiring. The stupa was lovely but not amazing, but it was nice to be not crowded by traders etc. when trying to look around. Had lunch ona balcony overlooking it, was nice
Awesome Place. There's nothing to like or don;t like....I simply love this place.....THe crowd, the amount of energies....and the really really awesome place....
Amazing temple on hilltop. The temple leaves you awestruck. But the place is not very well maintained inspite of being a world heritage site.

Kora around the stupa!. one of the most serene place in KTM, sacrate, peaceful, and holly. although the stupa is always full of people, tourists as well as locals, shops, but the normal chaos that was common scene at other tourism attractions was simply not found at this place. be it a stroke around the stupa early in the morning or later in the afternoon, or just a coffee at one of their roof top cafes, you will enjoy it! My number one most favourite place in KTM.
Very beautiful and magnificient. its big and clean. There is big market area around the Stupa mainly selling Tibetan stuff like Thanka Paintings. There are lots of good restaurants around too.
Don't miss this. this was our favorite place to go in Kathmandu - very peaceful. head to a rooftop resto for lunch or dinner to extend your stay here.
peace ... A symbol of calmness most go if u are in kathmandu. surrounding should be cleared as so much chaos around the stupa

A unique experience ... .Whether you are religious or not, the Stupa is a place of beauty and not to be missed. Mostly bustling with people of all nationalities doing the Kora - walking round the Stupa clockwise praying for family, friends or world peace. Surrounded by typically Nepali cafes and shops its an amazing experience. Respect the sanctity and don't wear revealing clothes ladies. Don't forget to haggle in the shops!
Peace. It is the biggest stupa you will see in Nepal or may be in the world, Try to visit during sherpa's New year or during the full moonnight.
Walk & Talk. Only place in Kathmandu where I observed cleanliness.You can roam around the Stupa & buy any good stuff.
Sensitive place!. Very nice. If you come to Kathmandu you have to see it. It is a very sensitive and quite place that give you a lot of atmosphere of tibetan buddism spirituality.

Oasis of sprititual quietness. Combine Bouddhanath with first Pashupatinath. The contrast between a Hindu and Buddhist atmosphere -so closely together in terms of location- can’t be more visual and intense. Pashupatinath overwhelms every visitor with its beautiful temple complex and ritual burnings at the river, its omnipresent colors and scents, and its constant crowd of people along cows and monkeys. By contrast, Bouddhanatah, located maybe only a km from Pashupatinath, submerges you in a complete opposite atmosphere. The huge stupa are an attraction for spiritual rest that you feel everywhere around you. It is good to do Pashupatinath first thing in the morning, take 1-2 hours to wander around and taste the atmosphere before it becomes too hot and then head to Bouddhanath to refind your breath, relax and pick out a nice restaurant with view for lunch on the stupa.
Stupa. Lots of people. Plenty of shops and eateries. Nice thing is that the vendors do not hustle the tourists.

Wonderful ....... small tibet. Went there with guide and other group members. When we entered I was already amaized with first view from gate........ wow wow ...We enjoyed our lunch with view of Stupa.... I loved this place very much.
You can have beautiful photo during the late afternoon.

Worth RS200. not expensive unlike other places (roughly $2) but really spectacular. well worth the visit. Worth going on a sunny day as it is all outdoors, and perhaps look for times when their are festivals or ceremonies.
Open, majestic and great aura. We visited in July, so it was too hot to fully enjoy it but i can imagine myself sitting on the steps in fall/winter months and listen to meditative chants whole day!
Fascinating )). The energy...the energy.... really just want to say the energy...

Got a good vibe here. This place is in the heart of Kathmandu. Its buzzing with tourists, locals, monks and was heavily crowded when we went there. But in the midst of all the buzz, there is something amazing about the vibes you get at this place. Walk down from the main ramp to the sides and you will actually find some quiet corners to sit and reflect. the faith that you see around is tremendous. A must go if you are slightly spiritual - if not, the view from the top is pretty cool too.
Nice place to visit. I just love this stupa...visited twice. This is the holiest buddhist stupa in kathmandu valley.I would recommend everyone to visit once when you are in Kathmandu.

Biggest stupa in Nepal. Went to the Boudhanath Stupa as part of my day tour after my Langtang trek. This stupa is really huge and there are alot of people there. I had lunch at a restaurant and had a good view of the stupa from a height and it was really amazing with the ceremony taking place. A must visit if you are in Kathmandu, even if you are not a believer of Buddhism.
Heart of Kathmandu. Bodh nath stupa is The Heart fo kathmandu i had stayed one whole day arround it is lovley with smel of nice insense. when you guys in nepal its worth is to visit.

108 Koras around the Great Stupa. The Boudhanath Stupa in Kathmandu is a must see! Hopping on a TukTuk for 25 rupees from Thamel you'll be really impressed by the spiritual energy you'll feel circambulating the stupa with local Tibetan buddhists and spiritual seekers alike. Retreaters from the famous Kopan November course do a 108 trips around to collect merit at the end of the course. SponsorIBA.org is also sponsoring a 108 Koras on the evening of August 10, 2012.
Largest Tibetan Stupa. Fantastic - the second largest stupa in the world and a major Budhist centre. It is surrounded by fascinating shops, restaurants and a number of Budhist monasteries.

A Biggest Stuppa of Nepal. Bouddhanath StupaBouddhanath Stupa, the biggest stupa in Nepal, lies about 7 km east of the capital. The Bouddhanath stupa, also called by many as Khasti Chitya, is one of the oldest stupas in the country. After 1959, many Tibetans arrived and settled in Bouddhanath area. The stupa, a well-known Buddhist pilgrimage site, is included in World Heritage Cultural site list by UNESCO.

Even if you don't like temples.... Having lived for a time in Japan & Bangkok I'm more than a little temple weary that said I found this a truly enjoyable experience and given that I was staying nearby returned on a number of occasions. The edifice itself is not in itself 'wow' but its piazza like setting surrounded by guest houses, restaurants and shops make for an extremely enjoyable experience. Visiting as I did in the off season there were very few western tourists and yet there was always a throng of people chanting, walking, prostrating themselves lighting candles, spinning prayer wheels and hanging flags. There were far fewer touts that at the other tourist areas and there was a very relaxing and peaceful vibe to the place - it's not number one in the guide book for nothing! As a tip, do take the time not only to walk around the temple from the outside but also go in and walk around from the inside, few people do and it's a completely different experience...Hope this is helpful.

I liked it. Its nothing special I grant you that, But I just loved walking around it taking in the atmophere of the place. Theres a great little cafe in the circle of shops around the stupa. I am not really into religious things but I liked this. I could also see it from my hotel rooftop. It something beautiful in the middle of great chaos.
Awesome place with a very good vibe. Go and enjoy this beautiful area...the vibe around this stupa is wonderful!Go - watch - enjoy

Yet another stupa, but geometrically superior. I did not find this area to warrant the price tags at the door, such as several of the other tourist hotspots around Kathmandu. The positive side is the size of the stupa itself, but as usual, the typical commercialized surroundings take away from the sacredness of such a site.On an another positive, the beautiful Kopan Monastery sits perched on a hill overlooking this area nearby and is accessible by a 30 minute walk from the stupa center. Supposedly, this is also one of the best places if interested in purchasing Tibetan clothing and the like.
Living Mandala. The site is fabulous and kept clean - the approach from the city is terrible
Must see. Largest stupa in Kathmandu. A real must see. You have to pay a small entrance fee, but it is kept clean and tidy (much more so than when I first visited nearly 20 years ago!
Cultural experience. The stupa was Very impressive and clean. We had lunch in one of the rooftop cafes and enjoyed the bright colors and activities below. It is a must see in Kathmandu

Buddha's eyes. This stupa is famous for its eyes, the two impressive eyes are said to be Buddha's. You can see these two eyes on T-shirt, bags, hats that are on sell in Thamel shops. Besides the stupa, the monkeys in this hill are funny, they are so used to people that sometimes they just jump onto tourists, some girls are screaming by most people just feel fun. This definitely the plece you should go for a visit in Kathmandu.

Must See Place in Nepal. November and December is the peak season for Tibetan pilgrims. This place is exceptional crowded during this time. October will be the best time to visit when the raining season is over and the place is dry and cool.You can take your time to see all the shops and food during this time. Experienced Tibetan and Nepali cultures altogether in one place.
Has to be seen to be believed. Try walking around the stupa with the pilgrims. Watch the different pilgrims and what they are doing.

The real Tibet in Nepal. The temple remind me a real tibet in Nepal. Thousands of devotee people are making round temple with spinning pryer whee. I really experienced a perfect buddhist site in Kathmandu as there are number of monastery around stupas. I
Please visit this temple if you are going to Kathamdnu otherwise your visit won't be complete.

very good buddhist site.. It was great to visit baudha stupa I felt I was somewhere in Tibet all tibetan music, prayer flag and devotee people make this place nicer. it is quite easy to get their either you can take a taxi that cost you 250 ruppees or you can also take local bus but you have to walk a bit to get the bus from Thamel. When you get back you find people to share cab.

Buddhism at its pristine best. Its such a charming place. The stupa has this circular courtyard around it filled with shops selling Tibetan thangkas & souvenirs plus several cafes. There is a monastery too. The place is quite clean although there are no toilets for visitors.

so much peace and special light. seeing the beautiful Stupa and going around is a great gift to the mind. it's worthwhile to read about he story of the Stupa and even more important to learn about the essence of Buddhism. being at this place is adding a lot of value to ones own life.

A real buddhist feeling. Arriving at the entrance (by taxi if you are lazy...) you will immediately feel the peace around you, though you are surronded by thousands of tourists. If you are lucky and the weather is nice, the blue sky with the gold of the stupa will make a perfect peaceful image.

Good place to see the wishing pond. Wishing pond - LikedGet 8Re coins for Rs.10 -Disliked. Old Budhist place to see. It has lot of small restaruents inside for refreshing yourself. The place gives you insight of the vastness of the Budhism religion. The best part was the back side of the place which was extremely colourfull statues painted Gold, Blue and red.

Revisiting Tibet. It was wonderful to see the Tibetan shops and shop owners, the monastery and the monks. Anything you might have forgotten to buy in Tibet you could find here. I didn't get an opportunity to eat at any of the restaurants but it was great knowing you had the choice to do so. I loved being able to have a little taste of Tibet again.

beautiful temple. We (trveling with kids) enjoyed every mnt we spent in the temple.Different colors,prayers and chants in the background,people walking and praying around the stupa and you could spend couple of hours looking around without being disturbed by anyone.Kids loved it too,probably because of the space and all the suvernior shops built around the temple and the friendly tibetian monks we were talking to.

Beautiful Stupa. This is a center of Tibetan Buddhism. It is such a colorful place, with many prayer flags. There are many people here--tourists, pilgrims, monks, shop keepers (the stupa is ringed by shops & places to eat). This is also a good place to learn about more aspects of this type of Buddhism.

Beautiful, a must see!. This is a beautiful stupa, really unique in its kind and a must see. Take your time and take a break in one of the many roof top restaurants and see the people down doing their prayers and walk their rounds around the stupa.
Beautiful Stupa inside the big city. i would recommend to all of you if you are visiting Nepal to go once to the Stupa. It makes different feeling being in the stupa. i love the place. !

Welcome to Little Tibet!. Visited here as a matter of course, you can't go to Katmandu without coming here. The architecture is fascinating , so much to see and experience. The vast majority of shops crafts are Tibetan. The owners are very knowledgable and there s a great variety of artiacts old and new. There are Tibetan resaurants where you can experience Tibetan cuisene also. The whole a,bience is quite special with Tibetan music everywhere. Visit some of the exquisite sites or experience a Tibetan services which are held in several locations. Fantastic!

Nepal Culture. This is a very interesting place used by locals for their rituals which you can join in or just sightsee. I stayed near here in a guest house and it was nice for a couple of days. The budhist monastry had a 3 day ceremony which meant constant changing and donging that became a headache after a while. !!

Incredible. This is a place you have to visit even once in a life. It has remarkable atmosphere, and you feel safe and calm even with all those crowds around. There are more than 40 temples around this place, and you can walk around stupa with the famous mantra - on the ground floor, moving those drums, or you can choose to walk on the upper level, there you can enjoy the view to the roofs of the temples and spectacular mountains.

A Favorite among many. I'd seen pictures of this stupa, but seeing it in person is almost too good to be true. I hope to return and stay right in the area next time. Following the circuit around and twirling the prayer wheels that were still turning from the touch of a stooped Tibetan walking ahead of me was quite humbling. I stayed at least five hours mesmerized by the Tibetan chants playing from several music shops and observing those who may have made that long journey from Lhasa. What a place to remember the rest of my life. (Nov. 2009)
peaceful even though its packed!. We went every night to the Stupa and walked the circuit. This is my favorite place in Kathmandu.
It's so magical !. I wouldnt have expected to see such a Stupa - in the middle of the city ! just outside you are on the main road and then suddenly you go inside to see such a beautiful place
Beautiful square with the all seeing eyes. You've seen it maybe many time on TV but in real it's impressive.
it was amazing, loved the atmosphere and people.. lots of tourists, stores, restaurants, spiritual monks, the famous temple itself
Wonderful. Very nice and clean, very spiritual, eyes are always watching you whichever way you turned. It,s a heritage site will recommend.
Interesting!. Wonderful place and very busy with the usual street touts!
Large Stupa. Our first visit was very crowded, smoky and hot. We visited again a few days later and it was less congested and cleaner. Try to avoid peak times if crowds bother you -ask your guide

Excellant. Its a religious place, nice structure. It is in the middle of the town and surrounded with the shops. If you are really interested in Budha culture, you will get many things to buy and understand the culture.
easy walk from the Hyatt. The Bodnath Stupa was an easy walk from the Hyatt Hotel. Great place to take in the sights and sounds of this holy temple surrounded by tourist shops
Spiritual. You can't help but be drawn into the spirituality of the people praying at the Stupa.
Historic. Very authentic budist shrine. You could witness devotees all around you which will enlighten you almost instantly.

Must visit. Felt very good after visiting here, especially visit temple in front of stupa to witness best/mesmerizing statue of buddha ! do visit to witness in person !
also organic tea at tea stalls.........................................................................................................

Fantastic! My favourite tourist site in Ktm. Arrived early afternoon on a hot day and found a rooftop restaurant with shade to relax and plan our attack over lunch. Then walked, looked at shops and the stupa and started taking photos. After 3pm everything started to get busy. We walked more, explored a monastery, looked at more shops, took more photos, stopped for a coffee - and all the while the hubbub of people around the stupa kept increasing. Just prior to sunset the clouds that had been building all afternoon rained briefly - and not very heavily. We bought some thangkas and bracelets just before leaving at 7pm.I could have stayed longer and taken a million photos. Highly recommended for culture, sights, eats, shopping and enjoying a traffic-free enclave in otherwise crazy Kathmandu!
awesome. you can watch the entire kathmadu from this place which was good experience in life.

Bursting with TIbetan Buddhist Devotion !. what an experience. just walk clockwise around this stupa. it POURED rain when we visited and we repaired like many others to a local shop awning. but the devotees continued their clockwise ambulations with their prayer wheels. if you can go at dusk, so much the better. even in the evening. it is a thoroughly magic place and an absolute MUST SEE while in Kathmandu. moreso even than other places in "Kat". Plan to spend time there, please. get into the spirit..

Something very special. Excep of beeing a great, fantastic exceptional building, it is an oasis in the busy city. Good for children to run around. Cute little shops surrounding it, even if a little bit more expensive then elsewhere in the city. You have a big choice of restaurants on the rooftops around the Stupa. A big recommendation is to sit up there, have a quiet lunch in company of a camera with a big zoom-objective. I got some really nice photos of the street life from there :-).

Colorful, peaceful, not intimidating. We were there on the triple holiday of Tibetan Buddha's birthday, Buddha's enlightenment and Buddha's parinirvana (death). It was crammed with devotees who circled the stupa all night long! We got a chance to buy prayer flags, whitewash for the stupa because they were re-decorating it. Pilgrims had come from Tibet as well as locals. Best time to go is early morning and late afternoon on a full moon night. Don't miss it.
Amazing site in the middle of Kathmandu. It was just so big! No traffic, which is a blessing, just lots of people and monks and people praying. At night when it is lit up it is a wonderful sight

Impressive monument (and mass of tourist shops). You must see it especially in the evening when locals come to walk around it while praying, very impressive. But you shouldn't eat around the square as the food is super expensive and the quality and cleanliness don't justify it. The only time I paid 87 roupies (instead of 15 in a supermarket) for water was in Bodnath...
Inspiring. Stayed overnight on this vist as last time we only came for a day. An amazing place to people watch and soak up the atmosphere.

Interesting Calm in a Noisy City. Beautiful Stupa in busy Kathmandu. Take your time and stroll around to absorb it all. Check out the Thanka Painters and paintings as some are painted by the monks. Cheaper here than in Thamel for quality work as well. Bring your camera and spin the Mani wheels while your there.
Religious and Accessible. It was in a public space where all can enjoy and worship.

Nice place. Is a nice place. I felt like Iwas in a budist Disney world. The temple is surrounded by a lot of restaurants and souvenir shops.I didn`t have access to the interior of the building but the entrance is amazing, with a lot of good energy.
One time visit. It is moreover same as swambhunath. Very near to market. Having a BIG BIG radius and circle.

Buddha is watching you. The eyes follow you all around the Stupa. We first went to Bodnath Stupa in 1981 and it was very, very different. There were no buildings all the way around it, however at least there is sufficient room to do a circuit around the outside. The giant prayer wheels are incredible to look at and just to sit and feel the peace of the place in such a mad city is great. There are any number of good restaurants all around the Stupa and the food is excellent.

it was a peaceful visit. Since we were travelling with children, it seemed like a long walk and the weather was hot and humid.. Recommend that a lot of water and refreshments be carried just to keep hydrated

Bodnath Stupa. Amazing site -- worth seeing on your adventures! Very busy - beware of people begging and as always in busy areas, make sure you keep your valuable hidden and close to your body. Whenever monkeys are present, never get eye contact with them as they can be aggressive! And again, keep belongings close as they can be sneaky!

Om Mani Peme Hung. A truly wonderful place filled with the blessings of Buddha himself.Go early morning if you wish to see the many Tibet's dressed in traditional clothes doing Kora around the Holy Stupa.The air is filled with the smell of Juniper.Go early evening and see the Stupa all lit up with butter lamps.You'll also find all kinds of interesting things in the shops around the Stupa and the shop owners will haggle with you if you want to knock the price down.DO NOT BUY MILK!!!! for the young girls that try to take you to shops to buy the milk.It's a scam,they're working with the shop owner and do not need the milk.When you've bought the milk, they give it back to the shop to re-sell.

Impressive temple. Kept really clean comparing to Hindu temples. Around the stupa, there are many shops and restaurants. You can walk around the stupa and go in. Nice place to take photos as the Buddha eyes with the colorful flags are impressive.

Beautiful stupa. I went to Buddha Stupa during my stay in Kathmandu, I really like this Stupa. Normally i suggest visiting this in evening with sun set which makes very much different than day time. It makes change my mind visiting this Stupa for religious view.

A must see in Kathmandu. This place has so much significance to the Tibetan people and apart from the colours and grandeur of the place it is wonderful to quietly watch the people as they perform their daily rituals.
Heritage site. Every thing is good in Baubbhanath which is clean and well managable

Don't miss this while in Kathmandu. If I had to choose whether to go to Monkey Temple or Boudhanath stupa, I would select Boudhanath. There's no view over Kathmandu like in Monkey Temple, but Boudhanath is bigger, more impressive and it feels more spiritual. Yes there are a lot of small shops around stupa, very commercial. Those still don't take away the special atmosphere.What to do here? Walk around the stupa, spin the prayer wheels, climb on the stupa, visit monastery, watch pilgrims, enjoy the feeling. And I highly recommend eating/having coffee at some rooftop restaurant. Saturday Cafe is nice and has good vegetarian food.

Interesting Place to go in rounds. Amazing collection of mercendise around the Stupa which is trifle expensive for the tibetan stuff you get otherwise - but overall a treasure trove for collectors. I happen to see the healing bowls there which were the best I have found anywhere thus far. And the sizes wereust amazing. They offerred a free trial as well. The lady with the Tibetan dress was nnice and offers the dress for photos to Kids at a very nominal rate. Kids will freak out and you get some great photos to remember.

Beautiful, inviting and perfect timing!. I just so happened to visit this Stupa on the Buddha's birthday, which added a whole new dimension to this amazing place. I like how this stupa is more open than the others, which allows you to walk around without crashing into statues or vendors. Very enjoyable.

If you have nothing else to do.... Not sure why this is rated number 1 on TA. This is a big stupa and it is beautiful, but there is so much more to do here. I would recommend going to the stupa outside of namche with a view of the mountains behind it. It is a good way to kill part of a day though. It is much more relaxing than thamel.
Lot's of pilgrims and tourists. It's a very scenic spot in Kathmandu. Mostly because of the large number of pilgrims. The stupa itself is ... big. You can spend sat least about an hour at this place.
Too commercialised. Would have preferred not to have shops alround it but loved the feel and mix of the place
Largest awesome Stupa. Beautiful and worth visiting. Much better than Thamel!
A must-see. It's pretty much a no-brainer that you have to go see Bodnath Stupa if you're in Kathmandu. It's impressive in pictures, but larger than life when seen with your own eyes.
Stupa. Enjoyed the sightseeing :-) Lots to do and see and loads of souveneirs.
Rooftop restaurants. Certainly prices are higher than downtown - excellent foods and teas Very rewarding when viewed from rooftop restaurants, Tibetan feeling.

Must visit while in Kathmandu. Although teeming with tourists all year round, Boudhnath shows you another side of Kathmandu, a feel of tibetan/"Mahayana" Buddhism, the stupa itself in the centre, the big monasteries, the monks, the oil lamps, the incense and so many restaurants serving reasonably good food is so different from the other tourist destinations in Kathmandu.

A nice place for the photo bugs.. Shops surrounding the stupa have interesting stuff to sell. Price is higher than outside.Get a place higher up for a coffee/beer and you will be rewarded with a fatastic view.

Preferably go at start or end of day. This is one of the most important buddhist temples, if not the most, in Nepal. It is also the centre of the Tibetan community in Nepal with many Tibetan buddhist monateries and business surrounding it. It is a beautiful complex built in a circle so that many people can walk clockwise around the stupa for their religious daily routine. Especially at sunrise and sunset. One building in the outer circle with a huge bell in front is definitely worth stepping inside. It contains a very large golden buddha statue. It also has a small room at the entrance with a 3 meter high cilinder bell, as well as a man-size bell outside with inscriptions. The outer circle buildings house many nice restaurants, some with rooftop seating, and shops. We had a late lunch / early dinner at Flavors. Higly recommended. If you are near this stupa and want to buy prayer flags and other buddhist religious souvenir items againts very cheap, fixed local prices, go from the stupa back to the main street Gangalal Way, outside the stuppa east gate turn right (south), after 300 meter, opposite the highly recommended Tibet International Hotel, you will find Yolmo Prayer Flags & Handicrafts.
magical. peaceful stupa area,restaurants good quality in area
Worth it. Easy to get to, beautiful, good places to eat and shopping.
Beautiful place. Having lunch at one of the rooftop cafes was great for people watching and seeing tourists, buddhists and monks going about their business
An Experience. Watching all the people walk around the stupa was wonderful. The faces were beautiful and reflected the diverse ethnicity of the people of Nepal.
Nice environment. The Stupa is beautiful, but the surroundings and the environment walking around the area is even better

Quiet place to prepare for mountain and rest afterwards. Great atmosphere in Bouddha in general, less touristic than Thamel. Stayed at Shechen Monastery Guest House that highly recommend for quietness beautiful garden and cleanliness.

Great surroundings. So many houses have beautiful wooden carvings on windows and doors, and none are more impressive than the ones around the Buddha Stupa. Ask for the agent or hotel to provide a guide to enjoy even more, but even without a visit is worth your time. Count around 30mins to 1 hour to visit this site.
great place. This place is so different to others in Kathmandu. Peaceful and quiet. Worth staying a while.
beautiful, special. One of Kathmandu's top picks. I wouldn't travel all the way to Nepal for Kathmandu, but before or after your trek, this is certainly a place you'd like to visit.
Fascinating. Great site with lots to see and do. Guides operate within the Stupa who will tell you all about the site which is fascinating.

Don't miss this site!. There is a feeling of awe and peace while visiting this imposing Stupa. People walk around it, clock-wise, rolling the prayer cylinders at the base, while chanting the "Om Mane Padme Hum" mantra. Lovely view from the top, so make sure to climb the small steps up.

very nice stupa. very nice stupa.live tibetan &buddism culture.its very nice to walk a round.Many nice thanka shops.many tourist around the stupa.you feel totally different while you are there.Many tibetan souveniers.

Amazingly spiritual. Bodnath is a mixture of buddhist and hindu spirituality. The stupa itself is massive and you can walk on most of it, decorated with prayer flags and with many prayer wheels. There are several gompas around the square with the opportunity to go up their balconies for an alternative view of the complex. Some hindu shrines are included within the site, but there is no friction between hindu and buddhist.The overall effect is one of peace, calm and tranquility which is hard to match. A must see.
Very atmospheric. Can't beat the atmosphere here, but a bit too many sellers of knick knacks for the perfect experience.
Amazing living temple. Surrounded by tourist shops crowded and busy it still manages to maintain is dignity and if you can get there early or late when it is quieter it is even more atmospheric
nice. interesting place of tibetain bouddhism and this culture.

Buddhist stupa. When you get out of transport you cannot believe you see Around the stupa are many shops with all kind of Nepali and Tibetan souvenirs at reasonable prices.Also many restaurants where you can enjoy the view around with a nice drink and good meal
The Center of Nepalese Buddhism. great experienceexcellent to observe people and interactionssuper relaxing to just sit and absorb the enery

Feel the Love. it's like going into Tibet. Lot's of Tibetian's doing their daily walk around the stupa. Fantastic at night see the butter lamps being lit by the monks all around the stupa.Best view is at the Stupa View restaurant which has wonderful apple pie.

One of the most beautiful and peaceful places in KTM. I was in KTM for 4mths at the end of 2011 and my memories of Bodnath remain with me - it's an absolute must-do for anyone visiting Nepal. You won't find a site with a more beautiful energy than this place - especially at sunrise when the gorgeous Tibetan women circle the stupa chanting, or at sunset when the monks do the same. Definitely recommend going early morning then joining the devout Tibetan Buddhists in their breakfast of flat bread and salty tea at nearby food stalls, no hawkers at this time of the morning either.
Beautiful city. Pollution and the dust, every one is walking with mask

Must See!. There are a hand full of sites that must be visited while in Kathmandu and this is one of them. The stupa is significant and beautiful to walk around. There are many shops that surround the stupa and these differ from the types of shops in Thamel.
GOTTA GO THERE. This is a must for all travellers to Kathmandu - a wonderfully preserved World Heritage site, with loads to do and see and learn

Early morning. I would recommend going early in the morning to beat the crowds although at about 4pm you will catch buddhist monks, chatting during afternoon prayer in one of the surrounding buildings.
Tired of temples. They were under construction and it was cluttered with debri and street hawkers. Not a very pleasant visit.
tours in KTM. Great tour guide and very informative. Liked the people and scenery
Mystical. Total immersion into Tibetan culture. A wonderful teaching tool and opportunity to people watch.
Great!!. Any body who is going to spend vacation in Nepal should not miss.
wonderful and colorful!. felt at peace around this stupa and soaked in the culture and serenity here.

Peaceful Energy. Amidst the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu, is the mighty white Bodnath Stupa surrounded but quality shops , cafe, and restaurants and chantimg that open the energy channels. What a great place to escape and ponder. you must not miss it
A must see. Have been there on three separate occasions and loved each time. Sit in a roof top restaurant sipping an Everest beer and watch watch the world go by!
Bodnath Stupa. Magical walking round the seeing eyes watching Buddhists turning the wheels

Awe inspiring!. Boudhanath means Lord of Wisdom, it is a protective, purifactory and wish-granting stupa. My wish was to be able to go back and see this magnificent cultural site. Built by a widow to enable all the people could go somewhere to celebrate the death of their loved ones. However, there are a few variations of the story, but nevertheless, it remains the most important place of pilgrimage for the Buddhist. Walking around it brings a feeling of calm and peace despite the hundreds of people that were there. The surrounding area is full of history, stalls and restaurants and taking time to people watch passed several hours of sheer delight and awe.
not impressive. After huge stupas in Sri-Lanka, Bodnath looks very small and poor.
Zen. amazing place and some sort of inner peace if felt when i was there, the chanting and nirvanaminus was that it was too overcrowded
A must see when in Kathmandu. the biggest buddhist stupa in Nepal. It is worth a visit. Impressive and interesting
Take time to walk the stupa. The intention of the locals as they pray and chime the bells
Must see. Amazing, magical place. It was all about the atmosphere
A place to visit ! don't miss it !. A very nice place in the heart of Kathmandu. Don't forget to turn in the right way !
Good lunch stop, as many restaurants have rooftop service.. Average as far as site impact. Good history and shopping.

Best site in Kathmandu. This was a welcome change from the chaos that is Kathmandu. Quiet and peaceful with several good shops selling quality merchandise, unlike the cheap knock-offs in Thamel. Check out the Dew Drop restaurant and learn about its history. Seek out a cafe with a rooftop space on a clear day and you'll see the Himalayas.

One of the best attractions in Kathmandu.. We had just visited the Hindu Temple (which we nicknamed the temple of doom, due to its un-cleanliness and overall poor maintenance), and then took a wild taxi ride to Bodnath for about 200rs, where we we surprised to find a well operated, clean, inviting atmosphere, surrounded with nicer shops and better prices than in Thamel. We spent quite some time here, had lunch on a rooftop terrace, and enjoyed ourselves for most of the afternoon. The pictures from here are wonderful as well. Highly recommended.

Festival Time. Interesting time to visit as it was festival time and the Stupa was filled with worshippers. They did not appear to consider us intruders. The only drawback was the smoke associated with incense burning
relaxing place away from the noisy Kathmandu. nice place to take pictures of people goingquiet place to have lunch at a terrasse with a view on the stupa
Large and beautiful. Large stupa, nice location, many small shops around, no need to go upstairs)))

My favourite place in Kathamandu. So easy to get lost in the atmosphere. Go sit in a rooftop cafe with some masala tea and watch the people walk round and round the stupa. An experience you should have!!
A holy place. Makes you relaxed and turns you from outside in. You can turn praying mills, wonder the people prostrate, watch the prayer flags and listen to the wind.

best pleace to se in Kathmandu. this is my favourite place in Kathmandu, the biggest stupa with nice tibetian area, many shops, many restaurants many buddist monastery, great pleace to have take a little rest watching on buddha's eyes and take some meditations
A must do!. What a great experience. You could just feel the spirituality of this amazing temple and and the people there. A very special place.
rendezvous!!. the peace and silence of the Bouddha is what that always attract the people.

Amazing. Boudha is a tranquil oasis and an amazing spectacle. To experience at its best you need to go early in the am or later in the afternoon. Try to avoid other times as most of the locals are not there and it can be very hot. Come at the times mentioned above and you will see all walks of life, walking. Make sure you visit inside the monasteries of the doors to the Gompa are open. Remember to take your shoes off.

great view from top. Firstly we need to climb more than 300 stairs to go on top and from there we can see the whole kathmandu city valley. it was in a great location and also they got bis buddha stupa there. you can get nice air over there.
worth it !. Very nice! Only 20 minutes away from the Pashupatinat so you can do both on a same day.
unbelievable stupa. very big unbelievable sputa, very peace full place...
Place to be. Simply a place you must have visited. Less impressive than a cathedral in Europe, but this comparision not somehow stupid. It is a central stupa, look around....

A must see at sunset. We visited to Stupa at sunset after the whirlwind of the temple of living beings and couldn't have been gladder for doing so. It is an oasis of calm. Go during the late afternoon when all the tourist groups have left. The Tibetan community also all comes together at this time and walks around the Stupa. Walk with them and take in the sense of community and serenity of the whole place.
Go in late afternoon to enjoy the atmosphere!. Wonderful spot for the holy and not so holy.... sit and people watch for a while....Go clockwise around the stupa
kathmandu stopover. Very interesting although a little commercialised.

Serenity amongst tourist shops. I've been back to this stupa each of the 3 times in Nepal as it is my favorite place. Although there is a lot of touristy stores around, the presence of the monks, Tibetans and devoted Buddhists circling the stupa at dusk is absolutely serene. We ate a great early dinner on the rooftop terrace of Dewdrop cafe with my Nepalese friend and looked across the clockwise movement of the crowds at sunset. Great photo opportunity!
Nice place. theres a tea shop that sells veyr nice lemon puffs

Great facebook timeline photo! :). My review is particularly about comparing the photographic opportunities between Boudhanath and Swayumbunath.The two main stupas in the Kathmandu Valley are both about the same size and significance, but have completely different surroundings. Swayumbunath is the more "natural" on a hilltop ridge, surrounded by an array of minor stupas and other shines, and with a fantastic view out over the entire city. You gradually climb up to the stupa complex. It is significantly less commercialised than Boudhanath.Boudhanath on the other hand, is on the opposite side of the valley, in a built up urban area. You don't see the stupa as you approach it by car. The stupa itself is of a similar size to the one at Swayumbunath, but is completely surrounded by a ring of souvenir shops, cafes and multistory buildings with rooftop restaurants and the area directly around the stupa itself is much clearer and open. The multitude of rooftop cafes and viewpoints, gives a much better opportunity to take panoramic and uninterrupted photos of the stupa than is possible at Swayumbunath. The emphasis is much more on looking in at the stupa, with no opportunity for expansive views of the city. There is significantly more commercialisation and "shopping" at Boudhanath.Both are a fantastic visit however, and their surroundings are so different that I urge you to visit both. I recommend Swayumbunath in the morning or dusk when the air is clear, and Boudhanath at any time.For what it is worth, as Swayumbunath is on a hilltop ridge surrounded by trees, there are significantly more monkeys than I have ever seen at Boudhanath.

a 'don't-miss';. Kathmandu has reached out to Bodnath Stupa and it is no longer outside the city. Regardless, it is a lovely enclave, and spiritual even for those who are not Buddhist. Do not miss a visit here and give yourself lots of time to walk around (clockwise!) - and turn the Prayer Wheels for blessings.
Amazing. A huge stupa, surrounded by temples, shops and buildings with beautiful Newari architecture. A really amzing experience not to be missed
My favourite place in Kathmandu Valley. Every time that I vist Nepal , I like to walk Bodnath Stupa, I feel very relax and enjoy drinking a cup of tea on the terrace around stupa.

A fabulous place to watch the parade of people. What a great place to sit and watch a slice of humanity. So many different looking people of different ages and origins all going around the Stupa. Could of spent ages here. A photographers paradise and chance to think about your own spirituality.

The most beautiful site in Kathmandu valley. The landmark of the city and the main destination of all Buddhists, the most impressive and maybe the largest stupa in the world! So colourful with plenty of shops, bars and restaurants around it, I loved to spend my time there!!!!

The best buddhist monument. This is a awesome monument with its brilliant white dome and golden pinnacle. We were there early morning and had a walk all around and then in some small alleys, where there are a lot of other monasteries and temples.

Holy site. This stupa is worth a visit. It is in an area where Tibetan refugees are a large portion of the population and it is very moving to see the constant crowds walking clockwise around the site spinning the prayer wheels and praying. It is a very safe environment and has a lovely atmosphere, I preferred it to the more popular Monkey Temple. There are shops all around the site where it's possible to browse without being hassled to buy. A highlight of our stay in Kathmandu.

Bodnath -- UNESCO Heritage Site. I am an amateur photographer and has a great propensity for cultural immersion and Bodnath is a window to one of South Asian's prolific cultures. You can see people from almost all continents converging in this area. The Stupa itself is not just an important edifice of traditional Buddhism but also Tibetan Buddhism.Countless restaurants and shops surround this largest Buddhist temple in the world.

Go in the evening....... Very unique experience and despite its importance, not overrun with tourists...at least in the early evening when we visited. Just beautiful....would have visited several times but our itinerary did not allow.
one of the most peaceful areas i have ever seen. I just wished i had more time to just sit there and enjoy the positive energies there!

Stupa good!. Though touristy like all sights in the world, this one's a little cheaper and no touts! Very peaceful as well!
You can venture behind the stupa and take a look at some of the daily lives of the monks living in the monastery!
Little Llasa. Enter the Stupa precinct and you are in mini-Tibet without the Chinese. Get swept up in the clock-wise parading flow of people. Eat momos.

Magical place!. An AMAZING place xxxx
Mind your valuables but not too much hassel from beggars
Very Good Temple. Very good temple and you can see very nice view from here.
Impressive and magic. This place is such a beatiful place... Really magic... Join it if you are in Nepal!!!

A serene place for the soul. This is a great place to see and feel the vibes of the devotees doing their prayers and meditation. Great for photo opportunities but do exercise some respect for the people.The stupa is surrounded with numerous shops selling various souvenirs. It can be a tourist trap for the uninitiated. Be sure to bargain like crazy and walk away if needed.

A must see in KTM.. We went to Nepal for trekking and good thing we got 1 day to roam around Pokhara and Kathmandu. Bodnath Stupa is right at the center of the city and it won't disappoint. The stupa is not violated and commercialized within unlike other Hindu and Buddhist places in Nepal. All the shops are just Around the hex shape stupa.
I liked it. Nice place, nice people, nice stuff to buy, amazing view from the hotel terrace.
Hidden away. All this history tucked away. surrounded by little shops and some neat coffee/tea shops it was worth a visit.

The largest in Nepal. Visited this twice during the 2 weeks we were there. In both cases it was near dusk or already dark, so no pictures.
The stupa is surrounded by restaurants and tourist shops.
Just take the time to walk around the stupa (Clockwise ONLY please) and take in the serene near silence.

A wonderful Buddhist Stupa!. This was a refreshing and clean place to visit after the somewhat grubby Darbar Square. The colourful entrance gate beckons the visitors to the largest Buddhist Stupas in the world. With diameter of about 100m and 40m height it leaves a lasting impression on ones mind. There is an interesting legend about this building, in ancient times a pious lady wanted to build a holy building so she went to the Rajah and asked him to donate some land for it, the Rajah told her to take one leather hide and spread it out on the land she liked and as much land the hide covered would be hers for the construction of the Stupa. The lady took prayed, then stretched one hide as much as she could and then started cutting small pieces out of it. She took all these pieces to this place she liked and started spreading them around.Thus it took a great effort and a small miracle to cover the entire land that now lies beneath the Stupa. The Raja was so impressed that he gave her the possession of the land at once. The monasteries around the Stupa are a must see. While the Stupa itself is stark and white these are colourful and vivid. There are huge praying cylinders in them. Seeing the monks and the Tibetan people was a real treat.

Festival atmosphere!. Of all the places I visited in Kathmandu, this was my fave! The atmosphere was very joyous & festive. The air was filled with music & song, and I soon found myself entranced with the crowds & Buddhists circling the Stupa. Because the Stupa is in an enclosed area (albeit a large area), you soon forget about the city outside & become a part of the moment here.There are many souvenir shops, but I didn't visit any. I did however visit the Buddhist Painting School, and encourage you to do the same. You can see young artists painting, and of course, purchase your own to take home. These paintings are amazing & I'm glad I brought one home as a unique souvenir.I think this is one place I could sit at a cafe and just people watch all day long without tiring...

Biggest Stupa. Superb & amazing.Must be the biggest stupa in Nepal if not in the world.A novel experience seeing the monks & many people walking around the stupa slowly chanting prayers.We also went round and spinned prayer wheels.Colourful shops around stupa worth seeing but very costly.
Fantastic. Really pleased we made the effort to see this. There was an event going on at the time which gave it even more atmosphere. Also interesting shops circle the stupa.

Amazing. It was quite an experience to be in the midst of Monks and local Nepali people as they walk around the Stupa saying their prayers and spinning the prayer wheels releasing the prayers contained inside!
One of the biggest stupa in the world. One of the favorite sight seeing destination in Nepal and Buddist pilgrimage destination. If you are into visiting sacred places this is the place to visit.
pilgrimage. Seeing the stupa was amazing but coulnd't combine shopping
Calm place. Boudha Nath stupa, steps away from the busy life in Kathmandu, and has sort of its own environment. A great place to go if you're a people photographer.
Bodnath Stupa. We loved it so much we went back once a week to take in the amazing setting and watch life go by.
amazing. the biggest supa on Nepal., also posibilty to see festival, so go on any festival/religious/ time

Excellent place!. I really enjoyed my visit to Boudhanath.....there was something serene and calming about the place. The colourful marketplace surrounding the Stupa is also worth a look, even though most of the things are overpriced.....you can haggle and bring them down to a reasonable price.

Boudhanath Stupa. Amazing must Visit Place.. If you are going to be in Kathmandu then Boudhanath Stupa, also called Boudha is one of the iconic locations of Nepal and it would be a shame to not make a visit to this pilgrimage site and walk around and spin the prayer wheels. It is a great spot to watch Nepali life for a while and of course there are plenty of places around to sit and have something to eat and drink if you like.
Very peacefull place. Very peacefull place, recommended to visit at a sunset

Huge Stupa, lots of local colour. You have to keep reminding yourself to keep walking - don't look back or you'll be going round anti clockwise, which is forbidden. This is a great place to have a meal, choose one of the restaurants surrounding the Stupa and go up to the roof terrace for a spot of great people watching.
Must visit once for sure. worth a visit... you may like to have a guide giving details / explaining about the stupa and various rituals that they keep performing.
valuable place to see. Holy place for buddhist peoples. chanting mantra of Mane- peme - owham wash your sin.A bit crowed and noisy by valuless peoples

you feel religious fervor. Tibetan culture very much alive. Interesting shops, the stoupa is very large, but the most interesting are the people walking slowly around the monument. The atmosphere is cordial but religious.
Don't miss it. Amazing to see and experience. Try to go at the end of the afternoon when everyone calls in to pray after theirs day's work.

Enjoyable walk from the Hyatt. This Buddhist Stupa was well worth the visit. I was staying at the Hyatt and it is a short and easy walk from there. The Stupa itself was fascinating and I enjoyed seeing the monks and locals turning the prayer wheels and praying. The shops along the perimeter were very good.

Interesting afternoon visit - people watching!. Great for people watching - stupa is enormous, with people walking around it. Photo opportunities everywhere. Shops around are a little tacky! Restaurants give view of Stupa (upper floors) and Himalayas! Enjoy!

Our favourite tourist site in Kathmandu. Try and get a booking in the Hyatt. There is a gate at the far side of the gardens taking you to the path that leads to the Stupa. Nice walk, and then the Stupa is in a relaxed part of Kathmandu. Busy, but clean with great shops, restaurants, and a peaceful vibe, probably due to the Stupa and worshippers. We went there twice, the only place we visited more than once in Kathmandu.

Well-known symbol of Nepal. The Great Stupa in Boudhanath (or Boudha) is located approximately 6-7 km from centre of Kathmandu, so the easiest way is to take a taxi - you shouldn't be paying more than 350-400 NPR. This is one of these places not to be missed during your trip to Kathmandu Valley.This is one of the oldest, most important and spectacular Buddhist pilgrimage sites in the world. I would say this is as well great place to relax from crazy capital and chaos on the roads. There is entry fee of 150 NPR (aprrox. 1,35 EUR) and this ticket is valid for one day. You will receive as well brochure in English with short description of this monumental site. Just to have an idea, how big is that stupa - 1 hec in width and 43 meter in height. Built on a plan of mandala and form of a double lotus. Do not forget your sun-glasses as white colour reflects sun really strong. My advice is to take your time and do not rush. This is place to clear your mind and rest for 2-3 hours... And visit Boudhanath min. 2 times during your stay in the area - morning and evening experiences and views are completely different.Around the stupa there are many shops and local restaurants run mostly by Tibetan refugees (arrived there after Chinese invasion in the 60s). It is worth to enter many of them and search for original and unique (or just better value) souvenirs and gifts. I found it more enjoyable than in Thamel where everybody almost forces you to buy - here you can take your time and find your own 'thing'. Do not miss monasteries on your way as they are really stunning and offers you great panoramic view of the Great Stupa!

A must experience for everyone!. This buddhist stupa seems to have an awesome energy. One feels calm and peaceful in its serene environment. I first visited this place in May 1998 and then once again last year. The impressions I carried with me from my first visit remained deeply engrained in me and brought me back. To witness the Tibetans monks and lay people praying there, circumambulating the stupa with deep dignity and amazing faith is an experience in itself. The beautiful colours of the prayer flags against the pristine white of the stupa is an image difficult to erase from the mind. This place is lively yet calm and time seems to stand still once you are there. I can easily spend a whole day there, eat in the restuarants, shop for interesting trinkets, consult a tibetan medicine practioner and visit the various monasteries around the place. The taxi-ride to the place and the entrance fee feels like money well-spent for trading some wondeful experiences.
Haven in a busy city. Wonderful atmosphere and spectacular buildings. A peaceful haven in the middle of a busy city. Good eating and lots of interesting shops

Bodanath is a mervellous place! I love it !!!. Bodanath is the biggest stuppa in the world. In this place I had very good feelings. It is Busddhist culture, where you can see many colored prier flags; many buddhist and hindu come there. Other religious culture or not religious are warmly welcomed ! in general I saw around this famous stupa tibetan people, sadhu, nepali and many tourists ! Around this stupa there are many shops and restaurants. It is our world heritage.
Great way to spend an afternoon. Amazing...love to watch the Buddhist monks walk around and do their daily prayers.

Eyes are watching you. We came on the day of full moon and could see colourful crowd of people, coming to worship from all the remote places of Nepal. Also some monasteries were open to visit and they also have a special celebrations on full moon. You can find nice art shops and souvenirs around Budnath Stupa... And those eyes of Budha, they follow you in every direction and you will never forget they watching you...
At sunset you have to "feel" this place!. At sunset you have to "feel" the energy of this place! it is very good
Awe inspiring!. Go in the early morning and just soak it all in! Despite how crazy every thing outside is, there's just this amazing sense of peace once you enter the courtyard.
Wow!!. Beautiful and serene, very colorful and unique, lots of Tibetan monks and film crews around, crowded and very dusty location but most of Kathmandu is like that
Budhist visiting place. Nice place to see ! one of the holly place for budhist. and is included in Sightseeing spot too.

BOUDHANATH. Located some eight kilometers north-east if Kathmandu, Boudhanath stupa is the largest of kind in the valley.Because of the area is full of the Tibetan re-settlers, one finds a large number of monasteries around there.Among the devotees who throng in there are mostly Tibetan followed by Sherpas. One would hardly come across any Newari Buddhist. One this stupa too there is pair of Buddha's eye, which have been painted on all the four sides of its tower, which can be seen from distance.Like in others monasteries, In Boudhanath too there are prayer wheels carrying the holy mantra "OM MANI PAD ME HUM" all around its large diameter. Roughly translated it means Oh, you jewel in the lotus blossom.
Love this place. Boudenath Stupa is one of my favourite places to visit. The Buddhist faith and people adds a distinct busy but reverant feel to the place. Highly recommended.
Soulful delight. Calm and serene environment, best to relax and meditate
Simply incredible!. The spectacle of the faithful and the curious sightseers was overwhelming!

A MUST SEE!!!. An important Tibetan Buddhist pilgrimage site! People watching, shopping, cultural events, activites are wonderful here.This place is a MUST SEE. Come in the mornings-or evenings to join the local crowd as circumambulation of the stupa and offerings of light occur. Monks and nuns are always there chanting prayers in the evenings. There is usually a big 'Tsog Puja' happening at the Great Stupa around that time, so it's quite a sight to behold.
Beautiful place. As soon as you arrive here, you feel the amazing energy of the place.
Lovely at anytime of day. Walk around at least 3 times and spin the prayer wheels. It is a great place to watch tourists, tibetans, and businesses. There are lovely statues there.
nice. we think it is about Volendam in Holland but it is a nice buddhistic temple. Walk around and you will see!
Wow so great and big!. This is an amazing place to visit. This is the biggest stupa in the world and it is so good when you go there in the evening time. You will see the lots of lights.......

Superb Sight & Setting. The Bodnath Stupa is quite a long way from the centre of town and patience is required because the famous Kathmandu traffic jams do make the journey feel like a penance. However, once you arrive you will be richly rewarded.The Stupa is the largest of it's type in Kathmandu and considered very sacred, this is evidenced by the amount of monks who walk around it in a clockwise manner. We found 5pm to be the best time although also the busiest. It is worth going inside the walls and walking on the stupa itself which is decorated with bright coloured flags.The stupa is surrounded by a number of shops which like the stupa form a circle that surrounds the stupa itself. Alot of the shops sell magnificent but expensive bronze pieces and you can have fun viewing. On the top floor of many of these shops after a climb up very steep steps are a number of cafe's all who have roof gardens who have perfect views of the stupa, which is best viewed while drinking a bottle of the local Everest beer which is surprisingly tasty. A not to be missed sight on your Kathmandu adventure.

the magic of Tibetan Buddhism. The stupa is an incredible sight, with its pure white mold topped with a sparkling pinnacle and the famous Buddha Eyes on it. Go at dusk to see the current of devotees circling the stupa.
Gorgeous and historical. Mind-boggling place; tons of people there for a celebration

A sacred landmark. Worth a visit.. It is a beautiful landmark...but more importantly it is a great place to people watch. Our tour guide was able to give us some good information and tips on where to take the nicest pictures.

Very interesting site. This was well worth the half day trip to the area. We took a local taxi up to the Stupa, walked around it for a while (clockwise, of course), and took a bunch of pictures. We had lunch at a rooftop restaurant overlooking the Stupa, enjoying the view and Everest brews. It's a good way to spend a couple hours in Bodnath.

An amazing piece of history. I visited the stupa on the day I took the Kathmandu tour. The stupa is huge and is well maintained. Many Buddhist pilgrims and monks circle the stupa. Bodnath is really photogenic, I just could not stop taking pictures. I truly enjoyed the time I spent at Bodnath.

a must-see buddhist monument. The biggest and most revered buddhist stupa outside of Tibet - it' a must see. Fascinating Buddhist Stupa. Very much a breathtaking site. The shops surrounding, although of course geared to tourists, are sensitive to the site. This is not to be missed.

Bodnath stupa. Very interesting stupa and all shops around it.
it is just you walk in Tibet.

A unique place to visit in kathmandu.. Called as monkey temple,a Buddhist cultural temple on the top of mountain and the view of Kathmandu valley up from there is awesome.Every traveler must visit this place at least once.

Amazing. Situated in the hill, from Stupa you may see whole valley.

A World of its Own!!. Its something that cannot be explained but has to be experienced.we felt at peace the minute we walked through the main entrance.Its a Huge stupa surrounded with the most beautiful buildings surrounding it which double up as an enclosure to the stupa and the hundreds of Buddhist monks who meditate there.would highly recommend anyone to just pull up a chair on one of the rooftop restaurants and watch the monks go about their daily rituals.

Must see and experience Buddhist place. A very holy place with much energy. Gigantic Stupa!. Very cool to see at least once in your life! It was cool to see the prayer flags hanging from the sides and all the monks walking around. I would definitely recommend visiting here.

This was the Nepali temple you were looking for.. When I wanted to visit Kathmandu, this was the one place I wanted to go to. It may be the only thing in it's area but it does not disappoint. Either way, it was an awesome experience that is quintessential Kathmandu.I actually saw an old pic of it on a wall somewhere when it was still surrounded by forests and was on the road away or to Kathmandu. Well not anymore, it's located in a very busy area but it still retains its charm.A must-see!

must see in kathmandu. One of the holiest Buddhist sites in Nepal and a main tourist attraction as well, this is a great area to spend some time.The stupa itself dates back to the 4th or 5th Century AD (depending on who tells the story) and is surrounded really towere above the square.A commercial center surrounds it, so you can shop for souveniers and handicrafts (or have lunch in a small care)-- and then have the experience of entering one of the monastaries where you may observe the in prayer and performing their rituals.It's a great area for people watchers, and on many levels shouldn't be missed.

A relaxing attraction with multiple photo opportunities. Take a cab to Bodnath and walk up the long set of stairs to the top. Be sure to snap photos next to all of the statues and monkeys. The best tip that I can offer is to avoid the guides willing to tell you about the history of the site. Yes, they can be helpful, but you get more from walking around on your own. Just keep up your no's and watch out for the monkeys. 200 rupees to enter

Nice place, especially if you take your time.... Love the great Stupa of Boudanath! Do take your time, do not rush it. Have a drink or eat at one of the eating places overlooking it. Take pics at any time of the day, an on any weather. They will be impressive, if you have even a small idea about photography. A great place, and the centre for Tibetan refugees in Nepal.
Peace. you feel like you have come here to get peace after visiting this amazing stupa feels like lord Buddha is giving you knowledge of peace in your mind

Great Spot to while away a morning. Certainly worth the cab drive out from Thamel. Best to visit in the early morning when the place is slowly coming to life. Have a walk around and then get up to one of the rooftop restaurants. Enjoy a beer and simply watch the world go by.

Peaceful like a heaven!. i have been this place once and i feel like i am in the heaven. Sitting in a rooftop restaurant and watching the view of stupa and the walkways really cool! Will visit again soon.
Charming place. surrounded by many souvenir shops, restaurants and a nice buddhist temple. Worth visiting. Don´t forget Buddha eyes...looking at you all the time :P

Amazing Buddish Temple!. It was an amazing Buddhist temple in Kathmandu. I went two times to visit this temple in the morning and in afternoon time for worship. They start to worship at 3 pm. it was amazing experience to me. I love this place.

Fascinating Place to Spend Many Hours. Me, I'm lucky. There are times I get to have a whole day to myself in Kathmandu without something else to do (business). Bodinath is an excellent place to while away hours observing the passing parade.The Stupa itself is one of the largest you may ever get to see, and certainly the largest in Nepal. Many believers travel great distance to pray there. A pilgrimage, if you allow.It is an important religious site for the Buddhist, but to any other religion as well. If only for the significance it has as a place of peace, tranquility and introspection.The site is reached easily from anywhere in Kathmandu Valley as it is on the Ring Road.I'd estimate it's about 5km East of Kathmandu's center (typically considered the Palace itself.) Once you arrive there's a small fee to be paid at the entrance (sometimes they'd just wave me through with a big smile.) Surrounding the Stupa itself is a ring (all the way 'round) of shops and services. Everything you've been seeing elsewhere in Kathmandu; curios, souvenirs, handicrafts, woven items, sculptures, thangkas, metal objects and everything else.It's a good place to 'shop', but it's a better place to spend the day than rupees.Bring a camera, take lots of photos. As the day goes by, you get all kinds of lighting conditions; all of which compliment one aspect or another of the structure itself.*I like to engage my photo subjects if I can, and possibly obtain a mail address for them so I can send them a copy of the picture I've taken. Tourists, after all, 'take' a lot of pictures but rarely 'give' them back. (Try it, it's fun.)There are -at least- three levels of things along the outer ring around the Stupa.Many great places to eat are hidden away in those layers. Great place to explore and discover things. Try it- lots of fun!If you get lucky, you may find a restaurant with an outdoor patio looking down on the open circuit around the Stupa. Excellent vantage point.It should go without saying (but I'll do it anyway)- if you're there during any of the many Holidays they celebrate in Nepal- Bodinath Stupa is a place to see great ceremonies.
Tibetan temple. this place is full of Tibetan monks and is amazing.. a must see

worth to visit above places. Nepal is naturally beautiful and culturally rich country. amazing as ever. make sure you stop for a meal or a drink from a roof top cafe/restaurant you can then watch the goings on undistrubed.
A place of worship, peace and awe. Walk and pray with the pilgrims that make their rounds around the stupa. Enjoy the deep hearted energy of the holy place.
Wonderful site!. It is amazing, sacred, a very worthwile experience.
beautiful temple. boudhanath iz one of the biggest temple in nepal and it is located in kathamandu district and it is beautiful,amazing

What a special place!. You can't help but experience a sense of peace in spite of being surrounded by so many people. The sounds, the sights, the smells..... a real delight to the sense. I have to back again!
Boudhanath Stupa. Very impressive sight and quite inspiring to watch the Bhuddhist devotees circle the stupa, spinning the mani wheels
